Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups flour
1 cup  sugar
1/2 cup  margarine
1  egg
1/3 cup  corn syrup
Ingredients:
1/4 cup  firmly packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon melted margarine
1 teaspoon  vanilla
1 1/2 cups Cranberry Almond Crunch Cereal
Instructions: Mix flour and sugar in medium bowl.  Cut in 1/2 cup margarine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Press firmly into bottom of greased 9-inch square baking pan.  Bake 20 minutes or until very lightly browned.  Mix egg, syrup, brown sugar, melted butter, vanilla and cereal until well blended.  Spread evenly over warm crust.  Bake 20-25 minutes or until topping is firm around edges and slightly soft in center.  Cool on wire rack.  Cut into bars.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons butter
4 tsp curry powder
3/4 cup chopped apple
1 chopped onion
Ingredients:
2 packages chicken legs, breasts or thighs
1 can mushroom soup
2 cups cream
salt
Instructions: Melt butter in pan and add curry powder, apple and onion.  Then add the soup and cream.  Place chicken pieces, salted, in one layer in roasting pan.  Pour sauce over.  Bake uncovered.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups  flour
1 cup  brown sugar
2/3 cup margarine
1  egg
1/2 cup  red & green glace cherries
Ingredients:
1/2 cup  blanched almonds
1/2 teaspoon almond extract
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Cream brown sugar and margarine, add slightly beaten egg, almond extract and beat well.  Sift flour, baking soda and salt together, add to batter and mix well.  Cut mixed glace cherries in quarters, chop almonds. Also take a little flour from sifter and sprinkle on cherries and almonds, add to mixture.  Form into a roll.  Wrap in wax paper and chill until hard.  When  hard, slice thinly with a sharp knife and bake.  This dough may be frozen and baked later.

Ingredient:
1 T\teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
4 large egg whites
1/4 cup x 3 sugar (various steps)
Ingredients:
2 large egg yolks
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar

See Tangy Lemon Filling Recipe
Instructions:
1.  Prepare Tangy Lemon Filling; cool to room temperature.  Spray 13 x 9 metal baking pan with nonstick cooking spray, line pan with waxed paper and spray waxed paper.  In small bowl mix flour, baking powder and salt.  In another small bowl, with mixer at high speed beat egg whites until soft peaks form.  Gradually beat in 1/4 cup sugar until sugar dissolves and whites stand in stiff peaks.  In large bowl, at high speed beat egg yolks, vanilla and 1/3 cup sugar 5 minutes.  Fold in flour mixture and beaten whites.  Spread batter in pan,  bake 8 to 10 minutes.  Sprinkle cloth towel with confectioners' sugar.  Invert cake onto towel, peel off waxed paper.  Starting at a long side, roll cake with towel jelly roll fashion.  Cool on wire rack.
Unroll cooled cake, spread with filling.  Roll up again without towel.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup  margarine
1 1/4 cups  white sugar
1 1/4 cups  packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon  vanilla
Ingredients:
2  eggs
4 cups  flour
2 teaspoons  baking soda
1 teaspoon  salt
4 cups  chocolate chips
Instructions: Mix margarine, sugars, vanilla and eggs in large bowl. Stir in flour, baking soda and salt.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Drop dough by spoon onto ungreased baking sheet.   Cool slightly, remove from baking sheet.

Ingredient:
3/4 Cups  Sugar
1/3 Cup  Flour
1/4 Teaspoon Salt
2 Cups  Milk
3 Egg Yolks, Slightly Beaten
Ingredients:
2 Tablespoons Butter
1 1/4 Teaspoons Vanilla
3 - 4   Bananas
1 - 9 Inch Baked Pie Shell, cooled
Instructions: In a saucepan, combine the sugar, flour and salt.  Add milk gradually while stirring.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture is bubbly.  Keep stirring and cooking for 2 more minutes and then remove from heat.  Stir in a  small amount of  hot mixture into the beaten egg yolks.  Add the egg yolk mixture gradually to the rest of the hot mixture.  Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and add the butter and vanilla.  Stir until it has a smooth consistency.  Slice bananas into the pie shell.  Top with pudding mixture.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.  Chill for an hour.

Ingredient:
2 Cups  Butter or Margarine
2 Cups  Brown Sugar
2 Cups  White Sugar
2 Tablespoons  Vanilla Extract
2 Tablespoons  Maple Extract
4  Eggs
4 Cups  Flour
Ingredients:
4 Cups  Oatmeal (finely grounded in blender)
1 Tablespoon   Baking Soda
1 Tablespoon  Baking Powder
1/2 Teaspoon  Salt
2 Cups  Chocolate Chips
1 Cup  White Chocolate (finely chopped)
3 Cups  Walnut pieces
Instructions: In a very large bowl cream together butter, sugars, vanilla, maple and eggs.  In a separate bowl combine the flour, ground oatmeal, baking soda, baking powder and salt.  Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture. Fold in the remaining ingredients. Roll into balls and freeze or bake

Ingredient:
1/2 Cup  Water
1/2 Cup  Sugar
2 Tablespoons  Lemon Juice
2 Tablespoons  Cornstarch
Ingredients:
1 Teaspoon  Grated Lemon Peel
1/3 Teaspoon  Salt
2 Drops  Yellow Food Coloring
Instructions: In one quart saucepan over medium heat - heat water, sugar, lemon juice, cornstarch, lemon peel , salt and yellow food coloring to boiling, stirring constantly.  Boil one minute.

Ingredient:
4 Cups  flour
2 Cups  Milk
1 Teaspoon  Salt
Ingredients:
1 Teaspoon  Baking Powder
2 Cups  Raisins (optional)
Instructions: Mix dry ingredients together, then add the milk till doughy, and then add more flour until the dough becomes not sticky.  Roll out the dough to about 2 inches thick.  Use a fork to poke holes on both sides of the dough.  Put on greased cookie sheet.  Bake till light brown, approximately 45 minutes.  Check it every ten minutes.  Take out the Bannock and cool it for about 20 minutes or you can cut it into little slices and fry it in butter.

Ingredient:
2  eggs
2  cups sugar
1/2  cup oil
1/2  cup nuts
1 cup  quick oats
2 cups  flour
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons  baking soda
2 teaspoons  cinnamon
2 teaspoons  nutmeg
3/4 teaspoon  salt
4 cups  sliced apples
Instructions: Combine dry ingredients and egg mixture.  Add apples and mix well.  Bake in a 9 x 13 pan for one hour.  Top with whipped cream.

Ingredient:
2 Cups  Flour
2 Cups  Sugar, divided
1 Cup  Margarine, softened
1 1/2 Cups  Corn Syrup
Ingredients:
6 Squares Baker's Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate
4  Eggs, slightly beaten
1 1/2 Teaspoons  Vanilla
2 1/2 Cups  Chopped Pecans
Instructions:
Lightly grease sides of a 15 x 10 x 1 inch baking pan.
Beat flour, 1/2 cup of sugar, butter and salt in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Press firmly and evenly into prepared baking pan.  Bake 20 minutes until lightly browned.
Microwave corn syrup and chocolate in large microwavable bowl on high 2 1/2 minutes or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring halfway through heating time.  Stir until chocolate is melted.  Mix in remaining 1 1/2 cups sugar, eggs and vanilla until blended.  Stir in pecans.  Pour filling over hot crust, spread evenly.
Bake 35 minutes or until filling is firm around edges and slightly soft in center.  Cool completely in pan on wire rack.  Cut into bars.
Top of stove preparation:  Heat corn syrup and chocolate in heavy 3 quart saucepan on very low heat, stirring constantly until chocolate is melted and mixture is smooth.  Continue as above.

Ingredient:
2 2/3 Cups Baker's Angel Flake Coconut
2/3 Cup  Sugar
6 Tablespoons Flour
Ingredients:
1/4 Teaspoon  Salt
4  Egg Whites, unbeaten
1 Teaspoon Almond Extract
Instructions:
Mix coconut, sugar, flour and salt in bowl.  Stir in egg whites and almond extract until well blended.  Drop by tablespoonfuls onto lightly greased and floured cookie sheets.
Bake 20 minutes or until egos of cookies are golden brown.  Immediately remove from cookie sheets.  Cool on wire racks

Ingredient:
4 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1 (16 ounce) can whole cranberry sauce
Ingredients:
1 (20 ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
Instructions: Place chicken in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish and pierce with a fork. Layer cranberry sauce and pineapple over chicken and sprinkle with cinnamon.  Cover dish and bake  for 25 minutes. Remove cover and bake for another 15 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through (juices run clear).

Ingredient:
BROWNIES:
1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup butter or margarine
2 tablespoons water
1 1/2 cups Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels, divided
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 large eggs

FROSTING:
1 container (16 ounces) prepared vanilla frosting
1 tube chocolate decorating icing
Instructions:
BROWNIES:
Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Combine sugar, butter and water in medium saucepan. Bring just to a boil, over medium heat, stirring constantly; remove from heat. (Or, combine granulated sugar, butter and water in medium, microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on HIGH power for 3 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking time. Stir until smooth.).  Add 1 cup morsels, peppermint extract and vanilla extract; stir until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Stir in flour mixture and remaining morsels. Spread into greased 9-inch-square baking pan.  Bake 20 to 30 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely (center will sink) in pan on wire rack.

FROSTING:
Spread vanilla frosting over brownie. Squeeze chocolate icing in parallel lines over frosting. Drag wooden pick through chocolate icing to feather. Let stand until frosting is set. Cut into bars.

Ingredient:
8 Squares Baker's Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate
1/3 Cup  Sweetened Condensed Milk
Ingredients:
1/4 Cup Freshly Brewed Maxwell House Coffee
1/2 Cup  Chopped Nuts
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
Instructions: Microwave chocolate, milk and coffee in large microwavable bowl on high 2 minutes or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring halfway through heating time.  Stir until chocolate is completely melted.  Stir in nuts and vanilla.  Spread into 8 inch square pan.  Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm enough to handle.  Shape into 1 inch balls.  Roll in desired coatings.  Store in refrigerator

Ingredient:
1 Package (8 oz) Philadelphia Cream Cheese, softened
4 Cups  Powdered Sugar
2 Packages (6 Squares each)  Baker's Premium White Baking Chocolate, melted
Ingredients:
1 1/2 Teaspoons Vanilla
1 Cup  Toasted Chopped Nuts
8 Drops  Yellow Food Coloring
4 Drops  Red Food Coloring
Multi-colored sprinkles (for garnish)
Instructions: Beat cream cheese in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth.  Gradually add sugar, beating until well blended.  Stir in white chocolate, vanilla, nuts and food coloring until well mixed.  Spread in foil lined 8 inch square pan.  Top with sprinkles.  Refrigerate 1 hours or until firm.  Cut into squares.

Ingredient:
4 oz Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Softened
1 Tablespoon Margarine, Softened
1 Tablespoon Light Corn Syrup
1/4 Teaspoon Peppermint Extract
4 Cups  Powdered Sugar
Ingredients:
Green and red food colorings
Sifted Powdered Sugar
Green, red and white decorator icings, optional
Instructions:
Beat cream cheese, butter, corn syrup and extract in large mixing bowl with electric mixer at medium speed until well blended.  Gradually beat in 4 cups powdered sugar until well blended.
Divide mixture into thirds.  Knead a few drops green food coloring into one third; red food coloring into second third; leave one third plain.  Wrap each piece in plastic wrap.
Working with one color at a time, shape dough into 3/4 inch balls.  Place on wax paper lined cookie sheet.  Flatten each ball with bottom of glass that has been lightly dipped in granulated sugar.
Repeat with remaining mixtures.  Decorate with icings, if desired.  Let dry before storing. Store in covered container in refrigerator

Ingredient: 1 (12oz) Package Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
Ingredients:
3/4 Cups Crunchy Peanut Butter
3 Cups Miniature Marshmallows
Instructions: Melt chocolate with peanut butter in double boiler over hot, not boiling water; stir until well blended.  Cool slightly.  Fold in marshmallows.  Press into a greased 8 inch square pan.  Chill until firm.  Cut in squares.  Keep refrigerated.

Ingredient:
1 (8oz) Package Philadelphia Cream Cheese, Softened
1 Cup  Parkay Margarine
1 1/2 Cups  Sugar
1 1/2 Teaspoons  Vanilla
4 Eggs
2 1/4 Cups  Sifted Cake and Pastry Flour
Ingredients:
1 1/2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
3/4 Cups Well Drained Chopped Maraschino Cherries
1/2 Cup Chopped Pecans
1/4 Cup Finely Chopped Pecans
1 1/2 Cups Sifted Icing Sugar
2 Tablespoons Milk
Instructions:
Thoroughly blend softened cream cheese, margarine, sugar and vanilla.  Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.  Gradually add 2 cups flour sifted with baking powder.  Combine remaining flour with cherries and 1/2 cup nuts.  Fold into batter.  Grease a 9 inch bundt pan; sprinkle with 1/4 cup finely chopped nuts.  Pour batter into pan.  Bake 1 hour 20 minutes.  Cool 5 minutes; remove from pan.  Glaze with mixture of sifted icing sugar and milk. Garnish with cherries and pecans as desired.
NOTE:  This cake makes excellent fits,.  Bake cake in containers as suggested below:
1.  Pour 2 cups batter into each of three greased 1 lb. Coffee cans.  Bake at 325 1 hour.
2.  Pour 1 cup batter into each of five greased 6 x 3 1/2 inch loaf pans.  Bake at 325, 45 to 50 minutes

Ingredient:
8 Cups Toasted Bread Cubes
1 Cup Miracle Whip Salad Dressing
1 Cup Finely Chopped Onion
2/3 Cup Thinly Sliced Celery
Ingredients:
1/3 Cup Cold Water
2 Teaspoons Salt
1 Teaspoon Sage
Dash Of Pepper
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients; mix lightly until well blended.  Stuff chicken or turkey or bake in shallow greased pan for  30 minutes
Allow approximately 3/4 cup stuffing per 1 lb.  of bird.

Ingredient:
Cake Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 cup white sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cups milk
1/3 Cup Shortening
1 Egg
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
Ingredients:
Creamy Custard Filling Ingredients:
1/3 Cup White Sugar
2 Tablespoons Cornstarch
1/8 Teaspoon Salt
1 1/2 Cups Milk
2 Egg Yolks
2 Teaspoons Vanilla
Chocolate Glazing Ingredients:
2 (1 oz) squares unsweetened chocolate
3 Tablespoons Butter
1 Cup Confectioners Sugar
3/4 Teaspoons Vanilla
2 Tablespoons Hot Water
Instructions:
CAKE DIRECTIONS:
Grease and flour 1- 9 inch high sided like a spring form pan or two round cake pans.
In a large deep mixing bowl   beat the flour,  sugar, baking powder, salt,  milk, shortening,  egg and  vanilla at low speed, scraping the bowl constantly for a good 30 seconds.  Then beat on high speed, scraping bowl occasionally for 3 full minutes.  Pour the batter into the prepared pan.  Bake for 30 - 35 Minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Remove from the pan  from oven and let cool on a wire rack.
FILLING DIRECTIONS:
In a medium deep mixing bowl, beat egg yolks until lemony, and set aside.  In a 2 quart heavy bottomed saucepan, mix 1/3 cup sugar, cornstarch and salt.  Stir in the milk gradually and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and boils.  Boil and stir 1 minute.  Stir at least 1/2 of this hot mixture slowly, a little at a time, into the egg yolks.  Return this mixture to the saucepan and boil and stir well for 1 minute.  Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla.  Let cool to room temperature.
CHOCOLATE GLAZING DIRECTIONS:
Heat the chocolate and butter over low heat until melted.  Remove from heat and stir in the confectioner's sugar and vanilla.  Stir in the water, 1 tsp at a time, until glaze is of desired consistency.
ASSEMBLING THE CAKE:
Using the two small thinner layer cakes or split the cooled spring form cake in half to make 2 thin layers.  Fill the layers with the filling.  Spread the chocolate glaze over the top.  Chill before serving and refrigerate any leftover cake.

Ingredient:
1 Cup  Flour
1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1 Teaspoon Powdered Sugar
1/4 Teaspoon Salt
1 Egg Beaten
Ingredients:
2 Georgia Apples, Peeled and Chopped
1/4 Cup Milk
Powdered Sugar
Vegetable Oil
Instructions: Combine dry ingredients in medium mixing bowl.  Combine milk and egg, stir into dry ingredients.  Stir in apples.  Drop batter by teaspoonful into deep hot oil, fry until brown, turning once.  Drain on absorbent paper, sprinkle with sugar.

Ingredient:
1/2 Cup  Butter
1 Cup Packed Brown Sugar
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
2 Eggs Beaten
1 1/4 Cups Flour
1 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2 Teaspoon Salt
Ingredients:
1/2 Teaspoon Nutmeg
1/4 Cup Chopped Candied Cherries
1/4 Cups Chopped Mixed Peel
1/2 Cup Raisins
1/2 Cup Chopped Dates
Icing Sugar
Instructions: Cream together butter and sugar.  Add vanilla and eggs, beaten well.  Blend together flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg.  Add to creamed mixture and beat well.  Stir in fruit.  Spread in well greased 9 inch square pan.  Bake about 25 minutes.  Cool and top with icing sugar.  Cut into small squares.

Ingredient:
1 Cup Brown Sugar
1 Tablespoon Ketchup
1 Tablespoon Soy Sauce
1/2 Cup Water
2 Tablespoons Cornstarch
Ingredients:
1 Tablespoon Mustard
1/2 Cup White Vinegar
1 Small Can Crushed Pineapple
23 Lbs. Ribs
Instructions: Brown the ribs in heavy skillet.  Mix the brown sugar and cornstarch.  Add ketchup, mustard and soy sauce.  Mix well.  Add the vinegar, water and pineapple and bring to a boil.  Pour this mixture over the browned ribs in a large casserole.  Bake for at least 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1 Cup  Shortening
1 Cup White Sugar
3 Eggs
2 Cups Apple Sauce
3 Cups Flour
3 Teaspoons Baking Powder
Ingredients:
1 Teaspoon Salt
2 Cups Cut-Up Gumdrops
1 Package Cut Fruit (Green/Red)
1/2 Cup Fine Coconut
1/2 Cup Raisins
Instructions: Bake in a greased tube pan

Ingredient:
1 1/4 Cups Graham Wafer Crumbs
1/3 Cup Butter (melted)
1/4 Cup White Sugar
3 Packages Cream Cheese (softened)
1 Can Sweetened Condensed Milk
Ingredients:
8 Squares Semi-Sweet Chocolate, melted and cooled
4 Eggs
2 Teaspoons Vanilla
1 Can Cherry Pie Filling
Instructions: Combine crumbs, butter and sugar.  Press firmly on bottom of  9 inch spring form pan.  In large mixer bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk, chocolate, eggs and vanilla until smooth.  Pour into prepared pan.  Bake 65 Minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched.  Cool.  Top with cherry pie filling.  Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate curls.  Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
1 Cup Cranberries (chopped)
1 2/4 Cups Flour
1 Cup White Sugar
1 1/2 Teaspoons Baking Powder
Ingredients:
1/2 Teaspoon Baking Soda
1/2 Teaspoon Salt
1 Egg
3/4 Cup Orange Juice
1/4 Cup Vegetable Oil
Instructions: Sift dry ingredients.  Stir in cranberries.  Beat together the egg, juice and oil.  Add to dry ingredients.  Beat for about 1/2 minute.  Batter will be lumpy.  Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1 (6oz) jar Red Cherries
1 Beaten Egg
1 1/4 Teaspoon Baking Powder
2 Cups Flour
1/2 Cup Chopped Walnuts
Ingredients:
3/4 Cup Sugar
1/2 Cup Sugar
1/2 Cup Melted Butter
1/4 Teaspoon Salt
Milk
Instructions: Drain the cherries, saving the juice.  Cut cherries in half.  Add enough milk to cherry juice to make one cup.  Combine sugar, butter, egg and milk - juice mixture.  Beat well.  Add sifted dry ingredients and stir only until mixed.  Add nuts.  Fold in cherries last.  Bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1 3/4 Cups Flour
1/2 Cup Sugar
1 1/2 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2 Teaspoon Baking Soda
1/2 Teaspoon Salt
1 Egg
3/4 Cup Milk
Ingredients:
3/4 Cup Applesauce
1/4 Cup Margarine, melted
1 Cup Fresh Cranberries, coarsely chopped and 2 Tablespoons Flour
1/2 Teaspoon Ground Cinnamon and 2 Tablespoons Sugar
Instructions: In medium bowl, sift together the first five dry ingredients.  In small bowl, combine egg, milk, applesauce and margarine and mix well.  Add egg mixture to flour mixture just until moistened.  In small bowl toss 2 Tablespoons of flour with cranberries.  Fold into batter.  Spoon batter into 12 cup greased muffin cups.  Sprinkle cinnamon and 2 tablespoons of sugar over tops of muffins.   Bake for 2-0 - 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Ingredient:
1 Cup  Dates, finely chopped
2 Cups  Boiling Water
2 Teaspoons  Baking Soda in water
Pour water over dates, let cool.
4 Cups Flour
1 Teaspoon Salt
Ingredients:
2 Cups  Sugar
2 Tablespoons Butter
2 Well Beaten Eggs
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
1 Cup Pecans/Walnuts, chopped
Instructions: Cream butter and sugar.  Add eggs, then dates/water.  Stir in rest of the dry ingredients.  Fold in nuts.    Bake for 2 hours in small bread pans.  It takes less time if using loaf pans.

Ingredient:
3 eggs
2 tablespoons butter
1/2 teaspoon salt
9 cups unbleached white flour
Ingredients:
2 packages dry yeast
3 cups warm water
Butter
Instructions: The final shape can be free form, braided or rolled into the shape of a small shell.  You can add raisins, currents or fruit.  In a bowl, combine eggs, butter, salt and  flour.  Gradually  mix the dry yeast into the warm water, then add to the dough mix, stirring with a wooden spoon and work it in slowly.  Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 10 minutes or until the dough is smooth and elastic.  Put in a greased bowl, turn to coat the top, cover and put in a warm spot for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until dough has doubled in bulk.  Punch down, turn out onto a floured surface again and knead for 2 minutes.  Return to greased bowl, cover and let rise again in a warm spot for about 1 hour.  After the second rise, turn out onto a floured surface, punch down and divide the dough into as many breads as you wish to bake.  Take 1 handful of the dough and roll it out to a length of about 1 foot.  Then twist it into a braid or roll it into snail-shell shape, curling it from the inside out.  Place the breads on a greased cookie sheet and cover lightly.  Place in a warm spot for about 1 hour.  Bake for about 45 - 60 minutes, depending on the size of the bread.  When done, it should have a nice golden brown appearance and the bottom sound hollow when tapped.  After removing from the oven, grease the tops slightly with butter while the breads are still hot.  Cool on wire racks.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup warm water
2 tablespoons margarine, cut up
1 large egg
2 tablespoons honey
2 cups bread flour
1/2 cup whole wheat flour
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon packed light brown sugar
1 tablespoon powdered dry milk
1 teaspoon salt
3/4 teaspoons cinnamon
1 1/2 teaspoons bread machine yeast
2/3 cup raisins
Instructions: Measure carefully, adding ingredients to bread machine pan in the order recommended by the manufacturer.  Select Sweet or Basic/White cycle.  Use Light or Medium crust color.  Add raisins at the raisin/nut cycle or 5 minutes before last kneading cycle ends.  This is supposed to be a soft and sticky dough.  Do not add flour, as the bread will become tough.  Remove baked bread from pan and cool on wire rack.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups water
3 cups flour
2 tablespoons dry milk
3 tablespoons sugar
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons butter
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons dry yeast
Instructions: Combine ingredients in bread machine and put through the entire dough cycle.  Remove and roll out onto a floured surface in a rectangle shape.  Melt 1/2 cup of butter and pour enough of the melted butter into two pie plates to cover the bottom.  Spread the rest of the  melted butter onto the dough.  Sprinkle brown sugar in each pie plate and over the dough.  Sprinkle cinnamon over the dough.  Roll up the dough length wise to make a long rope. Cut into 1 inch slices and place in pie plates.  Cover and let rise for about 2 hours.  Bake till golden brown on top.  Remove from the oven and immediately invert pie plate on a sheet of wax paper.  Cool.  Serve warm with butter.   Freezes very well.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups unsifted flour
2 tablespoons  sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 package active dry yeast
Ingredients:
1/2 cup milk
1/4 cup water
2 tablespoons margarine
Instructions: Mix 1/4 cup of the flour, sugar, salt and undissolved yeast.  Heat milk, water and margarine to 120 - 130 degrees.  Gradually add milk mixture to dry mixture and beat 2 minutes at medium speed of mixer.  Add 1/4 cup flour.  Beat at high speed 2 minutes.  Stir in enough additional flour to make soft dough.  On floured board knead 2 to 3 minutes.  Divide dough in 8 - 12 equal pieces.  Shape into balls. Place in an 8 inch round pan.  Pour a 1 inch depth of boiling water into large pan on bottom rack of cold oven.  Set rolls on rack above water.  Cover.  Close oven door, let rise for 30 minutes.  Remove the cover.  Remove pan of water.  Bake 20-25 minutes or till rolls are light golden in color. Remove from pan to cool.  Serve warm

Ingredient:
Pastry:
1 Cup Water
1 Cup Flour
1/2 Cup Butter
4 Large Eggs
1/4 Teaspoon Salt
Custard:
3 Cups Milk
Ingredients:
1/2 Cup Sugar
3 Tablespoons Cornstarch
4 Egg Yolks
2 Teaspoons Vanilla
Chocolate Covering:
12 oz. Semisweet Chocolate
1/4 Teaspoon Shortening
1/4 Cup Light Corn Syrup
6 Tablespoons Milk
Instructions:
Pastry:
Bring water with the salt to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in flour. Beat over low heat until mixture leaves from the side of the pan. Remove from heat.  Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat until shiny and satiny and broken in strands.  Drop three inches apart on ungreased sheet.  Form 12 strips 4 x 1 inches.  Bake for 40 minutes.  (it will sound hollow if tapped lightly.  Keep from drafts). Slit tops of eclairs and fill with custard. Spread tops with chocolate covering, chill and serve.
Custard:
In a medium saucepan heat milk slowly just until bubbles form round the edge. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cornstarch, mixing well. Stir into hot milk all at once. Cook, stirring, over medium heat until mixture boils. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 minute.  Beat a small amount of mixture into egg yolks. Pour back into sauce pan and cook, stirring, over medium heat until mixture boils and thickens.  Stir in vanilla.  Place waxed paper on surface to prevent skin from forming.  Refrigerate until ready to use.  Makes about 3 cups.
Chocolate Covering:
In top of double boiler, over hot but not boiling water, melt the chocolate with the shortening.  Add corn syrup and milk.  Stir until smooth and well blended.  Let cool slightly.  Spread covering over  degreesclairs.  Makes 2 cups.

Ingredient:
1/3 Cup Garlic Powder
1/2 Cup Salt
1/2 Cup Onion Powder
1/2 Cup Cayenne Pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 Cup Black Pepper
1 Teaspoon Ginger Powder
1 Teaspoon Dried Thyme
Instructions: Combine all ingredients and mix well.  Store in an airtight container.  Use to season  chicken, seafood, meat, vegetables, hamburgers or add 1 Tablespoon to 1 lb. of ground beef for meatloaf

Ingredient:
5 - 5 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 1/2 cups sugar
2 packages quick rise yeast
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup milk
3/4 cup margarine
2 eggs
1 1/2 tablespoons cinnamon
1 (8 oz) package chopped pitted dates
Ingredients:
Powdered Sugar Glaze:
In small bowl combine 1 cup powdered sugar, sifted and 1 - 3 tablespoons milk.  Stir until smooth.

Honey Glaze:
In small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup honey and 1/4 cup butter.  Cook over low heat until butter melts and mixture is blended, stirring frequently.
Instructions: In bowl, combine 2 cups flour, 1/2 cup sugar, undissolved yeast and salt.  Heat water, milk and 1/2 cup margarine until very warm; margarine does not need to melt.  Stir into dry ingredients.  Stir in eggs and enough remaining flour to make soft dough.  Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 4 to 6 minutes.  Cover, let rest on floured surface 10 minutes.  Roll dough to 22 x 10 inch rectangle.  Melt remaining margarine, brush on dough.  Evenly sprinkle with remaining sugar, cinnamon, and dates.  Beginning at long end, roll up tightly as for jelly roll.  Pinch seam to seal. With sharp knife, cut roll into 15 pieces.  Place, cut sides up, in greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan.  Cover, let rise in warm, draft free place until doubled in size, about 30 to 60 minutes.  Bake for 30 minutes or until done. Remove from pan, let cool on wire rack. Brush with Powdered Sugar Glaze or Honey Glaze

Ingredient:
1 1/4 Cups Sugar
6 Tablespoons Cornstarch
2 Cups Water
1/3 Cup Lemon Juice
3 Eggs - separated
Ingredients:
3 Tablespoons Butter
1 1/2 Teaspoons Lemon Extract
2 Teaspoons Vinegar
1 Pinch Salt
4 Tablespoon Sugar
Instructions: Mix sugar and cornstarch together, then stir in 2 cups water.  Combine egg yolks and lemon juice together well.  Add to sugar mixture and cook on medium heat until thick and boiling, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat; add lemon extract, butter, vinegar and salt. Place in baked pie shell.

Ingredient: 3 Egg Whites
Ingredients: 4 Tablespoons Sugar
Instructions: Beat egg whites until stiff, add 4 tablespoons sugar, beat well.  Pile on top of pie and bake until brown.

Ingredient:
l-1/4 cups sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarcch
Ingredients: 4 cups pitted dark sweet cherrie
Instructions:
In a large saueepan, combine sugaro cornstarch and salt; stir in
cherries. Let stand for 30 minutes. Cook and stir cherry mixture over
medium heat until mixture boils and starts to thicken. Line a f-in. pie
plate with bottom pastry; add filling. (If filling is frozen, thaw in the
refrigerator overnight.) Flute edges of pastry, Bake at 375 degrees for 45
minutes or until crust is golden brown and fitling is bubbly. Cover
edges during the last 20 minutes to prevent overbrowning.

Ingredient:
3 Cups Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1 - 14 oz Can Eagle Brand Condensed Milk
Dash of Salt
Ingredients:
1 Cup Chopped Nuts
1 1/2 Teaspoons  Vanilla
Instructions: In a heavy sauce pan over low heat, melt the chips with the condensed milk and salt.  Remove from heat, stir in nuts and vanilla.  Spread evenly into a 8 or 9 inch pan lined with aluminum foil.   Chill for 2 hours till firm.  Turn fudge onto cutting board, peel off foil and cut into squares.  Store loosely at room temperature.

Ingredient:
1 Cup All Purpose Flour
1/2 Teaspoon Salt
1 Cup Butter, at room temperature
1/2 Cup Powdered Sugar
Ingredients:
2 1/2 Teaspoons Vanilla
1 1/2 Cups Flaked Coconut
Extra Powdered Sugar For Rolling
Walnuts (optional)
Instructions:
Combine the flour and salt.  In a large bowl, cream the butter and powdered sugar.   Beat in the vanilla.  Gradually blend in the dry ingredients.  Fold in the coconut. Cover and chill for 4 hours.  Pinch off walnut sized pieces of dough and roll into balls.  Place each ball 1 inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets.  Bake for 10 - 12 minutes until  lightly colored.  Transfer to a wire rack to cool.  Just before serving, roll balls in powdered sugar..
Walnuts can be added for a great taste.  When pinching off a piece of dough, put a whole  walnut in the middle and roll into a ball covering the nut completely.

Ingredient:
1/2 Cup Margarine
1 Cup Sugar
4 Eggs
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
1 1/2 Cups Chocolate Syrup
1 Cup Plus 1 Tablespoon Sifted Flour
1/2 Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/4 Teaspoon Salt
Ingredients:
1/2 Cup Chopped Walnuts
-------
6 Tablespoons Margarine
6 Tablespoons Milk
1 Cup Sugar
1/2 Cup Semi-Sweet Chocolate Pieces
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
Instructions:
Beat margarine with sugar until light and fluffy.  Beat in eggs, two at a time and vanilla, mix well.  Stir in chocolate syrup.  Sift together flour, baking powder and salt.  Stir into chocolate mixture and add nuts.  Pour into well greased jelly roll pan and spread evenly.  Bake 22 - 25 minutes or until slight imprint remains when touched lightly.
-----
Combine margarine, milk and sugar in saucepan.  Stir to mix.  Bring to a boil and boil 30 seconds.  Add chocolate pieces, stir until mixture thickens slightly and cools.  Stir in vanilla and spread over cooled brownies.

Ingredient:
Base:
1/2 cup butter
1/4 cup sugar
5 tablespoons cocoa powder
1 egg, slightly beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1 cup shredded coconut
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
Ingredients:
Filling: (See also various fillings)
1/3 cup butter
3 tablespoons custard powder (or substitute vanilla jello pudding powder)
1/4 cup milk
3 cups icing sugar
Topping:
8 ounces semisweet chocolate
2 tablespoons butter
Instructions:
Base:
Melt butter in heavy saucepan.  Stir in sugar and cocoa until smooth.  Whisk egg with vanilla and stir into butter mixture.  Remove from heat.  Stir in crumbs, coconut and nuts.  Press evenly over bottom of greased 9 inch square pan.  Chill until set, at least 20 minutes.

Filling:
Beat butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in custard powder and milk.  Gradually beat in sugar.  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.
Topping:
Melt together chocolate and butter, stir until smooth.  Spread in even layer over chilled filling.  Store in fridge until chocolate topping begins to harden.  Score topping into bars.  Cut before totally solid, use a hot knife, wipe clean between cuts.  Store in fridge or freeze for up to 2 months.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons custard powder
1/4 cup milk
2 tablespoons butter, softened
Ingredients:
1/2 cup peanut butter, smooth
2 cups icing sugar
Instructions: Beat butter and peanut butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in custard powder and milk.  Gradually beat in sugar.  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.

Ingredient:
2 cups icing sugar
1/4 cup butter, softened
1/4 cup Grand Marnier or orange, liqueur
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon orange rind, coarsely grated
Instructions: Beat butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in Grand Marnier and orange rind.  Gradually beat in sugar.  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup butter, softened
1 tablespoon cherry juice
2 cups icing sugar
Ingredients:
1/3 cup Maraschino cherries, chopped
Drop or 2 of red food coloring
Instructions: Beat butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in cherry juice and food coloring.  Gradually beat in sugar and add cherries .  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup butter
3 tablespoons custard powder (or substitute jell pudding powder)
1/4 cup milk
Ingredients:
3 cups icing sugar
1 teaspoon peppermint flavoring
1 or 2 drop green food coloring as desired
Instructions: Beat butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in custard powder and milk.  Gradually beat in sugar, add peppermint flavoring and food coloring.  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons milk
3 tablespoons unsalted butter
2 teaspoons instant coffee or espresso powder
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups icing sugar
Instructions: Beat butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in instant coffee and vanilla.  Gradually beat in sugar.  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup butter
3 tablespoons custard powder (or substitute vanilla jell pudding powder)
Ingredients:
1/4 cup Bailey's Irish Cream
2 - 3 cups icing sugar
Instructions: Beat butter with wooden spoon until light.  Beat in custard powder and Irish Cream.  Gradually beat in sugar.  Spread over chilled base and let set in fridge.

Ingredient:
5 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
3 teaspoons ground ginger
2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon ground cloves
1 cup shortening
1 cup white sugar
1 1/2 cups molasses
2 eggs
Instructions:
Sift together flour, soda, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon and cloves.  Melt shortening in saucepan large enough for mixing dough.  Add sugar, molasses and eggs and mix well.  Gradually stir in 3/4 of the flour mixture.  Work in remaining flour mixture by hand.  Divide dough into thirds for easier handling.
Roll dough out on parchment paper to about 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick and cut with desired shape cookie cutters.
Bake for 9 to 12 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
Crust:
2 cups flour
1 cup butter
1/2 cup icing sugar
Ingredients:
Topping:
4 eggs
1/3 cup lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
2 cups sugar
1/4 cup flour
Instructions: Sift together flour and icing sugar.   Cut in butter till mixture clings together.  Press into a 13 x 9 inch pan and bake for 20 - 25 minutes or until lightly browned.  While crust is baking prepare topping by beating eggs together with the sugar and lemon juice.  Sift flour and baking powder together and stir into egg mixture. Pour topping over baked crust and bake for an additional 25 minutes.  Cool completely - sprinkle with icing sugar and cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups sugar
2 eggs
3/4 cup unsalted butter, melted and cooled
1 teaspoon almond extract
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups flour
2 cups fresh cranberries
1/2 cup chopped, pecans or almonds
Instructions: Butter 9 inch square baking pan.  Beat sugar and eggs in large bowl until slightly thickened, about 2 minutes.  Beat in melted butter and almond extract.  Add flour and stir until well blended.  Stir in cranberries and nuts.  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake until tester inserted into center comes out clean.  Transfer to rack to cool.  Dust with powdered sugar before serving

Ingredient:
1 3/4 cups oats, quick cooking or regular, uncooked
1 cup flour
1 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon almond extract
1/2 cup margarine, chilled
1 (12 oz) jar apricot preserves
Instructions: Stir together oats, flour, sugar, baking powder and almond extract.  Cut in butter with pastry blender until mixture becomes coarse.  Very firmly press 3 cups oat mixture into greased 9 inch square pan.  Spread with preserves leaving a 1/4 inch margin along sides.  Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.  Bake 25 - 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool before cutting.

Ingredient:
Cake:
Mix together:
1 yellow cake mix
1 small package vanilla instant pudding mix
4 eggs
1/2 cup cold water
1/2 cup oil
1/2 cup rum
Ingredients:
Glaze:
In small saucepan melt:
1 stick butter
1 cup sugar
1/4 cup water
1/2 cup rum
Instructions:
Cake:
Grease and flour bundt or tube pan.  Spread 2 cups chopped walnuts on bottom of pan.  Pour batter on top and bake for about one hour.  While cake is still warm prick all over with fork and pour glaze over all.

Glaze:

Mix until sugar is dissolved.  Boil for 5 minutes.  Pour slowly over cake.

Ingredient:
1 cup flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1 cup butter, softened
3/4 cup sugar
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
3 cups uncooked oatmeal
12 ounces butterscotch chips
Instructions: Spray a 10 x 15 inch rimmed cookie sheet with non-stick spray.  Combine flour, soda, salt and cinnamon.  Set aside.  Cream butter, then add sugar and mix until fluffy.  Add eggs and  vanilla and beat well.  Gradually add flour mixture.  Stir in oatmeal and butterscotch chips.  Spread in prepared pan and bake for 20 - 25 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cup dried apricots
2 2/3 cups flour (divided)
1/2 cup sugar
1 cup margarine
2 cups light brown sugar
Ingredients:
4 eggs
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup pecan pieces
Instructions:
In a medium saucepan, cover apricots with water and boil for 10 minutes, drain and cool.  When cooled, chop and set aside.
Sift together 2 cups four and 1/2 cup sugar.  Cut in the margarine.  Press in the bottom of a greased 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking dish and bake for 25 minutes.  Combine the brown sugar, eggs and vanilla.  Sift together the remaining flour, baking powder and salt.  Add to the sugar/egg mixture and mix well.  Add the apricots and pecan pieces.  Spread this mixture over the baked crust.  Bake for 35 minutes.  Cool several hours.  Cut into squares and sprinkle with icing sugar.  These freeze very well.

Ingredient:
2 cups sugar
2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons almond extract
1 cup butter, melted
4 eggs
icing sugar
slivered almonds
Instructions: Combine first  7 ingredients and mix well.  Grease a jelly roll pan and sprinkle with icing sugar.  Pour batter into the pan.  Pooch almonds into batter.  Bake 15 - 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Ingredient:
3 squares unsweetened chocolate
1/2 cup shortening
3 eggs
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup flour
1 1/2 cups chopped walnuts
1/3 cup raspberry preserves
Ingredients:
Velvet Chocolate Glaze:
1 square unsweetened chocolate
2 tablespoons butter
2 tablespoons light corn syrup
2 cups icing sugar
1 tablespoon milk
2 teaspoons vanilla
Instructions:
Melt 3 squares chocolate with shortening over warm water, cool slightly.  Blend together eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt; stir in chocolate  mixture, then flour.  Fold in walnuts.  Turn into well greased 8 inch square pan.  Bake for 40 minutes.  Spoon preserves over hot brownies; spread carefully.   Let cool.  Spread Velvet Chocolate Glaze over brownies.

Glaze:
Melt 1 square chocolate.  Blend in butter and corn syrup.  Stir in powdered sugar, milk and vanilla, mix well.

Ingredient:
Cream together:
2 cups butter
2 cups white sugar
2 cups brown sugar
Add:
4 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla
In Separate Bowl:
4 cups flour
Ingredients:
5 cups oatmeal (put in blender to make powder)
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons baking powder
2 teaspoons baking soda
Mix all ingredients together and add:
24 oz bag of chocolate chips
1 -8 oz plain Hershey bar, grated
3 cups chopped nuts
Instructions: Place golf ball sized cookies 2" apart on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake for 6 minutes.

Ingredient:
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 tablespoon honey
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon lime juice
1 teaspoon chopped garlic
4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
Instructions: In a shallow medium dish, blend soy sauce, honey, vegetable oil, lime juice and garlic. Place chicken breast halves into the mixture. Marinate in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes.  Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil grate.  Place marinated chicken on the prepared grill. Cook 6 to 8 minutes on each side, until meat is no longer pink and juices run clear.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1 cup white sugar
Ingredients:
2/3 cup butter, softened
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup mashed bananas (very ripe)
2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
Instructions: Sift the flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda together and set aside.  Cream the butter with the sugar until light and fluffy.  Beat in the eggs and vanilla.  Mix in the mashed bananas.  Add the flour mixture and stir until just combined.  Stir in the chocolate chips.  Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup butter
1 1/2 cups white sugar
1 1/2 cups brown sugar
4 eggs
1 tablespoon and 1 teaspoon vanilla
4 1/2 cups flour
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
5 cups semisweet chocolate chips
2 cups flaked coconut
2 cups chopped almonds
Instructions: Grease cookie sheet.  In a large bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar and brown sugar until smooth.  Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then stir in the vanilla.  Combine the flour, baking soda and salt, stir into the creamed mixture until well blended.  Finally, stir in the chocolate chips, coconut and almonds.  Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto the prepared cookie sheet.  Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.  Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 3/4 cups icing sugar
1 teaspoon orange juice
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups shredded coconut
1 (10 oz) jar maraschino cherries, drained
Instructions: In a medium bowl, cream together butter, icing sugar and orange juice, mix in coconut.  Wrap coconut mixture around each cherry to cover completely.  Store in refrigerator in a lightly covered container until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup sweetened condensed milk
1 1/2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
Ingredients:
3/4 teaspoon vanilla
pinch of salt
Instructions: In a medium sized saucepan, melt chocolate chips in sweetened condensed milk over medium-low heat.  Stir in vanilla and salt.  Pour chocolate mixture into ungreased 10 inch square pan.   Chill several hours until set.  Cut into squares

Ingredient:
2 cups white sugar
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup butter
25 marshmallows, quartered
Ingredients:
2 cups milk chocolate chips
2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 (1oz) squares unsweetened chocolate
1 cup chopped pecans
Instructions: Grease jelly roll pan.   Combine sugar, milk, vanilla and butter in large, heavy saucepan.  Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.  Boil for 2 minutes.  Remove from heat and add marshmallows, semi-sweet chocolate chips, milk chocolate chips and unsweetened chocolate.  Stir until melted and smooth.  Stir in nuts.  Mix well.  Pour into prepared pan.  Let fudge sit at least 24 hours before cutting into squares.  Refrigerate for easier cutting.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup shortening
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
1 egg
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup flour
Ingredients:
1 cup rolled oats
1/2 cup flaked coconut
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 cup gumdrops, halved
Instructions: Cream together first 5 ingredients.  Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.  Fold in gumdrops.  Drop by teaspoonfuls onto cookie sheet.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or just until golden brown.

Ingredient:
5 ounces sweetened condensed milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups icing sugar
Ingredients:
14 ounces flaked coconut
4 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
Instructions: Blend the condensed milk and vanilla in a bowl.  Add the icing sugar a little at a time, blending each time until smooth.  Stir in the coconut.  You should have a firm mixture.  Pat the mixture into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan and chill until firm.  Place the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl and heat on high 1 minute at a time, stirring after each minute, until melted.  Remove the pan from the refrigerator and cut the coconut mixture into 1 x 2 inch bars.  Set each bar on a fork and dip into the chocolate, completely coating the bar.  Let excess drip off, then set on waxed paper.  Repeat for each bar.  Bars will take several hours to air dry.  If you are in hurry you can refrigerate the bars for about 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 cups macaroni
2 (6 oz) cans tuna, drained
1 onion, chopped
1 green bell pepper, chopped
2 stalks celery, chopped
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons garlic powder
1 1/2 cups mayonnaise
2 tablespoons prepared mustard
salt to taste
ground black pepper to taste
Instructions: Cook noodles in a large pot of boiling water until done.  Rinse under cold water and drain.  Mix tuna, onion, pepper, celery garlic powder, mayonnaise, salt and pepper and mustard together in a large bowl.  Add pasta and mix well

Ingredient:
1 lb. Macaroni
1 1/2 lbs. Ground beef
1 small yellow onion, diced
1 green bell pepper, diced
1 cup sliced mushrooms
1 can whole kernel corn, drained
1 can peas, drained
1 can stewed tomatoes, cut in half and drained
1 can crushed tomatoes
Ingredients:
4 cans tomato paste
2 cans tomato sauce
3 cups water
1 tablespoon chopped garlic
1 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese
1 tablespoon dried parsley
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon black pepper
1/8 teaspoon white sugar
Instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.  Add macaroni and cook 8 to 10 minutes or until done, drain.  In a large saucepan, brown the ground beef with the onion, green pepper and mushrooms, drain.  Add corn, peas, stewed and crushed tomatoes, tomato  paste, tomato sauce and water.  Stir and bring to boil over medium heat.  Mix in garlic, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt, pepper, sugar and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes.  Mix together cooked macaroni and meat sauce.

Ingredient:
2 large skinless, boneless chicken breasts - cooked and cubed
1 cup chicken broth
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 can (5 oz) evaporated milk
1 cup sliced almonds
Ingredients:
1 can sliced mushrooms, drained
1 (8oz) can water chestnuts, drained and minced
1 (5oz) can crispy chow mien noodles
2/3 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 cup diced celery
Instructions: In a lightly greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish, combine all ingredients.  Mix well and make sure mixture is spread evenly in the dish.  Bake for 45 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
1 onion, chopped
3/4 cup butter, melted
1 1/3 cups water
Ingredients:
6 ounces dry bread stuffing mix
1/4 cup water
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Instructions: In a non-stick skillet, saut degrees the chicken and the onion until the chicken is completely cooked and onion is tender.  In a medium bowl blend the melted butter, water and stuffing mix.   In a 2 quart casserole dish layer half of the chicken, all of the stuffing, then the rest of the chicken.  Mix the 1/4 cup of water with the soup and pour over all in the casserole dish. Top with the cheese and bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
1 (8 oz) can water chestnuts
1 onion, chopped
Ingredients:
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 cup cornflakes cereal crumbs
1 cup mayonnaise
Instructions: In a large pot, boil the chicken until tender.  In a large bowl combine the chicken pieces with the water chestnuts, onion, soup, most of the crushed cornflakes and mayonnaise.  Mix well.  Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.  Sprinkle the rest of the crushed cornflakes on top of the  mixture.  Bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1 lb ground beef
1 green bell pepper, diced
1 bunch green onions, diced
1/4 lb sliced fresh mushrooms
1/2 cup Saltine crackers, finely crushed
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 package beef with onion soup mix
1 1/2 cups ketchup
1 tablespoon yellow mustard
2 teaspoons brown sugar
Instructions: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground beef, green pepper, green onion, mushrooms and saltine crackers.  Stir in the eggs and the beef with onion soup mix, mix thoroughly.  Press mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.  In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the ketchup, yellow mustard and brown sugar.  Mix thoroughly and pour over the meat mixture, spreading evenly.  Bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
2 lbs ground beef
1 cup chopped onion
1 can tomato sauce
3 1/2 lbs. chopped cabbage
Ingredients:
1 cup uncooked white rice
1 teaspoon salt
2 cans beef broth
Instructions: In a large skillet, brown beef in oil over medium high heat until redness is gone.  Drain off fat.  In a large mixing bowl combine the onion , tomato sauce, cabbage, rice and salt.  Add meat and mix all together.  Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 baking dish.  Pour broth over meat mixture and bake, covered, for 1 hour.  Stir, replace cover and bake for another 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 lb. Ground beef
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped celery
1 can condensed vegetable soup
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
3 cups mashed cooked potatoes
1 cup shredded cheese
Instructions: Lightly grease a 2 quart baking dish.  In a large skillet over medium high heat stir and cook ground beef, onion and celery until juices run clear.  Drain.  Pour mixture into baking dish with vegetable soup and thyme, stir well.  Spread mashed potatoes on top.  Bake 20 minutes.  Sprinkle shredded cheese on top and bake5 minutes more, or until cheese has melted.

RecipeName: Linguini with Broccoli and Red Peppers
Ingredient:
1 lb. Linguini pasta
1 lb. fresh broccoli, chopped
3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
1 tablespoon butter
Ingredients:
3 cloves garlic, minced
1 red bell pepper, thinly sliced
1 pinch garlic salt
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
Instructions: Bring large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.  Add pasta and cook 8 to 10 minutes or until done, drain.  Steam broccoli with 2 tablespoons water in microwave for 6 - 7 minutes.  In 10 inch skillet, heat olive oil and butter over low heat.  Stir in garlic and red pepper slices, saut degrees gently.  Drain broccoli and add to skillet.  Sprinkle lightly with garlic salt and saut degrees broccoli and peppers until soft.  Toss vegetable mixture with hot pasta.  Sprinkle with cheese.

Ingredient:
3 cups fresh sliced rhubarb
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
dash of salt

Topping:
3/4 cup flour
Ingredients:
1 cup sugar
1/3 cup margarine
1/3 cup sliced almonds or chopped walnuts
Whipping cream or ice cream
Instructions: Prepare rhubarb and place in 6 x 10 dish, sprinkle with cinnamon and salt.  In bowl combine flour, sugar and cut in margarine until crumbly , add almonds or walnuts.  Sprinkle crumb mixture over rhubarb.  Bake for 35 minutes or until golden brown with rhubarb soft and cooked.  Serve with whipped cream or ice cream

Ingredient:
6 strips bacon
1 medium onion, chopped
2 potatoes, peeled and cubed
1/2 cup water
2 cups milk
Ingredients:
2 cans cream style corn
1 can whole kernel corn, drained
1/2 red pepper, finely diced
1/2 green pepper, finely diced
1/2 teaspoon salt
Black pepper
Instructions: Fry bacon in a Dutch oven until crisp; remove bacon, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Crumble bacon and set aside.  Saut degrees onion in reserved drippings until tender; add potatoes and water.  Cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.  Stir in milk, corn, red and green peppers, salt and pepper to taste; continue to cook, stirring frequently, until heated through.  Sprinkle with crumbled bacon to serve.

Ingredient:
2 cups canned sliced peaches, drained
1 box (4 oz) instant vanilla pie filling
1 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 cup sour cream
1/4 teaspoon almond extract
2/3 cup reserved peach juice
1 tablespoon corn starch
1 teaspoon lemon juice
Instructions: Stir together milk, sour cream, pie filling and almond extract for 2 minutes.  Pour filling into baked pie shell.  Chill for 10 minutes.  Arrange peach slices in a nice pattern over custard in pie shell.  In a pot place reserved peach juice and corn starch.  Bring to a boil and cook for 2 minutes.  Remove from heat, and add lemon juice.  Pour glaze over peaches.  Chill until set.

Ingredient:
2 1/8 cups shortening
1 cup white sugar
5 cups flour
1 tablespoon cream of tartar
1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon vanilla
1 cup brown sugar
2 eggs
1 tablespoon salt
1 tablespoon baking soda
1 cup chopped pecans or walnuts
Instructions: Cream shortening with sugars.  Mix in beaten eggs.  Sift together flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; mix into creamed mixture.  Stir in nuts and vanilla.  Make rolls about 2 inches in diameter.  Refrigerate overnight.  Slice about 3/8 inch thick and place on greased cookie sheet.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes

RecipeName: Hawaiian Hamburgers With Sweet 'n Sour Sauce
Ingredient:
Burger Mixture:
2/3 cup undiluted Carnation Evaporated Milk
1 1/2 lbs. Ground beef
1/2 cup chopped onion
2/3 cup cracker crumbs
1 teaspoon seasoned salt
Ingredients:
Sweet 'n Sour Sauce:
15 ox can drained pineapple chunks (save the syrup)
Water
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup vinegar
1/4 cup brown sugar
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 cup coarsely chopped green pepper
Instructions:
Combine burger mixture ingredients.  Form six 4" patties by pressing each between pieces of waxed paper.  Brown patties in skillet in small amount of fat.  Make sauce.

Sauce:
Add water to pineapple syrup to make 1 cup.  In saucepan mix syrup with cornstarch, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce.  Cook, stirring until thick and clear.

Pour excess fat off burgers in skillet, cover with the sauce.  Add pineapple chunks and green pepper.  Cover, simmer over low heat 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons corn starch
1 teaspoon cinnamon
5 cups peeled and sliced cooking apples
Ingredients:
1/2 cup flour
1/3 teaspoon brown sugar
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 cup cold butter or margarine
unbaked pie shell
Instructions: In large bowl, stir together sugar, corn starch and cinnamon, add apple slices and toss until coated.  Turn into pastry shell.  In small bowl, combine flour, brown sugar and cinnamon.  With two knives cut in cold butter until coarse  crumble form.  Sprinkle evenly  over apples.  Bake for 15 minutes on 425 degrees then reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake 30 to 40 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 cups fresh or frozen and thawed rhubarb
2 cups fresh or frozen strawberries
3/4 cup sugar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1 teaspoon cinnamon
Ingredients:
1 cup rolled oats
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1/2 cup melted margarine
Instructions: In large bowl, combine rhubarb and strawberries.  In small bowl, mix sugar, cornstarch and cinnamon.  Add fruit, toss to coat well.  Spread evenly in 8 or 9 inch square baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.  In small bowl, combine oats, flour and brown sugar.  Add margarine, stir until crumbly.  Sprinkle evenly over filling.  Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until bubbling throughout.

Ingredient:
1 medium onion, chopped
1 medium carrot, chopped
1 stalk celery, chopped
1 tablespoon margarine
Ingredients:
2 cups bite-sized chunks cooked chicken
1 can Cream Of Chicken Soup
1/4 can water
1 can peas, drained
Instructions: In casserole dish, combine onion, carrot, celery and butter.  Cover, microwave at high 5 - 7 minutes or until vegetables are just tender.  Stir in chicken, soup and water.  Cover; microwave at medium 4 minutes, stirring once, until heated through.  Stir in peas.  Cover, microwave at medium 2 minutes.  Let stand, covered, 2 minutes.  Serve over rice or pasta.

Ingredient:
2 lbs chicken wings, cut in half, tips discarded
1/3 cup liquid honey
2 OXO Chicken Bouillon Cubes, crumbled
2 tablespoons soy sauce
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
Instructions: On a foil lined baking sheet, arrange wings in a single layer.  Bake in 450 degrees oven for 10 minutes.  Remove wings from oven; increase temperature to 475 degrees.  Drain excess fat from wings; in a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients; drizzle evenly over wings.  Bake 25 minutes, turning and basting occasionally until wings are golden and glazed.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup Kraft 100% grated parmesan cheese
1/2 cup cornflake crumbs
1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper (optional)
6 fish fillets (flounder, sole or cod, etc.)
1 egg, beaten
Instructions: Mix cheese, crumbs and pepper.  Dip fish in egg; coat with cheese mixture.  Place in greased shallow baking dish.  Bake for 5 to 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup Kraft 100% grated parmesan cheese
1/2 cup cornflake crumbs
1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper
Ingredients:
6 chicken breasts
1 egg, beaten
Instructions: Mix cheese, crumbs and pepper.  Dip chicken in egg; coat with cheese mixture.  Place in greased shallow baking dish.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Ingredient:
1 package Catelli Bistro Pesto Rotini
2 grilled or saut degreesed boneless, skinless chicken breasts, chopped
1/2 cup olives
Ingredients:
1 cup cubed or crumbled feta or blue cheese
8 cherry tomatoes, cut in half
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
1 cup bottled herb salad dressing
Instructions: Cook rotini 9 minutes or until tender.  Drain and rinse in cool water, drain well.  Combine cooked rotini with remaining ingredients; toss until well combined.  Cover and let stand 30 minutes to blend flavours.  Toss gently before serving.

Ingredient:
1 package Catelli Bistro Garlic and Parsley Fusilli
1 cup sliced cucumber
1 cup canned chick peas, drained and rinsed
Ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped sun-dried tomatoes
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
1 cup bottled feta and oregano salad dressing
Instructions: Cook fusilli 7 minutes or until tender.  Drain and rinse in cool water; drain well.  Combine cooked fusilli with remaining ingredients, toss until well combined.  Cover and let stand 30 minutes to blend flavours.  Toss gently before serving.

Ingredient:
1 package Catelli Bistro Fusilli
1 can artichoke hearts, drained and cut into squares
1 red pepper, chopped
Ingredients:
1 cup cubed mozzarella cheese
1 cup bottled sun-dried tomato and oregano salad dressing
Instructions: Cook fusilli 7 minutes or until tender.  Drain and rinse in cool water, drain well.  Combine cooked fusilli with remaining ingredients, toss until well combined.  Cover and let stand 30 minutes to blend flavors.  Toss gently before serving.

Ingredient:
2 1/4 cups white sugar
3/4 cups canned milk
16 large or 2 cups miniature marshmallows
1/4 cup margarine
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup chocolate chips
1 cup cut up walnuts or pecans
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Cook first 5 ingredients, stirring constantly over medium heat to a boil (mixture will be bubbling over).  Boil and stir 5 minutes more.  Remove from heat.  Stir in, until completely melted, chocolate chips.  Stir in walnuts and vanilla.   Spread in a buttered 8 inch square pan.  Cool and cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 head cauliflower
1 bunch broccoli
6 or 7 green onions
1 green pepper
1 cup sour cream
Ingredients:
1 cup salad dressing
1/3 cup white sugar
1 tablespoon vinegar
Dash Tabasco sauce
Dash Worcestershire sauce
Instructions: Cut vegetables in bite-size pieces and place in large bowl.  Combine remaining ingredients, mix well.  Pour over vegetables.  Toss well.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup raisins
3/4 cup margarine, softened
1 1/2 cups white sugar
3 eggs
2 cups applesauce
3/4 cup all-purpose flour
Ingredients:
3/4 cup whole wheat flour
2 teaspoons baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/3 cup sifted cocoa
1/2 cup coarsely chopped walnuts
Instructions: Soak raisins in boiling water to cover for 5 minutes.  Drain.  Stir together the flours, baking soda, salt, spices, and cocoa.  In a large bowl, cream the  margarine with the sugar.  Beat in the eggs, then the applesauce.  Beat the flour mixture into the applesauce mixture.  Stir in the raisins and walnuts.  Turn the batter into a greased and floured tube pan.   Bake for 80 minutes or until it tests done.  Let cake cool on a rack, and then chill.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
3 tablespoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup white sugar
1 egg
1 cup milk
1/4 cup vegetable oil
Ingredients:
Variations:
Blueberry Muffins:  Add 1 cup fresh blueberries
Raisin Muffins:  Add 1 cup finely chopped raisins.
Date Muffins:  Add 1 cup finely chopped dates
Cheese Muffins:  Fold in 1 cup grated sharp yellow cheese
Instructions: Stir together the flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in a large bowl.  Make a well in the center.  In a small bowl beat egg with a fork.  Stir in milk and oil. Pour all at once into the well in the flour mixture.  Mix quickly and lightly with a fork until  moistened, but do not beat.  The batter will be lumpy.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup applesauce
1/4 cup margarine, softened
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
1 egg
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 cup cocoa
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon (optional)
1 cup chocolate chips
Confectioners' sugar (optional)
Instructions: Line muffin cups with paper bake cups.  In large mixer bowl, beat margarine, sugar, brown sugar, egg and vanilla until well blended.  Add applesauce, blend well.  In a separate bowl, stir together flour, cocoa, baking soda, and cinnamon, if desired.  Add to margarine mixture, blending well.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Fill muffin cups 3/4 full with batter.   Bake for 22 to 26 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.  Cool slightly in pan on wire rack.  Sprinkle muffin tops with confectioners; sugar, if desired.  Serve warm

Ingredient:
2/3 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
5 eggs
3/4 cup white sugar
2 squares unsweetened chocolate
2 tablespoons water
2 tablespoon coffee-flavored liqueur
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons white sugar
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
Icing sugar for dusting
-----
4 squares semi-sweet baking chocolate
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese, softened
3 cups icing sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1 tablespoon coffee favored liqueur
Instructions:
Lightly spray a jelly roll pan and line with parchment paper.  Sift flour with baking powder and salt and set aside.  In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs on high for several minutes until they are very pale and fluffy.  Gradually add the sugar, beating 1 to 2 minutes more or until very thick.  Gently, but thoroughly, fold in the flour mixture.  Melt the chocolate in a small saucepan over low heat.  In a small bowl, combine the 2 tablespoons of water with the 2 tablespoons coffee liqueur and the remaining 2 tablespoons sugar and the baking soda, then gradually stir into the melted chocolate until smooth.  Quickly, but thoroughly, fold chocolate mixture into batter.  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Lightly sift an even layer of icing sugar over a cloth napkin or tea towel (do not use terry-cloth).  Flip the cake out of its pan onto the prepared cloth as soon as it comes from the oven.  Carefully peel away parchment paper.  Lightly dust top of cake with icing sugar, then trim away crisp edges.  Starting with one of  the short sides of the cake, immediately roll the cake up on the cloth, jelly roll style, and cool thoroughly on a rack.
For the filling and frosting:   In a small saucepan over low heat, melt the chocolate.  Remove from heat and let cool to lukewarm.  In a medium bowl, beat the cream cheese with the icing sugar until smooth, then blend in the vanilla and coffee liqueur.  Blend in the melted chocolate.  Unroll the cake and spread about 1/3 of the filling evenly over the surface.  Roll the cake back up.  Arrange cake roll on serving tray, then frost generously, swiping with an icing spatula to form the long bark line design.  Swipe ends of cake in a circular motion to simulate the tree-rings of a cut log.  Decorate log as desired with holly leaves and berries, mushrooms and snow.

Ingredient:
1 10kg  Butterball Turkey
1 pack  Butterball Frozen Stuffing
1/4 cup  Ocean Spray Craisins
12 strips  Maple Leaf Bacon, chopped
Ingredients:
1/4 cup  Planters Cashews, chopped
2 packs  Knorr Classic Turkey Roast Gravy
1 can  Ocean Spray Cranberry Sauce
4 tbsp  Olive oil
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Defrost turkey 60 hours prior to roasting. Discard any giblets or neck from the turkey cavity.   Pre-heat oven to 425 degreesF.   Soak Craisins in a little boiling water for 20 minutes, drain. Prepare stuffing according to directions. Add craisins, bacon and cashews. Stuff turkey. Tie legs with string. Place in roasting dish. Brush with oil, season with salt and pepper.   Prevent legs, thighs and breast from drying out by covering with foil, then roast at 425 degreesF for 45 minutes.
Lower temperature to 350 degreesF, brush with a little more oil, roast for further 21/2 hours, basting every 30 minutes.

Note: A meat thermometer also helps determine when your turkey is done. When the thermometer reaches 165 degreesF in the centre of the stuffing, then dinner's ready!
Remove foil, baste again, continue roasting at 220 degreesF for 30 minutes, allowing skin to crisp and brown.
Test with skewer to ensure juices run clear. Remove from oven, let stand 15 minutes before carving.
Make the gravy per instructions. Serve with roasted vegetables, and a side dish of cranberry sauce.

Ingredient:
1 (14 oz) bag fresh flaked coconut
1 (14 oz) can sweetened condensed milk
2 teaspoons vanilla
VARIATIONS:
Add before baking:  Can be decorated with maraschino cherries or sprinkles or fold in 4
Ingredients:
squares melted semi-sweet chocolate for chocolate macaroons or
1 cup raisins or
1 cup mini chocolate chips or
1 cup pecans or almond or
8 to 10 drops food coloring.
Instructions: Combine all ingredients, mixing well.  Drop by teaspoonfuls one inch apart on well greased cookie sheet.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are slightly browned.  Using a moistened spatula - remove at once - from baking sheet.  Cool on cooling racks until firm.  Store in covered container.  After cooled these could be dipped in chocolate for a chocolate coating.

Ingredient:
1/2 lb bacon
2 stalks celery, chopped
2 small cooking onions, chopped
2 tablespoons margarine
Salt
Black Pepper
1 can cream-style corn
Ingredients:
1 can kernel corn
4 cups chicken broth
2 cups 2% milk
6 small potatoes, cubed
2 carrots, chopped
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
Water
Instructions: Fry bacon in pan until almost done.  Add onions and celery, and saut degrees until lightly browned.  Transfer to a cooking pot.  Add cream corn, kernel corn, margarine and broth.  Add carrots and potatoes.  Cook for about 15 minutes.  Mix together flour and a little water to form a paste.   Add milk and flour paste.  You might want to add more flour paste, depending on how thick you want the chowder.  Simmer for 30 minutes or until you are ready to eat.  Add salt and pepper to taste.

Ingredient:
1  degrees cup   all-purpose flour
1 cup   granulated sugar
1 cup   (2 squares) Imperial Margarine, softened
1 egg, lightly beaten
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon   almond extract
1 cup   red raspberry jam
1 cup   chocolate chips
3/4 cup   sliced almonds
Instructions: Grease a 13 x 9 - inch  baking dish. In a large bowl, thoroughly combine flour and sugar. Cut in margarine using a pastry blender or two knives until mixture is crumbly. Add egg and almond extract; mix until thoroughly combined.  Set aside 1 cup of flour mixture for topping. Press remaining flour mixture into prepared baking dish. Evenly spread raspberry jam over dough. Thoroughly combine reserved flour mixture, chocolate chips and almonds. Evenly spoon topping over raspberry jam and press with the back of a spoon. Bake 40 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool in pan and rack.

Ingredient:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 egg, beaten
3/4 cup orange juice
1 1/2 cups fresh or frozen cranberries, chopped
Ingredients:
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup margarine
1 teaspoon grated orange peel (optional)
1 1/2 cups light raisins (optional)
Instructions: Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda into a large bowl.  Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly.  Add eggs, orange peel and orange juice all at once;  stir just until mixture is evenly moist.  Fold in raisins and cranberries.  Spoon into a greased loaf pan.  Bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.  Remove from pan; cool on a wire rack.

Ingredient:
4 cups graham wafers
1 1/3 cups flaked coconut
1/4 cup rum
Ingredients:
Icing sugar
1 cup finely chopped walnuts
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
Instructions: In large bowl, combine crumbs, nuts and coconut.  Add sweetened condensed milk and rum; mix well.  Chill 4 hours or overnight.  Dip palms of hands in icing sugar.  Shape by teaspoon into 1 inch balls, roll in icing sugar (rechill if mixture becomes too soft).  Cover and store in refrigerator.  If desired, reroll in icing sugar before serving.   The flavour of these candies improves after 24 hours.  They may be made ahead and stored in refrigerator for several weeks.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup margarine or butter
1 1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs
2 small all-purpose apples, pared and chopped (about 1 1/4 cups)
1 (6-ounce) package butterscotch flavored chips
Ingredients:
1 (14-ounce) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1 (3 1/2) can flaked coconut (1 1/3 cups)
1 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: In 13x9-inch baking pan, melt margarine in oven. Sprinkle crumbs evenly over margarine; top with apples.   In heavy saucepan, over medium heat, melt chips with Eagle Brand degrees. Pour butterscotch mixture evenly over apples.   Top with coconut and nuts; press down firmly. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into squares. Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
4 cups coconut
1/4 cup margarine (melted)
Ingredients:
1/2 cup icing sugar
1 small can Nestles Cream
Instructions: Mix above ingredients together and roll into small balls. Melt package Baker's Chocolate Chips.  Put a bit of parowax in and roll balls in.  Lay on cookie sheet.

Ingredient:
1 package semi-sweet chocolate chips
2 tablespoons margarine
Ingredients:
1 package miniature marshmallows
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Milk
2 cups walnut pieces
Instructions: In heavy saucepan, over low heat, melt chocolate chips with sweetened milk and margarine; remove from heat.  In large bowl, combine nuts and marshmallows, fold in chocolate mixture.  Spread in wax paper line 13 x 9 inch pan.  Chill 2 hours or until firm.  Remove from pan, peel off wax paper and cut into squares.  Cover and store at room temperature.

Ingredient:
1 lb cut mixed candied fruit
1 cup light raisins
1 cup dark raisins
1 cup chopped nuts
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 cup light packed brown sugar
1/4 cup margarine
3 eggs
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon almond
1 teaspoon dark rum
1/4 cup strong coffee
1/4 cup applesauce
1 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon cloves
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
Instructions: Grease loaf pan.  Line with foil and grease again.  Combine candied fruit, raisins, nuts in bowl.  Add 1/2 cup flour and mix well to coat and separate fruit.  Cream sugars and margarine together thoroughly.  Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition.  Add extract and rum.  Gradually add coffee and applesauce.  Mixture will look curdled.  Combine flour with salt, baking soda and spices.  Add to creamed mixture and mix just until mixture is well dampened.  Add floured fruits and nuts.  Mix well with wooden spoon.  Spread batter evenly in prepared pan.  Bake for 2.5 hours or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.  Remove from oven  lift out cake and cool on rack.  When thoroughly cooled, wrap in foil and keep in refrigerator.  Allow to ripen several weeks for best flavour.

Ingredient:
1/2 lb. Spaghetti, broken in half
1 package frozen broccoli cuts
Ingredients: 1 cup Cheese Whiz Pasteurized process cheese sauce
Instructions: Cook spaghetti as directed on package, adding broccoli during last 6 minutes of cooking time.  Drain.  Microwave cheese sauce as directed on label.  Pour over spaghetti and broccoli.  Toss until thoroughly coated.

Ingredient:
4 cups all-purpose flour
6 tablespoons sugar
4-1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons cold butter
Ingredients:
2 large eggs, room temperature
3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons whole milk, divided
1-1/2 cups fresh or frozen blueberries
Instructions: In a bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt; cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In a bowl, whisk eggs and 3/4 cup milk; add to dry ingredients just until moistened. Turn onto a lightly floured surface; gently knead in the blueberries.  Divide the dough in half. Pat each portion into an 8-in. circle; cut each into 8 wedges. Place on greased baking sheets. Brush with remaining milk. Bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Serve warm.

Ingredient:
3 eggs
1 cup white sugar
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1/2 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup grated carrot
2 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup coconut, flaked or medium
1/2 cup glazed cherries, cut up
1/2 cup raisins
1/2 cup chopped walnuts or almonds
Instructions: Grease one loaf pan.  In a large bowl beat eggs until fluffy.  Add sugar and oil.  Beat to blend.  Stir in milk, vanilla and carrot.  In another bowl, combine flour, baking powder, soda, cinnamon, salt, coconut, cherries, raisins and nuts.  Mix well to combine evenly.  Pour all at once over batter.  Stir to moisten.  Turn into greased loaf pan.  Bake for 1 hour until it tests done.   Cool 10 minutes.  Remove from pan.  Cool and wrap.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 teaspoon almond extract
Ingredients:
2 1/8 cups all purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup glazed fruit
3/4 cup raisins or currants
1/2 cup chopped almonds
Instructions: Grease loaf pan.  Cream butter and sugar together.  Beat in eggs one at a time.  Beat smooth.  Stir in milk, vanilla and almond flavoring.  In large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt.  Stir in fruit, raisins and nuts.  Add all at once to first bowl.  Stir only to moisten.  Turn into loaf pan and bake 1 hour or until it tests done.  Let stand 10 minutes. Remove from pan.  Cool. Wrap.

Ingredient:
1 Package Velveeta Shells & Cheese Dinner
1/4 cup chopped onion
1/4 cup chopped red or green pepper
1/4 cup margarine, divided
Ingredients:
1 package imitation crabmeat, tuna or salmon
1 cup frozen peas, thawed, drained
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/3 cup corn flake crumbs
1/4 teaspoon onion salt
Instructions: Prepare dinner as directed on package.  Cook and stir onion and red pepper in 2 tablespoons margarine in small skillet on medium-high heat until tender.  Add to dinner.  Stir in crabmeat, peas and mayo.  Spoon into 1 1/2 quart casserole, cover.  Bake for 15 minutes.  Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter.  Stir in crumbs and onion salt.  Uncover casserole; top with crumb mixture.  Continue baking uncovered, 5 to 10 minutes or until golden brown and thoroughly heated.

Ingredient:
2 cups white sugar
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup margarine
3/4 cup peanut butter
Ingredients:
3 cups quick cooking oats
6 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup raisins
Instructions: In a large saucepan combine, sugar, milk and butter and boil for 1 minute.  Take off heat and add peanut butter, oats, cocoa, vanilla and raisins.  Stir well.  Drop by teaspoon on wax paper.  Let sit one hour.

Ingredient:
1-3/4 cups confectioners' sugar
	1-3/4 cups sweetened shredded coconut
1 cup chopped almonds
	1/2 cup sweetened condensed milk
Ingredients:
2 cups (12 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips
	2 tablespoons shortening
	Optional ingredients: chopped almonds, sliced almonds, sprinkles and additional coconut
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine the confectioners' sugar, coconut, almonds and milk. Shape into 1-in. balls. Refrigerate until firm, about 20 minutes.  In a microwave, melt semisweet chips and shortening on high for about 1 minute; stir. Microwave at additional 10- to 20-second intervals, stirring until smooth.  Dip balls in chocolate; allow excess to drip off. Coat or garnish with ingredients of your choice. Place on waxed paper; let stand until set. Store in an airtight container.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
5 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
Grated rind of 1 orange
1/4 cup orange juice
Ingredients:
2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
4 ounces grated semisweet chocolate
1/3 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: Grease one loaf pan.  Cream butter and sugar together until fluffy.  Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Stir in vanilla, orange rind and juice.  In another bowl, put flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg. Stir in grated chocolate and nuts.  Pour into first bowl. Stir all together until moistened.  Spoon into loaf pan.  Bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Remove loaf from pan to cool on cake rack.  Wrap

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups flour
1/4 cup white sugar
1/2 cup margarine
1 egg
Ingredients:
1/3 cup maple flavored syrup or corn syrup
1/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 1/2 cups Post Great Grains Cereal, Crunchy Pecan or Post Cranberry Almond Crunch Cereal
Instructions: Mix flour and white sugar in medium bowl.  Cut in 1/2 cup margarine until  mixture resembles coarse crumbs.   Press firmly into bottom of greased 9 inch baking pan.   Bake for 20 minutes or until very lightly browned.  Mix egg, syrup, brown sugar, 1 tablespoon melted butter and vanilla until well blended.  Stir in cereal until well coated.
