Spread evenly over warm crust.  Bake an additional  20 - 25 minutes or until topping is firm around edges and slightly soft in center.  Cool on wire rack.  Cut into squares

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
3/4 cup icing sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 1/4 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 3/4 cups flour
1 1/2 cups Post Premium Raisin Bran
Jam or preserves
Instructions: Beat butter in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed to soften.  Gradually add icing sugar and salt, beating until light and fluffy.  Beat in vanilla.  Stir in flour and cereal.  Shape dough into 1 inch balls.  Place on ungreased cookie sheets.  Make an indentation in center of each ball.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Remove from cookie sheets.  Cool on wire racks.  Fill indentation with jam.  Sprinkle with additional icing sugar, if desired.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
3/4 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1 cup buttermilk
1 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups all purpose flour
1 cup chopped  maraschino cherries, drained
1 cup chopped pecans
Instructions: Grease loaf pan.  In a large bowl, cream butter or margarine and sugar together.  Add eggs, and continue mixing until light and fluffy.  Add baking soda, salt and vanilla, mix thoroughly.  Alternately add buttermilk and flour to the creamed mixture, mixing only enough to hold ingredients together.  Fold in cherries and nuts, mixing lightly.  Turn batter into prepared pan.  Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until bread tests done.   Cool completely before slicing.

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon dried dill
3/4 cup beer
Ingredients:
1/2 cup milk
2 eggs
1 1/2 to 2 lbs. Fish fillets
Vegetable Oil for deep frying
Instructions: In a large bowl, mix together flour, salt, baking powder and dill.  Add beer, milk and eggs; mix well.  Place fish fillets in batter mixture, coat well and let stand for 15 minutes.  Heat deep fryer to 375 degrees.  Place fish in hot oil and fry until golden brown.  Cook fish in batches to maintain oil temperature.  Serve

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups all purpose flour
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 lb. Chopped dates (add little water & microwave 3 minutes)
Chopped walnuts (optional)
Instructions: Cream butter and sugar together.  Beat in eggs one at a time.  Add vanilla.  Mix in remaining ingredients.  Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
3/4 cups peanut butter
3/4 cup mashed ripe banana
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 cup all purpose flour
1 cup whole wheat flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
Instructions: Beat margarine, sugar and peanut butter until light and fluffy.  Add eggs and mix well. Stir in bananas.  Combine flour and baking powder.  Add to bananas mixture mixing well. Drop by tablespoon onto lightly greased baking sheet.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool on wire rack.

Ingredient:
2 envelopes Dream Whip Whipped Topping Mix
2 3/4 cups milk
2 packages Jello Banana Flavor Instant Pudding and Pie Filling, or any other flavor
Ingredients: 1 baked 9 inch pie shell or 9 inch graham cracker crust, cooled
Instructions: Prepare whipped topping mix as directed on package, using large mixing bowl.  Add remaining 1 3/4 cups milk and pudding mix.  Blend then beat at high speed for 2 minutes scrapping bowl occasionally.  Spoon into pie shell.  Chill at least 4 hours.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup margarine, softened
1 1/2 cups firmly packed brown sugar
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 tablespoon water
1 1/2 cups quick oats, uncooked
2 cups Butterscotch Chips
1/2 teaspoon orange extract
Instructions: In small bowl combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt;  set aside.  In large bowl combine margarine, brown sugar, eggs and water, beat until creamy.   Gradually add flour mixture.  Stir in oats and butterscotch chips and orange extract.  Drop by slightly rounded tablespoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes.

Ingredient:
2.5 kg ground beef
2 medium onions, diced
6 stalks celery, diced
Ingredients:
1 can cream corn
2 kg potatoes
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: Brown off the ground beef.  Saut degrees onions and celery.  Boil and mash potatoes.  Place ground beef in the bottom of the pan, spread a layer of cream corn on top.  Pipe mashed potatoes over creamed corn.  Baste with butter.   Bake until golden brown.

Ingredient:
2 eggs
3/4 cup beer
1 1/2 cups milk
4 cups pastry flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons cornstarch
Salt
Pepper
Garlic Powder
1 lb. Fish fillets
Oil for deep frying
Instructions: In a medium bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda and cornstarch.  In a large bowl, beat together eggs and milk.   Mix in beer.  Stir in flour mixture.  Season to taste with salt, pepper and garlic powder.  In an electric deep fryer or a heavy saucepan heat oil to 375 degrees.  Coat fish in batter and submerge in hot oil.  Fry until golden brown, about 4 to 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup packed dark brown sugar
1 1/2 teaspoon mustard powder
1 1/2 teaspoon light rum
Ingredients:
1/8 teaspoon ground cloves
1 lb. Ham steak
Green leaf lettuce and chopped fresh parsley, optional
Instructions: Position rack 4" from heat source; preheat broiler.  In small bowl combine brown sugar, mustard, rum and cloves.  Place ham on rack set in broiler pan.  Brush 1/2 sugar mixture over ham; broil ham, turning once and glazing with remaining sugar mixture, until browned, about 2 minutes per side.  Transfer to serving platter.  Garnish with lettuce and parsley, if desired.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 apples, preferably Rome Beauty, about 1 lb. Peeled, cored and cut into 1/2 inch pieces
3/4 cup coarsely chopped walnuts
Ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar, divided
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 cup margarine
2 eggs
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
1/3 cup milk
Icing sugar for dusting
Instructions: Coat 9 inch square baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.  Combine flour, baking powder and salt.  In bowl combine apples, walnuts, 1 tablespoon sugar and cinnamon.  In another bowl with mixer at medium high speed beat butter with remaining sugar until smooth, about 3 minutes.  Beat in eggs, one at a time, until combined; beat in vanilla.  Beat in flour mixture alternately with milk.  Stir in apple mixture.  Pour batter into pan.  Bake about 45 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean and cake pulls away from sides of pan.  Cool in pan on rack at least 15 minutes; sprinkle with icing sugar, if desired.  Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream.

Ingredient:
1 cup milk
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup Cheddar cheese, grated
Ingredients:
2 potatoes thinly sliced
1 small onion, halved and thinly sliced
4 carrots thinly sliced
2 tablespoons margarine
Instructions: Butter 8 inch square baking dish.  In pot over medium high heat combine milk, flour, salt and pepper; cook, whisking constantly, until thickened, about 5 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Add cheese; mix until cheese melts.  In baking dish layer 1/3 of potatoes.  Top with 1/3 of onions, carrots and milk mixture.  Repeat layering with remaining potatoes, onions, carrots and milk mixture.  Dot with butter; cover with foil.  Bake 30 minutes.  Remove foil; bake until lightly browned about 15 more minutes.

Ingredient:
6 cups peeled, sliced fresh peaches
2 cups blueberries
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
2 teaspoons cinnamon
Ingredients:
Topping:
1 cup quick cooking rolled oats
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
3 tablespoons soft margarine
Instructions:
In baking dish combine peaches and blueberries.  In small bowl, combine sugar, flour and cinnamon; add to fruit and toss to mix.

Topping:  Combine rolled oats, sugar and cinnamon; with pastry blender or 2 knives cut in margarine until crumbly.  Sprinkle over top of fruit mixture.  Bake for 25 minutes or microwave on high for 10 minutes or until mixture is bubbling and fruit is fairly tender.  Serve warm or cold.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups all purpose flour, divided
1/3 cup white sugar
1 cup packed light brown sugar, divided
2 teaspoons grated lemon peel
1 teaspoon cinnamon, divided
Ingredients:
6 cups strawberries, halved
2 cups trimmed rhubarb, cut into 3/4 inch slices
3/4 cup margarine, melted
Pie shell
Vanilla ice cream, optional
Instructions: In large bowl combine 1/2 cup flour, white sugar, 1/3 cup brown sugar, lemon peel and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon.  Stir in strawberries and rhubarb.  Set aside for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, to let juices develop.  Spoon filling into crust. Place pie on foil lined jellyroll pan.  Bake for 50 minutes or until hot and bubbly.  Meanwhile, in bowl with fork stir together remaining flour, brown sugar and cinnamon with butter until crumbly.  Using fingers, press mixture together to form large crumbs.  Remove pie from oven.  Place crumbs on top of hot pie leaving 1/2 inch  border between crumbs and crust.  Continue baking 30 minutes or until crumbs are golden brown.  Cool on rack. About 1 hour.  Serve warm or room temperature topped with ice cream, if desired.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1/2 cup chopped onion
1 chopped carrot
1/2 sweet pepper, coarsely chopped
2 cups chopped cabbage
1 cup bean sprouts
Ingredients:
2 cups snow peas
2 cups cooked rice
2 tablespoons low sodium soy sauce
2 eggs, lightly beaten
2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds or slivered almonds
Instructions: In large nonstick skillet or wok, heat oil over medium high heat.  Add onion and carrot; stir-fry until onion is softened.  Add sweet pepper, cabbage, bean sprouts and snow peas; stir-fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until tender crisp, adding 1 tablespoon water at a time if necessary to prevent scorching.  Stir in rice, soy sauce and eggs; stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes until eggs are set.  Sprinkle with sesame seeds or almonds

Ingredient:
5 cups thinly sliced peeled apples
2 teaspoons lemon juice
1/2 cup white sugar
3 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 teaspoon grated lemon rind
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1 unbaked pie shell
Ingredients:
Topping:
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
3 tablespoons rolled oats
3 tablespoons whole wheat flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 tablespoon soft margarine
Instructions:
In bowl, toss apples with lemon juice.  In another bowl, combine sugar, flour, lemon rind, cinnamon and nutmeg; sprinkle over apples and stir until apples are well coated.   Spoon into pie shell.

Topping:  In bowl, combine brown sugar, rolled oats, flour and cinnamon.  With two knives cut in margarine until mixture is crumbly, sprinkle over filling.  Bake for 40 minutes or until top is golden and apples are tender.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup white sugar
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon finely grated orange rind
4 cups coarsely chopped rhubarb
2 cups sliced strawberries
Ingredients:
Topping:
1 cup all purpose flour
2 tablespoons white sugar
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons margarine, chilled and cut in bits
2/3 cup buttermilk
Instructions:
In bowl, combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and orange rind.  Add rhubarb and strawberries; toss to mix.  Spread mixture in shallow glass baking dish; bake for 10 minutes.
Topping:  In large bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Using fingers or two knives, cut in margarine until mixture is size of small peas.  With fork, stir in buttermilk until mixture is moistened and soft dough forms.  Drop by spoonfuls in 6 evenly spaced mounds on hot fruit.  Bake for 25 minutes or until top is golden.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup white sugar
3 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 teaspoon grated lemon rind
3 cups fresh or frozen thawed rhubarb
3 cups sliced apples
Ingredients:
Topping:
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
1/3 cup rolled oats
3 tablespoons whole wheat flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 tablespoons soft margarine, melted
Instructions:
In bowl combine sugar, flour and lemon rind, mix well.  Add rhubarb and apple; stir to mix.  Spoon into 8 cup baking dish.

Topping:  In bowl, combine sugar, rolled oats, flour and cinnamon.  Add melted margarine and stir to mix; sprinkle over filling.  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes until filling is bubbly and topping is brown.  Serve warm or at room temperature.

Ingredient:
6 boneless chicken breast halves
1 tablespoon cooking oil
1 medium onion, chopped
1 small green pepper, chopped
1 small red pepper, chopped
1 clove garlic, minced
Ingredients:
1 can Chili No Beans
1 can Mexican recipe stewed tomatoes
6 cups prepared rice
Dash hot pepper sauce
1/4 cup shredded cheese with peppers
Instructions: In large skillet saut degrees chicken in oil until no longer pink, set aside.  In same skillet, cook onion, peppers and garlic until tender.  Drain.  Stir in chili and stewed tomatoes.  Add rice and pepper sauce.  Arrange chicken on top of mixture.  Simmer 10 minutes.  Top with cheese

Ingredient:
3/4 lb boneless beef sirloin or top round steak
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
2 cups broccoli flowerets
1 medium onion, cut into wedges
Ingredients:
1/8 teaspoon garlic powder or 1 clove garlic, minced
1 can Cream of Broccoli Soup
1/4 cup water
1 tablespoon soy sauce
Instructions: Slice beef across the grain into thin strips.  In skillet, in 1 tablespoon oil, cook beef until browned, stirring often.  Remove.  In remaining 1 tablespoon hot oil, cook broccoli and onion with garlic powder until tender crisp, stirring often.  Add soup, water and soy.  Heat to boiling. Return beef to skillet.  Heat through, stirring occasionally.  Serve over rice.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups dry corkscrew macaroni
2 medium carrots, sliced
1 cup broccoli flowerets
1 large sweet red or green pepper, chopped
Ingredients:
1 can Cream of Celery Soup
1/2 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
1/2 cup milk
1 tablespoon prepared mustard
Instructions: In 4 quart saucepan, prepare macaroni according to package directions.  Add carrots, broccoli and pepper for last 5 minutes of cooking time.  Drain.  In saucepan, combine remaining ingredients.  Over low heat, heat until cheese melts, stirring often.  Add macaroni and vegetables.  Heat through, stirring occasionally.

Ingredient:
10 saltine crackers, crushed
1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning
2 skinless, boneless chicken breasts
1/4 cup egg substitute
1/2 cup julienned red bell pepper
1/2 cup julienned yellow bell pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 cup julienned green bell pepper
1 small onion, cut into wedges
1 clove crushed garlic
1 1/2 tablespoons butter
1/2 cup chicken broth
1/2 tablespoon all-purpose flour
Instructions:
In a shallow dish or bowl, mix together cracker crumbs and seasoning. Put egg substitute in a separate dish or bowl. Dip each chicken breast in the egg substitute, then coat with cracker mixture. Set aside.  In a large skillet saute bell peppers, onion and garlic in butter or margarine over medium heat, until just crisp and tender. Remove pepper mixture from skillet and set aside, keeping warm.
In the same skillet, saute coated chicken breasts in remaining butter or margarine until browned on both sides. Remove browned chicken breasts from skillet and keep warm.  Combine the chicken broth and flour and mix together. Pour broth mixture into pan drippings and heat through until mixture thickens and begins to boil. Stir in bell pepper mixture and heat through, stirring together. If desired, serve by placing chicken breast on a bed of hot cooked pasta and pouring bell pepper mixture over the top.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon oil
1 lb. Boneless skinless chicken breasts, cubed
1 small onion, chopped
1 small green pepper, chopped
1 package (10 oz) frozen sweet corn, thawed
Ingredients:
1 cup chicken broth
1 cup mild salsa
1 1/2 cups Minute Original Instant Rice
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Instructions: Heat oil in large skillet on medium high heat.  Add chicken, onion and pepper, cook and stir until chicken is cooked through.  Add corn, broth and salsa, bring to boil.  Stir in rice; cover.  Remove from heat.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Fluff with fork.  Sprinkle with cheese; cover.  Let stand 2 minutes or until cheese melts.

Ingredient:
2 cups semi sweet chocolate chips
1 (11.5 oz) package milk chocolate chips
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons cream or milk
2 teaspoons vanilla
1 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
Instructions: In saucepan, over low heat, melt semi sweet chocolate chips with 2/3 cup Eagle Brand Milk, 1 tablespoon cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla.  Remove from heat; stir in 1/2 cup walnuts.  Spread evenly into foil lined 9 inch square pan.  In another saucepan, over low heat, melt milk chocolate chips with remaining Eagle Brand Milk, 1 tablespoon cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla.  Remove from heat; stir in remaining walnuts.  Spread over fudge in pan. Chill two hours or until firm.  Turn fudge onto cutting board, peel off foil and cut into squares.  Store loosely covered at room temperature

Ingredient:
1 package Stove Top Chicken Flavour Stuffing Mix
2 tablespoons melted margarine
1 cup diced cooked ham
1 cup grated Swiss cheese
Ingredients:
1/2 cup frozen peas
1/2 cup chopped red pepper
2 cups milk
2 eggs, beaten
Instructions: Mix stuffing crumbs, seasonings and margarine in a lightly greased 9 inch quiche dish or pie plate.  Spread over bottom of dish.  Sprinkle peas, chopped peppers, ham and cheese evenly over crumbs.  Beat milk and eggs together until well blended.  Pour slowly over mixture in dish.  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until set.  Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Ingredient:
12 eggs
3 1/4 cups icing sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup vanilla
Ingredients:
10 cups milk
Brandy or rum, rye scotch
Nutmeg for garnish
Instructions: Using a large mixing bowl, beat eggs until very light and lemon color.  Gradually beat in sugar, salt and vanilla.  Stir in milk using larger container if necessary.  Add liquor.  Refrigerate for 24 hours before serving.  To serve, run through blender to foam up.  To store for a few days, keep covered in refrigerator.  Strength may be adjusted by adding more or less liquor or more or less milk. Garnish with nutmeg

Ingredient:
2 quarts apple cider
2 quarts ginger ale
Ingredients: Grenadine syrup (optional)
Instructions: Pour cider and ginger ale into punch bowl, add enough grenadine to make a light pink color.  Serve with ice cubes in each glass.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
1 cup icing sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
2 cups red & green candied cherries, halved
1 cup pecan halves
Instructions: In mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla, beat until fluffy.  Add flour, mix well.  Stir in cherries and pecans.  Chill for 1 hour.  Shape dough into 3 - 10 inch rolls, wrap in plastic wrap and place in a freezer bag.  Freeze up to 2 months or until ready to bake.  To bake, cut frozen rolls into 1/8" slices. Place on ungreased baking sheets.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are golden brown.  Cool on wire rack.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups Graham crumbs
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
2 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ginger
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
Ingredients:
1/2 cup margarine, softened
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
3/4 cup canned pumpkin
1 cup buttermilk or soured milk
1/2 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: Combine crumbs, flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg.  Set aside.  Cream margarine and sugar until light and fluffy.  Beat in eggs one at a time.  Blend in vanilla and pumpkin.  Mix well.  Add dry ingredients to pumpkin mixture alternately with buttermilk.  Fold in nuts. Spread evenly in greased 13 x 9 inch baking pan.  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until done.  Cool in pan on rack.  Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.

Ingredient:
1 package cream cheese, softened
2 1/2 cups icing sugar
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 tablespoon  milk
Instructions: Cream cheese with sugar until smooth.  Add vanilla and enough milk to make it spreadable.  Spread on cooled cake.  Chill until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
2 cups Oreo baking crumbs
1 cup coconut
1/2 cup chopped pecan pieces
3/4 cup margarine, melted
Ingredients:
Filling:
1/4 cup margarine, softened
2 cups icing sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 tablespoons custard powder
1/4 cup milk

Topping:
4 oz. Semi sweet chocolate
2 tablespoons margarine
Instructions:
Base:  Combine baking crumbs, coconut, pecan pieces and melted margarine.  Press into 9 inch square pan.
Filling:  Cream butter, sugar and vanilla.  Add custard powder and milk.  Pour over base and refrigerate until firm.
Topping:   Melt chocolate with butter and spread over top.  Refrigerate until set.  Cut into bars and serve.

Ingredient:
4 cups chopped rhubarb
2 cups blueberries
3/4 cup sugar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup cold water
1 1/2 cups flour
Ingredients:
3 teaspoons baking powder
1 tablespoon sugar
1/3 teaspoon salt
1/3 cup margarine
1/2 cup milk
1 egg, well beaten
2 tablespoons brown sugar
Instructions: Mix chopped rhubarb and blueberries together in a large saucepan.  Blend sugar and cornstarch together and stir into the fruit mixture.  Stir in 1/4 cup cold water.  Place on medium heat and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and cook until juices flow and fruit is soft.  Pour into the casserole dish.  In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, 1 tablespoon sugar and salt.  Blend well.  Cut in  margarine with a pastry cutter until  mixture is a coarse texture.  In another bowl blend milk and well beaten egg.  Make a hole in the centre of the flour mixture and add milk and egg mixture and stir until flour is moistened.   Drop dough by spoon fuls onto the fruit mixture.  Sprinkle with brown sugar evenly.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.  Serve with a tablespoon of whipping cream over each serving.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups blueberries, fresh or frozen
2 1/2 cups rhubarb, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cold water
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons raw Minit tapioca
1/8 teaspoon nutmeg
1/8 teaspoon cinnamon
Instructions: Place blueberries and rhubarb into a large saucepan.  Add sugar and water.  Place on heat and let cook on medium heat until fruit is soft.  Stir in tapioca and turn heat down to low.  Cover and cook for another 8 to 9 minutes, stirring frequently.  Stir in nutmeg and cinnamon and cook for another minute.  Remove from heat and serve warm over scoops of vanilla ice-cream or over a piece of an angel food or white cake.

RecipeName: Philadelphia 3 Step No Bake Cherry Cheesecake
Ingredient:
1 package Philadelphia Cream Cheese, softened
1/2 cup sugar
2 cups thawed Cool Whip
Ingredients:
Whipped Topping
1 graham cracker crumb crust
1 can cherry pie filling
Instructions: Mix cream cheese and sugar with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.  Gently stir in whipped topping.  Spoon into crust.  Top with pie filling.  Refrigerate 3 hours or until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
7 - 8 Honey Maid graham wafers
1 cup Chipits Chocolate Mint Chips
1/2 cup margarine
Ingredients:
3 cups icing sugar
1 egg
Green food coloring
Instructions: Line bottom of  8 inch square pan with graham wafers, cutting to fit pan.  Melt 1/2 cup Chipits over hot water; cool.  Cream margarine and blend in icing sugar and egg until light and fluffy.  Divide mixture in half; add melted Chipits to one part and green food colouring to the other part.  Spread chocolate mixture gently over wafers.  Then spread green mixture over chocolate layer.  Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup Chipits evenly over surface and press down gently.  Chill until firm.  Cut into squares

Ingredient:
1 yeast
1/4 cup lukewarm water
1 cup scalded milk
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons shortening
1 1/2 cups flour
Instructions: Soften yeast in water.  Combine the other ingredients.  Allow this to stand in a warm place until it is so light that it falls at the slightest touch.  Add 1 egg, 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg and 2 to 2 1/2 cups flour.  Knead.  The dough should be softer than bread dough.  Cover and set in a warm place to rise.  Roll 3/4 inch thick and cut with cutter and let rise.  Fry in deep fat.  Fry with raised side down.  Fill with jam

Ingredient:
2 cups prepared strawberries
1/2 cup canned, crushed pineapple, undrained
2 tablespoons lemon juice
Ingredients:
5 cups sugar
3/4 cups water
1 (1 3/4 oz) box powdered fruit pectin
Instructions: Crush strawberries 1 layer at a time; measure 2 cups.  Combine with pineapple, lemon juice and then stir in sugar.  Set aside.  Mix water with powdered fruit pectin and bring to a boil; boil hard 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Stir into fruit mixture and continue stirring 3 minutes.  Quickly ladle into sterilized jars, wipe rims and cover.  Let stand at room temperature until set; then store in freezer or refrigerator if using within three weeks.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 teaspoon salt
4 egg yolks
2 cups milk
Ingredients:
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1 pint strawberries, sliced
1 baked pie shell
1 large or 2 small bananas, peeled and sliced
Whipped cream, optional
Instructions: In medium saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch and salt.  Blend together egg yolks and milk.  Stir small amount of milk mixture into dry ingredients, making a smooth paste.  Gradually blend in remaining milk mixture.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until mixture thickens and boils.  Boil, stirring constantly, 1 minute.  Remove from heat.  Stir in vanilla.  Cool quickly by setting pan in bowl of ice or cold water and stirring for a few minutes.  Set aside about 1/4 cup strawberry slices for garnish.  Arrange remaining strawberry slices in pie shell.  Pour half of the custard mixture over strawberries.  Top with banana slices.  Cover with  remaining custard mixture.  Cover and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled.  Before serving, top pie with reserved strawberry slices.  Garnish with whipped cream, if desired.

Ingredient:
4 1/2 cups prepared strawberries
1/2 teaspoon ground allspice
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon butter
7 cups sugar
1 (1 3/4 oz) box powdered fruit pectin
Instructions: Crush strawberries, 1 layer at a time.  Stir in spices, butter and powdered fruit pectin.  Measure sugar, set aside.  Over high heat, stirring constantly, bring strawberries to a full rolling boil.  Immediately stir in all sugar.  Again, stirring constantly, bring to a full boil and boil hard 1 minute.  Remove from heat, stir 5 minutes to cool and prevent floating fruit.  Fill sterilized jars.  Process in boiling water bath 5 minutes; begin timing when water begins to boil.

Ingredient:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 cup margarine, softened
2 1/2 cups icing sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
3 bananas, sliced
1 can crushed pineapple, well drained
2 cups strawberries, sweetened and sliced
1 cup flaked coconut
1 cup heavy cream, whipped
1/2 cup pecans, chopped
Maraschino cherries
Instructions: Mix first 4 ingredients; pat into 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Beat eggs, margarine, icing sugar and vanilla at medium speed 5 minutes; pour over crumb layer.  Next, layer bananas, pineapple and then strawberries.  Cover with coconut.   Chill.  Top with shipped cream, pecans and cherries.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
2 cups sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup margarine
Ingredients:
4 eggs
1 cup Strawberry jam
1/2 cup margarine, softened
12 ounces shredded coconut
Instructions: Blend flour, 1 cup sugar and salt.  Cut in margarine to form fine crumbs.  Using fingers, mix in 1 lightly beaten egg to form dough.  Dust fingers with flour.  Press dough evenly on bottom of lightly greased 15 x 10 inch pan.  Spread with jam.  Cream softened margarine and remaining sugar.  Beat in remaining eggs, one at a time.  Beat mixture until light and creamy.  Add coconut.  Spread evenly over jam.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes.  Cool then cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 double pie crust, unbaked
2 cups strawberries, mashed
4 tablespoons water
1/2 cup sugar
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons cornstarch
2 1/2 cups rhubarb, diced
1 cup sugar
2 tablespoons margarine
Instructions: Bring strawberries and water to boiling point; remove from heat.  Mix 1/2 cup sugar and cornstarch; gradually stir into strawberries.  Cook over medium-low heat until thickened and clear.  Cool.  Spread rhubarb over crust bottom.  Sprinkle with 1 cup sugar and dot with margarine.  Cover with strawberry  mixture.  Then cover with top crust; make slits.  Bake at 450 degrees  for 10 minutes then reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake for an additional 30 to 40 minutes

Ingredient:
1 baked pie shell
1 cup sugar
Ingredients:
3 tablespoon cornstarch
4 to 5 cups strawberries
Instructions: Sift sugar and cornstarch two times.  Mash 2 cups berries; heat over medium heat, stirring, just to boiling point.  Remove from heat; gradually stir in sugar mixture.  Return to heat and cook over medium low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened and clear.  Cool.  Place remaining berries, points up, in pie shell, cover with glaze; chill.  Serve with whipped cream.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups prepared strawberries
1 cup prepared rhubarb
6 1/2 cups sugar
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon margarine
1 pouch liquid fruit pectin
Instructions: Crush strawberries, one layer at a time. Dice rhubarb; add 1/4 cup water; cover and simmer 2 minutes until tender.  Combine strawberries, rhubarb and sugar.  Heat, stirring constantly.  Add margarine just as mixture begins to boil.  Bring to a full rolling boil; continue stirring and boil hard 1 minute.  Remove from heat; immediately stir in liquid fruit pectin.  Skim foam with metal spoon.  Quickly fill warm sterilized jars to within 1/2 inch of top.  Wipe rims and cover.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups finely crushed graham cracker crumbs
1/2 cup all purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
Ingredients:
1/2 cup margarine, softened
1 1/2 cups raisins or chocolate chips
1 1/3 cups flaked coconut
1 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: Mix graham cracker crumbs, flour and baking powder.  Beat sweetened condensed milk and margarine until smooth.  Add crumb mixture.  Mix well.  Stir in raisins, coconut and walnuts.  Drop by tablespoons onto lightly greased cookie sheets.  Bake 9 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool 2 to 3 minutes.  Remove from cookie sheets.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup shortening
2 cups  sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 eggs
3/4 cup cocoa
Ingredients:
1 3/4 cups all purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon baking powder
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/8 teaspoon salt
1 3/4 cups milk
Instructions: Generously grease and flour two 9 inch round cake pans.  Cream butter, shortening, sugar and vanilla until fluffy; blend in eggs.  Combine cocoa, flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in bowl; add alternately with milk to batter.  Blend well.  Pour into pans and bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until done.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans.

Ingredient:
3/4 cups vegetable oil
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
3 large eggs
2 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 cup rolled oats
1 tablespoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 tablespoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
3/4 cups chopped pecans or walnuts
1 cup finely chopped peeled apples
2 cups sliced or whole cranberries
1/2 cup raisins

Icing:

1 cup icing sugar
2 to 3 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tablespoon softened margarine
Instructions: Generously grease and flour a 12 cup Bundt pan.  Using an electric mixer blend oil and brown sugar.  Add eggs and beat well.  In a separate bowl, mix lightly by hand the dry ingredients.  Add half the dry ingredients, half the milk and vanilla to egg mixture.  Mix until blended.  Add remaining flour and milk and mix until blended.   (Do not over mix)  Fold in nut, apples, cranberries and raisins.  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake 70 to 75 minutes.  Cool 15 minutes in pan, remove cake to wire rack.  Cool completely.  For icing, combine icing sugar, butter and lemon juice.  Drizzle over cooked cake.  Garnish with additional cranberries and nuts if desired.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup candied cherries, halved
1 cup butter
Ingredients:
1 cup sugar
4 eggs
2 teaspoons almond extract
Instructions: Combine flour and salt.  Stir well.   Mix 1/2 cup flour mixture with cherries.  Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Add remaining 1 1/2 cups flour gradually.  Stir in extract and floured cherries, mixing until well blended.  Spread mixture in greased loaf pan.  Bake for 90 to 100 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
1 pound ground beef
1/2 cup dry bread crumbs
1 egg
garlic powder to taste
Ingredients:
1 dash Worcestershire sauce
1/3 cup ketchup
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup pineapple preserves
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bread crumbs, egg, garlic powder and Worcestershire sauce. Mix well, and place into a 9x5 inch loaf pan.  Bake for 30 to 50 minutes.  Meanwhile, in a separate medium bowl, stir together the ketchup, brown sugar and pineapple preserves. Pour over the meatloaf about 20 minutes before removing from oven.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup chopped green pepper
1 small onion
2 tablespoons margarine
2 cans cheddar cheese soup
Ingredients:
1/2 cup milk
4 cups cooked ham, diced
4 cups cooked macaroni (2 cups uncooked)
Buttered bread crumbs
Instructions: Saut degrees green pepper and onion in butter.  Blend in soup and milk.  Add ham and macaroni.  Pour into casserole dish.  Top with crumbs and bake 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 lb ground beef
1 cup barbecue sauce
4 cups water
4 cups macaroni, uncooked
1 cup cheese whiz process cheese spread
Instructions: Brown meat in a large fry pan; drain.  Stir in barbecue sauce and water; bring to a boil.  Add macaroni, reduce heat to medium low and cover.  Cook 8 to 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender.  Stir in cheese whiz spread.

Ingredient:
5 cups prepared fruit (apples; peaches; rhubarb (cut into small  pieces and toss with 3/4 cup sugar); blueberries or cherries (pit and toss with 3/4 cup sugar))
1 cup packed brown sugar
3/4 cups rolled oats
Ingredients:
1 cup all purpose flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 cup margarine
Instructions: Arrange prepared fruit in a 7 x 11 baking dish.  Combine sugar, oats, flour and seasonings with margarine until crumbly.  Spread mixture over fruit.  Bake for 40 to 50 minutes.  Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose flour
1/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup firmly packed light brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Ingredients:
1/2 cup margarine
4 cups sliced fresh peaches
1 grated rind and juice of 1/2 lemon
2 tablespoons water
1 cup light cream, sweetened to taste and flavored with ground nutmeg, or vanilla ice cream
Instructions: Mix flour, sugars, nutmeg, salt and cinnamon.  Mix in margarine with a fork until coarse crumbs are formed.  Place peaches in 9 inch shallow baking pan.  Mix in lemon rind, juice and water.  Cover with crumb mixture, pat down so it sticks to fruit.  Cover and bake 15 minutes.  Uncover and bake for 30 minutes longer.  Serve warm with nutmeg flavored cream or vanilla ice cream.

Ingredient:
Cheesecake:
2 packages Philadelphia Cream Cheese, softened
1/3 cup sugar
1 teaspoon lemon juice
6 squares Baker's White Chocolate, melted
3/4 cup sour cream
Ingredients:
2 large eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla

Topping:
1 cup sour cream
2 tablespoons sugar
Fresh strawberries and kiwi
Instructions:
Beat cream cheese, sugar and lemon juice until blended and smooth.  Add chocolate, sour cream, eggs and vanilla.  Beat until well combined.   Pour batter into lightly greased 8 1/2 inch spring form pan; smooth top.  Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes.  Reduce heat to 250 degrees and bake 30 to 35 minutes longer.
For topping combine sugar and sour cream.  Spread over cheesecake; bake 5 minutes more.  Run sharp knife around sides; let cool completely before removing sides.  Refrigerate overnight, at least five hours.  Garnish with strawberries and kiwi or fruit sauce.

Ingredient:
2 Cups All Purpose Flour
1 Tablespoon  Sugar
1/2  Teaspoon Baking Powder
1/2  Teaspoon  Baking Soda
1/4  Teaspoon Salt
Ingredients:
1/3 Cup Butter, chilled
1 Egg
1/2 Cup Buttermilk
1 Teaspoon Vanilla
Instructions: In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. With a pastry blender or two knives cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  In separate bowl, combine egg, buttermilk and vanilla. Using fork, stir into dry ingredients to form a soft dough.  Gather into ball.  Turn out onto  lightly floured surface; knead lightly 10 times. With lightly floured hands, pat dough in 1/2 in thick  round.  Using 2 1/2 in. cookie cutter, cut dough into   rounds, gathering scraps together until dough is all used up.  Fold over double and place on lightly greased baking sheet.  Bake 12 to 15 minutesor  until golden brown and risen.  Let cool on wire racks.  Serve warm.

Ingredient:
1 cup ketchup
1 cup vinegar
1/4 cup brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon dry mustard
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
Dash of tobacco sauce
1 tablespoon Soya sauce
1 tablespoon chili powder
Instructions: Put all ingredients in a pot and mix well.  Bring to a boil over medium heat, let cool and brush over meat.  Store remaining sauce in the refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 package Jello Butterscotch Pudding and Pie Filling
1 cup corn syrup
3/4 cup evaporated milk
Ingredients:
1 egg, slightly beaten
1 cup chopped pecans
1 unbaked pie shell
Instructions: Blend pudding and pie filling mix with corn syrup.  Gradually stir in evaporated milk and egg.  Add pecans.  Pour into pie shell.  Bake until top is firm and just begins to crack about 40 minutes.  Cool 4 hours or more.  Serve decorated with whipped topping and pecan halves.

Ingredient:
1 Graham Pie Crust
4 cups mini marshmallows
2 tablespoons orange juice
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Ingredients:
1 cup heavy cream, whipped
1 cup diced peaches
Peach slices
Instructions: Prepare pie crust as directed on package.  Melt 4 cups marshmallows with orange and lemon juice in double boiler, stir until smooth.  Chill until slightly thickened, mix until well blended.   Fold in cream, peaches and remaining marshmallows.  Pour into prepared shell.  Chill.  Garnish with peach slices

Ingredient:
3/4 lbs. Linguine
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 onion, finely chopped
1/2 lb. Assorted mushrooms, sliced
8 asparagus spears, steamed and chopped
Ingredients:
1 jar pasta sauce
Salt and freshly ground pepper
1/4 lb. Ricotta cheese
Chopped fresh parsley
Instructions: Cook linguine 8 minutes or until tender.  In saucepan heat oil; cook onion and mushrooms until tender.  Add asparagus and past sauce; simmer 3 to 4 minutes.  Season to taste with salt and pepper.  Toss linguine with sauce and serve topped with cheese and parsley.

Ingredient:
1 lb Hamburg
1 cup cubed raw potatoes
1 cup sliced raw carrots
1 cup diced onion
Ingredients:
1/2 cup uncooked minute rice
1 medium can tomatoes and juice
1 can tomato soup
Instructions: Combine in buttered casserole dish, dot with bits of butter or a couple of diced bacon slices.  Bake for 1.5 hours

Ingredient:
1 large can creamed corn
1 large can corn niblets
1 box Jiffy corn mix
Ingredients:
1 stick melted margarine
1 cup sour cream
2 eggs
Instructions: Mix together, put in a 9 x 13 inch pan.  Bake 40 to 45 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 cup canned pumpkin
2 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon ginger
1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: Combine first two ingredients, beat eggs one at a time, stir in pumpkin.  Combine remaining ingredients.  Stir to  mix, pour into creamed mixture, stir just until moistened.  Spoon into greased loaf pan.  Bake for 1 hour or until done.  Cool 10 minutes, turn loaf onto rack.

Ingredient:
1 can salmon
1 cup milk
2 beaten eggs
2 slices bread (in small pieces)
Ingredients:
1 large onion, cut fine
1/2 teaspoon mustard
Pinch of salt and pepper
Instructions: Mix all ingredients together well and pour into greased loaf pan.  Bake for 45 to 50 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup (1 stick) butter or margarine
4-1/2 cups sugar
1 can (13 oz.) evaporated milk
3 pkg. (8 oz. each) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Chocolate Baking Chocolate squares (breaking in half before adding)
Ingredients:
1 jar (7 oz.) JET-PUFFED Marshmallow Creme
3 cups chopped PLANTERS Pecans
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. Vanilla
Instructions: Bring butter, sugar and milk to a full rolling boil in heavy 4-quart saucepan, stirring constantly. Boil 5 minutes on medium heat, stirring constantly to prevent scorching.  Remove from heat. Gradually stir in chocolate chunks until melted. Add remaining ingredients; beat until well blended.  Pour into greased 13x9-inch pan. Cool; cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup sour cream
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon almond extract
1 can whole berry cranberry sauce
1/2 cup chopped walnuts

Glaze (optional)
1/3 cup icing sugar
6 teaspoons warm water
1/2 teaspoon almond extract
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.  Add eggs, mix well.  Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt, add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream.  Add extract.  Spoon a third of the batter into a greased 9 inch square baking pan  Top with a third of the cranberry sauce.  Repeat layers twice.  Sprinkle with walnuts.  Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until done.  If desired, combine glaze ingredients and drizzle over cake.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
2 cups sugar
3 eggs
1 cup sour cream
1 teaspoon almond extract
2 cups all purpose flour
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
3/4 cups slivered almonds, divided
1 jar apricot preserves, divided
Instructions: In mixing bowl, cream margarine and sugar.  Add eggs, sour cream and extract; mix well.  Combine flour, baking powder and salt; add to creamed mixture and mix well.  Spread half of the batter in a greased and floured tube pan.  Sprinkle with half of the almonds.  Spread half of the preserves to within 1/2 inch of the edges.  Cover with remaining batter.  Spoon remaining preserves over batter to within 1/2 inch of edges.  Sprinkle with remaining almonds.  Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until done.  Cool in pan for 15 minutes.  Carefully invert onto a serving platter.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine, softened
1 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup sugar
2 cups all purpose flour
1 cup buttermilk
Ingredients:
1 egg
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon vanilla
3 chocolate English toffee candy bars, chopped
1/4 cup chopped pecans
Instructions: In a mixing bowl blend margarine, sugars and flour, set aside 1/2 cup.  To the remaining butter mixture, add buttermilk, egg, baking soda and vanilla; mix well.   Pour into a greased and floured  13 x 9 inch baking pan. Combine chopped candy and pecans with the reserved butter mixture, sprinkle over coffee cake.  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until done.  Cool on a wire rack.

Ingredient:
2 cups cubed day old bread, crusts removed
2 cups milk
1/4 cup sugar
3 tablespoons butter
Dash salt
2 eggs
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
Lemon Sauce:
1/2 cup sugar
1 tablespoon cornstarch
Dash salt
1 cup water
1 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon peel
2 tablespoons margarine
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 drop yellow food coloring, optional
Instructions: Place bread cubes in a greased 1 quart baking dish.  In a saucepan, heat milk, sugar, butter and salt over low heat just until butter melts.  In a bowl, beat eggs; whisk in warm milk mixture.  Stir in vanilla.  Pour over bread.  Place baking dish in a shallow pan of hot water.  Bake uncovered for 40 to 45 minutes or until a knife inserted 1 inch from the edge comes out clean.  For the lemon sauce, combine sugar, cornstarch and salt in a saucepan.  Stir in water and lemon peel; bring to a boil.  Cook and stir for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in butter, lemon juice and food coloring.  Serve warm or cold with the pudding.  Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
1 garlic clove, minced
2 tablespoons cooking oil
1 boneless rump roast (5 to 6 lb.)
3 tablespoons cider or red wine vinegar
1/2 cup tomato juice
2 tablespoons ketchup
1 tablespoon sugar
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
8 medium carrots, cut into thirds
1/2 lb. small whole onions
1/2 cup all purpose flour
1 cup cold water
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: In a Dutch oven over medium heat, saut degrees garlic in oil for 1 minute.  Add the roast; brown on all sides.  Combine vinegar, tomato juice, ketchup, sugar, salt and pepper, pour over roast.  Cover and simmer for 2 hours.  Add carrots and onions; cover and cook for 1 hour or until meat and vegetables are tender.  Remove to a serving platter and keep warm.  Skim fat from pan juices.  Add water to juices to measure 3 cups.  Mix flour and cold water until smooth, stir into pan juices.  Bring to a boil and cook and stir for 2 minutes.  Season with salt and pepper.  Slice roast, serve with vegetables and gravy.

Ingredient:
1 cup shortening
1 cup packed brown sugar
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
3 cups rolled oats
1 cup chopped pecans
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, cream shortening and sugars.  Add eggs and vanilla.  Combine flour, baking soda and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture.  Stir in oats and nuts.  Chill for 30 minutes.  Shape into 1 1/2 inch balls, place 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool on wire racks.

Ingredient:
20 cups cubed cooked chicken
1 package elbow macaroni, cooked and drained
6 jars (6 ounces each) sliced mushrooms, drained
2 jars (4 ounces each) diced pimientos, drained
2 large green peppers, chopped
2 large onions, chopped
4 cans (10 3/4 ounces each) condensed cream of celery soup, undiluted
Ingredients:
4 cans (10 3/4 ounces each) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
2 lbs. Process American cheese, cubed
1 1/3 cups milk
4 teaspoons dried basil
2 teaspoons lemon pepper seasoning
2 cups crushed cornflakes
1/4 cup margarine, melted
Instructions:
Combine the chicken, macaroni, mushrooms, pimientos, peppers and onion.  In a large bowl, combine soups, cheese , milk, basil and lemon pepper, add to chicken mixture.  Pour about 12 cups each into four greased 13 x 9 inch baking pans.  Cover and refrigerate overnight.  Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.  Combine cornflakes and butter sprinkle over the casseroles.  Cover and bake 45 minutes.  Uncover and bake 15 to 20
 minutes longer or until bubbly.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups chopped dates
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup butter
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
2 eggs
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup orange juice
1 1/4 cups all purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped walnuts

Orange Glaze:
3 cups icing sugar
1/4 cup margarine, softened
1 teaspoon grated orange peel
1/3 cup milk
Instructions: In a saucepan, combine the dates, sugar, water and butter. Simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally or until dates are softened.  Remove from heat; stir in chocolate chips.  Beat eggs, milk and orange juice.  Combine flour, baking soda and salt; add to date mixture alternately with orange juice mixture, mixing well after each addition.  Stir in walnuts.  Pour into a greased 15 x 10 inch baking dish.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until done.  Cool.  Combine icing sugar, butter and orange peel and stir in milk until glaze reaches desired consistency.  Spread over bars.

Ingredient:
4 cups sliced peeled tart apples
2 cups blueberries
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1 cup all purpose flour, divided
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1 egg, beaten
1/2 cup margarine, melted
Instructions: Place apples in a greased 11 x 7 inch baking dish.  Top with blueberries.  Mix brown sugar and 2 tablespoons flour and sprinkle over fruit.  Combine sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg and remaining flour.  Stir in egg with a fork until mixture is crumbly.  Sprinkle over fruit, drizzle with butter.  Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until done.  Serve warm

Ingredient:
3 cups lukewarm water
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons dry yeast
2 teaspoons salt
Ingredients:
4 eggs
1/2 cup oil
10 cups flour
Instructions: Combine first four ingredients together. When yeast has risen, add the next 3 ingredients.  Mix and knead well.  Let rise until double in size, about 1 1/2 hours.  Punch down and let rise 10 minutes.  Form  into buns on greased cookie sheet and let rise one hour.  Bake for 20 minutes.  When baked, brush top with butter.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 lbs. Ground beef
1/2 cup bread crumbs
1/2 cup water
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 (14 oz) can pineapple, tidbits, drained, reserve syrup
Ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped green pepper
1 (10 oz) can chicken with rice soup
1 tablespoon Soya sauce
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup pineapple juice
1/2 cup vinegar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
Instructions: Put first 5 ingredients in bowl.  Mix together well and shape into small balls.  Brown in fry pan with a little oil.  Remove to a 2 quart casserole dish.  In medium saucepan, combine pineapple, green peppers, soup, Soya sauce, sugar and pineapple juice.  Bring to a boil.  Stir cornstarch in vinegar.  Stir to make smooth.  Add to boiling mixture, stirring and cooking until thickened.  Pour over meatballs.  Cover.  Bake for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup shortening
1 cup flour
1 cup brown sugar packed
2 teaspoons fine grind ground coffee
1 egg, beaten
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups oatmeal
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1 cup raisins or chocolate chips
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 cup nuts
1/4 teaspoon allspice
Instructions: Cream shortening and brown sugar.  Add egg and vanilla.  Mix dry ingredients together and add to mixture.  Add nuts, raisins or chocolate chips.  Shape into 2 inch balls and put 3 inches apart on a greased cookie sheet.  Flatten to 1/2 inch thick.  Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool on sheet for a few minutes then transfer to rack to cool.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup finely chopped almonds
1 cup flour
1/2 cup  margarine
1 package cream cheese
1 cup icing sugar
Ingredients:
1 package vanilla instant pudding
1 1/2 cups milk
1 package chocolate instant pudding
1 1/2 cups milk
1 large container of Cool Whip
Instructions: Combine almonds, flour and margarine.  Press into 9 x 13 inch pan.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Cool.   Mix cream cheese and icing sugar together until creamy, then spread on cooled base.   Beat together vanilla pudding with milk.  Let stand 2 minutes, then spread on top of cream cheese layer.  Beat together chocolate pudding and milk.  Let stand 2 minutes, spread over vanilla layer.  Let stand 15 minutes.  Top with cool whip.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1/2 cup chunky peanut butter
2/3 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
Ingredients:
1 egg
1 cup all purpose flour
1/2 cup jam or jelly
Instructions: In mixing bowl, cream together butter, peanut butter, brown sugar and white sugar.  Beat in egg.  Stir in flour until well blended.  Refrigerate dough for 20 minutes or until firm.  Roll into 1 inch balls.  Flatten slightly.  Place 2 inches apart on baking sheet.  With finger or end of wooden spoon press round indentation in center of each cookie.  Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown.  While still hot, fill each indentation with 1/4 teaspoon jam.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
2 packages (4 oz each) Baker's German's Sweet Baking Chocolate , broken into squares
1/2 cup Angel Flake coconut, lightly toasted
1/2 cup toasted slivered almonds
Instructions: Beat margarine, brown sugar, egg and vanilla; mix in flour and salt.  Press into greased 13 x 9 inch pan.  Bake 30 minutes or until edges are golden brown.  Remove from oven; immediately place chocolate pieces on top.  Cover with foil; let stand 5 minutes or until chocolate is softened.  Spread chocolate evenly over entire surface; sprinkle with coconut and almonds. Cut into squares while still warm.

Ingredient:
1 package Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
1 cup blanched ground almonds
1 cup sifted icing sugar
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon powdered instant coffee
1/4 cup rum
3 squares unsweetened chocolate, melted
Coatings
Instructions: Blend cream cheese, ground almonds, icing sugar, powdered coffee and rum, mix well.  Add melted chocolate.  Roll mixture into 1 inch balls.  Chill mixture if too soft to handle.  Roll balls in coatings of your choice.  Coatings:  Chocolate sprinkles, toasted sliced almonds, icing sugar or toasted coconut.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon oil
4 small boneless skinless chicken breast halves
2 cups water
Ingredients:
3/4 cup barbecue sauce
1 cup frozen or canned corn, drained
2 cups Minute white rice, uncooked
Instructions: Heat oil in large nonstick skillet on medium high heat.  Add chicken, cover and cook 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.  Remove from skillet.  Add water, barbecue sauce and corn to skillet.  Bring to boil.  Stir in rice.  Top with chicken, cover.  Cook on low heat 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 lb ground beef or Italian sausage
4 cups penne pasta, cooked, drained
Ingredients:
2 3/4 cups spaghetti sauce
3/4 cup Parmesan Cheese, divided
2 cups Hearty Italian Style Shredded Cheese
Instructions: Brown meat in large skillet, drain.  Stir in penne pasta, spaghetti sauce and 1/2 cup parmesan cheese.  Spoon into 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Top with shredded cheese and remaining 1/4 cup parmesan cheese.  Bake for 20 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 cups water
2 cups elbow macaroni, uncooked
3/4 lb. Velveeta Pasteurized process cheese spread, cut up
Ingredients:
1 cup frozen vegetable blend
1 can tuna, drained, flaked
2 tablespoons milk
Instructions: Bring water to boil in saucepan, stir in macaroni.  Reduce heat to medium low, cover with tight fitting lid.  Simmer 8 to 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender.  Add Velveeta, vegetables, tuna and milk.  Stir until Velveeta is melted and mixture is thoroughly heated.

Ingredient:
1 envelope Roasted Garlic Salad Dressing
1/2 cup Kraft 100% Grated Parmesan Cheese
Ingredients: 6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
Instructions: Mix salad dressing mix and cheese.  Moisten chicken with water, coat with mixture.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until cooked through.

Ingredient:
1 package Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
3 tablespoons milk
3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh basil
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh parsley
2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives
1 clove garlic, minced
Assorted cut-up vegetables, breadsticks or chips
Instructions: Mix cream cheese and milk with electric mixer on medium speed until smooth.  Blend in remaining ingredients.  Refrigerate.  Serve with assorted cut up vegetables, breadsticks or chips

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/8 teaspoon salt
1 egg
1/2 cup skim milk
1/3 cup firmly packed brown sugar
3 tablespoons vegetable oil
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups Post Banana Nut Crunch cereal
1 cup finely chopped bananas
1/2 cup Post Banana Nut Crunch cereal, lightly crushed
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon vegetable oil
Instructions: Mix flour, baking powder and salt in large bowl.  Beat egg in small bowl; stir in milk, 1/3 cup brown sugar and 3 tablespoons oil.  Add to flour mixture; stir just until moistened.  (Batter will be lumpy).  Stir in 1 1/2 cups cereal and banana.  Spoon batter into either paper lined muffin pan or muffin pan which has been sprayed with a no stick cooking spary.  Fill each cup 2/3 full.  Mix 1/2 cup cereal, 1 tablespoon brown sugar and cinnamon.  Drizzle with 1 teaspoon oil; stir until crumbly.  Sprinkle evenly over muffins.  Bake 20 minutes or until lightly browned.  Serve warm.

Ingredient:
1 can (3 oz) Real Bacon Pieces or Bits
2 cups Ranch Dressing
1 cup Sour Cream
Ingredients:
1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese
2 green onions, sliced
Assorted cut up vegetables or chips
Instructions: Mix all ingredients.  Over and refrigerate.  Serve with assorted cup up vegetables or chips

Ingredient:
1 package stove top stuffing mix for chicken
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
Ingredients:
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1/3 cup sour cream or milk
Instructions: Prepare stuffing mix as directed on package; set aside.  Place chicken in 13 x 9 inch baking dish.  Mix soup and sour cream; pour over chicken.  Spoon stuffing evenly over top.  Bake for 35 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Ingredient:
2 2/3 cups Angle Flake coconut
2/3 cup sweetened condensed milk
Ingredients: 1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Mix coconut, milk and vanilla in large bowl.  Drop by teaspoonfuls about 1 inch apart on well greased cookie sheet, pressing down ends of coconut with back of spoon.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.  Immediately remove from cookie sheet and cool on wire rack.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
Dash pepper
2 eggs
1 cup milk
Instructions: Measure and sift dry ingredients together.  Beat eggs; add milk and mix well.  Add dry ingredients to liquid ingredients and stir gently until smooth.  Dip prepared pieces of fish in batter and deep fat fry.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup sugar
1 cup peeled, chopped apple
1 egg, lightly beaten
1 cup milk
1/3 cup melted margarine
Ingredients:
Topping:
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift together flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.  Stir in chopped apple.  Combine egg, milk and melted margarine.  Add liquid to dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened.  Do not over mix.  Spoon into greased muffin tins, filling 3/4 full.  Combine brown sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg; sprinkle on top of muffins.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 cups flour
4 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cup coarse walnuts
Ingredients:
6 tablespoons margarine
1 1/2 cups light brown sugar
2 eggs
2 cups crushed pineapple, including juice
Instructions: Combine dry ingredients.  Add walnuts.  Cream margarine and sugar, beat in eggs, one at a time.  Add 1/2 flour mixture, then the pineapple and then the remaining flour.  Pour into 2 large loaf pans, lined and greased.  Bake for 50 to 60 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup icing sugar
3/4 cup peanut butter
1 tablespoon margarine
1/2 cup walnuts, chopped
Salt
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
3 tablespoons milk
Coconut
3/4 cup dates, chopped
Instructions: Mix the sugar, peanut butter, margarine, walnuts, salt, vanilla and milk thoroughly.  Make into small balls placing date in center and roll in coconut.  Refrigerate

Ingredient:
1 bacon strip, diced
1 medium onion, diced
1 can chicken broth
2 cups water
2 large potatoes, peeled and diced
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 can whole kernel corn, drained
1 cup milk, divided
1/2 cup all purpose flour
Chopped fresh parsley, optional
Instructions: In a 3 quart saucepan, cook bacon until crisp, remove to paper towel to drain.  Saut degrees onion in drippings until tender. Add broth, water and potatoes, bring to a boil.  Reduce heat cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender.  Add salt and pepper, mix well.  Add corn and 3/4 cup of milk.  Combine flour and remaining milk until smooth; add to soup.  Bring to a boil, cook and stir for 2 minutes.  Garnish with bacon and parsley if desired.

Ingredient:
1 package cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup margarine, softened
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour

Filling:
1/2 lb. Fresh mushrooms, finely chopped
1 medium onion, finely chopped
2 tablespoons margarine
Ingredients:
1 package cream cheese, cubed
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1 teaspoon water
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until smooth; stir in flour.  Cover and refrigerate dough for at least 1 hour.  Meanwhile, in a skillet or saucepan, over medium heat, saut degrees mushrooms and onion in margarine until tender.  Remove from heat.  Add cream cheese, salt, thyme and pepper; stir until cheese is melted.  Cool to room temperature.  On a floured surface, roll dough to 1/8 inch thickness.  Cut into 3 inch circles.  Combine egg and water; lightly brush edges of circles.  Place about 1 teaspoon of filling in centre of each circle.  Fold over; seal edges.  Brush with egg mixture.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Ingredient:
2 cups chopped onion
1 1/2 cups chopped celery
1/2 cups margarine
12 cups unseasoned stuffing croutons or dry bread cubes
1 tablespoon poultry seasoning
2 teaspoons chicken bouillon granules
1 teaspoon pepper
1 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
1 teaspoon lemon pepper seasoning
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
2 - 2 1/2 cups boiling water
1 turkey (14 to 16 lb)

Glaze:
1/2 cup honey
1/2 cup Dijon mustard
1 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
1 teaspoon onion powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: In a large skillet, saut degrees onion and celery in margarine until tender.   Pour into a large bowl.  Add the next seven ingredients and mix well.  Stir in enough water until stuffing has reached desired moistness.  Just before baking, stuff the turkey.  Skewer openings; tie drumsticks together.  Place on a rack in a roasting pan.  Cover lightly with a tent of aluminum foil.  Bake for 4 hours.  Combine glaze ingredients.  Pour over turkey.  Bake and additional 1 - 1 1/2 hours, basting if needed, or until meat thermometer reads 185 degrees.  Remove all stuffing.

Ingredient:
8 squares semi sweet baking chocolate
1 can sweetened condensed milk, divided
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1 package (14 oz) Premium White baking chocolate
Instructions: Microwave semi sweet chocolate and 3/4 cup of milk in medium microwavable bowl on high 2 minutes or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring halfway through heating time.  Stir until chocolate is completely  melted.  Stir in vanilla and nuts.  Spread in foil lined 8 inch square pan.  Microwave white chocolate and remaining milk in medium microwavable bowl on high 1 1/2 minutes or until white chocolate is almost melted, stirring halfway through heating time.  Stir until white chocolate is completely melted.   Spread evenly over semi sweet chocolate layer.  Refrigerate 30 minutes.   Refrigerate 1 1/2 hours or until firm.  Cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon oil
4 small boneless skinless chicken breast halves
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 soup can water
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons soy sauce
2 cups minute white rice, uncooked
1 package frozen stir-fry vegetables, thawed
Instructions: Heat oil in large nonstick skillet on medium high heat.  Add chicken, cover and cook 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.  Remove chicken from skillet.  Stir in soup, water and soy sauce.  Bring to boil.  Stir in rice and vegetables. Top with chicken, cover.  Cook on low heat 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
3 cups grated carrot
2 cups chopped celery
2 cups raisins
Ingredients:
2 cups salad dressing or mayonnaise
1 tablespoon vinegar
1-2 teaspoons sugar
1/4 teaspoon prepared mustard
1/8 teaspoon paprika
Instructions: Combine carrot, celery and raisins in bowl.  Measure remaining ingredients into another bowl.  Mix.  Pour over vegetables and toss.

Ingredient:
1 package Philly cream cheese
1 tub sour cream
Ingredients: 1 package taco seasoning
Instructions: Blend together with mixer.  Spread over a large dish.  Then spread medium salsa sauce over that and sprinkle shredded cheese on top (and chopped green pepper if desired).  Dip it up with Taco chips.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups white sugar
1/2 cup margarine, melted
2 eggs
Ingredients:
2 cups self-rising flour
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 (16 oz) can fruit cocktail
Instructions: Grease and flour a 9 x 13 inch pan.  In a large bowl mix sugar and melted margarine.  Add eggs, and beat well.  Mix in flour and vanilla.  Stir in fruit cocktail.  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake for 25 to 35 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups white sugar
1 cup Butter Flavor Crisco
2 eggs
1/4 cup light corn syrup or regular pancake syrup
1 tablespoon vanilla
Ingredients:
3 cups all purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Combine sugar and Crisco in large bowl.  Beat at medium speed until well blended.  Add eggs, syrup and vanilla, beat well.  Combine 3 cups flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Add gradually to creamed mixture at low speed.  Mix until well blended.  Divide dough into quarters.  (If dough is too sticky/soft to roll, wrap each quarter of dough with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour).  Spread 1 tablespoon flour on large sheet of waxed paper.  Place a quarter of dough on floured paper.  Flatten dough slightly, turn over and cover with another sheet of waxed paper.  Roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness.  Cut out with floured cutter.  Transfer to ungreased baking sheet two inches apart.  Sprinkle with decors, or leave plain to frost when cooked.  Bake 5 to 9 minutes .  Do not over bake.  Cool 2 minutes on baking sheet.  Remove to counter to cool completely, then frost if desired.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups sifted icing sugar
1 package Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups shredded coconut
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Dash of salt
Instructions: Gradually add sugar to softened cream cheese, mixing well after each addition.  Add 1/2 cup coconut, vanilla and salt, mix well.  Chill.  Shape into 1 inch balls and roll in remaining coconut.  Chill several hours.  Keep stored in refrigerator until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
1 cup graham cracker crumbs
3 tablespoons margarine, melted
3 packages Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
3/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
Ingredients:
4 eggs
3/4 cup sour cream
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 teaspoon almond extract
1 cup chopped cranberries
Instructions:
Combine crumbs and margarine, press onto bottom of 9 inch spring form pan.  Bake 10 minutes.  Remove from oven.  Increase temperature to 450 degrees.  Combine cream cheese, sugar and flour, mixing at medium speed  until well blended.  Blend in egg, one at a time, then sour cream and flavourings. Stir in cranberries.  Pour over crust.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Reduce oven temperature to 250 degrees continue baking 40 minutes.  Run knife around cake. Allow to cool in pan.  Top with Cranberry Glaze

Cranberry Glaze:  Combine 1 cup cranberry juice and 1 tablespoon cornstarch in saucepan.  Cook until thickened.  Spoon a thin layer over top of cake; let stand 10 minutes then spoon remaining sauce over top, allowing some to dribble over sides.  Refrigerate several hours before serving

Ingredient:
1 cup chocolate chips
1 cup butterscotch chips
1 cup Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed milk
Ingredients:
1 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Melt chocolate and butterscotch chips with the milk over a warm burner.  Stir carefully so it doesn't burn.  When melted remove from heat, add nuts and vanilla.  Blend well.  Chill

Ingredient:
2 slices bacon, cut into 1/2 inch pieces
1 large onion, chopped
1 red pepper, diced
1/4 cup all purpose flour
Ingredients:
5 cups milk
1 can cream corn
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: In medium saucepot over medium high heat saut degrees bacon pieces until lightly browned.  Remove bacon drain and set aside.  To bacon drippings in pot add chopped onion and diced red pepper, cook 3 to 5 minutes, stirring frequently.   Stir in all purpose flour.  Gradually stir in milk, then cream corn, Worcestershire sauce and salt and pepper to taste.  Bring just to boiling over low heat; simmer 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Sprinkle chowder with reserved bacon pieces.

Ingredient:
1 can peach slices in syrup
1 cup rolled oats
1 cup all purpose flour
3/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon gingerroot
Ingredients:
1/2 cup margarine, softened
1 egg
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Whipped cream for garnish
Instructions: Drain peach slices, reserving 1/2 cup syrup.  Place peach slices and reserved syrup into 11 x 7 inch baking dish.  In medium bowl combine rolled oats, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon and gingerroot; rub in softened margarine with finger tips or with a fork until crumbly.  In small bowl lightly beat egg with lemon juice.  Add to crumb mixture; stir until  moistened.  Evenly spoon over peaches.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes until lightly golden and bubbly around sides.

Ingredient:
1 package (2 layer size) chocolate cake mix
1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa
3 eggs
Ingredients:
1 1/3 cups water
1 cup Miracle Whip dressing
Instructions: Stir cake mix and cocoa, add remaining ingredients.  Beat at medium speed with electric mixer until blended.  Pour into greased and floured baking pan.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until done.  Cool and frost as desired.

Ingredient:
2 eggs
3/4 cup white sugar
3/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1/2 cup Miracle Whip dressing
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
2 cups flour
1 package (14 oz) caramels
1/4 cup milk
1 cup semi sweet real chocolate chips
1 cup chopped pecans
Instructions: Beat eggs, sugars, dressing and vanilla at medium speed; add flour and baking soda.  Set aside 1 cup of the batter.  Spread remaining batter into lightly greased 13 x 9 inch pan.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool 10 minutes.  Melt caramels with milk in heavy saucepan over low heat, stirring frequently until smooth.  Top crust with caramel mixture, sprinkle with chips and pecans.  Spoon reserved 1 cup batter by teaspoonfuls over pecans.  Continue baking 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 package jello light vanilla instant pudding
1 can pineapple in juice (crushed or tidbits)
Ingredients: 1 cup plain low fat yogurt
Instructions: Combine pudding mix and pineapple with juice in bowl; mix well.  Blend in yogurt.  Spoon into serving dishes.  Garnish with fruit if desired.  Ready to eat in 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup Mazola Corn oil
1/4 cup Mayonnaise
1/4 cup vinegar
1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 teaspoon sugar
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground pepper
1 tablespoon chopped fresh basil
1 tablespoon chopped fresh orange
2 green onions, chopped
Instructions: Combine all ingredients except herbs and onions in blender container or food processor bowl.  Cover and blend or process until smooth and creamy.  Stir in herbs and onions.  Let stand 1 hour to blend flavours.

Ingredient:
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup corn syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 cup peanuts
1/2 teaspoon soda
1 tablespoon butter
Instructions: Mix sugar, corn syrup and peanuts together.  Microwave on high 8 to 10 minutes (until mixture is brown) stirring every 2 minutes.  Add rest of ingredients and mix well.  Pour into greased pizza pan and let cool.  Break into pieces.

Ingredient:
6 skinless chicken pieces
3 chopped potatoes
3 chopped carrots
Ingredients:
1 chopped onion
1 cup Zesty Italian Dressing
Parmesan Grated Cheese
Instructions: Place chicken, potatoes, carrots and onion in a large baking dish.  Drizzle dressing.  Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 1 hour, remove foil during last 10 minutes of baking.  Sprinkle with cheese.

Ingredient:
1 package frozen broccoli, thawed and chopped
2 cups cubed ham
2 cups cheddar cheese
2 cups croutons
Ingredients:
4 eggs
2 cups milk
1 cup Miracle Whip dressing
Instructions: Combine in a baking dish broccoli, ham, cheese and croutons.  Mix together eggs, milk and dressing.  Pour over the ham mixture.  Refrigerate for 30 minutes or overnight.  Bake uncovered for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
2 cups Minute Rice
Kraft Catalina dressing
Dash of Soya sauce
Ingredients:
Chicken
Vegetables
Instructions: Prepare rice substituting Catalina dressing for half the water.  Add a dash of Soya sauce.  Cook 5 minutes.  Stir in slices of cooked cubed chicken and vegetables.

Ingredient:
Sirloin Steak cut in strips
Broccoli, cut up
Red Pepper, chopped
Ingredients:
Zesty Italian Dressing
Minute Rice
Instructions: Stir fry strips of sirloin steak, broccoli and chopped red pepper in Zesty Italian Dressing until meat is cooked and vegetables are tender crisp.  Serve over prepared rice.

Ingredient:
Miracle Whip Salad dressing
Parmesan Grated Cheese
Ingredients: Boneless Chicken Breasts
Instructions: Stir together equal amounts of Miracle Whip dressing and Parmesan Grated cheese.  Spread sauce over chicken and bake for 15 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
Miracle Whip Salad dressing
Salsa
Ingredients: Dash of Chili powder
Instructions: Stir together equal amounts of Miracle Whip dressing and salsa and a dash of chili powder..  Spread sauce over chicken and bake for 15 minutes or until done.

Ingredient: 1/2 cup Miracle Whip Salad Dressing
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
Dash of Tarragon
Instructions: Stir together Miracle Whip dressing with a spoonful of mustard and tarragon..  Spread sauce over chicken and bake for 15 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup Miracle Whip Salad Dressing
1 teaspoon Soya sauce
Ingredients:
Dash of ginger
Dash of cayenne pepper
Instructions: Stir together Miracle Whip dressing with Soya sauce, ginger and pepper.  Spread sauce over chicken and bake for 15 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 lbs lean sirloin steak, cut into strips
1 large green pepper, cut into strips
1 onion, thinly sliced
1 garlic clove, crushed
2 tablespoons butter
Ingredients:
1 cup beef broth
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1 tablespoon white sugar
2 tablespoons Soya sauce
1/2 teaspoon ginger
2 medium tomatoes, cut in wedges
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: Saut degrees beef, green pepper, onion and garlic in butter until beef is lightly browned.  Add beef broth and simmer 1 to 2 minutes.  Combine cornstarch and sugar with Soya sauce and ginger.  Add to fry pan and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.  Top mixture with tomato wedges, cover pan and simmer 2 to 3 minutes or until tomatoes are hot but still firm. Season to taste.  Serve with hot fluffy rice.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup lemon juice
1/3 cup vegetable oil
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1/4 teaspoon thyme
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon rosemary
1 teaspoon salt
Dash of pepper
1 clove garlic, crushed
3 lbs. Chicken pieces
Instructions: Combine all marinade ingredients and blend well.  Place chicken in non metal shallow dish.  Pour  marinade over chicken.  Leave at room temperature for 2 hours or in the refrigerator over night.  Turn pieces occasionally.  Drain chicken and reserve marinade.  Place chicken on barbecue grill bone side down.  Grill slowly over gray coals for 35 to 40 minutes or until there is no trace of pinkness next to the bone; turn halfway through cooking time. Brush occasionally with reserved marinade.

RecipeName: Sweetened Condensed Milk (same as Eagle Brand)
Ingredient:
1/3 cup boiling water
3 tablespoons margarine
2/3 cup sugar
Ingredients:
1 cup instant no fat dry milk powder
Lemon juice
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in blender.   Refrigerate in a covered glass container.

Ingredient:
1 bag hash browns
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 small container sour cream
1 diced onion
Ingredients:
1 1/2 - 2 cups grated cheddar cheese
2 cups crushed cornflakes
1/4 - 1/2 cup melted margarine
Instructions: Put in casserole dish and sprinkle with crushed cornflakes and margarine mixture and bake 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
3 eggs
1 1/2 cups oil
1 cup white sugar
1 cup brown sugar
3 cups flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
2 teaspoons soda
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons vanilla
2 cups coconut
2 cups finely grated carrots
1 cup crushed pineapple and juice
1 cup raisins or nuts
Instructions: Beat eggs, oil and sugar.  Sift flour, cinnamon, soda and salt.  Combine in egg mixture.  Add vanilla.  Add remainder of ingredients.  Stir well.  Bake for 50 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons margarine
1/2 cup onion, chopped
1/2 cup green peppers, chopped
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 cup sour cream
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon dried parsley
1 package extra broad noodles
1 cup shredded mozzarella
1 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese
2 cups cooked ham, cubed
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: Cook noodles, rinse, drain and set aside. In large saucepan, melt margarine, saut degrees onions and green peppers. Stir in soup, sour cream, ham, garlic powder and parsley. Simmer on low heat for couple of minutes.  Stir in noodles, 3/4 cup of each of the cheeses and salt and pepper.  Spray a 2 quart casserole with cooking spary and transfer noodle mixture into casserole.  Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until heated through and golden brown.    Cooked chicken or turkey can be used instead of ham.

Ingredient:
2 cups milk
1/2 cup rice
1/2 cup raisins
1/4 cup margarine
2 cups milk
Ingredients:
3 beaten eggs
1/3 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 teaspoon salt
Cinnamon
Light cream
Instructions: In a heavy saucepan, bring 2 cups milk, rice and raisins to a boil, reduce heat.  Cover, cook over very low heat till rice is tender, about 15 minutes.   Remove from heat, stir in margarine till melted.  In bowl combine 2 cups milk, eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt.  Gradually stir rice mixture into egg mixture.  Pour into a 10 x 6 dish.  Bake uncovered 50 minutes.  Stir, sprinkle with cinnamon.  Serve warm or chilled with cream.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup maple syrup
1/2 cup apple juice
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Instructions: Remove ham from oven 30 minutes before it is cooked.  Mix all ingredients and heat until thickened.  Score fat and stud with cloves.  Spread glaze over ham.  Increase oven temperature to 350 degrees and bake ham for the remaining 30 minutes, basting occasionally.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup vegetable oil
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
1/4 cup vinegar
1/4 cup Soya sauce
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
1 teaspoon dry mustard
1 teaspoon parsley
2 cloves of garlic, crushed
Pepper
Instructions: Stir all ingredients together.  Marinate meat for two hours at room temperature or in the refrigerator overnight.

Ingredient:
4 teaspoons butter
2 cloves garlic, chopped
1/2 cup mushrooms, sliced
Ingredients:
2 lbs. Scallops
1 cup chopped tomatoes
1/2 cup sherry
Salt and pepper
Instructions: In a frying pan, melt the butter.  Add the garlic, mushrooms and scallops.  Cook over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes.  Stir in tomatoes and sherry.  Season with salt and pepper to taste and cook for a further 1 to 2 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup chopped fruit or frozen cranberries
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
2 cups all purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 egg
1 cup milk
1/3 cup vegetable oil
1 teaspoon vanilla
