Instructions: Combine cranberries and 1/4 cup of the sugar; set aside.  In large bowl combine remaining sugar, flour, baking powder, soda and salt.  Stir in cranberries. In bowl, beat egg with milk, oil and vanilla.  Add to dry ingredients all at once, stirring just until moistened.  Spoon into greased muffin tins, filling 3/4 full.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.

RecipeName: Melt In Your Mouth Chocolate Bars
Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup cocoa
1 egg, beaten
2 cups graham wafer crumbs
Ingredients:
1 cup flaked or shredded coconut
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1 cup sweetened condensed milk
1/3 cup lemon juice
1/3 cup chocolate chips, melted
Instructions: In saucepan over medium heat, melt butter; stir in sugar, cocoa and egg; cook, stirring for 30 seconds.  Stir in crumbs, coconut and walnuts.  Press into bottom of 9 inch square pan.  Stir together sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice until well blended.  Spread evenly over crumb base.  Drizzle with  melted chocolate.  Refrigerate until firm.  Cut into squares.  Store in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
Crust:
3/4 cup margarine, softened
1/3 cup icing sugar
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour

Filling:
1 package cream cheese, softened
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1/4 cup Lemon juice
2 tablespoons corn starch
1 tablespoon packed brown sugar
1 can whole berry cranberry sauce
Ingredients:
Topping:
1/3 cup all purpose flour
2 tablespoons packed brown sugar
1/4 cup firm margarine
3/4 cup chopped walnuts
Instructions:
Crust:
In large bowl, cream together margarine and icing sugar until fluffy.  Gradually stir in flour.  Press onto bottom of 13 x 9 inch baking pan.  Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned.  Reduce oven temperature to 325 degrees..

Filling:
In large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Gradually beat in sweetened milk until smooth. Stir in lemon juice.  Pour over baked crust.  In small bowl, combine corn starch and brown sugar, mix well.  Stir in cranberry sauce.  Spoon evenly over cheese layer.

Topping:
In medium bowl, combine flour and brown sugar.  Cut in firm margarine until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Stir in nuts.  Sprinkle evenly over cranberry layer.  Bake 45 minutes or until bubbly and golden.  Serve warm or chilled.  Cover leftovers, refrigerate.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup shortening
1 1/2 cups icing sugar
Salt
1 egg
Ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped cherries
1 cup marshmallows
3/4 cup coconut
Almond or vanilla
Instructions: Line 8 inch square pan with graham wafers.  Top with filling made by creaming the shortening, icing sugar, salt and yolk of egg and flavoring until light and fluffy.  Beat egg white until stiff and fold into first mixture.  Add coconut, cherries and marshmallows.  Spread evenly over crackers.  Sprinkle top with cracker crumbs or more cherries.  Put in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 cup shortening
1 cup white sugar
1 cup brown sugar
1 egg
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup walnuts
3 1/2 cups flour
Instructions: Mix well, make in a roll in wax paper until cold enough to slice and bake until brown.

Ingredient:
Base:
1 cup graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup melted margarine
Ingredients:
Filling:
1 cup coconut
1 small package chocolate chips
1 small package butterscotch chips
1 can sweetened condensed milk
Instructions: Prepare base and press into baking dish.  Sprinkle on top of base, one layer at a time the coconut, chips and milk.  Sprinkle nuts over the top.  Bake for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup soft margarine
1 cup icing sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1/2 cup cherries (chopped)
3/4 cup coconut
2 cups rolled oats
Instructions: Cream margarine and sugar.  Add cherries, coconut, rolled oats and vanilla.  Shape into balls.  Roll in chopped nuts.  Keep in fridge.  Will keep for several weeks.  Remove from fridge several hours before serving or margarine will be hard.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
1/2 cup icing sugar
1/2 cup corn starch
Ingredients:
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
Instructions: Mix together margarine and icing sugar.  Sift together the flour and the cornstarch and mix in gradually in the margarine mixture.  Add the chocolate chips.  Shape dough into small balls of approximately 1/4 inch in diameter.  Put on a non greased cookie sheet and bake for 20 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1/2 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup white sugar
1/2 cup peanut butter
1 egg
1/4 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 cup all purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
2 cups rolled oats
1 cup coarsely grated carrot
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
Instructions: Cream together the margarine, sugars and peanut butter.  Add in the egg and the milk.  Sift together flour, salt and baking soda and stir in.  Stir in oats.  Add in the carrots and chocolate chips.  Drop by teaspoon onto cookie sheet and bake for 15 minutes

Ingredient:
4 cups sliced peaches
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1 cup all purpose flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 cup milk
White sugar, to sweeten peaches if desired
Instructions: Melt margarine, put it in the bottom of a large casserole or 9 x 13 inch pan.  Slice peaches, and add enough sugar to sweeten.  Place in casserole dish.  In a mixing bowl, combine the 1 cup sugar, salt, baking powder, flour, cinnamon and milk.  Sprinkle over the peaches.  Bake for 45 minutes or until top is brown

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
Ingredients:
3 cups all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Cream together margarine, sugar and eggs. Stir in vanilla, flour, baking soda and salt.  Roll out (not too thin) and cut into any shape.  Bake for 8 minutes.  Decorate as desired.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
Grated rind from one orange
1/2 cup fresh orange juice
2 cups all purpose flour
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup chopped walnuts, optional
1/2 cup orange juice
1/4 cup white sugar
Instructions: Stir together flour, baking powder, salt and nuts.  In a large bowl, beat together margarine and 1 cup sugar.  Beat in eggs one at a time.  Stir in rind and 1/2 cup juice.  Pour in flour mixture and stir until moistened.   Turn into a greased loaf pan.  Bake for 1 hour, or until done.  Remove loaf from oven, but not from pan.  Combine 1/2 cup orange juice with 1/4 cup sugar in a small saucepan.  Heat and stir to dissolve sugar.  Spoon glaze over hot loaf.  Let stand in pan for 10 minutes before removing from loaf to rack to cool.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
4 squares unsweetened chocolate
2 cups white sugar
3 eggs
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup all purpose flour
1 1/2 cups chopped walnuts
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
Instructions: Melt butter and 4 squares of unsweetened chocolate in a medium size saucepan over moderate heat.  Remove from heat.  Beat in sugar gradually with a wooden spoon until thoroughly combined. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition; stir in vanilla.  Stir in flour until thoroughly combined.  Stir in 1 cup of the walnuts.  Spread into greased 9 x 13 pan.  Combine remaining 1/2 cup walnuts with chocolate chips; sprinkle over top of brownie mixture, pressing down lightly.  Bake for 35 minutes or until done.  Cool completely in pan on wire rack.  Cut into squares

Ingredient:
1 box yellow cake mix
1 package instant vanilla pudding mix
4 eggs
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1/2 cup rum
Ingredients:
1/2 cup coarsely chopped pecans
3 tablespoons margarine
1/4 cup water
3/4 - 1 cup sugar
1/2 cup rum
Instructions:
Grease and flour one 10 inch tube pan.  Combine cake mix and pudding mix.  In another bowl beat eggs, water, oil and rum until frothy.  Add cake/pudding mixture and beat until well mixed.  Spread pecans evenly over the bottom of the prepared pan and pour batter over pecans.  Bake for 60 minutes or until done.  Allow to cool in pan for 5 minutes and remove from pan.  Place in serving dish immediately, right side up (Pecans should be on the bottom).
To Make Glaze:  During the last 15 to 20 minutes of baking time, combine margarine, water and sugar in a sauce pan and bring to boil over high heat.  Reduce heat to medium and boil rapidly until it's very thick and syrupy stirring very frequently.  The syrup mist be reduced quite a bit and very thick otherwise it will make the cake mushy.  Remove from heat and add rum.  While cake is still hot, poke holes all over top of cake with a toothpick and spoon glaze over top of cake.  Allow cake to sit at room temperature for one day then refrigerate.

Ingredient:
2 cups pasta (such as bowties, mafalda or macaroni) cooked and drained
1 cup broccoli flowerets
1 cup chopped carrots
Ingredients:
1 cup sliced celery or cucumber
1 can white tuna in water, drained, flaked
3/4 cup Miracle Whip salad dressing
1 teaspoon dill weed
1/2 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Mix all ingredients.  Refrigerate several hours or overnight.  Serve on lettuce lined platter.  Garnish with halved lemon slices.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup margarine, softened
3/4 cup peanut butter
1 1/4 cups packed brown sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 3/4 cups mini M & M's
Instructions: In a large bowl, cream margarine, peanut butter and sugar until light and fluffy.  Beat in egg and vanilla.  Combine flour, baking soda, and salt; blend into creamed mixture.  Stir in 1 1/3 cups M & M's.  Shape dough into 1 1/4 inch balls.  Place about 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.  Gently flatten to about 1/2 inch thick.  Place 7 or 8 of the remaining candies on each cookie; press lightly.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are light brown.  Do not over bake. Cool about 1 minute on cookie sheet; transfer cookies to wire racks to cool completely.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons margarine
2 tablespoons water
1 1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
2/3 cup all purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup chopped walnuts

Fudge Sauce:
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup evaporated milk
1/4 cup sugar
1 tablespoon margarine
Instructions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring sugar, margarine and water to a boil.  Remove from heat; stir in chocolate chips until  melted. In a mixing bowl, beat eggs and vanilla.  Add chocolate mixture; mix well.  Combine flour, baking soda and salt; add to chocolate mixture.   Stir in walnuts.  Pour into a greased 9 inch pie plate.  Bake for 28 to 30 minutes or until done.  Cool on a wire rack.  For fudge sauce, heat chocolate chips, milk, sugar and margarine in a microwave or double boiler until chocolate and margarine are melted; stir until smooth.  Drizzle over pie.  Cut into wedges, serve with ice cream and additional sauce.

Ingredient:
2 packages Philadelphia Cream Cheese, softened
1/2 cup sugar
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peel
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
2 eggs
1 graham cracker crumb crust
Cool Whip Whipped Topping, thawed
Lemon slices
Instructions: Mix cream cheese, sugar, juice, peel and vanilla on medium speed until well blended.  Add eggs, mix until blended.  Pour into crust.  Bake for 40 minutes or until center is almost set.  Cool.  Refrigerate 3 hours or overnight.  Garnish with Cool Whip and lemon slices.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 pounds ground beef
1 cup dry bread crumbs
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
2 eggs
1 teaspoon dried minced onion
Ingredients:
1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons cider vinegar
1/2 cup white sugar
2 teaspoons prepared mustard
Instructions:
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bread crumbs, salt, ground black pepper, eggs, onion flakes and 1/2 of the can of tomato sauce. Mix together well and place into a 5x9 inch loaf pan.  Push the meatloaf down into the pan forming a well for the sauce around all the edges.  Bake for 40 minutes.  Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, combine the remaining tomato sauce, brown sugar, vinegar, white sugar and mustard. Bring to a boil and remove from heat.

6. After meatloaf has cooked for 40 minutes, remove from oven and pour sauce over the top of the meatloaf.

7. Return to oven and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 more minutes. Let sit 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups raspberries
1 1/2 cups strawberries, sliced
1 cup blueberries
1 baked pastry shell, cooled
Ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1 1/2 cups water
1 package Jello Strawberry Flavor Gelatin Dessert
1 tub Cool Whip Whipped Topping
Instructions: Mix berries in large bowl.  Pour into pastry shell.  Mix sugar and cornstarch in medium saucepan.  Gradually stir in water until smooth.  Stirring constantly, cook on medium heat until mixture comes to boil; boil 1 minute.  Remove from heat.  Stir in gelatin until completely dissolved.  Cool to room temperature.  Pour over berries in pastry shell.  Refrigerate 3 hours or until firm.  Spread whipped topping over pie before serving.  Store leftover pie in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup orange juice or apple cider vinegar
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1/2 cup oil
1 envelope Good Seasons Oriental Sesame, Honey French, or Italian Salad Dressing Mix
Ingredients:
1 lb. Lean boneless beef sirloin, cut into strips
5 cups cut up fresh vegetables or 1 package frozen mixed vegetables, thawed
Hot cooked Rice
Instructions: Mix juice, soy sauce, oil and salad dressing mix in small bowl as directed on envelope.  Heat large skillet on medium heat.  Cook meat in 1 tablespoon of dressing mixture 8 minutes or until cooked through.  Add vegetables and remaining dressing mixture; cook and stir until vegetables are tender crisp.  Serve over rice.

Ingredient:
1 envelope unflavored gelatin
1/4 cup cold water
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup cornstarch
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 3/4 cups milk
4 egg yolks, beaten
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons margarine
1 tablespoon vanilla
4 medium firm bananas
1 cup heavy cream, whipped
1 pasty shell, baked
Juice and grated peel of 1 lemon
1/2 cup apple jelly
Instructions: Soften gelatin in cold water; set aside.  In a saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch and salt.  Blend in the milk and egg yolks; cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thickened and  bubbly, about 20 to 25 minutes.  Remove from heat; stir in softened gelatin until dissolved.   Stir in butter and vanilla.  Cover the surface of custard  with plastic wrap and chill until no longer warm.  Slice 3 bananas, fold into custard and whipped cream.  Spoon into pie shell.  Chill until set, about 4 to 5 hours.  Shortly before serving time, place lemon juice in a small bowl and slice the remaining banana into it.  Melt the jelly in a saucepan over low heat.  Drain banana; pat dry and arrange on top of pie.  Brush banana with the jelly.  Sprinkle with grated lemon peel.  Serve immediately.

Ingredient:
1 package active dry yeast
3/4 cup warm water divided
4 - 4 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1/4 cup sugar
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup warm milk
1/4 cup margarine, softened
Ingredients:
1 egg

Filling:
1/4 cup margarine, melted
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
4 teaspoons ground cinnamon
Instructions: In a large mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup warm water.  Add 2 cups of flour, sugar, salt, milk, butter, egg and remaining water; beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.  Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.  Turn onto a floured board; knead until smooth and elastic. About 6 to 8 minutes.  Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.  Punch down.  Roll in butter.  Combine brown sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter.  Let dough rest for 6 minutes.  Cut lengthwise into three 16 x 4 inch pieces.  Cut each strip into 16 4 x 1 inch pieces.  Twist and place on greased baking sheets.   Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.  Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
2 squares unsweetened chocolate
2 cups sugar
Ingredients:
1 cup light cream or evaporated milk
1.2 cup light corn syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: In a saucepan, melt butter and chocolate.  Add sugar, cream, corn syrup and vanilla.  Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Boil for 1 1/2 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Serve warm or cold over ice cream or pound cake.  Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
4 cups brown sugar
2 cups shortening
2 cups peanut butter
Ingredients:
4 eggs
4 teaspoons baking soda, mixed in a little hot water
4 cups flour
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and make into balls.  Press with fork and bake for 10 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup peanut butter
1 cup powdered milk
Ingredients: 1/2 cup honey
Instructions: Blend all ingredients together with hands.  Roll into balls the size of large marbles and refrigerate.  Optional:  Roll balls in powdered cocoa, coconut or dip into chocolate fondue

RecipeName: Peanut Butter Cups In A Pan
Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, softened
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
Ingredients:
1/2 box icing sugar (1/2 lb)
1 package chocolate chips
Instructions: Mix everything but the chocolate.  Spread in a 9 x 9 pan.  Melt chocolate chips over low heat until just melted.  Spread over the peanut butter stuff.  Cool in the fridge until it is solid.  Cut into squares.

Ingredient:
3 cups icing sugar
1 jar marshmallow cr degreesme
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 bag caramels
3 tablespoons water
1 1/2 cups chopped pecans
Instructions: In a bowl, combine sugar, marshmallow cr degreesme and vanilla.  Knead it until it's smooth.  Shape into six 4.5 x 1.25 inch logs.   Chill overnight.  Melt the caramels with the 3 tablespoons water until smooth.  Dip logs into caramel; roll in pecans.  Chill for 2 hours.  Cut into 1/3 inch slices

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups vanilla wafer crumbs
1/4 cup Bacardi dark rum
1/4 cup honey
Ingredients:
2 cups ground walnuts
Icing sugar
Instructions: Combine all ingredients, except sugar, blend thoroughly.  Shape into small balls about 1 inch in diameter.  Roll in sugar.  Store in tightly covered container.

Ingredient:
1 package (12 oz) semisweet chocolate morsels
1 jar (12 oz) crunchy peanut butter
Ingredients: 1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
Instructions: Put chocolate chips and peanut butter into a microwave safe dish.  Microwave on high 1 to 2 minutes until chips have completely melted.  Add sweetened condensed milk, stir until mixture is of a uniform consistency.   Pour into 8 x 8 inch pan lined with wax paper.  Refrigerate until firm.  Cut into 1 inch pieces.

Ingredient:
1 package graham crackers, crushed
1 lb icing sugar
3/4 cup margarine
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups peanut butter
1/2 cup margarine
1 package chocolate chips
Instructions: Melt together 3/4 cups butter and peanut butter.  In large bowl, combine crushed graham crackers and icing sugar.  Mix in the melted butter/peanut butter.  Press into a 13 x 9 inch pan.  Melt together butter and chocolate chips.  Pour over the mixture in the pan.  Refrigerate.

Ingredient:
1 lb butter
1 1/2 cups brown sugar
1 1/2 cups white sugar
1/2 cup boiling water
3 eggs
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons vanilla
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
6  1/2 cups flour
2 cups chopped pecans
Instructions: Mix butter, sugars and boiling water until smooth and well blended.  Add eggs and mix well.  Sift soda, salt and flour.  Add pecans.  Add dry ingredients to butter sugar mixture and mix well.  Divide dough into 4 portions.  Form each portion into a log about silver dollar size around.  Wrap each roll in plastic wrap.  Place rolls in heavy duty freezer bag.  Stores well up to 6 months in freezer. When ready to cook remove from freezer.  Unwrap and slice off the number of cookies needed, 1/4 inch thick each.  Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 6 to 10 minutes until edges brown.

Ingredient:
3 cups flour
2 cups sugar
1 1/4 cups cooking oil
3 eggs
1 1/2 cups milk
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
Ingredients:
1 1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
1 1/2 teaspoons almond extract
1 1/2 teaspoons butter flavoring
4 - 5 teaspoons poppy seeds
Instructions: Beat all ingredients together for 2 to 5 minutes.  Pour into two greased loaf pans.  Bake until browned and toothpick comes out clean.  At least 1 hour 15 minutes.  Loosen sides and bottom edge with dull knife and turn out of pans.  Sprinkle with icing sugar

Ingredient:
7 oz package dates
1 cup boiling water
1 teaspoon soda
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup margarine
3/4 teaspoon ginger
Ingredients:
3/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped nuts
1 egg
1 3/4 cups flour
Instructions: Chop dates and soak in boiling water and soda for 15 minutes.  Mix remaining ingredients in normal order.  Bake in loaf pan for 1.5 hours.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup mashed bananas
1/4 cup unsweetened crushed drained pineapple
3 1/2 tablespoons orange juice concentrated
1/2 cup low fat yogurt
Ingredients:
2 egg whites, lightly beaten
1/2 cup oat bran flakes
1/2 cup all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
Instructions: Spray 6 muffin cups with no stick cooking spray.  Mix first 6 ingredients in a medium size bowl and set aside until flakes are soft.  Combine flour and baking soda in a small bowl.  Add yogurt mixture.  Mix until combined.  Immediately spoon into sprayed muffin cups.  Bake about 25 minutes until golden brown or until done.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons and 1 teaspoon cornstarch
2 cups skim milk
1/2 medium size onion, minced
1 teaspoon soy sauce
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon onion powder
2 teaspoons dried parsley
1 - 2 tablespoon snipped chives
2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese
5 medium size potatoes, peeled, sliced and parboiled 10 minutes
Instructions: Spray a 1 1/2 quart baking dish with no stick cooking spray.  Combine cornstarch and a little milk in a medium size saucepan until smooth.  Add remaining ingredients except potatoes.  Cook over medium high heat, stirring constantly until smooth and thick.  Combine with parboiled potatoes in a baking dish.  Bake 35 to 40 minutes, until bubbly and browned on top.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
2 cups sugar
1 tablespoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
3/4 cup cocoa
1 cup salad oil
1 cup buttermilk
2 eggs
2 cups very hot water
Instructions: Grease and flour cake pans.  Combine all dry ingredients except cocoa in a large mixing bowl.  Add oil, buttermilk and eggs.  Mix thoroughly.  In separate bowl mix cocoa and hot water.  Stir until smooth.  Pour into mixing bowl with rest of ingredients.  Mixture will be very thin.  Pour into prepared pans.  Bake 25 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups vegetable oil
2 1/2 cups sugar
3 eggs
3 cups flour
1 teaspoon soda
3/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon, optional
1 1/2 teaspoon cloves, optional
1 1/2 teaspoon allspice, optional
3/4 teaspoon nutmeg, optional
1/2 cup buttermilk
1 1/2 cups mashed bananas
1 cup chopped nuts
1 cup coconut
Instructions: Combine and blend oil, sugar and eggs.  Sift dry ingredients.  Combine vanilla, buttermilk and bananas and add alternately to first mixture and dry ingredients.  Stir in nuts and coconut.  Bake 1 hour and 15 minutes or until done in a tube or Bundt greased pan.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups cake flour
1 2/3 cups sugar
1 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
1 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Ingredients:
3/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon cloves
2/3 cup shortening
2/3 cup buttermilk
1 1/4 cups mashed ripe banana
2 eggs
Instructions: Sift dry ingredients into large mixing bowl.  Add shortening, buttermilk and mashed bananas.  Mix until all flour is dampened.  Beat at low speed 2 minutes.  Add eggs.  Beat 1 minute.  Turn batter into three 8 or 9 inch floured cake pans.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
2 1/4 teaspoon active dry yeast
1 2/3 cups bread flour
1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
Ingredients:
1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil
3  tablespoons honey
1 1/4 cups water
Instructions: Add all ingredients in the order suggested in your bread machine manual and process on the basic bread cycle according to the manufacturer's directions.

Ingredient:
1 cup warm 2% milk (798 degrees-80 degrees)
1 egg yolk
1/2 cup canola oil
2 tablespoons honey
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
3 1/2 cups bread flour
2 1/4 teasppons active dry yeast
Ingredients:
GLAZE
1/3 cup sugar
2 tablesspons melted butter
1 tablespoon honey
1 egg white
Additional honey, optional
Instructions:
In bread machine pan place the first 8 ingrediatns in order suggested by manufacturer. Saelect dough setting (check dough after 5 minutes; add 1 - 2 tablespoons water  or flour if needed),  When cycle is completed, turn dough onto a slightly floured surface,  Punch down, cover and let rest for 10 nubutes,  Divide into 24 pieces, shape each into a ball.  Place 12 balls each into 2 greased 8 inch baking pans,  cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled about 30 minutes.

For glaze:  Combine the sugar, butter, honey and egg whites.  Drizzle over dough, Bake 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.  Brush with additional honey. If desired,

Ingredient:
1/3 cup corn syrup
1/4 cup soft margarine
1 teaspoon peppermint flavoring
Ingredients:
4 cups icing sugar
2 drops colouring
Instructions: Beat till well combined, colour, corn syrup, margarine and flavouring.  Add 2 cups icing sugar and beat well.  Stir in with spoon as much of remaining 2 cups icing sugar as needed.  Turn out on surface lightly covered with 1 cup icing sugar and knead enough to  make dough smooth.  Make into 3/4 inch balls.  Place 2 inches apart on cookie sheet lined with wax paper and flatten with fork dipped in icing sugar.   Let dry several hours.

Ingredient:
2 cups milk
2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup shortening
2 tablespoons yeast or 2 packages
3 cups flour
Ingredients:
2 eggs, slightly beaten
1/2 cup raisins
1/2 cup currents
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon mace
Approximately 3 more cups flour
Instructions: Heat milk with shortening and salt to scalding point. Remove from heat and add sugar and let cool to lukewarm.  Dissolve yeast in 1 cup warm water with a bit of sugar.  Beat yeast, milk and flour and let rise until double (about 1/2 hour).  Add eggs and remaining ingredients.  Knead and make into 2 inch balls and let rise until double.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until brown.  Glaze with corn syrup mixed with a little water and icing sugar and make crosses when cooled.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup shortening
1/2 cup sugar
2 egg yolks
1 cup light molasses
2 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon cloves
1 teaspoon ginger
1 cup boiling water
2 teaspoons baking soda
2 egg whites, stiffly beaten
Whipped cream
Instructions: Grease 9 x 13 inch pan.  Cream shortening, add sugar gradually.  Add 2 well beaten egg yolks.  Add molasses and stir.  Sift together flour, salt and spices.  Dissolve baking soda in boiling water.  Add baking soda and water mixture alternately with flour to the creamed mixture. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.  Bake for 45 minutes.  Serve hot with whipped cream.

Ingredient:
1 large jar cheese whiz
1 1/2 inch thick ham slice, cubed
1 tablespoon diced onion
Salt and Pepper to taste
1 lb. Cooked elbow macaroni
Ingredients:
1 (13 oz) can evaporated milk
1 tablespoon prepared mustard
1 small can mushrooms
1 tablespoon margarine
Instructions: Mix 1/2 cup breadcrumbs with 1 tablespoon melted margarine, set aside.  Saut degrees onions and ham cubes in margarine till the onions are transparent.  Add mushrooms.  Add cheese whiz, milk, mustard and salt and pepper to taste, slowly cook until cheese whiz is thoroughly incorporated into mixture.  Combine all the above in a greased casserole dish and top with buttered bread crumbs.  Bake 30 to 45 minutes or until hot and top is browned.

Ingredient:
3 lb. Chicken pieces, skin removed
1/2 cup mayonnaise
Ingredients: 1 1/4 cups Italian seasoned bread crumbs
Instructions:
Brush chicken on all sides with  mayonnaise.  Place bread crumbs in large plastic food bag.  Add chicken 1 piece at a time; hake to soak well.  Arrange on rack in broiler pan or on foil lined baking sheet.  Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until golden brown and tender.

Variation:  Reduce bread crumbs to 1 cup and mix in 1/4 cup grated Parmesan  cheese.  Substitute boneless chicken breast for chicken pieces.

Ingredient:
1 package active dry yeast
3 cups bread flour
1/4 cup sugar
3/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup warm milk
1/2 cup warm water
2 heaping tablespoons lard or butter
3 tablespoons white sugar
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons brown sugar
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1 tablespoon cinnamon

If you want to make sticky buns
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/4 cup melted butter
2 tablespoons corn syrup
Instructions:
Put first 7 ingredients into bread machine, select manual or dough setting.  Press go.  While waiting for dough combine the last four ingredients  After the dough is ready (1 hour and 40 minutes) take it and place on a lightly floured surface, roll or pat into a 12 x 9 rectangle.  Melt 1/3 cup of butter.  Spread butter over the flattened dough and then sprinkle evenly the sugar and cinnamon mixture over the dough.  Starting with the short side roll up the dough and pinch edge to seal.  Cut into 12 slices and place in a 13 x 9 inch pan. Cover and let rise in a warm place until double in volume (about 45 minutes).  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until light golden brown color.
For sticky buns:  Take the above and put into the pan before the cinnamon rolls.

Ingredient:
1 package active dry yeast
3 cups bread flour
1/4 cup sugar
3/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup warm milk
1/2 cup warm water
Ingredients:
2 heaping tablespoons lard or butter
1 egg yolk (reserve the white)
1 tablespoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon nutmeg
1 cup raisins and some candied fruit
1 teaspoon baking powder
Instructions: Select manual or dough setting and press go.  Add the fruit about 10 or 15 minutes later or it will disappear.  When the dough is ready pat out into a 12 x 9 inch rectangle and then break off into 12 little balls.  Place into the greased 13 x 9 inch pan and cover and let rise in a warm place until double in size (about 45 minutes).  Take the reserved egg white and add 1 teaspoon of water and mix well.  Brush the rolls and put into the oven and bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until light golden brown.  Take what is left of egg white/water mixture and add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla and some icing sugar till its thick.  Place in a small plastic bag and make your white crosses on the buns after they have cooled.

Ingredient:
1 gallon jug apple cider
1 1/2 cups brown sugar
Dash of nutmeg
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons allspice
4 sticks cinnamon
24 whole cloves
Instructions: Tie allspice and cinnamon in a cloth bag.  Simmer all ingredients 10 minutes. Serve

Ingredient:
3 egg yolks
1 cup sugar
3 tablespoons cocoa
1 tablespoon margarine
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons corn starch
1 cup boiling water
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Mix corn starch, sugar, cocoa and butter.  Add boiling water. Stir well.  Cook over water until thick.  Add vanilla to mixture.  Add to egg yolks adding a few tablespoons at a time afterwards, return to stove and cook until thick.

Ingredient:
2 cans evaporated milk
1 1/2 cups sugar
4 egg yolks
2 teaspoons vanilla
1/4 cup sugar
1 cup raisins
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon rum extract
1/2 cup pecans
6 slices toasted bread
Separate egg whites
1 block butter
1/2 teaspoon rum extract
1/8 teaspoon cream of tarter
Instructions: Heat raisins in extract with 1 tablespoon water.  Cream butter, sugar, egg yolks, vanilla and milk.  Add raisins, pecans and bread.  Bake in deep dish for 45 minutes.  Whip cold egg whites until fluffy.  Slowly add cream of tarter and sugar.  Mix in rum extract and whip until eggs are stiff.  Place egg whites over cooked custard and cook for about 5 minutes until meringue is golden brown.

Ingredient:
2 cups margarine
4 cups flour
2 teaspoons baking soda
2 cups sugar
5 cups blended oatmeal
24 oz chocolate chips
Ingredients:
2 cups brown sugar
1 teaspoon salt
1 (8 oz) Hershey bar (grated)
4 eggs
2 teaspoons baking powder
3 cups chopped nuts
2 teaspoons vanilla
Instructions: Cream the butter and sugars.  Add eggs and vanilla; mix together with flour, oatmeal, salt, baking powder and soda.  Add chocolate chips, Hershey bars  and nuts.  Roll into balls and place two inches apart on a cookie sheet.  Bake for 10 minutes.

Ingredient:
Filling:
1 cup white sugar
3 tablespoons cornstarch
4 cups rhubarb
1/2 cup water
Few drops red food coloring (optional)
Ingredients:
Base:
1 cup graham crackers
2 tablespoons sugar
4 tablespoons margarine

Toppings:
1/2 cup whipped cream
1 1/2 cups mini marshmallows
3 3/4 oz vanilla instant pudding, prepared as package directs
Instructions: Combine filling ingredients in saucepan.  Cook over medium heat until thickened.  Reduce heat and cook 2 to 3 minutes more.  Cool.  Combine base ingredients.  Press into 8 x 8 inch pan, saving 1/4 cup of crumbs for topping.  Bake for 10 minutes.  Cool.  Mix together whipped cream and marshmallows.  Layer as follows:  Chilled rhubarb on wafer base, marshmallow and whipped cream mixture, instant pudding.  Sprinkle with remaining crumbs.  Chill

Ingredient:
2 cups elbow macaroni
1 can cream of celery soup
3/4 cup milk
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped celery
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 lb. Franks cut in 1 inch pieces
1/2 cup bread crumbs
Instructions: Cook and drain macaroni.  Mix soup, milk, salt, pepper and celery and with macaroni. Stir well.   Add cheese and franks.  Pour into greased casserole dish.   Sprinkle with bread crumbs and bake for 35 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 slices white bread, cubed
2 cups cooked chicken, cut up
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped celery
1/2 cup chopped green pepper
Ingredients:
3 eggs, beaten
1/2 cup milk
1 can cream of mushroom soup
Sharp cheese, grated
Instructions: Place bread cubes in bottom greased casserole.  Add chopped ingredients, then eggs and milk.  Lay on top of 3 slices of bread.  Chill overnight.  Then pour over 1 can cream of mushroom soup, mixed with 1 can milk.  Sprinkle sharp cheese on top.  Bake for 1 hour 15 minutes.  Uncover the last 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 lb. Hamburger
1 cup chopped onion
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 cup bread crumbs
1 1/2 cups grated cheese
1 can tomato sauce
Instructions: Fry hamburger and onions until done.  Add salt, pepper and cheese.  Put in casserole dish.  Put bread crumbs on top and rest of tomato sauce on top of bread crumbs.  Bake until heated thoroughly.

Ingredient:
6 to 8 medium potatoes
1 small package cottage cheese
1 cup sour cream
2 medium onions
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups grated cheese
Paprika
Garlic Salt
Pepper and Salt
Instructions: Peel and slice thinly  potatoes.  Cook until almost done.  Drain.  Stir cottage cheese, sour cream, potatoes and onions gently together.  Add 1 cup cheese.  Mix again.  Sprinkle with garlic salt, salt and pepper.  Put in large casserole dish.  Sprinkle 1/2 cup cheese on top.  Sprinkle with paprika.  Bake for 40 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 package frozen chopped broccoli
1 can cream of mushroom soup
2 eggs
1 cup mayonnaise
1 1/2 cups grated cheddar cheese
Instructions: Cook broccoli as directed on package.  Drain.  Combine soup, eggs, mayonnaise and cheese.  Mix well.  Add broccoli.   Pour into buttered casserole dish and bake until set.

Ingredient:
2 cups milk
2 cans minced clams
2 cups cracker crumbs
4 eggs, well beaten
Ingredients:
1/4 cup minced onion
1 tablespoon minced pimento
3/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Pour milk over crackers, let stand 15 minutes.  Add other ingredients, including clam juice.  Pour into greased 2 quart casserole dish and bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1 cup macaroni
2 tablespoons flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 lb. Cheddar cheese
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons butter
1 1/2 cup milk
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup buttered bread crumbs
Instructions: Cook macaroni according to directions.  Drain.  Place in buttered casserole dish.  Melt butter in double boiler.  Add flour, salt and pepper and blend.  Add milk slowly until sauce thickens.  Cut cheese into cubes, add to sauce.  Stir constantly until cheese has melted.  Pour cheese sauce over macaroni and top with bread crumbs.  Bake for 30 minutes

Ingredient:
2 large slices ham, 1/2 inch thick
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 cup sour cream
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
Dash of pepper
8 medium potatoes, thinly sliced
1 small diced onion
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Instructions: Cut ham into 8 pieces.  Combine soup, sour cream, salt and pepper.  In a greased 3 quart casserole, alternate layers of ham, potatoes and onion with sour cream mixture.  Top with cheese.  Cover dish.  Bake for 2.5 hours.

Ingredient:
1 can pink salmon
2/3 cup bread crumbs
1 tablespoon celery
1/2 cup milk
1/4 teaspoon Tabasco sauce
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 teaspoon chopped onion
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon pepper
1 egg
2 tablespoons butter
Ingredients:
Sauce:
2 hard boiled eggs
1/4 cup butter
2 tablespoons flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1 1/4 cups milk
2 teaspoon mustard
2 tablespoons pimento
Instructions: Mix casserole ingredients and bake for 40 minutes.  Heat sauce slowly over medium stove.  Stir constantly until sauce is thickened.  Ladle sauce over individual casserole servings.

Ingredient:
1 can creamed corn
1 1/2 cup cubed ham
Ingredients:
1 cup mashed potatoes
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Instructions: Grease a 2 quart casserole dish.  Pour in creamed corn; blend in ham.  Spread mashed potatoes evenly over corn mixture.  Sprinkle cheese over top.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until casserole is completely heated and cheese is bubbly and lightly browned.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 lbs. boneless pork cut in 1" cubes
Salt and pepper
1/2 cup barbecue sauce
1/2 cup syrup from tin pineapple
Ingredients:
1/4 cup vinegar
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1 can (19 oz) pineapple chunks, drained, keeping syrup
1 green pepper cut in thin strips
Instructions: Brown meat, season to taste.  Stir in combined pineapple syrup, barbecue sauce, vinegar and cornstarch.  Cover and simmer 35 minutes.  Add pineapple and green pepper and simmer 10 minutes more. Serve over rice.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 lb. Round or sirloin steak
1/4 cup salad oil
1 cup water
1 medium onion, cut in 1/4 inch strips
1/2 teaspoon garlic salt
1/4 teaspoon ginger
Ingredients:
2 medium green pepper, cut in 3/4 inch strips
1 tablespoon cornstarch
2 teaspoons sugar
2 tablespoons soy sauce
2 medium tomatoes
Rice
Instructions:
Heat oil, cook meat in oil for 5 minutes.  Stir in water, onion, garlic salt and ginger.  Heat to boiling. Reduce heat, cover and simmer 12 to 15 minutes for round steak/5 to 8 for sirloin.  Add green pepper during last 5 minutes.  Blend cornstarch, sugar and soy sauce, stir into meat mix.  Cook, stir constantly until mix thickens and boils.  Cut tomato into 8's and place on meat.  Cover and cook on low heat about 3 minutes or till tomatoes are hot.  Serve with rice.
Double almost everything for sauce for rice except oil and meat.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons cooking oil
2 onions, diced
8 chicken legs or thighs
3 teaspoons curry powder
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1 teaspoons ginger
1 teaspoon turmeric
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon coriander
1 teaspoon cumin
4 cloves or 1 teaspoon celery salt
4 tablespoons barbecue sauce
1/4 cup vinegar
2 - 3 fresh tomatoes cut up.
Dash of Worcestershire sauce
Instructions: Heat oil in fry pan and fry onions until golden.  In a small bowl mix the spices with the vinegar until they make a paste.  Add this mixture to the onions and stir.  Fry for a few minutes.  Add barbecue sauce, Worcestershire sauce and cut up tomatoes.  Add chicken legs or thighs and spoon sauce over them.  Cover and simmer about 1 hour until chicken is done.  Serve with rice.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon shortening
1 tablespoon flour
1/8 teaspoon celery salt (optional)
3/4 cup canned tomatoes
1/2 lb. Ground beef
1/4 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon finely chopped onion
1/4 teaspoon salt
Pepper
2 medium potatoes
2 tablespoons margarine
Instructions: Wash and pare potatoes.  Cook until tender in a medium amount of boiling salted water or use leftover mashed potatoes.  Drain steam and mash potatoes.  Beat potatoes with milk and margarine until mixture is light and fluffy.  Melt fat in frying pan, add onion and meat and brown.  Drain off excess fat.  Add seasoning and flour.  Add tomatoes and cook until mixture is tender.  Pour  mixture into a greased casserole dish.  Top with mashed potato mixture.  Cover and bake for 25 minutes.  Remove cover and bake 10 minutes more or until top is golden brown.

Ingredient:
4 lb. Spareribs in 3 rib pieces
3/4 cup minced onion
1 cup ketchup
1 cup water
1 1/2 teaspoon mustard
Ingredients:
1/4 cup sugar
1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 bay leaf
1 1/2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
Instructions:
Brown spareribs and place in roasting pan.  Make barbecue sauce of remaining ingredients.  Pour half over meat, cover and baste for 2 to 3 times during baking.  Uncover during last 15 minutes of baking.  Keep remaining sauce hot and serve with spareribs.

Short ribs may be used instead of spareribs.

Ingredient:
1 lb. Cut sparerib sections
1 tablespoon flour
1 cup beef broth or consomm degrees
1/8 teaspoon thyme
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons vinegar
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1/2 bay leaf
1 clove
Instructions: Brown spareribs slowly in frying pan.  Remove spareribs and pour off all but 1 tablespoon dripping.  Stir flour into drippings, add beef broth and cook till thickened.  Add spareribs and remaining ingredients; cover and simmer 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
10 slices bacon
1 medium onion chopped
1/4 teaspoon minced garlic
1 egg
1/2 cup tomato sauce
Ingredients:
3/4 cup oatmeal
2 tablespoon sparsely
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
l lb. Ground beef
Instructions: Partially cook bacon, drain fat saving 2 tablespoons.  In reserved fat cook until tender onion and minced garlic.   In a bowl combine remaining ingredients and add onion mixture and ground beef.  Divide beef mix into 4 parts.  Place 2 slices bacon side by side on waxed paper.  Cut another piece in half crosswise.  Place the half slice at one end of bacon slices, overlapping slightly.  Pat 1/4 of meat mix evenly over bacon.  Roll up jelly roll style. Place rolls seam side down on rack in a baking dish.  Bake for 40 minutes.   This makes a lot of smoke.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons butter
1 cup Cream of Chicken Soup
1 cup celery
26 ounce can Bean Sprouts
2 onions, chopped
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cup water
1 pound hamburger
1/4 cup Soya Sauce
1 1/3 cups cooked rice
1 can Cream of Mushroom Soup
Instructions: Saute first four ingredients until well cooked.  Add cooked rice, Cream of Mushroom Soup, Cream of Chicken Soup, Bean Sprouts, water, soya sauce and mix well.  Place in 9 x 12 inch dish.  Put can crush chow mein noondles on top.  Bake for  35-45 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons oil
5 lasagna noodles
1/4 onion, finely chopped
1/2 lb. Ground beef
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon basil
2 teaspoons parsley
15 oz tomato sauce
1/4 lb. Mozzarella cheese, grated
1/2 cup cottage cheese
1 egg
1 teaspoon parsley
Instructions: Boil water in large saucepan and add oil and noodles.   Cook in frying pan onion and ground beef until brown.  Drain off fate and add salt, pepper, basil, parsley and tomato sauce.   Let simmer.  Drain water off noodles, run cold water over them, dry.  Mix together cheese, egg and parsley.  Grease pan and layer meat, lasagna, cheese.  Cook for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 eggs
1/3 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon sugar
1/8 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Beat until light and frothy eggs.  Add milk, sugar and salt and beat.   Dip bread into mixture and fry in frying pan.

Ingredient:
1 cup undiluted evaporated milk
1 cup water
1/2 - 1 teaspoon salt
1 envelope (3 oz) instant mashed potatoes crystals
1 cup (7 3/4 oz) drained, flaked salmon
Ingredients:
1/2 cup finely chopped celery
1/4 cup finely chopped onion
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1/3 cup prepared cornflake crumbs
Instructions: Heat milk, water and salt to just below boiling.  Remove from heat.   Stir in instant potato crystals with a fork. Beat until liquid is fully absorbed.  Add salmon, celery, onion, lemon juice and pepper.  Mix well.  Divide mixture into 8 heaping 1/3 cup portions and shape into 5 inch long bars.  Roll in cornflake crumbs.  Place on a buttered baking sheet.  Bake 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 cups milk
2 tablespoons butter
2 teaspoon yeast
2 teaspoons sugar
1/2 cup warm water
1 cup sugar
Ingredients:
Dash salt
Dash nutmeg
2 well beaten eggs
5 - 5 1/2 cups flour
Instructions: Scald milk and add butter, let cool, add yeast cake, sugar, eggs, flour, nutmeg, salt and let rise.  Roll out and cut, let raise again.  Fry and glaze while hot.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1 3/4 cups sugar
1 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
3/4 cup cocoa
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
3/4 cup soft shortening
1 cup milk
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
1/4 cup milk
3 eggs
Instructions: Line two 9" layer pans.  Sift flour once before measuring.  Sift together in large mixing bowl sugar, soda, baking powder, cocoa and salt.   Add shortening, milk and vanilla.  Beat on low medium speed 2 minutes.  Scrape beaters and sides of bowl.  Add 1/4 cup milk and eggs.  Beat on low medium for 2 minutes.  Pour into pans.  Bake for 35 minutes or until done.  Let cool 10 minutes on rack and remove from pan.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
2 cups sugar
3 eggs
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
3 cups flour
1/2 cup boiling water
1/2 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Cream margarine and sugar well and add eggs (one at a time), salt, baking powder and flour alternately with water, milk and vanilla.   Beat well.  Bake for 1 3/4 hours

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 cups oatmeal
1 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon soda
3/4 cup shortening
Salt
Ingredients:
Filling:
1 lb dates
1 teaspoon corn starch
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup hot water
Instructions: Mix well flour, oatmeal, sugar, soda, shortening and salt.  Put layer of crumbs in pan, pack well.  Put filling in and remainder of crumbs on top.  Filling:  Cook in double boiler until thick.  After putting in filling, cook for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup butter
2 eggs
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup raisins
Instructions: Melt butter and all remaining ingredients.  Cool.  Beat slightly and add eggs.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1/2 cup milk
2 tablespoons salad oil
Instructions: Combine milk and salad oil, add to dry ingredients stirring until just moistened.  Drop from tablespoon on bubbling stew.  Cover tightly, bring to a boil, reduce heat.  Simmer 12 to 15 minutes or until done.  (Don't lift cover)

Ingredient:
1 2/3 cups flour
3 tablespoons white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1/4 cup margarine
1/2 cup shortening
1 egg
Instructions: Blend together flour, sugar and salt.  With a pastry blender or two knives cut in until the consistency of coarse meal the margarine and shortening.  Beat slightly the egg.  With a fork, stir egg into flour mixture.  Wrap tightly in wax paper and chill.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup raspberry jam
1 egg
1 cup brown sugar
1/8 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup shredded coconut
1/4 cup melted butter
1/4 cup cherries, chopped
Instructions: Line 8 tart or muffin tins with pastry.  Spoon a heaping teaspoon of jam into each.  Beat egg, add remaining ingredients and blend.  Spoon filling into tarts.  Bake at 425 degrees for 10 minutes, reduce temperature to 350 degrees and bake until filling is set, about 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
3 egg whites
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar
6 tablespoons sugar
Instructions: Beat egg whites with vanilla and cream of tartar until soft peaks form.  Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff peaks form and all the sugar is dissolved.  Spread atop pie, sealing to edge of pastry.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until meringue is golden.  Cool.

Ingredient:
1 cup sugar
1/3 cup flour or 3 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups milk
Ingredients:
2 squares unsweetened chocolate, chopped.
3 beaten egg yolks
2 tablespoons butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: In saucepan combine sugar, flour and salt.  Gradually add milk and chocolate squares. Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture boils.  Cook 2 minutes longer.   Remove from heat.  Stir small amount of hot mixture into beaten egg yolks.  Immediately return hot mixture; cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add butter and vanilla.  Pour into cooled baked pastry shell.  Spread meringue atop pie and bake 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool

Ingredient:
3/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups milk
Ingredients:
3 beaten egg yolks
2 tablespoons butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup flaked coconut
Instructions: In saucepan combine, sugar, flour and salt.  Gradually add milk, mixing well.  Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture boils.  Cook 2 minutes longer.  Remove from heat.  Stir small amount of hot mixture into beaten egg yolks and immediately return to hot mixture; cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and add butter, vanilla and coconut.  Pour into cooled baked pastry shell.  Top with meringue; sprinkle with 1/3 cup coconut.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool.

Ingredient:
3 bananas
3/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
2 cups milk
3 beaten egg yolks
2 tablespoons butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Slice 3 bananas into cooled and baked pastry shell.   In saucepan combine sugar, flour and salt.  Gradually add milk, mixing well.  Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture boils.  Cook 2 minutes and remove from heat.   Stir small amount of hot mixture into beaten egg yolks.  Immediately return to hot mixture and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add butter and vanilla.  Pour into pastry shell.  Spread meringue and bake for 12 to 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup brown sugar
1/3 cup flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups milk
Ingredients:
3 beaten egg yolks
3 tablespoons butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: In saucepan combine sugar, flour and salt.  Gradually add milk, mixing well. Cook and stir over medium heat until the mixture boils.  Cook 2 minutes longer and remove from heat.  Stir small amount of hot mixture into beaten egg yolks.  Immediately return hot mixture; cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla.  Pour into pastry shell.  Spread meringue and bake for 12 to 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup shortening
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 eggs, beaten
1/2 cup molasses
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons ginger
1/8 teaspoon salt
3/4 teaspoon soda
1/2 cup boiling water
Instructions: Cream shortening, add sugar gradually.  Beat well.  Add eggs and molasses slowly.  Beat well, gradually add dry ingredients and boiling water quickly.  Do not over mix.  Immediately turn batter into greased  inch prepared pan.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes.  Serve with lemon sauce or whipped cream.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup sugar
1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/8 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon grated lemon rind
Ingredients:
1 cup warm water
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tablespoon butter
Instructions: Combine sugar, cornstarch, salt and lemon rind in saucepan.  Gradually add warm water, stirring constantly.  Cook over low heat for 5 minutes stirring constantly.  The sauce should be clear and slightly thickened.  Remove from heat and stir in butter and lemon juice.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup soft margarine
1/2 cup canned milk
1 cup crushed graham wafers
1 cup coconut
1/4 teaspoon salt
Vanilla
Ingredients:
Butter Icing:
1/3 cup soft margarine
3 1/2 cups icing sugar
1/4 cup milk
1 teaspoon rum flavoring
Instructions:
Mix together first 6 ingredients.  Line 9 x 9 inch pan with whole wafers.  Put filling over whole wafers.  Ice with butter icing.

Icing:  Cream butter.  Add icing sugar alternately with milk, until creamy.  Stir in rum.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1 cup margarine
2 tablespoons white sugar
Salt
1 small bottle cherries (drain & cut small)
Ingredients:
1 - 20 oz can of crushed pineapple (drain)
1/2 cup white sugar
4 tablespoons cornstarch (dissolve with pineapple juice)
1 tablespoon vanilla
2 egg whites
3 tablespoons white sugar
Instructions: Mix first 4 ingredients and pack into 9 x 12 inch pan.  Brown in oven.  In top of double boiler combine, cherries, pineapple, sugar, cornstarch and vanilla.  Cook until thick and spread on baked crust.  Beat egg whites until very stiff and add white sugar beating again.  Spread egg mixture over second mixture and sprinkle with coconut and brown.

Ingredient:
1 - 6 oz package butterscotch chips
1/2 cup margarine
Ingredients:
1/2 cup peanut butter
1 bag miniature marshmallows
Instructions: Melt and cool first three ingredients.  Add marshmallows and pour into baking dish.

Ingredient:
Bottom layer:
3/4 cup margarine. melted
1/4 cup white sugar
1/3 cup cocoa
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 egg
2 cups graham wafer crumbs
1/2 cup coconut
Ingredients:
Filling:
1/4 cup butter
2 teaspoons vanilla instant pudding mix
2 teaspoons milk
2 cups sifted icing sugar

Topping:
3 oz semi sweet chocolate
1 tablespoon butter
Instructions: Cream 1/4 cup butter, pudding mix, milk and icing sugar.  Spread over crumb mixture and chill.  Mix chocolate and butter and spread on chilled mixture.  Chill again and cut into squares.

Ingredient:
3 (8 oz.) packages cream cheese
1 cup sugar
5 whole eggs
1 1/2 teaspoon. vanilla or lemon flavoring
Ingredients:
1 cup sour cream
1/2 cup sugar
1/4 teaspoon vanilla
Red currant jelly
Instructions: Cream sugar and cream cheese. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well, about 10 or 15 minutes. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla. Pour mixture into foil baking cups which have paper separators (about 3/4 full). Bake for 40 minutes.  Cheesecakes will rise, but will not brown. Take out of oven and cool for 5 minutes. A hole will form in center of each cheesecake. Combine sour cream, 1/2 cup sugar and 1/4 teaspoon vanilla and put about one or two teaspoons of topping into the hole that forms. Add 1 teaspoon of jelly on top of the topping. Return to oven and bake for another 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 (8 oz.) packages cream cheese
3/4 cup sugar
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 Tablespoon lemon juice
Instructions: Blend all ingredients. Use muffin papers to line muffin cups. Place vanilla wafer in bottom of each cup. Divide mixture to make 24 cheesecakes. Bake for 15 minutes.  When cool, top with choice of pie filling. (One can will do 24 cakes.)

Ingredient:
2 packages  (8 oz.) cream cheese
3/4 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon  vanilla
24 vanilla wafers
1 tablespoon  lemon juice
Ingredients:
Cranberry Glaze:
1 (16 oz.) can whole-berry cranberry sauce
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1 tablespoon  cold water
Red food coloring
Instructions:
Beat cream cheese, sugar, eggs, lemon juice and vanilla until light and fluffy. Line muffin tins with 24 cupcake papers. Place a vanilla wafer in the bottom of each. Fill cups two-thirds full with cheese mixture. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until set. Top each with one tablespoon
cranberry glaze. Chill.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup graham cracker crumbs
4 teaspoons butter or margarine, melted
2 eggs
1/2 cup low fat cottage cheese
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons sugar
2 tablespoons  all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon. finely shredded lemon peel
4 teaspoons. lemon juice
Instructions: Combine graham cracker crumbs and butter. Press mixture firmly onto bottom and all the way up the sides of 4 fluted tart pans or 3/4-inch up the sides of 4 muffin cups. In a small mixer bowl or blender container combine the eggs, cottage cheese, sugar, flour, lemon peel and lemon juice. Beat on medium speed of an electric mixer until well combined. Divide cheese mixture evenly among crusts.  Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until center appears set. Cool slightly. Cover with clear plastic wrap or  waxed paper. Chill at least 2 hours.

Ingredient:
1 (8 oz.) package cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup vanilla yogurt
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1/2 cup heavy cream
6 graham cracker tart shells
Assorted fresh fruits (any canned fruit, drained or 2 Tbsp. fruit pie filling may be substituted)
Instructions: In large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in yogurt and vanilla until smooth and well blended. In chilled bowl, with chilled beaters, beat cream until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cream cheese mixture. Spoon 1/3 cup of the whipped cream mixture into each tart shell. Garnish with fruit. Chill until serving time.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups flour
1/3 teaspoon salt
4 oz. almond paste
1 (1/4 lb.) stick butter
1/2 cup sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon Vanilla
Ingredients:
Chocolate Cream Cheese Filling:
4 (3 oz.) package cream cheese
3/4 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup chocolate coating (3 oz. chocolate pieces and 1 Tbsp. oil melted in double boiler)
Instructions:
Sift flour and salt onto wax paper. Crumble almond paste thoroughly with fingers into a large bowl to eliminate any lumps before adding other ingredients. Add butter; mix with hands until thoroughly blended and smooth. Beat in sugar, eggs and vanilla with electric mixer on medium, until light and fluffy. Add flour mixture, 1/3 at a time, beating well after each addition. Wrap in plastic wrap; chill at least 1 hour.  Form cold dough into 1-inch balls. Press balls of dough
into very well greased tiny muffin pan cups (1 3/4 inches),  pressing against bottom and side with fingers to form cups, keeping dough slightly below rim (will rise some in baking).  Put 2 teaspoons Chocolate Cream Cheese Filling in each cup.  Top with candied cherry half if desired. Bake for 10  minutes or until firm and lightly golden around edge. Remove from oven; loosen with small knife; remove from pan to wire rack; cool.

Frosting:
Beat softened cream cheese and sugar in a medium size bowl until smooth and fluffy. Stir in eggs, vanilla and chocolate coating; blend well. Refrigerate until ready to use.

Ingredient:
3 (8 oz. each) package cream cheese
1 cup sugar
5 eggs
1 1/2 teaspoons. vanilla
Ingredients:
1 cup sour cream
1/2 cup sugar
1 can cherry pie filling
1 teaspoon lemon juice
Instructions: Cream together cream cheese and 1 cup sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla. Pour into paper lined cupcake tins. Bake for 25 minutes. Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes. Mix sour cream and sugar by hand. Top each cake with one teaspoon of mixture. Return to oven for 5 minutes. When ready to serve, top with pie filling mixed with lemon juice.

Ingredient:
1 (4 - 5 lb) Oven Roast
1 tablespoon minced garlic or 1 teaspoon garlic powder
Ingredients: 1 tablespoon coarsely ground pepper
Instructions:
Place roast fat side up on rack in roasting pan without lid.  Rub with garlic cloves and sprinkle with pepper or use variations.  Insert meat thermometer into center of roast.  Add 1 1/2 cups water to pan and place roast in preheated oven 500 degrees.  After 30 minutes reduce oven temperature to 275 degrees.  Cook an additional 1 1/4 - 1 3/4 hours until medium done.

Barbecue Roast:  Combine 1/4 cup each strong coffee and barbecue sauce with 1 teaspoon minced garlic; brush on roast before and during roasting.

Teriyaki Roast:  Combine 1/4 cup each sherry and soy sauce with 1 tablespoon dry mustard; brush on roast before and during roasting.

Cranberry Roast:  Combine 1 can jellied cranberry sauce, 2 chopped green onions, 1/4 cup soy sauce, 1 teaspoon ginger.  Heat and spread on roast.  Reserve extra and serve heated with roast.

Ingredient:
3 cups tri-colour fusilli or shell pasta - uncooked
1 1/2 cups cooked roast beef - cut in thin strips
15 cherry tomatoes - cut in half
1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
Ingredients:
1 small red onion - finely chopped
1 english cucumber - sliced
3/4 cup bottled Greek or Italian salad dressing
Instructions: Cook pasta according to package; drain.  Toss with remaining ingredients in a large bowl.

Ingredient:
3 cups cooked roast beef - cut into thin strips
1 can pineapple tidbits - undrained
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1 teaspoon dry mustard
1 pouch onion soup mix
Instructions: Lightly brown beef in oiled skillet for 2 minutes.  Combine remaining ingredients, add to beef and mix thoroughly. Simmer for 20 minutes, covered.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspon salt
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Ingredients:
1 cup gratd carrot
1/2 cup whole cranberry sauce
1 cup sugar
2/3 cup oil
2 eggs
1/2 cup sifted icing sugar
1 tablespoon light cream
Instructions: Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, nutmeg and cinnmon.  Add carrots, cranberry sauce, sugar, oil and eggs; beat until well blended.  Pour into greased 9 x 9 pan.  Bake for 40 to 45 minutes.  When cool, combine icing sugar and cream and drizzle over the cake.

Ingredient:
6 large eggs
1/2 cup sugar
4 cups milk
2 teaspoons vanilla
Ingredients:
1/2 cup brandy (optional)
2 cups whipping cream
Ground nutmeg
Instructions: In a large heavy saucepan, beat eggs and sugar until well blended.  Gradually stir in milk.  Cook over medium-low heat, stirring constantly until mixture is thick enough to coat a spoon, about 25 minutes.  Pour custard into a large bowl.  Stir in vanilla and brandy.  Chill bowl in ice water for a few minutes, stirring occasionally.  Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours or overnight.   To serve, beat whipping cream until soft peaks form.  Gently fold whipped cream into custard.  Sprinkle lightly with  nutmeg. Either keep eggnog refrigerated or place bowl on a bed of ice.  Serve within 2 hours

Ingredient:
12 hard cooked eggs, peeled
1/4 cup mayonnaise
2 teaspoons dijonnaise creamy mustard
Pinch of salt and pepper

Herbed Eggs:  To half of stuffing add:
1 tablespoon minced fresh chives
1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley
Pinch of dried tarragon
Pinch of garlic powder.
Garnish with cherry tomato wedges
Ingredients:
Smoked Salmon Devils:  To half of stuffing add:
1/4 cup mashed smoked salmon
2 teaspoons minced capers
Minced dill to taste
Lemon juice to taste

Eggs with Shrimp:  To half of stuffing add:
1/4 cup mashed cooked shrimp
1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley
Drained horseradish to taste
Lemon juice to taste
Garnish with mayonnaise, small cooked shrimp
Instructions: Cut eggs in half lengthwise.  Remove yolks.  With fork, mash yolks, add mayonnaise, dijonnaise, salt and pepper.  Divide amount in half.  To each half, add the ingredients for one of the variations above.  Refill whites with yolk mixture and garnish as directed.  Serve immediately or store, covered in refrigerator.  Use within 3 days.

Ingredient:
5 cups medium farfalle, bows or spiral shaped pasta
1/2 cup sun dried tomatoes
1/2 cup green pepper, diced
1/2 cup yellow pepper, diced
1/2 cup chopped onion or green onions
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley or basil
5 hard cooked eggs, chopped
1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, cut in half (optional)
Ingredients:
Vinaigrette:
1/2 cup Corn oil
1/4 cup red wine vinegar
1 clove garlic, minced
Pinch of sugar
Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: Cook past according to package directions.  Rinse under cold water.  Drain thoroughly and place in a large bowl.  If using dry packed tomatoes, soak in hot water 1 minutes, drain and past dry.  Chop tomatoes coarsely, add to past.  Add peppers, onion and parsley.  Combine ingredients for vinaigrette, in a screw top jar.  Shake well.  Toss pasta mixture with 1/4 cup vinaigrette.  Add eggs and toss carefully.  Cover tightly, refrigerate both salad and remaining vinaigrette at least 1 hour.   Just before serving, add cherry tomatoes, toss with remaining vinaigrette.

Ingredient:
2 packages regular or light cream cheese, softened
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup cornstarch
3 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla
Ingredients:
2 cans (10 oz) mandarin orange sections, drained
1 cup liquid (mandarin syrup plus orange juice)
1/4 cup sugar
4 teaspoons cornstarch
Graham Crumb crust
Instructions: In blender or food processor combine cheese, 3/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cornstarch, eggs and vanilla.  Drain one can of mandarin sections; add 1/2 cup syrup to cream cheese mixture.  Blend 1 minute or until smooth, scraping down sides once.  Chop drained mandarin sections, stir into filling.  Pour into crust.  Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until set.  Turn oven off, open door slightly and let cheesecake cool in the oven for 1 hour.  Remove to a wire rack and cool completely.  Remove sides of pan.  Drain remaining can of orange sections.  Add enough orange juice to syrup to make 1 cup of liquid.  In a small saucepan, combine 1/4 cup sugar, 4 teaspoon cornstarch and syrup and juice mixture.  Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.  Simmer 2 minutes.  Spoon half of the mixture over top of cake.  Arrange orange sections on top a nd spoon remaining mixture on top.  Refrigerate at least 4 hours.

Ingredient:
1 cup graham cracker crumbs
3 tablespoons sugar
Ingredients: 1/4 cup melted margarine.
Instructions: Spray sides of an 8 1/2 inch spring form pan with cooking spray. Combine all ingredients.  Press on bottom of pan.  Refrigerate.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/2 cup margarine
5 squares semi-sweet chocolate
3/4 cup sugar
3 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup all purpose flour
1 cup chopped walnuts
Ingredients:
Chocolate Glaze:
3 squares semi sweet chocolate
1 tablespoon margarine
2 tablespoons corn syrup
1 teaspoon milk

1 square white chocolate, melted
Instructions:
Spray an 9 inch square pan with cooking spray.  In a  large saucepan, bring corn syrup and butter to a boil, stirring occasionally, remove from heat.  Add semi-sweet chocolate stir until melted.  Add sugar.  Stir in eggs, one at a time, then vanilla, flour and nuts.  Pour into pan.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes, or until done.   Cool completely on rack.  Prepare glaze; spread on top of brownies.  Drizzle with white chocolate.  Let stand until set.  Cut into squares.

Chocolate glaze:  In a small saucepan melt chocolate, margarine over low heat stirring often.  Remove from heat.  Stir in corn syrup and milk.

Ingredient:
1 can sockeye salmon, drained & mashed
1/2 cup Miracle Whip Salad dressing
1/2 cup light sour cream
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill or 2 teaspoons dried dill weed
2 teaspoons lemon juice
1 green onion, chopped
Instructions: Stir together all ingredients and chill.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup Miracle Whip salad dressing
1/2 cup sour cream
Ingredients:
1 can crushed pineapple
2 green onions, chopped
2 teaspoons curry powder
Instructions: Stir ingredients together and chill.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup Miracle Whip salad dressing
1/3 cup plain yogurt
2/3 cup Greek Salad Crumbled Feta Cheese
Ingredients:
1 clove garlic, minced
1/2 English cucumber, diced
Cucumber sticks and cherry tomatoes
Instructions: Stir together salad dressing, yogurt, cheese and garlic.  Chill.  Add cucumber just before serving; serve with cucumber sticks and cherry tomatoes.

Ingredient:
3 cups hot cooked broccoli spears
2 cups cubed, cooked chicken
1 can condensed cream of broccoli soup
1/3 cup milk
Ingredients:
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
3 tablespoons dry bread crumbs
1 tablespoon margarine, melted
Instructions: Arrange broccoli and chicken in 9 inch pie plate or 2 quart shallow baking dish.  Combine soup and milk; pour over broccoli and chicken.  Sprinkle mixture with cheese.  Mix bread crumbs with margarine and sprinkle over cheese layer.  Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.  If desired, serve with rice.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1  lb. Boneless beef sirloin or inside round steak, cut in strips
1 medium green pepper, cut in strips
1 medium onion, diced
1 can condensed tomato soup
Ingredients:
1/4 cup orange juice
2 tablespoon Soya sauce
1 tablespoon vinegar
1 teaspoon garlic powder
4 cups hot cooked rice
Instructions: Heat half the oil at medium high in large skillet.  Add beef and stir fry until cooked through.  Reduce heat to medium.  Set beef aside.  Add remaining oil.  Add pepper and onion and cook  until tender crisp.  Stir in mixture of soup, orange juice, Soya sauce, vinegar and garlic powder.  Return beef to skillet.  Heat through, stirring occasionally.  Serve over rice.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 lb. Boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut in chunks
1 can condensed cream of celery soup
Ingredients:
2 1/4 cups water
2 cups fresh cut up or frozen vegetable mixture
1/2 teaspoon dried basil leaves
2 cups uncooked rotini pasta
Instructions: Heat oil at medium high in large skillet.  Add chicken and stir fry until cooked through.  Stir in mixture of soup, water, vegetables and basil, heat to a boil, stirring often.  Stir in pasta.  Cook at medium low heat, until pasta is tender, stirring often, about 15 minutes.  Serve with grated parmesan cheese if desired.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 lb. Boneless beef sirloin or inside round steak, cut in strips
2 cups sliced mushrooms
1 medium onion, diced
Ingredients:
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1/2 cup water
2 tablespoons Dijon style mustard
4 cups hot cooked rice
Instructions: Heat half of the oil in large skillet over medium high heat.  Add beef and brown until cooked through.  Set beef aside.  Reduce heat to medium.  Add remaining oil.  Add mushrooms and onion and stir fry until tender.  Stir in mixture of soup, water and mustard.  Heat to a boil.  Return beef to skillet and heat through.  Serve with rice if desired.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
1 can condensed cream of mushroom & onion or cream of mushroom soup
2 teaspoons paprika
Ingredients:
1/2 medium red pepper, cut in strips
2 cups hot cooked broccoli florets
1/3 cup sour cream or plain yogurt
4 cups hot cooked egg noodles
Instructions: Heat oil at medium high in large skillet.  Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides.  Set chicken aside.  Reduce heat to medium.  Add soup, paprika and red pepper strips to skillet.  Heat to a boil, stirring occasionally.  Return chicken to skillet; add broccoli.  Reduce heat to low.  Simmer, covered, until c chicken is cooked through, about 5 minutes.  Stir in sour cream and heat through.  Serve with noodles.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1/2 cup chopped red or green pepper
1/2 cup chopped celery
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1/3 cup milk
Ingredients:
2 cups cubed, cooked chicken
1 cup frozen green peas
Dash pepper
4 cups hot cooked rice or pasta
Instructions: Heat oil at medium high in large skillet.  Add pepper and celery and stir fry until tender crisp.  Reduce heat to medium.  Stir in mixture of soup and milk.  Add chicken, peas and pepper.  Heat through, stirring occasionally.  Serve over rice or pasta.

Ingredient:
1 teaspoon plus 2 tablespoons butter, divided
24 ounces Baker's white baking chocolate, coarsely chopped
Ingredients:
1 cup sweetened condensed milk
1/2 cup chopped pecans, toasted
1/3 cup Kahlua (coffee liqueur)
Instructions: Line a 9-in. square pan with foil; grease foil with 1 teaspoon butter. In a large heavy saucepan, cook and stir white chocolate over low heat until melted. Add milk and remaining butter; stir until blended. Remove from heat; stir in pecans and Kahlua.  Spread into prepared pan. Refrigerate, covered, 2 hours or until firm. Remove foil; cut fudge into 1-in. squares. Store between layers of waxed paper in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 lb. Boneless beef sirloin or inside round steak, cut in strips
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 1/2 cups frozen green peas
Ingredients:
1 large onion, chopped
1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
3/4 cup sour cream
1/8 teaspoon pepper
4 cups hot cooked egg  noodles
Instructions: Heat oil at medium high in large skillet.  Add beef and cook until browned and cooked through.  Add onions and stir fry  until tender.  Reduce heat to medium.  Combine soup, peas and Worcestershire sauce and add to skillet.  Heat to a boil. Simmer, covered about 5 minutes.  Reduce heat to low.  Stir in sour cream and pepper.  Heat through.  Serve with noodles.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoon vegetable oil
8 mini red skinned potatoes, thinly sliced
1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast halves, cut in strips
1 can condensed cream of broccoli soup
Ingredients:
1/2 cup milk
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
2 cups fresh or frozen broccoli florets
1/3 cup grated parmesan cheese
Instructions: Heat oil at medium high in  large skillet.  Add potatoes slices and stir fry  until tender crisp.  Add chicken and continue to stir fry until chicken is browned on all sides.  Reduce heat to medium.  Stir in mixture of soup, milk and garlic powder.  Arrange broccoli on top; heat to a boil.  Simmer, covered over low heat until chicken is cooked through and broccoli is tender, about 5 minutes.  Stir in parmesan cheese.

Ingredient:
1 can condensed cheddar cheese soup
1/2 soup can milk
Dash pepper
4 cups hot cooked elbow macaroni
Ingredients:
1 medium tomato, chopped
1 green onion, sliced
3 tablespoons dry bread crumbs
2 tablespoons margarine, melted
Instructions: Combine soup, milk and pepper in baking dish.  Stir in macaroni, tomato and green onion.  Mix bread crumbs with margarine and sprinkle over macaroni mixture.  Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 tablespoon chili powder
4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 large red or green pepper, cut in strips
Ingredients:
1 can condensed fiesta tomato or tomato soup
1 cup corn niblets
1/4 cup shredded cheddar or Monterey jack cheese
4 cups hot cooked rice
Instructions: Mix flour and chili powder.  Coat chicken with four mixture.  Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat.  Add chicken and cook until browned on both sides.  Set chicken aside.  Drain fat.  Stir in mixture of pepper strips, soup and corn; heat to a boil. Return chicken to skillet.  Reduce heat to low.  Simmer, covered, until chicken is cooked through about 5 minutes.  Sprinkle with cheese and serve with rice.

Ingredient:
4 pork chops
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
Ingredients:
1/2 cup water
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Instructions: Brown pork chops in oil in skillet.  Add soup mixed with water and garlic powder.  Cover and simmer until pork chops are cooked through.

Ingredient:
4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Ingredients:
1 can condensed cream of broccoli soup
1/2 cup water
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Instructions: Brown chicken in oil in skillet.  Add soup mixed with water and lemon juice.  Cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through.  Bone in chicken may be substituted but allow 5 - 10 minutes to cook.

Ingredient:
4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 can cream of chicken soup
Ingredients:
1/2 cup water
3 tablespoons Dijon style mustard
1 tablespoon honey
Instructions: Brown chicken in oil in skillet.  Add soup mixed with water, mustard and honey.  Cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through

Ingredient:
Easy Herbed Rice:
Substitute Chicken Broth for the water when cooking rice.  During the simmering time, add your favorite fresh or dried herbs, such as oregano, thyme or parsley.

Mushroom Rice:
Cook rice with chicken or beef broth instead of water.  Stiry fry fresh sliced mushrooms in a saucepan.  Add to simmering rice at the end of cook time.
Ingredients:
Savoury Rice Pilaf:

cook rice in chicken or beef broth, instead of water.  D During the last 10 minutes of the simmering time, add fresh or frozen sliced vegetables.

Ingredient:
CRUST
2 cups ROBIN HOOD Best For Blending Flour
1/2 cup sugar
3/4 cup margarine
Ingredients:
TOPPING
4  eggs
1 cup sugar
1 cup corn syrup
1/4 cup margarine, melted
1 package (300 g) butterscotch chips
1 1/3 cups pecans, coarsely chopped
Instructions:
Crust:
Combine all ingredients, mixing until crumbly.  Press firmly into 13" x 9" (33 x 23 cm) cake pan sprayed with a non-stick spray.  Bake at  for 15-18 minutes, or until light golden.

Topping:
Beat eggs, sugar, corn syrup and margarine together until blended. Stir in butterscotch chips and pecans. Pour evenly over crust. Bake about 30 minutes longer, or until set and golden. Cool completely on wire rack. Cut into bars.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup corn syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
3 cups rolled oats
1/2 cup semi sweet chocolate chips
1/4 cup creamy peanut butter
Instructions: Cream margarine, brown sugar, corn syrup and vanilla in large bowl at medium speed until smooth.  Stir in oats, mixing thoroughly.  Press firmly in 8 inch square pan.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly golden and is done.  Cool 5 minutes.  Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly on top.  Drop small spoonfuls of peanut butter over chips.  Let stand 5 minutes to soften.  Swirl chocolate and peanut butter together to marble.  Cool completely then chill 15 minutes to set topping before cutting.

Ingredient:
Brownie Layer:
3/4 cup margarine
6 squares semi sweet chocolate
1 tablespoon instant coffee powder
3/4 cup all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
2 eggs
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
Ingredients:
Cheesecake Layer:
1 package cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup white sugar
2 eggs
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
2 tablespoons strong coffee or coffee liqueur

Sour Cream Layer:
1 1/2 cups sour cream
3 tablespoons white sugar
Chocolate covered coffee beans, optional
Instructions:
Brownie Layer:
Melt margarine and chocolate together until smooth.  Stir in coffee; cool.  Combine flour and baking powder.  Beat eggs and sugar until blended.  Stir in chocolate and flour mixture.  Mix well.  Spread in greased 13 x 9 inch pan.  Chill 10 minutes.

Cheesecake Layer:
Beat cream cheese, sugar and eggs until creamy.  Gradually add flour and coffee, beating until smooth.   Spread over brownie layer.  Bake for 2 minutes or until done.

Sour Cream Layer:
Combine sour cream and sugar.  Spread over cheese layer.  Bake 10 minutes longer.   Cool completely; cut into small squares.  Decorate with coffee bean.

Can be frozen.

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose flour
1/2 cup corn starch
1/2 cup icing sugar
3/4 cup butter, softened
2 squares bittersweet chocolate, coarsely grated
3 squares bittersweet chocolate, cut into large chunks
Ingredients:
Cashew Shortbread:
3/4 cup cashews, chopped

Pistachio Cranberry Shortbread:
3/4 cup pistachios, chopped
1/2 cup dried cranberries
Instructions:
Combine flour, corn starch and icing sugar in large bowl.  With large spoon blend in butter and grated chocolate thoroughly.  Work with hands until soft, smooth dough forms.  Shape into 1 inch balls.  Place on ungreased baking sheet.  Flatten slightly with lightly floured bottom of glass or roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness.  Cut into shapes with cookie cutters.  Press a chocolate chunk into center of each cookie.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until edges are slightly browned.  Remove from sheet, cool completely.

Cashew Shortbread:
Omit chocolate.  Add cashews to dough.  Top each cookie with a small cashew half.

Pistachio Cranberry Shortbread:
Omit chocolate.  Add pistachios and cranberries to dough.  Press balls with floured fork or roll dough to 1/4 inch thickness.

Can freeze

Ingredient:
Crust:
1 cup all purpose flour
1/4 cup white sugar
1/3 cup margarine
Ingredients:
