Topping:
2 eggs
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 cup corn syrup
2 tablespoons margarine, melted
1 cup semi sweet chocolate chips
3/4 cup chopped walnuts
Instructions:
Crust:
Combine all ingredients mixing until crumbly.  Press firmly into greased 9 inch pan.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until light golden.

Topping:
Beat eggs, sugar, syrup and margarine together until blended.   Stir in chocolate chips and nuts.  Pour evenly over crust.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes longer or until set and golden.  Cool completely on wire rack.  Cut into bars.

Can freeze

Ingredient:
1 2/3 cups all purpose flour
1/2 cup white sugar
2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon ginger
6 tablespoons margarine
Ingredients:
1 cup milk
1 2/3 cups coarsely chopped peaches or 1 can sliced peaches

Topping:
2 tablespoons white sugar
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Instructions:
Combine first 5 dry ingredients in large bowl.  Cut in margarine with pastry blender until crumbly.  Add milk and peaches, stirring just until blended.  Spoon into greased muffin cups.  Sprinkle with topping mixture of sugar and cinnamon.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until done.  Peaches can be replaced with fresh strawberries.
Can freeze

Ingredient:
1 3/4 cups all purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
Ingredients:
1 egg
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup raspberry jam
1/2 cup flaked coconut
1/3 cup finely chopped pecans or walnuts
Instructions:
Combine flour, baking powder and salt.  Cream margarine, sugar, egg and vanilla together thoroughly.  Add dry ingredients, mixing well. Work with hands to a smooth dough.  Roll dough between 2 sheets of wax paper, lightly dusted with flour to a 12 x 9 inch rectangle.  Combine jam, coconut and nuts.  Spread evenly over dough leaving a 1/2 inch border.  Roll up tightly, jelly roll fashion, using wax paper to help, starting from long side.  Press edge to seal and shape into a roll.  Wrap in plastic wrap.  Chill overnight.  Cut into 1/4 inch thick slices.  Place on greased baking sheet.  Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden.
Roll can be frozen before baking.  Cookies can also be frozen after baking.

Ingredient:
Cake:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
3 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups all purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups sour cream
Ingredients:
2 cups chopped fresh cranberries
1/4 cup white sugar

Topping:
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 tablespoon margarine
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/3 cup chopped almonds
Instructions:
Cake:
Cream margarine, sugar, eggs and vanilla until light.  Combine flour, baking powder, soda and salt.  Add to creamed mixture alternately with sour cream mixing lightly after each addition.  Combine cranberries and 1/4 cup sugar.  Spread half of batter into greased 10 inch springform pan.  Sprinkle with cranberries.  Spread remaining batter on top.  Combine topping ingredients sprinkle over batter.  Bake for 50 to 55 minutes or until  done.  If using frozen cranberries, thaw and pat dry with paper towel.
Can freeze

Ingredient:
Fruit:
5 cups peeled, thinly sliced apples
1 cup cranberries
1 cup raspberries, fresh or frozen
3/4 cup white sugar
1/4 cup all purpose flour
1/3 cup water
Ingredients:
Topping:
1 3/4 cups all purpose flour
2 tablespoons white sugar
4 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup milk
Instructions:
Fruit:
Combine all ingredients.  Mix well. Turn into 9 inch square baking dish.
Topping:
Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Cut in margarine with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal.  Add milk, all at once.  Stir with fork until all ingredients are moistened.  Drop spoonfuls of batter over fruit, covering surface.  Place pan on a piece of aluminum foil to catch any drops that boil over.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until top is golden.  Serve warm.

Ingredient:
1 envelope  Pie Crust Mix
3/4 cup sugar 1
1/4 cup  All Purpose Flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
Ingredients:
4 cups peeled apples, sliced
2 cups peaches, fresh or canned (drained), sliced
1 cup cranberries
1 tablespoon lemon juice
2 tablespoons butter
Instructions:
Prepare pastry according to package directions for two-crust pie.  Roll out bottom crust and fit into 9" (23 cm) pie plate.  Mix sugar, flour and spices.  Combine sugar mixture with fruits and lemon juice. Mix well.   Fill bottom crust with fruit mixture. Dot with butter. Place top pastry crust over filling. Seal and flute edge. Slash top crust for steam to escape.  Place pie on a piece of aluminum foil to catch any drips.  Bake on lower oven rack at 450 degreesF  for 15 minutes, then reduce temperature to 350 degreesF  and bake 35 to 40 minutes longer, or until fruit is tender and crust is golden.
Can freeze

RecipeName: Banana Cake With Cream Cheese Icing
Ingredient:
CAKE:
2 cups  all purpose flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups sugar
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1/4 cup buttermilk or sour milk
Ingredients:
1 cup ripe bananas, mashed
2  eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/4 cup buttermilk or sour milk

FROSTING
2 packages (250 g each) cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup butter or margarine
2 cups icing sugar, sifted
Instructions:
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in large mixer bowl.  Add sugar, butter, 1/4 cup buttermilk and banana. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.   Add eggs, vanilla and 1/4 cup buttermilk. Beat on medium speed for 1 minute. Spread batter evenly in two greased 9" round cake pans.   Bake at  for 30 to 40 minutes or until done. Cool 10 minutes, then remove from pans and cool completely.

FROSTING:
Beat cream cheese and butter together on medium speed of electric mixer. Add icing sugar, beating until smooth.  Fill and frost cake layers.

Ingredient:
1 cup  All Purpose Flour
1/2 cup corn starch
1/2 cup icing sugar
Ingredients:
3/4 cup hazelnuts, finely chopped
3/4 cup butter, softened
Instructions:
Combine flour, corn starch, icing sugar and nuts in a large bowl.   With large spoon, blend in butter. Work with hands until soft, smooth dough forms.  Shape dough into a smooth roll about 1 1/2" (4 cm) in diameter.   Wrap and chill until firm (about 4 hours or overnight). Store rolls in refrigerator for up to 1 month.   Cut with sharp knife into thin slices. Place on ungreased baking sheet.   Bake at  for 8 to 12 minutes, or until edges are lightly browned.  Remove from sheet and cool complete.   Can freeze

VARIATION:
Cherry Pecan Shortbread: Omit hazelnuts. Mix dough until smooth then mix in 3/4 cup (175 mL) chopped candied cherries and 1/2 cup (125 mL) chopped pecans until evenly distributed.

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose or cake and pastry flour
1 1/2 cups icing sugar
12 large egg whites, at room temperature
1 1/2 teaspoons cream of tartar
Ingredients:
1 cup white sugar
2 teaspoons vanilla
4 squares bittersweet chocolate, grated
2 squares bittersweet chocolate, melted and cooled
1 cup fresh raspberries (optional)
Instructions: Sift flour and icing sugar together into a bowl, set aside.  Beat egg whites on medium speed until frothy.  Add cream of tartar and beat on high speed, adding sugar gradually, until whites are glossy and stiff.  Add vanilla and mix until just blended.  Fold flour mixture into egg whites, using a large rubber spatual.  Fold in grated chocolate and raspberries.  Pour batter into ungreased tube pan.  Bake for 50 to 55 minutes or until done.  Remove pan from oven and invert.   Cool cake completely.  Turn cake right side up and runknife between cake and side and center of the pan to loosen it.  Invert cake onto serving plate.  Drizzle melted chocolate on top and sides of cake to decorate..  Can freeze undecorated.

RecipeName: White Chocolate and Almond Carmel  Bars
Ingredient:
2 cups all purpose flour
2 cups rolled oats
1 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 cup margarine, melted
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups white chocolate chips
1 cup slivered almonds
1 cup skor toffee bits
1 1/3 cups caramel sundae sauce
1/3 cup all purpose flour
Instructions: Combine first 4 dry ingredients in mixing bowl.  Add melted margarine.  Mix well.  Reserve 1 cup of crumbly mixture.  Press remainder in greased 13 x 9 inch pan.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.  Combine chips, almonds and toffee bits.  Sprinkle evenly over base.  Mix sundae sauce and 1/3 cup flour until smooth.  Pour evenly over base.  Sprinkle reserved oat mixture on top.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes longer or until golden.  Cool completely before cutting into bars.  Can freeze.

Ingredient:
Crust:
1 cup all purpose flour
1 1/4 cups packed brown sugar
3/4 cup rolled oats
2 tablespoons grated lemon rind
1/2 cup butter, softened
Ingredients:
Filling:
3 packages Philadelphia cream cheese, regular or light, softened
3/4 cup white sugar
3 eggs
2 cups berries (strawberries and blueberries) fresh or thawed and well drained frozen may be used
Instructions:
Crust:
Mix flour, brown sugar, oats and lemon rind; cut in butter until mixture is crumbly.  Press into bottom of 9 inch spring form pan.  Bake for 30  minutes.  Cool for 10 minutes.  (Crumb mixture will be starting to harden).  In pan crush warm mixture into small chunks using a fork; reserve 1 cup.  Press remaining mixture onto the bottom and 1 inch up sides of pan.

Filling:
Beat cream cheese and sugar until very smooth.  Beat in eggs, one at a time, just until blended.  Pour over crumb crust.  Place fruit on top of cheese filling and sprinkle reserved crumb mixture on top.  Bake 60 to 70 minutes or until set.  Remove from oven and run knife around sides of pan to loosen.  Cool on wire rack at room temperature.  Chill overnight

Ingredient:
Brownie Base:
4 squares unsweetened chocolate
3/4 cup butter
2 cups white sugar
3 eggs
1 cup all purpose flour
Ingredients:
Mocha Layer:
2 tablespoons instant coffee granules
1/4 cup hot water
2 tablespoons custard powder
1/2 cup butter, softened
4 cups icing sugar, sifted

Garnish:
2 squares semi sweet chocolate, melted
Instructions:
Brownie Base:
Melt chocolate and butter over low heat or in microwave on medium power for 2 minutes until butter is melted.  Stir until completely smooth.  Stir in sugar and eggs.  Mix well.   Stir in flour until smooth.  Spread in a greased foil line 13 x 9 inch cake pan.  Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until done.  Do not over bake.  Cool in pan.

Mocha Layer:
Dissolve coffee granules in hot water.  Add remaining ingredients and beat until smooth.  Spread over cooled brownie layer.  Drizzle with melted chocolate to garnish.  Let chocolate set, then cut into bars.
Can freeze without drizzle

Ingredient:
1 lb. Medium ground beef
1 jar Uncle Ben's Cacciatore Sauce
1/2 package broad egg noodles
Ingredients:
2 cups mozzarella cheese, grated
1/3 cup sour cream
1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, grated
Instructions: Brown meat in skillet, drain off fat.  Stir in sauce and simmer uncovered for 10 minutes.  Cook noodles according to package directions; drain.  Combine mozzarella cheese and sour cream.  In greased 8 cup casserole spread half the noodles.  Tip with cheese mixture, then half the meat, the remaining noodles and remaining meat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.   Bake, covered for 30 minutes or until bubbly, removing cover for last 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 lb. Medium ground beef
1 jar Uncle Ben's Cacciatore Sauce
1 tablespoon chili powder
6 to 8 flour tortillas
Ingredients:
2 cups shredded lettuce
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
Sour cream, optional
Instructions: Brown meat in skillet; drain off fat.  Stir in sauce and chili powder.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Warm tortillas as directed on package.  Divide mixture among tortillas, leaving a 1 inch border at each end.  Top with lettuce and cheese.  Fold edges over filling.  Garnish with sour cream if desired.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 lb medium ground beef
1 jar Uncle Ben's Country Chicken Sauce
1/3 cup dry bread crumbs
1 egg, lightly beaten
1 small onion, minced
Ingredients:
1 tablespoons chopped parsley
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon dried sage
2 tablespoons butter
3 cups sliced mushrooms
Instructions: Combine meat, 1/4 sauce, crumbs, egg, onion, parsley, pepper and sage.  Pack into 9 x 5 loaf pan.  Bake for 1 hour.   Meanwhile melt butter over medium heat.  Saut degrees mushrooms until lightly browned.  Stir in remaining sauce and heat through.  Cut meat loaf in slices and serve with mushroom sauce.

Ingredient:
1 egg
1/4 cup fine dry bread crumbs
1/4 cup milk
2 tablespoons minced onion
1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper
1 lb medium ground beef
1 jar Uncle Ben's Sweet and Sour Sauce
Rice, cooked
Instructions: Combine egg, bread crumbs, milk, onion, parsley, salt, pepper and meat; mix well.  Form into walnut sized balls.  Brown meatballs, drain off fat.  Add sauce, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.  Serve on rice.

Ingredient:
3 lb chicken wings
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 jar Uncle Ben's Teriyaki Sauce
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons liquid honey
3 cloves garlic, crushed
Instructions: Remove tips from wings.  Fry wings for 3 to 4 minutes in oil until browned.  Drain on paper towel.  Mix together remaining ingredients.  Place wings on a foil lined baking pan.  Pour sauce evenly over wings.  Bake for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 pork chops
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
Pepper
1 jar Uncle Ben's Oriental Sauce
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/4 teaspoon allspice or cloves
1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1 cup coarsely chopped green apple (skin on)
Instructions: Trim fat from chops and cut edges in several places. Heat oil over medium heat.  Add chops and brown both sides, sprinkling with pepper.  Drain off fat.  Add remaining ingredients, except apples.  Cover and simmer for 45 minutes.  Turn chops and add apples, covering with sauce.  Cover and simmer another 25 to 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 cups sweetened flaked coconut
1 cup dried apricots, finely chopped
Ingredients: 2/3 cup sweetened condensed milk
Instructions: Grease cookie sheet.  Mix all ingredients until well blended.  Roll rounded teaspoonfuls into balls.  Place 1 inch apart on cookie sheet.  Bake 12 minutes or until set.  Remove to wire rack to cool.  Store in airtight containers up to 2 weeks.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups all purpose flour
1 cup rolled oats
1 1/3 cups finely cut up gumdrops, no black
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup margarine, at room temperature
1 cup packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 large egg
Instructions: Lightly grease cookie sheet.  In a large bowl, mix flour, oats, 1 cup of the gumdrops, the baking powder, baking soda and salt until blended.  In another large bowl, beat margarine, sugar and vanilla until fluffy.  Beat in egg until blended.  With mixer on low speed, gradually beat in flour mixture just until blended.  With floured hands, roll slightly rounded teaspoonfuls of dough into 3/4 inch balls.  Place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart.  Decorate tops with remaining 1/3 cup cut up gumdrops.  Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.  Store airtight up to 2 weeks or freeze.

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose flour
1 cup pecans
1/2 cup margarine, at room temperature
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons white sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
Icing sugar for decoration
Instructions: Have ungreased cookie sheet ready.  Process flour and pecans in a food processor or blender until nuts are very finely chopped.  Beat butter, sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until pale and fluffy.  With mixer on low speed gradually beat in flour mixture just until blended.  Roll level tablespoonfuls dough into balls. Place about 1 inch apart on cookie sheet.   Bake 45 minutes or until golden.  While war, roll in icing sugar.  Place on wire rack to cool completely, then roll in icing sugar again.  Store airtight up to 2 weeks or freeze.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, at room temperature
3/4 cup sour cream, at room temperature
1 egg yolk
2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
Ingredients:
Filling:
3/4 cup white sugar
3/4 cup walnuts or hazelnuts, coarsely chopped
1 teaspoon cinnamon
Instructions:
Beat butter, sour cream and egg yolk in a large bowl until smooth.  With mixer on low speed, gradually bet in flour until blended.  Divide dough into fourths.  Wrap each separately and chill 1 hour or until firm enough to roll.

Filling:
Process sugar, nuts and cinnamon in food processor or blender until  nuts are very finely chopped.  On a lightly floured surface, roll out 1 piece of dough at a time (keep remaining refrigerated) to an 11 inch circle.  Sprinkle with 1/4 of the filling.  Using a pizza wheel or small knife, cut circle into 16 wedges.  Using a small metal spatula, carefully slide out 1 wedge.  Roll up from wide edge to point of triangle. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and curve into a crescent shape.  Repeat with remaining wedges and remaining pieces of dough.  Bake 25 minutes orjust until golden.  Remove to wire rack to cool.  Store airtight at room temperature up to 2 weeks or freeze.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine, at room temperature
1 cup white sugar
2 large eggs, yolks, separated from whites
2 teaspoons freshly grated lemon peel
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
2 1/3 cups all purpose flour
3/4 cup pistachio nuts or pecans, finely chopped
1/2 cup preserves, such as raspberry or apricot
Instructions: Lightly grease cookie sheet.  Beat margarine and sugar in large bowl until pale and fluffy.  Beat in egg yolks, lemon peel and lemon juice until blended.  With mixer on low gradually beat in flour just until blended.  If necessary, refrigerate dough until firm enough to handle.  Beat egg whites with a fork in a shallow bowl until foamy.  Place chopped nuts on waxed paper.  Shape rounded teaspoonfuls dough into 1 inch balls.  Dip in egg whites, then roll in nuts to coat.  Place 1 inch apart on cookie sheet.  Make a deep indent in the top of each ball.  Bake 15 to 18 minutes.  Remove to wire rack to cool.  Store airtight up to 3 weeks or freeze.  Shortly before serving fill indents with preserves

Ingredient:
2 beaten eggs
1 1/2 cups canned pumpkin
1 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon cloves
1/4 teaspoon ginger
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
Ingredients:
1 large can undiluted Carnation Evaporated Milk

Praline Topping:
2 tablespoons melted margarine
1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1/2 cup chopped pecans
Instructions:
Combine eggs, pumpkin, sugar, salt and spices.  Gradually stir in evaporated milk.  Pour into unbaked pie shell.  Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes then reduce to 350 degrees and continue baking for 40 minutes.   Cool.  Just before serving top with Praline topping.

Praline topping:
Combine all ingredients.  Sprinkle evenly over pie. Place under broiler until top is bubbly about 1 minute.  Serve immediately.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons flour
3/4 cup white sugar
1/8 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
4 cup cherries, pitted
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Instructions: Mix first three ingredients and spread 1/4 of the mixture on bottom of pie crust.  Add cherries and sprinkle rest of flour mixture on top of cherries.  Sprinkle lemon juice on top.  Flute top crust and bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
6 cups vinegar
3 cups white sugar
Ingredients:
4 cups water
Pickling spice
Instructions: Boil above mixture putting pickling spice in bag, for 10 minutes.  Sterilize jars and pack cooked beets in jars.  Pour vinegar over beets and seal.

Ingredient:
4 strips bacon, diced
1 1/2 cups cream style canned corn
1 1/2 cups boiling water
1 cup diced raw potatoes
Ingredients:
1/2 cup onions, chopped
2 cups milk
2 drops Tabasco
Instructions: Saut degrees onions and bacon until onions are transparent.  Add potatoes, salt and boiling water to onion mixture.  Cover and cook until the potatoes are soft.  Add milk and corn and simmer slowly for a few minutes.  Serve piping hot with crackers.

Ingredient:
3/4 lb lean pork cut into strips
2 teaspoons vegetable oil

Sauce:
1 cup apple cider/juice
1 tablespoon soy sauce
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1 teaspoon ginger
1/2 teaspoon cornstarch
Ingredients:
Vegetables:
1 medium red onion, cut in wedges
1 stalk celery, sliced
1 cup red cabbage, thinly sliced
2 cups sliced green vegetables
3 red cooking apples, cored and cut in wedges
Instructions: Combine sauce ingredients, stir well and set aside.  Heat oil in large heavy skillet over high heat; brown pork strips 1 - 2 minutes.  Add onions and celery and cook while stirring about 1 - 2 minutes. Add cabbage and green vegetables, cook and stir 2 minutes.  Stir in apples and sauce. Bring sauce to a boil; reduce heat to medium.  Cook 2 - 3 minutes until sauce thickens.  Do  not overcook.  Serve immediately over rice or noodles.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 lb trimmed, boneless pork loin chops cut into thin strips
1 clove garlic, minced
1 cup thinly sliced carrots
Ingredients:
1 cup sliced green beans
1 1/2 cups water
1/2 cup orange juice
1 package Lipton Noodles & Sauce Butter & Herb
Instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.  Add pork strips and stir fry quickly for 2 - 3 minutes.  Add garlic and stir fry with pork for 2 minutes.  Add carrots, green beans, water, orange juice and noodles & sauce.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to medium low and simmer uncovered for 7 minutes.  Sprinkle with almonds and orange sections if desired.  Cover and let stand 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 boneless pork loin chops
2 tablespoons flour
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/2 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons vegetable oil
2 teaspoons freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/4 cup chicken stock
Lipton Pasta Sauce Fettucine Alfredo
Instructions: Trim pork chops well.  Mix together flour, thyme and pepper.  Coat chops with mixture.  Heat oil in a non stick skillet over medium high heat.  Saut degrees chops 3 - 5 minutes per side until brown.  Reduce heat to medium low.  Add lemon juice and chicken stock scraping up brown bits.  Turn chops once and remove.  Spoon sauce over chops.  Prepare Lipton Pasta and Sauce Fettucine Alfredo according to package directions.

Ingredient:
4 cups soft bread crumbs
1/2 cup melted margarine
1/8 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon poultry seasoning
2 tablespoons minced onion
Instructions: Mix ingredients together lightly with a fork.

Ingredient:
3 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
Ingredients: Coatings: Finely chopped toasted nuts, flaked coconut, chocolate sprinkles, colored sprinkles, unsweetened cocoa, confectioners' sugar or colored sugars
Instructions:
In large saucepan, over low heat, melt chocolate chips with Eagle Brnad. Remove from heat; stir in vanilla.  Pour into medium bowl. Cover and chill 2 to 3 hours or until firm.  Shape into 1-inch balls; roll in desired coating and/or decorate with frosting and candies. Chill 1 hour or until firm. Store leftovers covered in refrigerator.

Notes: Tip: Place individual chocolate truffles into gold/silver foil candy wrappers or arrange on a tray for a decadent dessert presentation. Or serve individual truffles with a cup of coffee after dinner as a mini chocolate treat

Other Ideas: Truffles make a great homemade gift to give to friends and co-workers to simply say "thank you." Arrange several decorated truffles in a pretty box or other tin/basket lined with colorful wax or gift paper. Wrap with a bow. Note: re-usable tins are a nice keepsake after the truffles are gone.

Ingredient:
Thin Sauce:
1 cup milk
1 tablespoon oil
1 tablespoon flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon pepper

Medium:
1 cup milk
2 tablespoons flour
2 tablespoons oil
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
Thick:
1 cup  milk
3 tablespoons flour
3 tablespoons oil
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Melt fat over low heat.  Remove pan from heat and add flour and seasonings.  Stir.  Add milk slowly and stirring constantly.  Cook until sauce is thickened.  Continue cooking until all taste of raw starch is gone.

Ingredient:
2 eggs
3 tablespoons margarine
Pinch of salt
Ingredients:
4 slices of bread
1/2 cup milk
Instructions: Beat eggs, salt and milk lightly until well blended. Heat frying pan and melt butter.  Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture and fry until golden brown on both sides.  Serve at once with syrup or sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup margarine
40 large marshmallows or 3 cups miniature
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
5 - 6 cups Rice Krispies
Instructions: Melt margarine in saucepan.  Add marshmallows and cook over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture and marshmallows are well blended.  Remove from heat and stir in vanilla.  Add rice krispies and stir until coated with marshmallow mixture.  Press into buttered 13 x 9 inch pan.  Cut into squares when cool.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup undiluted Carnation Evaporated Milk
1 2/3 cups sugar
2 cups miniature marshmallows
Ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1 1/2 cups semi sweet chocolate chips
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Combine milk and sugar in saucepan; heat to boiling.  Cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add marshmallows, nuts, chocolate chips and vanilla.  Stir until marshmallows melt.  Pour into buttered 8 or 9 inch pan.  Cool.  Cut in squares.

Ingredient:
3 tablespoons oil
1 cup chopped onions
1 clove crushed garlic
1/2 cup chopped green pepper
3 tablespoons finely chopped chili pepper or hot red pepper
1 cup chopped celery
Ingredients:
1 - 3 teaspoons chili powder
1 teaspoon tomatoes paste
1 lb ground beef
1 can whole tomatoes
1 can kidney beans
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Heat oil in large frying pan.  Add next five ingredients.  Cook, stirring for five minutes.  Add chili powder and tomato paste.  Cook for 2 minutes.  Add ground beef and cook until browned.  Add tomatoes and kidney beans and seasoning.  Stir till boiling. Reduce heat.  Cover and simmer for 45 minutes.  Stir occasionally.

Ingredient:
3 cups all- purpose flour
1 Tablespoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon nutmeg
1 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup sugar
3 large eggs
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons vanilla
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup butter, melted
1/2 Tablespoon orange extract
1/3 cup orange juice
3 cups blueberries, fresh or frozen
1 cup chopped nuts (walnuts/ pecans
Instructions: Combine the flour, baking soda, nutmeg, sugar, and salt. Using a wooden spoon, beat eggs, milk, vanilla, melted butter, orange extract and orange juice.  Pour into the dry ingredients and stir until flour is thoroughly moistened. Add the blueberries and the nuts. Stir thoroughly but gently. Pour into a well buttered mini loaf pans and set aside for fifteen minutes. Bake  for about 45 minutes or until the loaves test done.  Makes 4 mini loaves or one very large loaf. Remember, if you do the large loaf the cooking will be a lot longer (around an hour and a quarter)

Ingredient: 1 package (8 oz) chocolate chips
Ingredients: 1/2 lb peanuts
Instructions: Melt chocolate chips over low heat.  Remove from heat and add peanuts.  Stir well and drop by teaspoonful onto waxed paper.  Chill in the refrigerator

Ingredient:
3 cups diced fruit
1/3 teaspoon flour
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 tablespoon flour
1/2 cup sugar
1 tablespoon water
Ingredients:
Topping:
6 tablespoons flour (3/4 cup = 12 tbsp)
1/2 cup brown sugar
6 tablespoons margarine
1/2 cup rolled oats
Instructions: In greased casserole dish combine first 6 ingredients.  Cream flour, margarine and sugar.  Stir in rolled oats.  Sprinkle over fruit.  Bake for 40 minutes or until fruit is tender and top is brown.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup cocoa
1/2 cup boiling water
2/3 cup shortening
1 3/4 cups sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 eggs
Ingredients:
2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 1/3 cups buttermilk or sour milk (To sour milk us 4 teaspoons vinegar plus milk equal to 1 1/3 cups)
Instructions: Stir together cocoa and boiling water in small bowl until smooth; set aside.  Cream shortening, sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl until light and fluffy.  Add eggs; beat well.  Combine flour, baking soda and salt;  add alternately with buttermilk to creamed mixture.  Blend in cocoa mixture.  Pour into three greased and floured 8 or two 9 inch layer pans.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until done.  Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans.  Cool completely; frost as desired.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup shortening
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons milk
2 1/4 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
Vanilla
1 cup chopped nuts (optional)
1 cup chopped dates
1/2 cup chopped cherries
Instructions: Roll in a ball, flatten, put cherry on top and bake for 12 to 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons cooking oil
1 lb hamburger
3 tablespoons Soya sauce
Salt and pepper
1 cup onions
2 cups celery
Ingredients:
1 green pepper
1 can mushroom soup
1 can bean sprouts
1/4 cup bean sprout juice
1 can chow mien noodles
Instructions: Brown first 4 ingredients in frying pan, leaving juice.  Put in casserole.  Fry onions, celery and green pepper.  When soft, put in casserole with soup, bean sprouts and juice.   Cover with Chow Mien Noodles

Ingredient:
1 lb ground beef
2 onions, chopped
1 cup chopped celery
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 can cream of mushroom soup
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cans water
1/2 cup uncooked minute rice
1/4 cup Soya sauce
Pepper
Chinese noodles
Instructions: Grease casserole dish with butter.  Brown Hamburg with onions and celery.  Add remaining ingredients and bake for 30 minutes.  Add Chinese noodles on top and bake another 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 lb Hamburg
1 green pepper
1 onion
1 teaspoon thyme
1 can mushrooms
Ingredients:
1 can tomatoes
1 medium bottle spaghetti sauce
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 package egg noodles, cooked
Instructions: Simmer above ingredients.  Fold in egg noodles. Put in casserole.  Cover with grated mozzarella cheese and bake for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
Crust:
2 cups all purpose flour
1/3 cup white sugar
2/3 cup margarine, softened

Filling:
6 squares semi sweet chocolate
1 1/2 cups corn syrup
1 1/2 cups white sugar
4 eggs, slightly beaten
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
2 1/4 cups chopped pecans
Ingredients:
Drizzle:
2 squares semi sweet chocolate
Instructions:
Crust:
Combine flour, sugar and margarine in large bowl.  Beat on medium speed until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Press firmly and evenly into greased 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan.  Bake for 15 minutes.

Filling:
Heat chocolate and corn syrup in saucepan over low heat, stirring until smoothly melted.  Remove from heat.  Stir in sugar, eggs and vanilla until blended.  Stir in pecans.  Pour filling over hot crust; spread evenly.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until filling is firm around edges and slightly soft in centre.  Cool in pan on rack.

Drizzle:
Melt chocolate over hot water or in microwave on medium for 2 to 30 minutes.  Drizzle on top.  Cool.

Ingredient:
2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 cup sugar
Pinch of Salt
Pinch of nutmeg
Pinch of ginger
1/2 cup orange juice
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons butter, melted
4 tablespoons water
1 egg, beaten
4 oz. Cranberries
4 oz. Hazelnuts, chopped
1 tablespoon icing sugar
Instructions: Sift together the dry ingredients and make a well in the center.  Add the orange juice, butter, water and egg.  Beat until the flour is all incorporated.  Stir in the cranberries and nuts.  Grease and line loaf pan. Spoon in the mixture and bake for 1 hour or until done.  Remove from pan, peel of the paper and dust with icing sugar.  Slice and serve warm or cold with butter or cream cheese.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup sugar
6 cups water
Ingredients:
Salt
Raisins
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and cook on stove.  Pour into pie shell and bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1 package (1 pound) fresh peeled baby carrots
2 tablespoons butter
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon dried dillweed
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
Instructions:
Place the carrots in a medium saucepan and cover with water; bring to a boil over high heat. Boil for about 10 minutes, or until tender (see Note).   Drain the carrots then return them to the pan. Add the remaining ingredients and cook over low heat until the butter is melted and the carrots are evenly coated.
NOTE: The cooking time may vary, depending upon the size and age of the carrots.

Ingredient:
1 cup unsweetened pineapple juice
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
Ingredients:
1/3 cup light soy sauce
2 pounds chicken breast tenders, raw
Instructions: In a small saucepan over medium heat, mix pineapple juice, brown sugar and soy sauce. Remove from heat just before the mixture comes to a boil.  Place chicken tenders in a medium bowl. Cover with juice mixture, and marinate in the refrigerator at least 30 minutes.  . Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat, and lightly oil grate. Thread chicken onto wooden skewers.  Grill chicken tenders about 5 minutes per side, until no longer pink and juices run clear. They cook quickly, so watch them closely.

Ingredient:
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
7 ounces seasoned bread crumbs
6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
12 ounces pasta sauce
6 slices Monterey Jack cheese
Instructions: Pour beaten eggs into a shallow dish or bowl. In another shallow dish or bowl, mix together the grated Parmesan cheese and bread crumbs. Dip chicken breasts into beaten egg, then into bread crumb mixture to coat.  In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add coated chicken and saute for about 8 to 10 minutes each side, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.    Pour tomato sauce into a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Add chicken, then place a slice of Monterey Jack cheese over each breast, and bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is completely melted.

Ingredient:
3 tablespoons Dijon mustard
2 tablespoons honey
2 tablespoons dried tarragon
2 teaspoons dried basil
2 teaspoons dried thyme
1/8 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
4 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
1 cup white wine
Instructions: In a small bowl, blend Dijon mustard and honey. Mix in the tarragon, basil, thyme, salt, and pepper.  Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place chicken in the skillet, and brush on both sides with the Dijon mustard mixture. Pour 1/4 cup wine around the chicken. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer about 10 minutes, until liquid is reduced.  Pour another 1/4 cup wine around the chicken, and continue to cook about 5 minutes, until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear. Remove from heat, reserving remaining liquid.   Mix remaining wine into the skillet. Increase heat to medium, and scrape up browned bits. Cook and stir until liquid is reduced by about 1/3. Serve as a sauce over the chicken.

Ingredient:
1 pound linguini pasta
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1 pinch cayenne pepper
1/2 teaspoon onion powder
1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper
4 tablespoons butter
1/2 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 cup heavy cream
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 cloves garlic, chopped
4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into cubes
3/4 cup white wine
1 pound medium shrimp - peeled and deveined
Instructions:
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add linguini pasta and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente; drain.  In a small bowl, combine nutmeg, cayenne pepper, onion powder and pepper; set aside.
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, melt butter and add 1/2 of the spice mixture, milk and cream. Heat until sauce thickens; set aside.  In a large skillet over medium heat, warm olive oil and add garlic, chicken, wine and remaining spice; cook until chicken is no longer pink. Remove chicken from pan and cook shrimp.  Deglaze pan by adding some wine and heating it for 2 to 3 minutes; add the cream sauce and reheat if needed. Pour sauce over hot linguine and add chicken mixture and shrimp.

Ingredient:
1 3/4 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup shortening
1 egg
Ingredients:
1 teaspon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 tespoon nutmeg
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup applesauce
Instructions: Grease and flour 9 inch pan.  Combine all ingredients and pour into prepared pan.  Bake for 40 minutes or until done.  Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Ingredient:
6 cups apples
1 1/4 teaspoons cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1 cup sugar
3/4 cup milk
1/2 cup Bisquick Baking Mix
2 eggs
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons margarine

Streusel:
1 cup bisquick
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
3 tablespoon margarine
Instructions:
Grease pie plate.  Mix apples and spices; turn into pie plate.  Beat remaining ingredients until smooth.  Pour into plate.  Sprinkle with streusel.  Bake 55 to 60  minutes.

Streusel:
Mix ingredients and sprinkle on top of pie.

Ingredient:
12 oz medium pasta shells
6 3/4 cups broccoli florets
1 lb Velveeta cheese
1/4 cup milk
1 1/4 teaspoons paprika
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon dry mustard
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon turmeric
1/2 cup cheddar cheese, shredded
1/2 cup packaged croutons, preferably butter and garlic flavored, coarsely crushed
Instructions: In large pot cook pasta according to package directions, adding broccoli during last 3 minutes of cooking time; drain.  In same pot over medium low melt Velveeta with milk.  Stir in paprika, garlic powder, dry mustard, pepper and turmeric until blended.  Slowly stir in Cheddar; cook, stirring constantly, until cheese is completely melted. Remove from heat.  Stir in pasta and broccoli.  Transfer to serving dish.  Sprinkle with croutons.

Ingredient:
12 - 14 large cukes, peeled, seeded and diced
4 cups onions, chopped fine
1/2 cup salt
4 cups vinegar
Ingredients:
5 cups sugar
1 cup flour
1 teaspoon celery seed
1 teaspoon mustard seed
1 teaspoon turmeric
Instructions: Combine first 3 ingredients and let stand overnight.  Put pan on to heat in the morning.  When heated, drain and add to the remainder of the ingredients.  Boil all together for 10 minutes, then put in sterilized bottles.

Ingredient:
12 cucumbers
3 onions
4 cups vinegar
Ingredients:
6 teaspoons dry mustard
2 teaspoons turmeric
4 cups white sugar
1 cup flour
Instructions: Cut cucumbers and onions in desired sizes, sprinkle with salt and let stand overnight.  Cook remainder of the ingredients in the morning until clear and drain vegetables.  Add vegetables to mixture and simmer 3 minutes and put in sterilized bottles.

Ingredient:
4 quarts cucumbers
6 medium onions
1/3 cup salt
1 tablespoon alum
Ingredients:
5 cups white sugar
3 cups vinegar
7 teaspoons mustard seed
1 1/2 teaspoons celery seed
1 1/2 teaspoons turmeric
Instructions: Cut cucumbers and onion in desired sizes.   Soak for 4 hours in cold water with remaining ingredients, then drain.  Boil remainder of ingredients 5 minutes and pour over cucumber and onions for 2 more minutes.  Place in sterilized bottles.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
3 teaspoons baking powder
4 tablespoon sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
2 eggs
4 tablespoons shortening
1 cup milk
1 cup blueberries
Instructions: Drench blueberries with flour.  Sift dry ingredients; add beaten eggs to milk and melted shortening and stir in easily the blueberries. Bake for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 quarts cukes, cut in pieces
1 quart onions, sliced or diced
1/2 cup pickling salt
Ingredients:
2 quarts vinegar
6 - 7 cups white sugar
Pickling spice
Instructions: Put vegetables in large pot or enamel pan and cover with cold water and salt.   Let stand overnight.  In morning put on the stove and warm through.  Do not boil.  Remove and drain well.   Boil together the remainder of the ingredients placing picking spice in bag.  Just before removing from heat fill in air tight jars.

Ingredient:
1 cup cold milk
1 tablespoon corn starch
2 tablespoons margarine
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
Pinch nutmeg (optional)
Ingredients:
Lemon Herb Sauce:
1 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs or 1/4 teaspoon dried herbs such as dill, basil or parsley
1 tablespoon lemon juice

Cheese Sauce:
1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
Instructions:
In small saucepan gradually add milk into corn starch until smooth.  Add margarine, salt, pepper and nutmeg.  Stirring constantly, bring to boil over medium heat, boil 1 minute to thicken.

Cheese Sauce:
Add cheese into prepared sauce until melted.  Serve over broccoli, cauliflower or baked potatoes.

Lemon Herb Sauce:
Stir in herbs and lemon juice into prepared sauce.  Serve over cooked vegetables, poultry or seafood.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon light brown sugar
1 teaspoon chili powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
1 roasting chicken, 5 - 7 lb.
Instructions: In small bowl combine sugar, chili powder, salt, cumin, garlic powder and oregano.  Rub spice mixture evenly over chicken; place on wire rack set in roasting pan.  Roast, basting occasionally with pan juices, until done.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
2 cups all purpose flour
1 egg yolk, beaten
1/2 sour cream
Ingredients:
Filling:
1/2 cup apricot jam
1/2 cup angel flake coconut
1/4 cup finely chopped pecans
Sugar
Instructions: Cut margarine into flour until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Combine egg yolk and sour cream; blend into flour mixture.  Chill dough several hours or overnight.  Divide dough into four equal portions, keeping each part refrigerated until ready to use.  Roll each part into a 10 inch circle on lightly floured surface.  Spread with 2 tablespoons filling.  Cut circule into 12 wedges.  Starting from wide end, roll each wedge into a crescent.  Sprinkle with sugar.  Place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool on rack.  Repeat with remaining pastry.

Ingredient:
4 squares unsweetened chocolate
3 tablespoons margarine
3 cups icing sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/3 cup hot milk
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 1/2 cups miniature marshmallows
1 cup chopped walnuts
1/2 cup miniature chocolate chips
Instructions:
Microwave:  In a large microwaveable bowl, melt unsweetened chocolate and margarine on medium for 3 to 4 minutes; stir until smooth.  Add icing sugar, salt, milk and vanilla; mix well.  Fold in marshmallows, nuts and chocolate chips.  Spread in waxed paper line 9 x 5 loaf pan.  Chill until firm.

Stove Top:  Melt chocolate and margarine in a saucepan over medium heat; stir until smooth.  Continue as directed above.

Ingredient:
1 package Jello Butterscotch Pudding and Pie Filling
3/4 cup margarine
3/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 egg
Ingredients:
2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
3 teaspoons ginger
1 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
Instructions: Cream Jello pudding and pie filling mix with margarine and sugar.  Add egg and blend well.  Combine flour, baking soda, ginger and cinnamon; blend into pudding mixture.  Chill dough until firm, about 5 to 10 minutes.  Roll on a floured board about 1/4 inch thickness and cut with cookie cutter.  Place on greased baking sheet and use a straw to make a hole in the top of the cookie for hanging on the tree.   Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.  Remove from oven and cool on wire rack.  Decorate as desired.

Ingredient:
Base:
1 cup salt purpose flour
1/4 cup sugar
2 teaspoons instant coffee granules
1/2 cup margarine
Topping:
1/3 cup all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon instant coffee granules
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
3 eggs
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 teaspoon almond extract
1 1/2 cups sliced blanched almonds
Instructions:
Base:
Combine flour, sugar, coffee.  Cut in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into an 8 inch square pan.  Bake for 20 minutes.

Topping:
Sift together flour, baking powder, coffee, salt and cinnamon; set aside.  Beat eggs well.  Gradually add sugar, almond extract and flour mixture; blend.  Stir in almonds.  Spread over base.  Bake for 25 minutes.  Cool on wire rack and cut into bars.

Ingredient: 3 containers Magic Moments Vanilla Pudding (142 g each)
Ingredients:
3 tablespoons sherry or light rum
2 tablespoons milk
Instructions: Combine pudding, sherry and milk in a microwaveable bowl.  (Use extra milk to thin pudding to a pourable consistency).  Warm on medium power 2 minutes to blend flavours and heat through.  Serve warm over plum pudding, fruitcake or gingerbread cake.

Ingredient:
Crust:
1 1/2 cups graham wafer crumbs
1/4 cup butter, melted
1/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar

Filling:
4 packages Philadelphia Cream Cheese, softened
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups sugar
5 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla
2 teaspoons lemon juice

Topping:
1 1/4 cups sugar
1/3 cup water
1 cup whipping cream
1/2 cup butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions:
Crust:
Combine crust ingredients; press mixture onto bottom and 1 inch up sides of 9 inch spring form pan.  Chill.

Filling:
In a large bowl using beat cream cheese and sugar until very smooth.  Beat in eggs, one at a time, until just blended.  Beat in remaining ingredients.  Pour into pan.  B ake for 60 minutes or until centre is just set.  Remove from oven and run knife around sides of pan.  Cool (cheesecake will fall slightly in centre)

Topping:
Heat sugar and water in saucepan over low heat, stirring until sugar dissolves. Increase heat and boil without stirring until mixture is a rich caramel colour, occasionally swirling and washing down sides of pan with brush dipped in cold water, about 8 to 10 minutes.  Reduce heat to low; add whipping cream.  Mixture will bubble up. Stir until smooth.  Mix in butter and vanilla.  Cool slightly.  Pour 2/3 cup caramel sauce into centre of cake, spreading evenly.  Chill cake at least 2 hours before serving.  If desired, garnish with whipped cream and pieces of caramel candy bars.  Serve remaining sauce with cake

Ingredient:
6 squares semi sweet chocolate
1/4 cup margarine
Ingredients:
1/2 cup peanut butter
1 package flavoured miniature marshmallows
Instructions: Melt chocolate and margarine in large saucepan over medium heat.  Stir in peanut butter, mix well.  Fold in marshmallows.  Spread in wax paper ined 9 inch baking pan. Chill until firm, about 2 hours.  Cut into squares.  Store in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons margarine
1 tablespoon flour
1/4 cup finely chopped onion
1 large clove garlic, crushed
1/2 teaspoon ground oregano
1/4 teaspoon ground marjoram
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon ground thyme
3/4 cup water
2 teaspoons lemon juice
Salt and pepper
1 lb flank steak, broiled as desired
Chopped parsley
Instructions: Melt margarine.  Blend in flour; add onion and garlic.  Cook, stirring occasionally, over medium heat until onions are tender.  Remove from heat; stir in herbs.  Gradually add water and lemon juice.  Heat stirring until mixture boils.  Season with salt and pepper.  Set aside; keep warm.  Thinly slice cooked steak on an angle across grain.  Serve topped with sauce; garnish with parsley.

Ingredient:
1 can salmon, drained and flaked
2/3 cup liquid (drained salmon with water added)
1 cup fine dry bread crumbs
Ingredients:
1 egg
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Mix ingredients until blended.  Turn into greased 9 inch pan.  Bake for 45 minutes.  Let stand a few minutes.  Unfold on serving platter. Serve hot, with Mushroom Sauce.

Ingredient:
1can sliced mushrooms, reserving liquid
1 cup mushroom liquid plus water to make cup
1/3 cup dry  milk
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
Pinch pepper
Instructions: Drain mushrooms reserving liquid.  Add enough water to  liquid to make one cup.  Combine liquids with milk, flour, salt and pepper.  Beat until well blended.  Cook, stirring constantly until sauce thickens and comes to a boil.  Stir in mushrooms.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons margarine
1/4 cup chopped onion
2 tablespoons chopped green pepper
3 tablespoons flour
1 1/2 cups cold water
2/3 cup instant dry milk
Ingredients:
2 cans tuna, drained and flaked
1 package frozen peas, cooked and drained
2 tablespoons chopped pimiento
1/4 teaspoon salt
3 cups cooked rice
2 tablespoons chopped parsley
Instructions: Melt margarine, add onion and green pepper; cook until tender.   Blend in flour.  Remove from heat.  Blend together water and dry milk.  Gradually stir into flour mixture until smooth.  Cook, stirring constantly, until sauce is thickened and starts to boil.  Add tuna, peas, pimiento and salt.  Cook, stirring, until heated.  Combine rice and parsley, and serve with tuna.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup margarine
1/4 cup peanut oil
1/3 cup chopped blanched almonds
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Melt margarine; stir in oil.  Add chopped almonds and cook over low heat until almonds are lightly browned, about 12 minutes.  Stir in lemon juice and salt.  Serve hot over fish.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup margarine
1 tablespoon minced chives
1 tablespoon minced parsley
Instructions: Melt margarine in small saucepan.  Stir in chives and parsley.  Serve over cooked potatoes, cauliflower or zucchini.  Store any remaining sauce covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup margarine
1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill or 1 teaspoon dill weed
Instructions: Melt margarine in a small saucepan.  Stir in dill. Serve over cooked potatoes, carrots or turnips.  Store any remaining sauce covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1/4 teaspoon crushed rosemary leaves
1/4 teaspoon thyme leaves
Instructions: Melt margarine in a small saucepan.  Stir in rosemary and thyme.  Serve over cooked peas, green beans or zucchini.  Store any remaining covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup margarine
1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar
4 slices pineapple or 1 - 19 oz can crushed pineapple
5 maraschino cherries
Cake  Batter:
2 cups cake flour
3 teaspoons baking powder
Ingredients:
1/3 teaspoon salt
2/3 cup margarine
1 1/8 cup white sugar
3/4 cup milk
3/4 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/3 teaspoon almond extract
3 large egg whites (optional)
Instructions: Melt 1/4 cup margarine, pour into a 9 inch square pan.  Sprinkle with brown sugar, arrange pineapple slices and cherries in center of pineapple circles.  Sift together first 3 cake batter ingredients.  Cream margarine, gradually add 7/8 cup sugar, cream until light and fluffy.  Combine milk and flavourings.   Add sifted dry ingredients to creamed mixture alternately with milk mixture, begin and end with dry ingredients.  Beat egg whites until foamy, gradually add remaining 1/4 cup sugar and beat until stiff and glossy.  Carefully fold into batter.  Pour batter over brown sugar and pineapple.  Bake for 45 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups pineapple juice
1/2 cup soy sauce
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon white pepper
4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
Instructions:
In a large bowl, mix together the pineapple juice, soy sauce, ginger, garlic powder, and white pepper. Reserve a small amount of the marinade separately for dipping later.   Place chicken in marinade, and add enough water to cover. Cover, and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Heat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat.   Brush grate lightly with oil. Grill chicken 5 to 7 minutes per side, depending on thickness. Chicken is done when inside is no longer pink and juices run clear.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup graham cracker crumbs
3 tablespoons sugar
2 tablespoons margarine, melted
1 tablespoon peanut oil
1 package (9oz) Royal Lemon Gelatin
1 cup boiling water
Ingredients:
1 1/2 lb cottage cheese, not creamed
1/4 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 can (10 oz) crushed pineapple
1 tablespoon water
2 teaspoons cornstarch
Instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients.  Press on bottom of 8 inch spring form pan.  Chill.  Dissolve gelatin in water; cool to lukewarm.  Blend cheese, sugar and salt well.  Slowly add gelatin; mix until blended.  Pour over crust.  Chill until firm.  Stirring constantly, bring remaining ingredients to a boil.  Cool 15 minutes; spread over cheesecake.  Chill at least 1 hour longer.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup softened butter
1/3 cup sugar
1 cup all purpose flour
Ingredients:
See Lemon Cream Cheese Filling
Creamy Orange Filling
Blueberry Lemon Tart
Peach Melba Tart
Bumbleberry Tart
Simple Strawberry Tart
Instructions: Beat butter and sugar on medium speed until smooth.  Add flour and continue beating until  mixture is crumbly.  Push and press mixture firmly up sides an don bottom of 9 inch pie plate, quiche pan, flan pan or spring form (1 inch up sides) pan.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool 20 minutes before adding filling

Ingredient:
1 package Philadelphia cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup milk
Ingredients:
2 tablespoon lemon juice
1 teaspoon grated lemon rind
1 cup Cool Whip Whipped Topping, thawed
Instructions: Beat cream cheese and sugar on medium speed until smooth.  Blend I milk, lemon juice and lemon rind.  Fold in Whipped topping.

Ingredient:
1 package Jello Instant Vanilla Pudding
3/4 cup milk
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons granted orange rind
1/2 cup Cool Whip Whipped Topping, thawed
Instructions: Prepare pudding as directed on package, reducing milk to 3/4 cup.  (Mixture will be thick)  Fold in orange rind and Whipped Topping.

Ingredient:
3lr. cup finely chopped pecans
1 cup flour
1 Tbsp. granulated sugar
1/2 cup non-hydrogenated margarine, melted
1 pkg. [250 g] Phitadetphia Light Brick Cream Cheese Spread, softened
Ingredients:
1/2 cup icing sugar
1 tub [1 Ll Light Coo[ Whip Whipped Topping, thawed, divided
1 pkg. each [4-serving sizeJ JeLt-0 Vanilla Fat Free lnstant Pudding
and Je[t-O Chocolate Fat Free lnstant Pudding
3 cups cold skim miLk, divided
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Mix pecans, flour, granutated sugar and margarine.  Press onto bottom of greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake 20 min. Cool.  Neat cream cheese spread and icing sugar in medium bowl with electric mixer untit well  blended. Stir in 2 cups of the whipped topping; spread over crust.  Prepare each dry pudding mix with 1 1/2 cups milk in separate bowls, beating with wire whisk 2 min. or until well blended. Layer vanitla and chocolate pudding over cream cheese mixture. Top with remaining whipped topping.  Refrigerate at Least 3 hours before serving. Store Leftovers in refrigerator.
JAzz tr Up: Garnish with 2 Tbsp. grated Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate
before cutting to serve.

Ingredient:
Creamy Orange Filling
4 cups peeled peach slices
Ingredients:
Lemon juice
1/3 cup fresh raspberries
Instructions: Spread crust with Creamy Orange Filling.  Brush peach slices with lemon juice to prevent browning; pat dry.  Arrange slices randomly over filling.  Sprinkle with fresh raspberries.

Ingredient:
Lemon Cream Cheese Filling
1 cup strawberries
1 cup raspberries
Ingredients:
1 cup blackberries
1 cup blueberries
Instructions: Spread crust with Lemon Cream Cheese Filing.  Place washed and thoroughly dried mixed berries over filling.

Ingredient: Creamy Orange Filling
Ingredients: 4 cups strawberries
Instructions: Spread crust with Creamy Orange Filling.  Cut strawberries in half lengthwise; reserving 1 whole strawberry for centre.  Working from outside edge of tart to centre, place berries on filling, tip of berry facing out

Ingredient:
1 package fettuccine noodles
4 cups cut up vegetables (broccoli, carrots, snow peas, red pepper)
3/4 cup Cheez Whiz
Instructions: Prepare pasta as directed on package, adding vegetables to boiling water during last 3 to 4 minutes of pasta cooking time.  Drain well. Heat Cheez Whiz in a microwaveable bowl in microwave on medium for 1 minute, stirring once.  Pour over hot pasta and vegetables.  Serve immediately.

Ingredient:
1/2 cups semi sweet chocolate chips
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1 1/4 cups icing sugar
Ingredients:
Pinch salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: In heavy saucepan over low heat, melt chips with milk.  Remove from heat; stir in icing sugar, salt, vanilla and nuts. Spread evenly in wax paper lined 8 inch square pan.  Chill 2 to 3 hours or until firm.  Turn fudge onto cutting board; peel off paper; cut into squares. Store loosely covered at room temperature.    Can be frozen.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups   all-purpose flour
2 tablespoons   granulated sugar
1/2 cup margarine
2 eggs
11/2 cups   brown sugar, lightly packed
Ingredients:
1/4 cup   margarine,  melted
1 cup   raisins
1 tablespoon   vinegar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 teaspoon   all purpose flour
Instructions: In a medium bowl, combine flour and granulated sugar; cut in margarine with pastry blender until coarse crumbs are formed. Press into a 9 inch (2 L) square pan. Bake at  10 minutes, let cool 10 minutes. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs and brown sugar  until light and fluffy. Add remaining ingredients; pour over base. Return to oven, bake 25-30 minutes. Cool; cut into squares. Makes 25 squares.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup flour
	1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
	1/2 teaspoon salt
	1/2 teaspoon pepper
	1/2 teaspoon paprika
	1 1/2 pounds stewing beef
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
	2 tablespoons butter
	2/3 cup low sodium beef broth
	3-4 sprigs fresh thyme
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups mushrooms, halved
	1 large onion, chopped
Sauce
1/2 cup sour cream
	1 carton McCormick Simply Better Gravy, beef flavor
	2 teaspoons cornstarch
Other
	8 oz dry egg noodles
	1 Tablespoon fresh parsley
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees.  	In a large bowl, combine the flour & seasonings. Set aside.  	Remove any fat from the beef and gently toss with the flour mixture to coat.  	Heat the vegetable oil and butter in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the dredged beef chunks and brown until a crust forms on each side.  	In 9 degrees13 inch pan combine beef, onions, mushrooms, thyme and beef broth  Cover tightly with tin foil and bake for 2 hours or until beef is fork tender.  	Meanwhile, combine the sour cream,Simply Better Gravy and cornstarch in small bowl and set aside.  	Cook the egg noodles 2 minutes less than indicated on the package. Drain well.  	Remove the beef from the oven and turn the oven up to 350 degrees.  	Remove the thyme sprigs from the pan, stir in the egg noodles and the gravy mixture.  	Bake an additional 15 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
Optional Crumb Topping: Combine 1/2 cup Panko bread crumbs, 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder and 1 1/2 tablespoons melted butter.  Sprinkle over the casserole just before baking

Ingredient:
4 fresh salmon filets
1/4 cup margarine
1/2 cup chicken bouillon
1 tablespoon lemon juice
2 tablespoons chopped parsley
Instructions: Melt half of margarine in a non stick skillet over medium heat.  Cook salmon in margarine for 5 to 7 minutes, turning once, until salmon begins to flake easily.  Season with salt and pepper.  Remove salmon from skillet and place on a warm serving platter.  To skillet, add chicken stock and lemon juice, bring to the boil.  Boil 1  minute.  Remove from heat, stir in remaining margarine until melted and pour sauce over salmon.  Sprinkle with chopped parsley.  Serve immediately.

Ingredient:
1 medium onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
3 tablespoons margarine
3 tablespoons all purpose flour
1 1/4 cups milk
1 cup chicken stock
1 cup cooked cubed ham (optional)
Ingredients:
3/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
3/4 teaspoon dried sweet basil
3/4 teaspoon whole oregano
1/4 teaspoon pepper
3 cups uncooked penne pasta
1 medium red pepper, diced
2 cups broccoli florets
Instructions: In skillet, saut degrees onion and garlic in melted margarine, 3 to 4 minutes.  Stir in flour and cook 1 minute, stirring.  Whisk in milk and stock; bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, simmer 2 minutes, stirring occasionally.   Add ham, cheese, basil, oregano and pepper; heat through and set aside.  Cook pasta according to package directions.  Add red pepper and broccoli to pasta water 1 to 2 minutes before end of cooking time.  Drain pasta and vegetables.  Toss with sauce and serve immediately.

Ingredient:
1 head romaine lettuce
1/2 cup Creamy Caesar Dressing
1 cup Caesar Salad Croutons
2 slices bacon, cooked & crumbled
Ingredients: See Creamy Caesar Dressing
Instructions: Wash lettuce and tear into bite size pieces.  Add dressing, croutons and bacon and toss to coat well.  Serve immediately garnished with fresh ground pepper and lemon slices.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup milk
1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
2 tablespoons Dijonnaise mustard
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons lemon juice or vinegar
1 clove garlic, crushed
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: In small bowl, combine all ingredients, mix until well combined.  Cover and chill until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup mayonnaise
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 teaspoon sesame oil
1/4 teaspoon ginger
1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 red pepper, cut in thin strips
Ingredients:
8 oz Catelli Bistro Fettuccine with Herbs, cooked and drained
1 cup cucumber strips
1 cup snow peas, blanched
3 green onions, sliced
1 cup cooked chicken strips (optional)
Instructions: In large bowl, combine mayonnaise, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger and cayenne pepper.  Add fettuccine and remaining ingredients; toss to coat.  Cover and chill 1 to 2 hours to blend flavours.

Ingredient:
1 cup mayonnaise
2 tablespoons Dijonnaise mustard
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
3 hard cooked eggs, diced
4 cups peeled, cooked potatoes, cubed
Ingredients:
1 cup sliced celery
1/2 cup sliced green onions
1/2 cup grated carrot
Paprika
Chopped parsley
Instructions: In large bowl, combine mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper.  Stir in eggs, potatoes, celery, green onions and carrot.  Cover and chill 1 to 2 hours to blend flavours.   Sprinkle with paprika and chopped parsley.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 1/2 cups quick cooking rolled oats
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/4 cup melted butter
1/4 cup corn syrup
1 can whole cranberry sauce
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 teaspoon grated lemon rind
Instructions: In large bowl, combine flour, oats, brown sugar and baking soda.  In small bowl, combine melted butter and corn syrup, stir into dry ingredients.  Set aside 1 cup of the mixture, pat remaining mixture into 9 inch square baking pan.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until very lightly browned.   In bowl, combine cranberry sauce, lemon juice and rind. Spread over base. Sprinkle evenly with reserved oats mixture; pat down lightly.  Bake  for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.  Let cool completely on rack.

Ingredient:
1 cup graham wafer crumbs
1 cup sifted icing sugar
1/4 cup sifted unsweetened cocoa
1/4 cup frozen orange juice (thawed, undiluted)
Ingredients:
1 tablespoons corn syrup
1 teaspoon vanilla or rum flavouring
Cocoa or icing sugar for coating, optional
Instructions: In bowl, combine crumbs, icing sugar and cocoa.  Stir together orange juice, corn syrup and vanilla, pour into dry mixture and stir until moistened.  Cover and chill for about 30 minutes.  Shape into small balls about 1 inch in diameter.  If desired, roll in cocoa or icing sugar.  Place in tiny paper cups.  Store in refrigerator.  For best flavour, remove from refrigerator about 20 minutes before serving.

Ingredient:
3 packages Philadelphia cream cheese
3/4 cup white sugar
Ingredients:
3 eggs
1/4 cup Raspberry Jam
Instructions: Mix cream cheese and sugar until smooth.  Add eggs, one at a time, and  mix until just blended.  Pour into prepared crust.  Heat and sieve Raspberry jam and dot cheesecake batter with jam.  Zig zag a knife through jam to marble.  Bake for 40 minutes or until centre is set.  Cool to room temperature.  Refrigerate 3 hours or overnight.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup all purpose flour
1/4 cup cocoa
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
3 eggs
1 cup white sugar
1/3 cup water
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
Filling:
1 cup whipping cream
2 tablespoons white sugar
1 tablespoon finely ground coffee

Icing:
1 3/4 cups chocolate icing
Instructions:
Cake:
Grease jelly roll pan and line with wax paper.  Combine flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt; set aside.  Beat eggs, 3 minutes, until foamy.  Gradually beat in sugar, 4 to 5 minutes, until very thick.  Stir in water and vanilla.  Blend in flour mixture until smooth.  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until done.  Cool 5 minutes.  Turn out onto kitchen towel dusted with cocoa, trim edges; remove wax paper.  Roll up from one narrow end; cool in towel on rack

Filling:  Beat whipping cream until thickened.  Beat in sugar, until stiff peaks form.  Fold in coffee

Assembly:
Unroll cake; spread with filling; re-roll.  Spread icing over roll to cover.  Decorate with red and green cherries.  Chill until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons margarine
1 can Cream of Mushroom soup
4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1/2 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups sliced mushrooms
1 small onion, sliced
1 clove garlic, minced
Hot cooked noodles
Instructions: In a large skillet, over medium high heat, melt half of the margarine.  Brown chicken 5 minutes on each side. Remove from pan; set aside.  Reduce heat to medium.  In same skillet, add remaining margarine, saut degrees mushrooms and onions with soup, milk and pepper to taste.  Bring to a boil.  Return chicken to skillet.  Reduce heat to low.  Cover; simmer 5 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink, stirring occasionally.  Serve with noodles.

Ingredient:
Filling:
1/3 cup Pure Raspberry Jam
1/4 cup dry plain bread crumbs
1/4 cup white sugar
2 tablespoons softened butter
Ingredients:
Dough:
2 - 2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
1 package Quick Rise Yeast
1/2 cup sour cream
1/2 cup softened butter
1 egg
Icing sugar
White sugar
Instructions:
Filling:
Stir together jam, bread crumbs, sugar and butter.

Dough:
Combine 1/2 cup flour and undissolved yeast. Heat some cream with 1 tablespoon water until warm, stir into flour. Stir in butter, egg and enough of the remaining flour to make a soft dough.  Knead into a ball; divided in half, wrap with plastic; refrigerate 2 hours.  Line baking sheet with wax paper.  Sprinkle work surface with white sugar.  Roll one dough half to 18 x 8 rectangle. Spread half of the filling, lengthwise over half of dough  Fold dough, lengthwise, in half, trim edges.  Cut crosswise into 12 strips, twist each in center to form bow.  Place on greased baking sheet.  Repeat process.  Bake for 15 to 20  minutes until golden.  Cool on wire racks.  Dust with icing sugar

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
Ingredients:
2 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips
1 cup peanut butter-flavored chips
Instructions: In 13x9-inch baking pan, melt butter in oven.  Sprinkle crumbs evenly over butter; pour Eagle Brand evenly over crumbs. Top with remaining ingredients; press down firmly with spoon.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool. Cut into bars. Store covered at room temperature.   For perfectly cut bars: Line entire pan with a sheet of aluminum foil first. When bars are cool, lift up edges of foil to remove from pan. Cut into individual squares. Lift off foil.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons oil
2 lb chicken pieces, skins removed
1/3 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon chili powder
1/2 cup Heinz Chili Sauce
1 (19 oz) can chunk pineapple, drain, reserve 3/4 cup juice
Instructions: In  a large skillet, over medium high heat, brown chicken in oil, drain, set aside.  In a small saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch, chili powder, stir in pineapple juice and chili sauce.  Cook over medium high heat until mixture boils, stirring occasionally.  Cook 1 minute longer.  Add pineapple chunks.  Place chicken in 1 quart casserole dish.  Pour chili sauce mixture over chicken.  Bake for 45 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast, chopped
1 green pepper, cut into thin strips
1 small onion, cut into thin wedges
1 1/2 cups spaghetti sauce
Ingredients:
2 cups rotini pasta, cooked, drained
1 package Kraft Mozzarella & Parmesan Italian Style Shredded Cheese, divided or Kraft Finely Shredded Low Moisture Part Skim Mozzarella Cheese
Instructions: Cook chicken in large skillet sprayed with no stick cooking spray  5 minutes.  Add green pepper and onion; cook until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender.  Stir in sauce, rotini and 1 cup of the cheese.  Sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese; cover.  Let stand 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Ingredient:
3 tablespoons sugar
3 tablespoons margarine
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
2 packages cream cheese, softened
Ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar
2 teaspoon vanilla
2 eggs
1/2 cup chilled whipping cream
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Heat 3 tablespoons sugar and margarine in saucepan over low heat, stirring frequently, until margarine is melted.  Stir in cracker crumbs.  Press firmly against bottom and sides of ungreased pie plate.  Beat cream cheese slightly; add sugar, vanilla and eggs.  Beat on medium speed until smooth, about 2 minutes.  Pour over crumb mixture.  Bake about 30 minutes.  Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours, but no longer than 48 hours.  Beat whipping cream and vanilla in chilled bowl until stiff.  Spread over cheesecake.  Top with cherries, blueberries etc.  Refrigerate any remaining cheesecake immediately.

Ingredient:
1 cup graham cracker crumbs
3 tablespoons margarine, melted
2 (8 oz) packages cream cheese, softened
Ingredients:
1/2 cup sugar
1 tablespoon grated lemon rind
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
2 eggs, separated
Instructions: Combine crumbs and margarine; press onto bottom of 9 inch spring form pan.  Bake at 325 degrees for 10 minutes.  Combine cream cheese, sugar, juice, rind and vanilla.  Mix at medium speed until well blended.  Add egg yolks, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.  Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites; pour over crust.  Bake at  300  degrees for 45 minutes.  Serve with fresh fruit or cherry pie filling.

Ingredient:
Vanilla wafers
2 (8 oz) packages cream cheese
3 eggs
Ingredients:
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
Pie Filling (cherry, blueberry or pineapple)
Instructions:
Combine at room temperature cream cheese with eggs, sugar and vanilla.   Line each cupcake paper with a cookie.  Fill each cup 3/4 full with the cheese mixture.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes.  Cool and top with a teaspoon of filling.  May be frozen before adding fruit topping.
For 22 large cupcakes, use Nabisco wafers and large cupcake papers.  For 36 small cupcakes, use Sunshine wafers and miniature papers.  Foil liners work well.

Ingredient:
Crust:
3/4 cup margarine
1 1/2 cups flour
Filling:
1/2 cup sugar
2 tablespoons flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 (8 oz) packages cream cheese (softened at room temperature)
4 egg yolks
1 cup light cream
4 egg whites
Instructions:
Crust:
Mix ingredients and flour to a crumbly mass; pat into rectangular cake pan or a spring pan.  Bake the crust at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Filling:
Blend sugar with 2 tablespoons flour, salt and softened cream cheese.  Add cream, blend thoroughly.  Beat egg whites until stiff.  Pour into mixture and pour on top of crust.  Bake at 325 degrees for 1 Hour and 15 minutes (or until set in the center).  Serve with strawberries or cherries which have been jellied.

Ingredient:
1 (16 oz) pound cake mix
3 eggs
2 tablespoons margarine, melted
4 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese
Ingredients:
1 can Eagle Brand milk
2 cups pumpkin
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: On low speed combine cake mix, 1 egg, margarine and 2 teaspoons pie spice until crumbly.  Press into bottom of 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan.  In large mixer bowl beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Gradually beat in Eagle Brand and remaining eggs, pumpkin, and remaining pie spice and salt; mix well.  Pour over crust; sprinkle with nuts.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until set.  Cool.  Chill.  Cut into bars.  Store in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine, melted
1/3 cup brown sugar
1 cup flour
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese
Ingredients:
1/4 cup sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon lemon juice
2 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Mix brown sugar, nuts and flour, stir in the butter.  Mix until crumbly.  Remove 1 cup for topping.  Press remainder in 8 inch square pan and press firmly.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.  Beat cream cheese with 1/4 cup sugar.  Beat in egg, lemon juice, milk and vanilla.  Pour onto baked crust. Top with reserved crumbs.  Bake for 25 minutes.  Cool thoroughly.  Refrigerate.

Ingredient:
Crust:
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup chopped nuts
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 cup margarine
Filling:
4 eggs, well beaten
Ingredients:
2 (8 oz) packages cream cheese
1 cup sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups sour cream
2 teaspoons vanilla
2 teaspoons lemon juice
Instructions: Grease bottom and sides of spring form pan.  Press crust mixture into bottom and 2/3 up sides of pan.  Reserve 3 tablespoons of crust mixture to sprinkle on top of cake.  Beat eggs and sugar until fluffy.  Add cream cheese, salt, extracts, beat until smooth.  Blend in sour cream and pour into crust.  Sprinkle crumbs on outside edge.  Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Ingredient:
Crust:
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
3 tablespoons sugar
3 tablespoons margarine, melted
Filling:
3 (8 oz) packages cream cheese, softened
Ingredients:
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
2 tablespoons all purpose flour
3 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla
1/2 cup chopped pecans
Instructions: Mix graham cracker crumbs, sugar and margarine, press into 9 inch spring form pan.  Bake for 10 minutes or use ready  made graham cracker pie shell.  Beat cream cheese until smooth, add brown sugar and flour, mix well.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.  Stir in vanilla and pecans.  Pour into prepared c rust.  Bake for 40 to 45 minutes.   Let cool to room temperature; refrigerate overnight.  Remove sides of spring form pan; top with whipped cream and pecan halves.

Ingredient:
2 (8 oz) packages cream cheese, softened
2 eggs, beaten
Ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Instructions: Beat all ingredients together.   Line muffin tins with cupcake papers.  Put a vanilla wafer in the bottom of each paper.  Fill about half full with cream cheese mixture and bake for 13 minutes.  Let cool for about 20 minutes.  Top with a teaspoon of cherry or blueberry pie filling.  Refrigerate for about an hour before pulling off papers.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups graham wafer crackers, crushed
1/3 cup margarine
1/4 cup brown sugar, packed
Ingredients:
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese, at room temperature
1 (15 oz) can condensed milk
1/2 cup lemon juice
2/3 cup powdered milk
Instructions:
Crust:
Combine graham crackers, margarine and brown sugar and mix well.  Line bottom and sides of 9 inch pie pan.  Bake 8 minutes and then cool.  Reserve 2 tablespoons of mix for garnish.
Filling:
Mix cream cheese, lemon juice and powdered milk together.  Add condensed milk.  Mix again.  Pour into cooled crust and sprinkle with reserved crust mix and refrigerate about 3 hours.  Cherry pie filling can be used as garnish.

Ingredient:
4 (8 oz) packages cream cheese, softened
1 can sweetened condensed milk (Eagle Brand)
1 tablespoon lemon juice
Ingredients:
1 cup graham crackers
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
Chopped maraschino cherries
Instructions: Beat cream cheese; gradually add milk and lemon juice, beating well.  Chill thoroughly.  Combine graham cracker crumbs and cinnamon in a small mixing bowl.  Drop 1 teaspoon chilled cream cheese mixture onto the graham cracker crumbs.  Shake bowl completely coating cream cheese.  Shape cream cheese mixture into a ball and place in a petit-four cup.  Repeat procedure until cheese mixture is completely used up.  Garnish with cherries.   Freeze.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup butter
1 1/4 cups biscuit mix
1/2 cup nuts
1 (8oz) package cream cheese
1/4 cup brown sugar
Ingredients:
1 egg
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
3 cups peeled, sliced apples
1/4 cup water
1/4 cup sugar
Instructions: Combine brown sugar, butter, biscuit mix and nuts until crumbly.  Press 2/3 of this in an 8 inch greased pan.  Bake for 8  minutes.  Beat cream cheese, brown sugar, egg, lemon juice and vanilla together.  Cook apples in water with sugar to tender.  Drain and add 1/4 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon lemon juice.  Over crust layer apples, then cheese, then rest of crumbs.  Bake 25 minutes.  Store in refrigerator or freeze.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons  soy sauce
2 tablespoons Italian dressing
1 teaspoon cornstarch
1 tablespoon minced garlic
1 teaspoon ground ginger
3/4 pound round steak, cut into strips
6 cups water
Ingredients:
5 cubes beef bouillon
4 ounces linguine pasta
1/2 cup fat free beef broth
1/2 cup sliced green onion
1 pound broccoli, separated into florets
1 cup small fresh mushrooms
Instructions:
In a shallow glass dish or bowl, stir together the soy sauce, Italian dressing, cornstarch, garlic and ginger. Place steak strips in the mixture to marinate for 15 minutes.  While the beef is marinating, combine the bouillon cubes in water in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, and add pasta. Cook for about 8 minutes, or until al dente. Drain.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Remove beef from marinade with a slotted spoon, and place in the hot skillet. Discard marinade. Cook beef, stirring constantly for 2 to 3 minutes, or until mostly browned. Stir in the beef broth, mushrooms and green onions, reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove lid, add broccoli, and cook until broccoli is bright green and tender but still crisp. Add drained linguine, toss, and serve.

Ingredient:
1 cup raw cranberries, cut in half
3/4 cup sugar
2 cups flour
3/4 teaspoon baking soda
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 egg
1 1/4 cups buttermilk
1/4 cup melted shortening
Instructions: Mix cranberries and 1/2 cup sugar. In large bowl, mix flour, baking soda, salt and remaining sugar. Combine egg, buttermilk and shortening and pour into center of flour mixture. Spoon in cranberry mixture. Spoon batter into greased  muffin pans. Bake 20 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 Tablespoon grated lemon rind
3 Tablespoons lemon juice
Ingredients:
1 cup all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/8 teaspoon salt
2 Tablespoons sugar
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
Instructions: Cream butter; gradually add 1/2 cup sugar, beating until light and fluffy. Add eggs, beating well. Stir in lemon rind and juice. Combine flour, baking powder and salt; add to creamed mixture, mixing well. Spoon batter into greased muffin (mini 1 3/4-inch) pans, filling 2/3 full. Combine 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle evenly over each muffin.  Bake for 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar
1/8 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup butter or margarine
1 cup packed light brown sugar
Ingredients:
1 large egg
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup walnuts chopped fine
1/2 cup fresh cranberries, chopped coarse
1 teaspoon grated fresh orange peel

For decorations: 1/2 cup fresh cranberries cut in half
Instructions:
Mix flour, baking soda, cream of tartar and salt. In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar with electric mixer until fluffy. Beat in egg and vanilla.  Gradually stir in flour mixture until blended. Stir in nuts, chopped cranberries and orange peel. Divide dough in half. Wrap and chill about 30 minutes or until firm enough to handle. Shape each half into a 7 inch long roll.
