Wrap and chill about 3 hours until very firm or freeze. With a very sharp knife cut 1 roll at a time (keep remaining refrigerated) into 1/4 inch slices. Place 1 inch apart on prepared cookie sheets.
Press a cranberry half cut side down in each center.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are
golden brown. Remove to rack to cool.

Ingredient:
Filling:
2 (8 oz.) packages cream cheese
3 eggs
1 cup whipping cream
1 teaspoon vanilla
2/3 cup sugar
Ingredients:
12 oz. package semi-sweet chocolate chips, melted
2 tablespoons margarine or butter, melted

Crust:
1 3/4 cups chocolate wafers, crushed
6 tablespoons margarine or butter, melted
Instructions:
In medium bowl, combine crust ingredients; reserve 1 tablespoon crumbs for garnish. Press
remaining crumbs over bottom and 2-inches up sides of 10-inch spring-form pan. Refrigerate. In large bowl, combine softened cream cheese and sugar; beat until smooth. Add eggs, one at a
time, beating until well blended after each addition. Add melted chocolate; beat well. Add cream, 2 tablespoons margarine and vanilla; beat until smooth. Pour into prepared crust. Bake for 55 to 60 minutes or until edges are (center of cheesecake will be soft ) cool in pan 5 minutes.  Remove sides of pan. Cool completely. Garnish with reserved crumbs.  Store in refrigerator.  To prevent cracks in top of cheesecake, place pan of water on rack below cheesecake while baking.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup graham crumbs
1/2 cup flour
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
Ingredients:
1/3 cup sugar
1 egg
1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peel
1 tablespoon lemon juice
2 tablespoons finely crushed graham crackers
Instructions: Stir together graham crackers, flour, nuts and 1/4 cup sugar.  Add melted butter, mix until crumbly.  Pat into ungreased 9 inch baking pan.  Bake for 12 minutes.  Cream together cheese and 1/3 cup sugar.  Add egg, lemon peel and juice, mix well. Pour over baked layer.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.  Sprinkle with graham cracker's  Cool, cut into bars.  Store in refrigerator

Ingredient:
12 cupcake papers
12 vanilla wafers
4 (3 oz) packages cream cheese
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1 can pie filling
Instructions: Place one vanilla wafer in each cupcake paper; set into pans.  Beat together cream cheese, eggs, sugar and vanilla.  Fill each paper 2/3 full.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.  Refrigerate 1 hour before serving.  Add topping.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1 1/2 cups butter, cut up
2/3 cup packed brown sugar
1 package creamy chocolate fudge frosting mix
Ingredients:
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese, cut up
2 eggs
3/4 cup slivered almonds
Instructions: Combine flour, butter and sugar and beat to resemble crumbs.  Pat into 13 x 9 inch pan.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.  Combine frosting and cheese.  Add eggs, beat until smooth.  Spread over crust.  Sprinkle with nuts.  Bake for 30 minutes.  Cool.  Cut into bars and store in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup hot water
1 can mandarin oranges
24 graham crackers
Ingredients:
1/2 cup sugar
1 cup sugar
1 package (3 0z) orange gelatin
1 large can evaporated milk, chilled
1/2 cup butter
Instructions: Make a graham crust from the crackers, 1/2 cup sugar and butter, by melting butter, crushing crackers and mixing with sugar in a 9 inch pan.  Dissolve gelatin in hot water, add juice from oranges.  Let cool.  Combine cheese, sugar and vanilla; beat until mixed.  Mix with cooled gelatin.  Whip chilled milk until it stands in peaks.  Add to gelatin mixture.  Spread in graham crust over layer of oranges.  Chill until firm.  Save a few oranges to decorate the top.

Ingredient:
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese
2 cups Cool Whip
Ingredients:
1/2 cup sugar
9 inch graham cracker crust
Instructions: Mix cream cheese and sugar.  Blend in Cool Whip.  Put mixture incrust.  Chill about 1 hour.  Top with cherry or blueberry pie filling.

Ingredient:
1 3/4 cups graham cracker crumbs
2 tablespoons sugar
1/2 cup butter, melted
5 (8 oz) packages cream cheese at room temperature
1 1/2 cups sugar
Ingredients:
6 eggs
1 cup dark rum
1 cup raisins
1 tablespoon vanilla
4 egg yolks
1/3 cup coffee cream
Instructions: Butter 8 inch spring form pan.  Mix crumbs, sugar and butter; coat pan completely with mix.  Beat cream cheese until smooth.  Beat in sugar and vanilla.  Beat in eggs and yolks, 1 at a time.  Do not over mix.  Blend in rum and coffee cream; stir in raisins.  Pour batter in prepared pan.  Add enough cold water to roasting pan to come 1 1/2 inches up sides of spring form pan.  Bake for 90 minutes.  Cool completely.  Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
1 package butterscotch chips
1/2 cup margarine
2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1 cup chopped nuts
Ingredients:
1 package cream cheese, softened
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 egg
Instructions: In medium saucepan melt chips and margarine.  Stir in graham crumbs and nuts.  Press half the mixture firmly in bottom of greased 9 inch baking pan.  In large mixing bowl beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Beat in Eagle Brand milk, vanilla and egg, mix well.  Pour into prepared pan.  Top with remaining crumb mixture.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until done.  Cool to room temperature.  Chill before cutting into bars.

Ingredient:
24 cupcake liners
24 vanilla wafer
2 packages cream cheese, softened
3/4 cup sugar
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 can peach or cherry pie filling
Instructions: Line cupcake pans with liners.  Place a vanilla wafer in the bottom of each liner.  In small mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, eggs, lemon juice and vanilla; until light and fluffy.  Fill liners 2/3 full with cheese mixture.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until set.  Remove from oven and top each with spoonful of pie filling.  Chill.

Ingredient:
Crust:
1/3 cup soft margarine
1/3 cup brown sugar
1 cup flour
1/2 cup chopped pecans
Ingredients:
Topping:
1/4 cup sugar
1 package cream cheese
1 egg
2 tablespoons milk
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions:
Crust:  Cream margarine and brown sugar until light and fluffy.  Add flour and nuts, blend until mixture resembles crumbs.  Set aside 1 cup.  Press remaining mixture into 8 inch pan. Bake for 12 minutes.
Topping: Combine sugar and cream cheese, beating until smooth.  Add egg, milk and lemon juice and beat well.  Spread over mixture of baked crust.  Sprinkle reserved crumbs on top.  Bake for 25 minutes.  Cool and cut into bars.  Keep refrigerated.

Ingredient:
4 egg yolks
2 cups sugar
2 tablespoons plain flour
1 cup blackberry jam or jelly
Ingredients:
1 pint cream
1 tablespoon butter
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 baked pie shells
Instructions: Mix sugar and flour.   Add cream.  Stir.  Add eggs and jam.  Cook over medium heat until quite thick.  Remove from heat.  Add butter and vanilla.  Cool and place in pie shells.  Top with meringue and brown.

Ingredient:
4 eggs
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 1/3 cups white syrup
3 tablespoons margarine
1 1/2 cups chopped pecans
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and pour into two frozen pie shells which have been thawed.  Use the regular size frozen pie shells for two pies.  Bake for 50 minutes.  Cool before serving.

Ingredient:
2 cups sugar
2 cups cold water
6 tablespoons cornstarch
1 small package peach jello
Ingredients:
2 pints fresh peaches
1 large container Cool Whip
2 baked 9 inch pie shells
Instructions: Combine sugar, water, cornstarch and jello in pan.  Bring to a boil and cook until thick and clear, cool.  Line cooled pie shells with fresh peaches.  Pour mixture over peaches in shells.  Refrigerate until set.  Top with Cool Whip.

Ingredient:
2 packages dry yeast
2/3 cup sugar, divided
1 cup warm water
1 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1/2 cup margarine, softened
1/2 cup shortening
1 cup boiling water
2 eggs, beaten
6 - 7 cups all purpose flour, divided
Instructions: Dissolve yeast and  teaspoon sugar in in  cup warm water; let stand about 5 minutes.  Combine remaining sugar, salt, butter, and shortening in a large bowl.  Add boiling water, stirring until butter and shortening melt.  Cool slightly.  Add dissolved yeast, stirring well.  Add eggs and 3 cups flour, beating at medium speed until smooth.  Gradually stir in enough remaining flour to make a soft dough.  Place in a well greased bowl, turning to grease top.  Cover and let rise in a warm place 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until doubled in bulk.  Punch down down; turn dough out onto a well floured surface and knead several times. Shope into 2 inch balls andplace in a3 grased 9 inch round pans.  Cover and let rise in a warm place 30 to 40 minutes or until doubled in bulk.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or  until golden

Ingredient:
1 lb. Lean ground beef
1 large onion, chopped
1 clove garlic, minced
1 can whole tomatoes, cut up
1 can tomato sauce
1 can tomato paste
1 cup beef bouillon
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons minced parsley
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1 teaspoon basil leaves
1 teaspoon oregano leaves
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Crumble and brown ground beef in a skillet with the onion and garlic.  When meat loses red color, remove from heat and drain off excess fat.  Put meat mixture into a crock pot and add all remaining ingredients.  Stir well.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours, stirring occasionally if possible.  Serve hot over hot spaghetti.  May be made ahead and frozen

Ingredient:
Sauce:
1/4 cup ketchup
1 tablespoon sugar
1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
Main:
1/2 lb ground beef
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
Dash of pepper
2 teaspoons dehydrated onion flakes
1 small egg, slightly beaten
1/2 cup rolled oats
1/4 cup ketchup
Instructions: Mix together well all sauce ingredients.  Cover and set aide in refrigerator.  In a separate bowl, combine all main ingredients and put into a loaf pan.  Bake for 55 minutes.  Spread sauce on top of loaf and bake for another 5 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
4 boneless chicken breasts or 10 boneless chicken tenders
Ingredients:
1/2 cup butter, melted
1/4 cup honey
1/4 cup lemon juice
1 tablespoon soy sauce
Instructions: Combine flour and salt.  Dip chicken in flour salt mixture.  Arrange chicken in baking dish.  Pour melted butter over chicken.  Bake for 30 minutes.  Mix rest of ingredients together and pour over chicken.  Bake 30 minutes, basting often.

Ingredient:
1 large can pear halves
1 small can pineapple tidbits
1 cup flour
1 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon vanilla
3/4 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
Instructions: Slice pears into small slices.  Place pears, pineapple tidbits and juices of both to equal the same amount of juice that is found in the pears.  Add other ingredients and mix well.  Bake for 35 minutes.  Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or cool whip.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
2 cups light brown sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla
2 1/2 cups sifted flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
3 cups rolled oats
Ingredients:
Fudge Nut Filling:
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup sweetened condensed milk
2 tablespoons butter
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped nuts
2 teaspoons vanilla
Instructions: Cream together butter and sugar.  Mix in eggs and vanilla.  Sift flour, soda and salt; stir in oats.  Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.  Set aside while you make filling.  Spread about 2/3 of oatmeal mixture in bottom of a greased 8 inch pan.  Cover with chocolate mixture.  Dot with remainder of oatmeal mixture and swirl it over chocolate filling.  Bake for 25 to 30o minutes or until lightly browned.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup flour
3 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
Ingredients:
1 cup white sugar
1/2 cup brown sugar
3 teaspoons vanilla
3 cups diced apples
Instructions: Beat eggs, add sugar and vanilla and beat well.  Add dry ingredients and mix.  Dump in apples and stir until evenly distributed.  Put in a deep baking dish.  Bake for 45 minutes.  Serve warm.

Ingredient:
Crust:
1 cup margarine
2 cups flour
1/2 cup icing sugar

Filling:
1 package cream cheese, softened
2 eggs
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon almond extract
Ingredients:
Frosting:
1 1/2 cups icing sugar
1/4 cup butter
1 1/2 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon almond extract
Instructions:
Crust:
Mix all ingredients well and pat into a 9 inch pan.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.

Filling:
Beat ingredients together well and pour over crust while it is still hot.  Bake 15 to 2 minutes.  Cool

Frosting:
Whisk together ingredients and spread evenly on baked, cooled cookies.  Cut into bars.

Ingredient:
1 cup shortening
1 cup sugar
1 egg
1 cup molasses
2 tablespoons vinegar
5 cups sifted all purpose flour
Ingredients:
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 - 3 teaspoons ground ginger
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon cloves
Instructions: Cream shortening and sugar.  Beat in egg, molasses and vinegar.  Sift together dry ingredients and blend into creamed mixture.  Chill 3 hours.  Roll dough on lightly floured surface to 1/8 inch thick. Cut in shapes.  Bake 5 to 6 minutes.  Cool slightly on cookie sheet and then remove to rack.

Ingredient:
1 pound ground beef
1 onion, chopped
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
Ingredients:
4 cups milk
1 (15 ounce) can peas, drained
salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
Place the ground beef and onion in a large skillet over medium high heat. Saute for 5 to 10 minutes, or until beef is browned and onion is translucent; set aside.  Melt the butter or margarine in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Remove from heat and add the flour, mixing thoroughly.  Add the milk slowly, stirring constantly, and return to the heat. Keep stirring until thickened to desired consistency.
Add the reserved beef mixture, the peas, and season with salt and pepper to taste

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/8 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
Ingredients:
3/4 cup packed golden brown sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 egg
1 1/2 cups vanilla milk (white chocolate) chips
3/4 cup coarsely chopped macadamia nuts
3/4 cup coarsely chopped pecans
Instructions: Grease 2 cookie sheets.  Mix first 4 ingredients together in a small bowl.  Beat butter, sugar and vanilla in a large bowl until light and fluffy.  Beat in egg.  Stir in dry ingredients, then vanilla milk chips and nuts.  Drop cookie dough onto cookie sheet.  Bake 15 minutes.  Cool cookies on sheets for 5 minutes.  Transfer cookies to rack to cool.

Ingredient:
2 cups packed brown sugar
1 cup margarine, softened
1 teaspoon vanilla
2 eggs
2 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
3 cups rolled oats
2 tablespoons margarine
1 can sweetened condensed milk
1 package semisweet chocolate chips
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup chopped nuts, optional
Instructions: Mix brown sugar, cup of margarine, teaspoon vanilla and eggs.  Stir in the flour, baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon salt; stir in the oats.  Set aside 1/3 of the oat mixture.  Press remaining oat mixture in a greased jelly pan.  Heat 2 tablespoons margarine, the milk and chocolate chips over low heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted.  Remove from heat, stir in nuts, teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon salt.  Spread over oat mixture in pan.  Drop the reserved oat mixture onto the chocolate mixture.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 up Crisco vegetable shortening
1 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup white sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 teaspoon water
Ingredients:
2 eggs
2 cups plus 4 tablespoons flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 cups M & M plain candies
Instructions: Blend shortening and sugars.  Beat in vanilla, water and eggs.  Sift remaining dry ingredients together and add to the sugar and egg mixture.  Mix well.  Stir in M & M's.  Drop from teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown.  For additional color, press extra M & m's into cookies before baking.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup icing sugar
1/2 cup shortening
1/2 cup butter
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon peppermint flavouring
2 cups all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Cream sugar, shortening, butter and extract thoroughly.  Add flour and salt and mix well.  Form into one inch balls, place on cookie sheet and bake 8 to 10 minutes.  Cool on rack.  Dip tops in icing, pink and green, then in coconut.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1 1/2 cups grated sharp cheddar cheese
1 tablespoon sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 eggs, beaten
1 cup undiluted Carnation evaporated milk
1/4 cup melted margarine
Instructions: Stir flour, cheese, sugar, baking powder and salt together.  In a small bowl, combine beaten eggs, milk and melted margarine; add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir in quickly until ingredients are just mixed and batter is lumpy in appearance.  Fill greased muffins pans 2/3 full.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes.  Remove from pan and serve warm.

Ingredient:
2 unbaked pie shells
2 packages cream cheese, softened
1 can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
3 eggs, separated
Ingredients:
1/4 cup Lemon juice
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cans cherry pie filling
Instructions: Bake pie shells according to package instructions for a chiffon pie.  While curst is cooling prepare filling.  Beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Add Eagle brand and egg yolks and beat until smooth.  Stir in lemon juice.  Beat egg whites with salt to soft peaks.  Fold into Eagle brand mixture.  Pour into baked pie shells.  Bake for 30 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched.  Chill and top with cherry pie filling or blueberry.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter
1/4 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup cocoa
1 egg, beaten
2 cups graham wafer crumbs
1 cup coconut, flaked or shredded
Ingredients:
1/2 cup walnuts or peanuts, chopped
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
1/3 cup lemon juice
1/3 cup melted Chipits semisweet chocolate baking chips
Instructions: Melt butter and stir in sugar, cocoa, egg, crumbs, coconut and walnuts.  Press into bottom of a 9 inch pan.  Combine Eagle Brand with lemon juice.  Blend well and spread onto base.  Sprinkle with toasted almonds or pistachio or drizzle with melted chocolate chips.  Refrigerate until firm about 2 hours.,

Ingredient:
1 lb dried beans
1/2 teaspoon dried mustard
1 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons brown sugar
2 tablespoons molasses
1/2 lb salt pork, diced
1 medium onion
Instructions: Soak beans overnight in plenty of water.  Drain.  Place in a large bean crock, the beans, mustard, salt, pepper, sugar, molasses and salt pork.  Mix well and add enough water to cover.  Bury the onion in the centre of the beans.  Cover and bake for 8 to 10 hours.  Add more water if necessary.

Ingredient:
Cookie Base:
1/2 cup margarine
1 1/2 cups firmly packed brown sugar
2 eggs
1 teaspoon brandy extract
2 cups sifted all purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
Dash salt
1/4 teaspoon ginger
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon allspice
Ingredients:
1 (1 1/8 oz) packets instant oatmeal with apples and cinnamon, uncooked
2 ( 1 1/2 oz) package instant oatmeal with raisins and spice, uncooked
1 package shelled walnuts

Frosting:
1/3 cup margarine
1 cup sifted icing sugar
1 teaspoon brandy extract
Instructions:
Cookie Base:  Beat together margarine and sugar until fluffy.  Beat in eggs and brandy extract.  Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, ginger, nutmeg and allspice.  Add to creamed mixture; beat, until smooth.  Stir in instant oatmeal.  Spread batter into a greased 13 x 9 inch pan.  Bake 30 minutes.  Cool.
Frosting:  Beat margarine until light and fluffy.  Add icing sugar, a little at a time, beating after each addition.  Beat in brandy extract, a few drops at a time.  Chill.  Frost cookie base before cutting and top each bar with a walnut half.

Ingredient:
Base:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon soda
1/4 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon milk
1/4 cup white sugar
1/2 cup margarine
1 egg
1/2 cup jam
Ingredients:
Topping:
2 tablespoons margarine
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs, separated
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup coconut or nuts
Instructions:
base:  Measure flour, soda and sugar in bowl.  Mix and cut in margarine.  Beat egg and milk together.  Make well in dry ingredients and pour in liquid.  Mix and press in 9 inch pan.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes.  Cool.  Spread with jam.

Topping:
Cream butter and sugar together.  Blend in egg yolks, salt, vanilla and coconut.  Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into cream mixture.  Spread evenly over jam and pastry.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until brown.

Ingredient:
2 cups uncooked rice
2 cups boiling water
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
1 onion, chopped
1/2 lb ground beef
Ingredients:
1 large cabbage
1 1/2 cups tomato juice
2 tablespoons margarine, melted
3/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
Instructions: Add rice to boiling water and salt; bring to a boil, remove from heat and let stand until water is absorbed.  Saut degrees onions and meat; add to rice, cool.  Cut core from cabbage, remove outer leaves.  Place cabbage in a deep pan, pour boiling water in hollow until leaves are soft and pliable.  Drain, take leaves apart carefully.   Fill cabbage leaves with meat and rice mixture; roll up tightly.  Arrange rolls in layers in casserole; sprinkle a little salt on each layer.  Combine tomato juice, butter, salt and pepper.  Pour over cabbage rolled until liquid barely shows between the rolls; cover, bake for 1.5 hours.

Ingredient:
2 cups dry white beans
6 cups water
2 tablespoons onion, chopped
1/3 cup molasses
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons prepared mustard
2 tablespoons brown sugar
1/4 lb salt pork
Boiling water
Instructions: Bring beans and water to a boil in a covered saucepan.  Boil two minutes.  Remove from heat and let stand, covered for 1 hour.  Return to boil; reduce heat and simmer, covered for 40 minutes.  Drain beans, reserving 1 1/2 cups liquid.  Combine beans, bean liquid, onion, molasses, mustard and sugar in a casserole dish.  Make cuts in salt pork at 1/2 inch intervals.  Place in centre of beans.  Bake for 4 hours, stirring every hour.  If beans become dry during baking, add boiling water to moisten.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 lb boneless chicken breasts, cut in strips
4 cups Green Giant Frozen Valley Classic Vegetables
1 cup small whole mushrooms
1 medium onion, cut in wedges
Ingredients:
1 small red pepper, cut in thin strips
Sauce:
1/2 cup beef broth
3 tablespoons soy sauce
1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 tablespoon brown sugar
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
Instructions: In large skillet or wok, heat oil over medium high heat.  Add chicken, stir fry until browned.  Reduce heat to medium, add frozen vegetables, mushrooms, onion and red pepper.  Stir fry for 5 minutes. In small bowl combine all sauce ingredients.  Add sauce to wok; stir until thickened.  Cover and simmer for 2 minutes.  Serve with rice.

Ingredient:
250 g linguine or spaghetti pasta
2 packages (250 g each) Green Giant Frozen Cut Broccoli in Cheese Sauce
1 package (175g) cooked ham slices, cut in thin strips
Ingredients:
1/4 cup margarine
1 cup cream or milk
2 eggs, beaten
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
Instructions: Cook pasta as directed on package; drain.  Cook vegetable pouches as directed on package.  In large saucepan, combine cooked pasts, ham and butter.  With wooden spoon, stir over medium heat until butter melts. Remove from heat, stir in broccoli in cheese sauce.  In small bowl, combine cream and eggs; stir into pasta mixture.  Return to low heat and stir gently until sauce thickens.  Serve immediately, sprinkled with Parmesan cheese.

Ingredient:
2 large baking potatoes
1 package Green Giant Frozen Broccoli and Cauliflower in Cheese Sauce
Ingredients:
1 cup diced cooked ham or 1 can tuna, drained
1 cup grated cheddar cheese, divided
1 tablespoon chopped green onion
Instructions: Bake potatoes in microwave oven, set aside.  Microwave vegetable pouch as directed on package.  In medium microwavable bowl, combine vegetables, ham or tuna, 1/2 cup cheese and green onion.  Cook at high power for 1 minute, stir.  Cut potatoes in half lengthwise, scoop centres out slightly.  Place cut side up in microwaveable dish; spoon filling evenly into potatoes.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Cook, uncovered at high powder for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese melts.

Ingredient:
Crust:
1 1/3 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/3 cup margarine, melted
1/4 cup sugar

Filling:
3 packages cream cheese, softened
1 cup sugar
4 eggs
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups sour cream
2 teaspoons finely grated lemon peel

Topping:
1 package Frozen Whole Raspberries in Light Syrup, thawed
3 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup water
1 package Frozen unsweetened blueberries
1/3 cup orange juice
Instructions: In medium bowl, combine crust ingredients.  Press in bottom of 9 inch pan.  Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, cool.  Reduce oven to 350 degrees.  In large bowl beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Add sour cream and lemon peel; blend well.  Pour over crust.  Bake for 1 hour; turn off oven.  Leave cheesecake in oven with door open, until cool.  Refrigerate for several hours.  To prepare topping, drain syrup from raspberries and set aside. In saucepan, combine cornstarch and water.  Blend in raspberry syrup, stir over medium heat until sauce boils and thickens.  Boil sauce for 1 minute.  Remove from heat, stir in raspberries, frozen blueberries and orange juice.  Serve topping spooned over wedges of cheesecake.

Ingredient:
3 cups broccoli flowerets, cooked and drained
1 1/2 cups cubed cooked chicken or turkey
1 can Cream of Broccoli Soup
1/3 cup milk
Ingredients:
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
2 tablespoons dry bread crumbs
1 tablespoon margarine, melted
Instructions: In baking dish, arrange broccoli and chicken.  In small bowl, combine soup, milk and half of the cheese.  Pour over broccoli and chicken.  In cup, combine remaining cheese, bread crumbs and margarine, sprinkle over top.  Bake 10 minutes or until hot.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons margarine
1 small onion, sliced
1 can Broccoli Cheese Soup
1/3 cup milk
1/8 teaspoon pepper
Ingredients:
4 medium potatoes, cooked and sliced
3 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled
Fresh parsley for garnish
Instructions: In large skillet over medium heat, melt margarine.  Cook onion until tender. Stir in soup, milk and pepper.  Bring to boil.  Add potatoes, stirring carefully to coat slices.  Reduce heat to low.  Cover; simmer 5 minutes or until hot, stirring occasionally.  Sprinkle with bacon.  Garnish with parsley, if desired.

Ingredient:
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
5 medium pork chops
1 medium onion, chopped
1 1/2 cups sliced fresh mushrooms
Ingredients:
1 clove garlic, minced
1 can Cream of Mushroom Soup
1/2 cup milk
Instructions: In large skillet over medium high heat, heat oil.  Brown chops 3 minutes, on each side.  Remove.  Pour off fat.  In same skillet, cook onion, mushrooms and garlic, 2 minutes or until tender.  Stir in soup and milk. Bring to a boil.  Return chops to skillet.  Reduce heat to low.  Cover; simmer 20 to 25 minutes or until tender, turning chops halfway through cooking and stirring occasionally.

Ingredient:
Brownie:
1/4 cup soft margarine
2/3 cup white sugar
1/3 cup cocoa
1 egg white
1/3 cup skim milk
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
3/4 cup all purpose flour
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 cup chopped pecans

Icing:
1/2 cup sifted icing sugar
1 tablespoon cocoa
1 - 2 tablespoons skim milk
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions:
Brownie:  Melt margarine in medium saucepan.  Remove from heat. Add sugar and cocoa mixing until combined.  Add egg white, milk and vanilla.  Mix well.  Add flour, baking powder and baking soda, mixing until smooth.  Stir in nuts.  Spread batter evenly in 9 inch pan sprayed with nonstick cooking spray. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until done.  Cool
Icing:  Combine all ingredients using enough milk to make a smooth drizzle consistency.  Drizzle over brownie.  Let icing set about 30 minutes before cutting.

Ingredient:
1 unbaked pastry shell
1 can (19 oz) pumpkin pie filling
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
2 eggs
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon ginger
1/2 teaspoon salt
Whipped cream and nuts (optional)
Instructions: In large bowl combine filling ingredients; mix well and turn into crust.  Bake 15 minutes; reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees and continue baking 35 to 40 minutes or until done.  Cool before cutting.  Garnish with whipped cream and nuts if desired.  Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 eggs, slightly beaten
2 cups all purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1 (6 oz) package semi sweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup margarine
2 cups sifted icing sugar
2 eggs, slightly beaten
1 bag fruit flavoured miniature marshmallows
3/4 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: Cream margarine with brown sugar and eggs until light and fluffy.  Add flour and salt; mix until smooth.  Spread in an ungreased 9 inch pan.  Bake 25 minutes.  Cool.  Melt chocolate and margarine over low heat in a saucepan.  Stir constantly until smooth.  Remove from heat.  Stir in icing sugar and eggs. Beat until smooth.  Fold in marshmallows and nuts.  Spread over cookie base. Chill 2 hours.  Store covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup margarine
1 2/3 cups sugar
3 eggs
1 1/4 cups mashed bananas
2 1/4 cups all purpose flour
1 1/4 teaspoons baking powder
Ingredients:
1 1/4 teaspoons soda
1 teaspoon salt
2/3 cup buttermilk
2/3 cup chopped nuts
Instructions: Cream margarine and sugar; blend in eggs.  Add bananas and mix well.  Combine flour, baking powder, salt and soda; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk.  Stir in nuts.  Pour into greased and floured 13 x 9 inch pan.  Bake 45 to 50 minutes.  Cool.  Frost with Caramel Frosting.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1/4 cup milk
Ingredients:
1 cup brown sugar
3 cups sifted icing sugar
Instructions: Combine margarine, milk and brown sugar in saucepan; bring to boil stirring constantly.  Cool 10 minutes.   Gradually add icing sugar, beating until well blended.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter, melted
1 egg
1 cup sugar
1 3/4 cups flour
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon peppermint extract
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
1/4 bar paraffin wax
Instructions: Beat butter, egg and sugar together.  Combine flour and baking soda; add to butter mixture.  Stir in peppermint extract.  Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased baking sheets.  Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.  Remove from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.  In double boiler over hot (not boiling) water melt chips and paraffin.  Drop cookies into chocolate to coat.  Lift out with a fork and place on wire racks to harden.

Ingredient:
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
6 cups shredded coconut
2 teaspoons vanilla
Ingredients:
1 1/2 teaspoons almond extract
1 cup almonds, chopped or slivered
9 red or green candied cherries, quartered
Instructions: Combine all ingredients, except cherries, in a large bowl.  Blend well and drop by teaspoonfuls, one inch apart, onto a greased baking sheet.  Garnish each with a quarter glace cherry.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned.  Remove immediately to cookie rack to cool.

Ingredient:
1 cup margarine
1/4 cup sugar
2 cups all purpose flour
1 1/2 cups coconut
Ingredients:
2/3 cup chopped red or green maraschino cherries
1/4 cup raisins or currants
1/3 cup chopped walnuts or almonds
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
Instructions: Cream margarine and sugar together.  Blend in flour until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Pat dough evenly into a greased 9 inch square pan.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Combine remaining ingredients.  Spread evenly on shortbread.  Bake an 35 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool thoroughly and cut into bars.  Sprinkle with sifted icing sugar if desired.

Ingredient:
2/3 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
4 eggs
Ingredients:
1 cup sugar
2 tablespoons water
1/4 cup Robin Hood baking liquid unsweetened chocolate
2 cups whipping cream, whipped and sweetened
Instructions: Grease and line a jelly roll pan with waxed paper.  Grease again.  Combine flour, soda and salt.  Beat eggs in small bowl at high seed until light coloured, about 5 minutes.  Gradually add sugar, beating until thick.  Blend in water and chocolate baking liquid.  Fold dry ingredients into egg mixture gently but thoroughly.  Spread in prepared pan.  Bake for 15 to 17minutes or until cake is done.  Loosen edges and turn out of pan immediately onto tea towel sprinkled generously with sifted icing sugar.  Remove waxed paper and trim any crisp edges from cake.  Beginning at narrow edge, roll up cake in towel loosely.  Cool.  Unroll cooled cake.  Spread evenly with sweetened whipped cream.  Reroll.  Even ends by removing slice from each.  Use centres of slices for log bumps.  Frost log completely with Chocolate Butter Icing.  Score with fork to resemble bark.  Sprinkle with icing sugar if desired.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup butter
2 cups sifted icing sugar
2 tablespoons Robin Hood baking liquid unsweetened chocolate
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons milk
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Combine all ingredients.  Beat until smooth and of good spreading consistency.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups butter, softened
2 3/4 cups white sugar
5 eggs
1 teaspoon almond or vanilla extract
3 cups all purpose flour
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup light cream
1 jar maraschino cherries, drained and chopped
Sifted icing sugar to garnish
Instructions: Beat butter, sugar, eggs and extract in large bowl on low speed until blended, then on high speed 5 minutes until light and fluffy.  Combine flour, baking powder and salt.   Add dry ingredients alternately with cream to creamed mixture, mixing lightly after each addition.  Fold in cherries.  Turn batter into greased 12 cup bundt or tube pan.  Bake 65 to 75 minutes.  Cover with foil for last 10 minutes if becoming too brown.  Cool in pan 10 minutes.  Remove from pan; cool completely.  Dust with icing sugar before serving.

Ingredient:
10 squares semi sweet chocolate
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk, divided
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons vanilla
1 package white chocolate squares
Few drops green food colour (optional)
Instructions: In heavy saucepan over low heat, melt semi sweet chocolate with 1 cup Eagle Brand milk.  Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.  Spread half the mixture into wax paper lined 8 inch pan; chill 10 minutes or until firm.  Hold remaining chocolate mixture at room temperature.  In heavy saucepan over low heat, melt white chocolate with remaining Eagle Brand.  Remove fro mheat; stir in peppermint extract and food colour.  Spread on chilled chocolate layer; chill 10 minutes longer or until firm.  Spread reserved chocolate mixture on mint layer.  Chill 2 hours or until firm.  Turn onto cutting board; peel of paper and cut into squares.  Store loosely covered at room temperature.

Ingredient:
3 cups vanilla wafer cookie crumbs
1 1/3 cups Angel Flake coconut
1 cup finely chopped nuts
Ingredients:
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
1/4 cup rum
Additional coconut, chopped
Instructions: In large mixing bowl, combine crumbs, coconut and nuts.  Add Eagle Brand and rum; mix well.  Chill 4 hours.  Shape into 1 inch balls.  Roll in additional coconut.  Store tightly covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
3 packages bittersweet chocolate squares
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
1 tablespoon vanilla
Ingredients:
Coatings:
Finely chopped nuts, flaked coconut, chocolate sprinkles, cloured sprinkles, unsweetened cocoa powder or icing sugar
Instructions: In heavy saucepan, over low heat, melt chocolate squares with eagle Brand.  Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.  Chill 2 hours or until firm.  Shape into 1 inch balls and roll in coatings.  Chill 1 hour or until firm.  Store covered at room temperature.

Ingredient:
1 cup lukewarm water
2 teaspoons sugar
2 packages dry yeast (or 2 tablespoons)
3 cups hot water
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons shortening
1 tablespoon salt
3 cups cold water
16 cups flour
Instructions: Mix first 3 ingredients and let stand 10 minutes.  In very large bowl, add hot water, shortening and salt.  Let shortening melt.  Add cold water (mixture should be lukewarm).  Add yeast mixture and stir in flour.  Knead well.  Let rise til double in size, about 1 hour.   Knead and put in pans.  Let rise 1 hour.  Bake for 1 hour.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup vinegar
1 cup brown sugar
2 cups water
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons flour
1 cup ketchup
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and pour over meat.

Ingredient:
2 tablespoons margarine
1 clove garlic, minced
2 cups mixed fresh or frozen vegetables
Ingredients:
1 can Broccoli Cheese Soup
1 cup milk
1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
3 cups hot cooked fettucine
Instructions: Use favourite vegetable combination such as: sliced carrots, zucchini and mushrooms; broccoli and cauliflower flowerets and sliced red peppers; sliced carrot, sliced mushrooms and snow peas; frozen mixed vegetables in large pieces.  In large skillet over medium heat, melt margarine.   Stir fry garlic and vegetables until tender crisp.  Stir in soup, milk and cheese, bring to boil.  Reduce heat to low. Cover; simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Pour over fettuccine, toss to coat.

Ingredient:
4 chicken breast halves or legs
1 can Italian Style Tomato Soup
1 tablespoon packed brown sugar
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon water
1 tablespoon vinegar
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
Hot cooked rice or noodles
Instructions: Remove skin from chicken.  In baking dish, arrange chicken.  Bake 30 minutes.  In small bowl, combine soup, sugar, water, vinegar and sauce;  spoon over chicken.  Bake 30 minutes longer or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear.  Stir sauce before serving.  Serve with rice or noodles.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup butter
3 cups white sugar
3 eggs, beaten
6 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon salt
1 tablespoon and 1-1/2  teaspoons baking powder
Ingredients:
1-1/2 teaspoons baking soda
2-1/4 cups orange juice
3 tablespoons orange zest
3 cups chopped cranberries
1-1/2 cups chopped walnuts
Instructions: Grease three 8x4 inch loaf pans.  Blend together butter, sugar and eggs.  Sift together the flour, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Add to wet ingredients, alternating with orange juice.  Mix in the orange rind, cranberries and walnuts. Stir until just combined and pour into prepared pans.  Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups graham wafer crumbs
1/4 cup melted butter
3 1/2 ounce package lemon pudding and pie filling mix
Ingredients:
2/3 cup undiluted Carnation Evaporated Milk
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 cups well drained sliced peaches
Instructions: Mix crumbs and butter.  Save 1/4 cup mixture for topping.  Press 2 tablespoons of crumb mixture in bottom and up sides of 8 dessert dishes; chill.  Prepare pudding according to label directions for lemon meringue pie.  Cool; stir often.  Chill Carnation in refrigerator tray until soft ice crystals form around egos of tray (10 to 15 minutes).  Whip until stiff; add lemon juice.  Whip very stiff.  Beat cooled pudding until light and fluffy.  Fold Carnation into pudding.  Spoon into chilled dessert dishes.  Top with peaches and remaining 1/4 cup crumbs.  Chill until ready to serve.

Ingredient:
2/4 cup vegetable oil
1 cup white sugar
1 cup grated carrots
2 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla
Walnuts, crushed
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Dissolve sugar in oil.  Add dry ingredients.  Add carrot, then eggs, one at a time.    Bake for 30 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
2 cups white sugar
2 cups shortening
4 eggs
5 cups flour
Ingredients:
4 teaspoons cream of tartar
2 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
6 tablespoons milk
2 teaspoons vanilla
Instructions: Cream shortening and sugar together.  Add eggs.  Sift dry ingredients together.  Add to creamed mixture.  Stir in milk and vanilla.  Roll on floured board to 1/4 inch thickness.  Cut and place on greased cookie sheet.  Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
5 3/4 cups graham wafer crumbs
1/2 cup white sugar
1 1/4 cups margarine, melted
1 1/2 cups margarine, soft (chilled)
Ingredients:
3 cups icing sugar
3 eggs
3 cups whipped topping (liquid)
2 cups pineapple (well drained)
Instructions: Mix graham crumbs, sugar and melted margarine.   Press half or more of crumb mixture evenly in bottom of pan.  Heat in oven 3 to 5 minutes.  Cool.  In bowl, beat butter, icing sugar and egg until lightly fluffy.  Spread over bottom mixture.  Whip topping. Fold in pineapple.  Spread over margarine mixture.  Sprinkle with remaining cracker crumbs.  Chill at least 12 hours.

Ingredient:
1 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup margarine
1 egg
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1 small bottle cherries
1 cup juice from cherries plus water to fill
2 cups flour
1/2 cup walnuts
Instructions: Mix.  Stand 20 minutes.  Put in loaf pan and bake for 45 minutes

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
Ingredients:
3/4 cup mazola oil
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1 cup canned pumpkin
1 cup raisins
Instructions: Combine sugar and oil and mix well.  Add eggs, one at a time.  Add dry ingredients, slowly and pumpkin and raisins.  Bake for 55 to 60 minutes

Ingredient:
1/2 cup corn starch
1/4 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger
2 cloves garlic, minced
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1/2 cup soy sauce
1/4 cup cider vinegar
1/2 cup dry sherry or water
1 1/2 cups beef or chicken broth
Instructions: In jar combine first 5 ingredients.  Add remaining ingredients and shake until blended.  Store covered in refrigerator up to 2 weeks.  Shake well before using.

Ingredient:
3 1/2 cups flour
4 teaspoons baking powder
2 eggs, separated
1 cup sugar
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon butter or shortening
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
3/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons milk
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions: Sift flour and baking powder together twice.  Beat egg yolks.  Add sugar gradually.  Add creamed butter, salt, nutmeg and 2 tablespoons milk.  Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.  Blend in dry ingredients and remaining milk; alternately, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.  Add vanilla.  On lightly floured surface pat dough to 1/2 inch thickness.  Cut with doughnut cutter.  Fry in deep fat at a temperature of 360 degrees (A one inch cube of bread will brown in 1 minute).  Drain on absorbent paper.  Sprinkle with sugar.

Ingredient:
10 cups E.D. Smith Cherry or Apple Pie Filling
3 cups Sliced or Diced Drained, Canned Pears in light syrup
3/4 cup all purpose flour
3/4 cup Whole wheat flour
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 1/2 cups toasted wheat germ
Ingredients:
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
3/4 teaspoon cinnamon
3/4 cup soft tub margarine
2 cups rolled oats
1/3 cup slivered almonds or chopped pecans (optional)
Instructions: Spoon filling evenly into an ungreased 12 x 20 inch pan.  Distribute pears over filling.  Combine flours, sugar, wheat germ, salt and cinnamon in food processor.  Cut in margarine.  Add to oats in a mixing bowl; blend evenly.   Sprinkle over fruit mixture.  Sprinkle nuts over topping.  Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Ingredient:
3 cups semi sweet chocolate chips
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
Ingredients:
Dash salt
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
1/2 cup chopped nuts (optional)
Instructions: In top of double boiler, melt chocolate over boiling water, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat, stir in Eagle Brand, salt, vanilla and nuts.  Spread mixture evenly into a waxed paper lined 8 inch pan.  Chill 2 hours or until firm.  Turn fudge onto cutting board, peel off paper and cut into squares.   Tightly cover leftovers.

Ingredient:
1 (6-ounce) pie crust
 3 tablespoons cornstarch
 1 1/3 cups water
 1 (14-ounce) can Eagle degrees Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk (NOT evaporated milk)
 3 egg yolks, beaten
Ingredients:
2 tablespoons margarine or butter
 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
 1/2 cup flaked coconut, toasted
 2 medium bananas
 Lemon juice from concentrate
 Whipped cream, whipped
Instructions: In heavy saucepan, dissolve cornstarch in water; stir in Eagle degrees Brand and egg yolks. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat; add margarine and vanilla. Cool slightly.  Fold in coconut. Slice bananas; dip in lemon juice and drain. Arrange on bottom of pie crust. Pour filling over bananas; cover.   Chill 4 hours or until set. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with toasted coconut and sliced bananas if desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
1 cup rolled oats, uncooked
1 cup flour
1/2 cup flaked coconut
1/2 cup coarsely chopped walnuts
1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 cup margarine, melted
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
1/2 cup lemon juice
Instructions: In medium bowl, combine oats, flour, coconut, nuts, sugar, baking powder and butter; stir to form a crumbly mixture.  Set aside.  In medium bowl combine sweetened milk and lemon juice.  Pat 1/2 the crumb mixture evenly on bottom of 9 inch baking pan.  Spread milk mixture on top and sprinkle with remaining crumbs.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool thoroughly before cutting.  Loosely cover any leftovers.

Ingredient:
6 medium potatoes, peeled
2 slices dry bread
1 egg, beaten
1 onion, chopped
Ingredients:
1/2 stack soda crackers
1 tablespoon summer savory
1 tablespoon poultry seasoning
Salt and pepper
1 apple, peeled and diced
Instructions: Boil and mash potatoes.  Crumble bread and crackers and mix in. Stir in egg.  Add onion and apple.  Adjust seasonings to taste.

Ingredient:
1 cup semi sweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup peanut butter chips
Ingredients:
2 cups miniature marshmallows
2 cups rice krispies cereal
Instructions: In heavy saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate and peanut butter chips, stirring constantly until smooth.  Remove from heat.  Mix in marshmallows and cereal until well coated.  Turn out onto waxed paper and shape into  log by bringing long sides of waxed paper together and pressing firmly.  Wrap tightly in the waxed paper and chill until firm, about 1 hour; slice.  These can also be spread in a pan and cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1 cup white sugar
1 cup butter, softened
1 egg, separated
1/4 teaspoon almond extract
Ingredients:
2 cups all purpose flour
1 tablespoon water
1/2 cup chopped almonds
Instructions: In large bowl cream together sugar, butter, egg yolk and almond extract, blend in flour.  Beat at low speed for 2 to 3 minutes or until particles are fine.  Press onto bottom of greased 15 x 10 inch jelly roll pan.  In small bowl beat egg white and water until frothy; lightly brush on dough, discarding excess.  Sprinkle almonds over top, lightly pressing in place.  Bake 15 to 20  minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool completely in pan on wire rack.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup barbecue sauce
1/2 cup liquid honey
Ingredients:
1  to 2 tablespoons soy sauce
1/3 cup finely chopped onions
Instructions: Combine ingredients and mix well.  Simmer 5 minutes.  Spread on meat

Ingredient:
4 - 5 lb spareribs
Salt and pepper
Ingredients:
1/2 cup water
Honey Barbecue Sauce (see recipe)
Instructions: Place spareribs in large roasting pan.  Season to taste.  Add water.  Cover with foil and bake 30 minutes.  Remove foil and cook 15 more minutes.  Separate spareribs and broil, turning often, basting with Honey Barbecue Sauce until crisp and tender.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups flour
1 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/2 teaspoon salt
8 tablespoons butter
Ingredients:
1/2 cup sliced almonds
5 peaches
1 teaspoon lemon juice
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1/4 teaspoon almond extract
Instructions: Butter a 9 inch baking dish.  Combine flour, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg and salt.  Cut in the butter until the mixture is crumbly.  Mix in almonds.  Refrigerate.  Peel peaches and slice.  Toss sliced peaches with lemon juice, remaining sugar and nutmeg, the cornstarch and almond extract.  Pour the peach mixture in pan and sprinkle crumb topping on top.  Bake 45 minutes or until top is golden brown and juices are bubbling.  Serve warm or cooled.

Ingredient:
4 cups blueberries
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 cup water
2 cups all purpose flour
4 teaspoons baking powder
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons butter or shortening
3/4 cup milk
Instructions: In saucepan, combine blueberries, 1/2 cup sugar and water.  Cover, bring to boil, reduce heat and simmer about 5 minutes or until very juicy.  Meanwhile, make dumplings:  Combine flour, baking powder, 2 teaspoons sugar and salt.  Cut in butter until fine.  Add milk all at once, stirring with a fork to make a soft dough; don't over mix.  Quickly drop dough by heaping tablespoons onto simmering blueberry mixture.  Cover tightly and simmer for 15 minutes without lifting lid.  Serve hot.

Ingredient:
2 lb haddock fillets
3 teaspoons salt
1 cup milk
2 cups flour
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons baking powder
2 tablespoons cooking oil
2 eggs
Instructions: Heat fat to 375 degrees.  Cut fish in serving size pieces.  Sift flour, salt and baking powder together and roll fish in mixture.  Beat eggs and stir in milk an and oil.  Add flour left from coating the fish, and stir until smooth.  Dip fish pieces in this batter and fry one or two pieces at a time in hot fat.  Cook until dark golden brown and drain on paper towel.  Serve hot with French fries.

Ingredient:
1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
1 3/4 cups sifted icing sugar
1 egg
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
2 cups all purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
Variations:
Decadent Chocolate - Stir in 1/4 cup cocoa
Holiday Spice - Stir in 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon and 1/4 teaspoon allspice
Light Citrus - Stir in 1 teaspoon finely grated lemon, lime or orange peel
Instructions: In a large bowl, cream butter with icing sugar.  Beat in egg, then vanilla.  In a small bowl, using a fork, stir flour with baking powder and salt until all ingredients are well mixed.  Beat flour mixture in 2 batches, into butter mixture, just until flour is moistened.  Spoon half of dough into a row in center of a sheet of waxed paper.  Roll paper around dough and form into a 2 x 6 inch log.  Twist ends to seal.   Repeat with remaining dough.  Refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to 3 days.  Or wrap in foil and freeze for up to 2 months.  To bake, slice logs into 1/4 inch rounds.  Place round 1 1/2 inches apart on cookie sheets.  Bake until lightly browned about 9 minutes.  Transfer to a rack to cool.  Store in airtight container

Ingredient: 1 (6 oz) can frozen orange juice concentrate
Ingredients:
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 tablespoon prepared mustard
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and spread evenly over picnic shoulder and continue baking 10 to 20 minutes or until golden.

Ingredient: 4 tablespoons honey
Ingredients: 2 teaspoons prepared mustard
Instructions: Warm honey in saucepan.  Mix with mustard to form a smooth paste.  Spread evenly over picnic shoulder and continue baking for 10 to 20 minutes until golden brown.

Ingredient:
6 squares unsweetened chocolate
3/4 cup butter
6 eggs
3 cups sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
3/4 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
2 cups coarsely chopped walnuts

Chocolate Glaze:
4 squares semi sweet chocolate
1/4 cup plain yogurt
Instructions:
Melt chocolate and butter over hot water, stirring frequently.  In large bowl, at low speed, beat eggs, sugar, vanilla and salt until well blended.   Add chocolate mixture; increase speed to medium and beat 5 minutes.  Stir in flour and nuts just until blended.  Pour into greased and floured jelly roil pan.  Bake for 45 minutes or until brownies begin to pull away from sides of pan.  Cool completely in pan on wire rack.  Spread with chocolate glaze.

Chocolate Glaze:  Melt chocolate over hot water.  Remove from heat.  Slowly stir in yogurt until well blended.

Ingredient:
1 1/3 cups chocolate graham crumbs
1/3 cup butter, melted
1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
Ingredients:
1 cup extra smooth peanut butter
1 egg
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1/2 cup flaked coconut
Instructions: Combine crumbs and butter; press evenly over bottom of 13 x 9 inch pan.  Stir together condensed milk, peanut butter and egg; pour over base in pan.  Sprinkle with walnuts and coconut; press down gently.  Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool.

Ingredient:
1 cup all purpose flour
1/2 cup white sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 cup melted butter
1/2 cup lemon juice
2 eggs
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons finely grated lemon rind (optional)

Topping:
1/2 cup melted butter
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1/2 cup white sugar
Instructions:
Combine dry ingredients and blend well.  Melt butter.  Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice, eggs and lemon rind.  Stir egg mixture into dry ingredients and stir only to moisten.  Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until nicely browned.  Remove from pan while warm and dip in topping.
Topping:  Combine melted butter and lemon juice.  Measure sugar in separate dish.  Dunk top of muffins into butter, then sugar

Ingredient:
1 egg
1 (14 oz) can crushed pineapple
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup margarine, melted
1 1/2 teaspoons rum extract
Ingredients:
2 1/2 cups all purpose flour
3/4 cup coconut, toasted
1/2 cup white sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
5 maraschino cherries drained, and halved
Instructions:
Grease large muffin tins.  Beat egg in bowl with fork.  Blend in undrained pineapple, milk, margarine and extract.  Combine remaining ingredients, except cherries, in large bowl.  Stir liquid ingredients into dry ingredients, stirring until moistened.  Spoon into muffin tins, generously filling each to the top.  Place one cherry half in centre of each muffin.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool.  Store in airtight container.
To toast coconut:  Place on baking sheet, in oven, while preheating, for 3 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned.

Ingredient:
6 yams or sweet potatoes
3 ounces butter
3 ounces light rum
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon salt
Pinch freshly ground pepper
Cinnamon
Instructions: Wash yams, rub their skins with butter and bake until tender about 40 minutes.  Cut in half lengthwise and remove pulp, being careful not to break the skin.  Mash the pulp, add the butter and whip until smooth.  Season with salt and pepper and beat in rum.  Put mixture back in the shells, dust with a little cinnamon and place in oven to brown.

Ingredient:
1 cup butter or shortening
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
2 3/4 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup red and green cherries
Instructions: Blend shortening and sugar.  Add eggs and flavoring. Stir in dry ingredients and cherries.  Roll in a long smooth roll in aluminum foil or waxed paper.  Chill or freeze until needed.  Cut in thin slices and bake on slightly greased cookie sheet 6 to 8 minutes.

Ingredient:
Dough:
1 cup boiling water
1 tablespoon butter
1 teaspoon salt
3 cups flour
1 tablespoon sugar
1 package yeast or 1 tablespoon
1 teaspoon sugar
1/2 cup warm water
Ingredients:
Topping:
1/2 lb salami
1 lb pepperoni
Hamburger
1 lb bacon
Onion
Pizza Sauce
Green pepper
Mushrooms
1 lb mozzarella cheese
Instructions:
Dough:
Let water become warm before adding yeast mixture and flour.  Combine yeast and sugar in warm water and let stand 10 minutes.

Ingredient:
5 1/2 cups all purpose flour
2 teaspoons salt
1 lb tenderflake
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon vinegar
Water
Instructions:
Mix together flour and salt.  Cut in tenderflake with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles course oatmeal.  In a 1 cup measure, combine vinegar and egg.  Add water to make 1 cup.  Gradually stir liquid into tenderflake mixture.  Add only enough liquid to make dough cling together.   Gather into a ball and divide into 6 portions.  Roll out each portion on lightly floured surface.

Baked Tarts:  Line tart shells with dough.  Add filling and bake at 375 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or as directed in recipe.

Ingredient:
4 cans red sour pitted cherries
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1/4 teaspoon almond extract
1 cup all purpose flour
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
3 tablespoons margarine
1/2 cup skim milk
Instructions: Drain fruit, reserving 1/2 cup syrup.  Combine brown sugar, cornstarch and reserved syrup; add fruit.  Cook, stirring, until  mixture starts to boil; add almond extract.  Keep warm.  Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Cut in margarine.  Add skim milk, stirring to moisten.  Pour fruit mixture into 2 quart casserole dish.  Drop topping by spoonfuls onto mixture.  Bake for 20 minutes or until done.

Ingredient:
3 cups sugar
3/4 cup butter
2/3 cup canned milk (1 small can)
1 large package chocolate chips
Ingredients:
1 (7 oz) bottle marshmallow fluff
1 teaspoon vanilla
Nuts (optional)
Instructions: Bring to boil.  Boil 5  minutes stirring constantly.  Remove from heat add chocolate chips, marshmallow fluff and vanilla.  Add nuts if desired.  Pour into 9 x 13 inch pan.

Ingredient:
1 cup sifted flour
1/2 cup soft margarine
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup graham wafer crumbs
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1 cup chocolate chips
Instructions: Sift together flour and salt.  Cream butter and sugar.  Add  vanilla and eggs, beat well.  Stir in graham crumbs and mix well.  Add flour mixture, stir until thoroughly combined.  Add chocolate chips and stir until well mixed.  Spread in well greased 9 inch pan.  Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.  Cool.  Frost.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup (1-1/2 sticks) butter or margarine , softened
3 cups sugar
1 can (5 oz.) evaporated milk (2/3 cup)
1 pkg. (8 squares) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate
1 jar (7 oz.) JET-PUFFED Marshmallow Cr degreesme
Ingredients:
1 tsp. vanilla
1 cup chopped  Walnuts

*Or substitute 1 pkg. (12 oz.) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Real Chocolate Chips
Instructions: Microwave butter in 4-quart microwavable bowl on HIGH 1 minute or until melted. Add sugar and milk; mix well. Microwave 5 minutes or until mixture begins to boil, stirring after 3 minutes. Stir well, scraping down sides of bowl. Microwave 5-1/2 minutes; stirring after 3 minutes. Let stand 2 minutes.  Add chocolate; stir until melted. Add marshmallow and vanilla; mix well. Stir in nuts. Pour into greased 13x9-inch pan.  Cool at room temperature; cut into squares.

Ingredient:
Bottom:
2 cups graham wafer crumbs
1/4 cup melted butter
1/4 cup icing sugar
Ingredients:
Top:
1 can Eagle Brand milk
1 can fruit cocktail, drained
Extra cherries
Juice of one lemon
Instructions:
Bottom:  Mix all ingredients until crumbly.  Press into 9 inch pan and bake 5 minutes.

Top:   Mix ingredients and pour over bottom and bake 30 minutes.  Cool, top with whipped cream

Ingredient:
1/2  cup butter
1/4 cup milk
1/2 cup shortening
2 cups flour
1 1/4 cups sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon vanilla
1/8 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon almond extract
1 1/2 cups cherries (red or green, drained well)
1 1/2 tablespoons lemon juice
1/2 cup walnuts or almonds
4 eggs
1/2 cup flour
Instructions: Cream butter and shortening until fluffy, add sugar gradually mixing until creamy.  Add flavouring and then the eggs, one at a time, beating well.  Stir in milk.  Blend in all dry ingredients throoughly.  Slice cherries and chop nuts.  Add to 1/2 cup flour coating well.  Stir into above mixture.  Bake ina loaf pan that has been greased and lined with three layers of wax paper.  Bake for 1.5 hours or until done.  After cake has cooled 5 minutes turn on rack and cool well before storing.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup shortening
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
2 cups flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 small bottle cherries including liquid
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon soda
2 teaspoons vanilla
1 cup sour milk
Instructions: Blend shortening, sugar. Add beaten eggs and vanilla.  Add dry ingredients alternately with milk.  Add cherries including juice.  Bake 1.5 hours.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups rolled oats
1 cup flour
1 cup shortening
1 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon soda
Ingredients:
Filling:
1 lb dates
1 1/2 cups water
1 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla
Instructions:
Mix first 5 ingredients and press half in bottom of 9 x 12 inch pan.

Filling:  Combine and cook until thick.  Spread over base and cover with rest of crumbs.  Bake for 25 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup fine coconut
1 cup milk
2 cups white sugar
3/4 cup margarine
1 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
3 eggs, well beaten
2 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
Instructions: Soak coconut in milk for 10 minutes.   Meanwhile cream margarine and sugar; add vanilla, eggs, flour, baking powder and salt.  Stir in milk and coconut mixture; mix well.  Bake in a greased tube pan 50 minutes.  If if desired or make a thin glaze and let it drizzle down over the cake, decorate with thinly sliced cherries.

Ingredient:
2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
3/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup unsalted butter or margarine
1/2 cup granulated sugar
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon vanilla extract
1 cup finely chopped pecans
3/4 cup sifted confectioners sugar
Instructions: Butter two baking sheets. Onto a piece of wax paper, sift the flour and salt. In a medium-size bowl, with an electric mixer on high, cream the butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Blend in the vanilla.   Using a wooden spoon, stir in the flour mixture, then the pecans. Dust your hands with a little of the confectioners sugar and roll the dough into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on the baking sheets and bake for 25 minutes or just until light brown.  Transfer to racks to cool for 15 minutes, then roll in the confectioners sugar. These cookies keep well in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks. Do not freeze them.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine or butter
1 1/2 cups graham crackers crumbs
1 (7-ounce) package flaked coconut (2 2/3 cups)
1 (14-ounce) can Eagle Brand Sweetened
Ingredients:
Condensed Milk (NOT evaporated milk)
1 (12-ounce) semi-sweet chocolate chips
1/2 cup creamy peanut butter
Instructions:
In 13x9-inch baking pan, melt margarine in oven. Sprinkle crumbs evenly over margarine. Top evenly with coconut then Eagle Brand.   Bake 25 minutes our until lightly browned. In small saucepan, over low heat, melt chips with peanut butter. Spread evenly over hot coconut layer.
 Cool 30 minutes. Chill. Cut into bars. Store loosely covered at room temperature.

Ingredient:
3 cups semi-sweet chocolate chips (or milk-chocolate chips)
1 (14-oz.) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1/2 to 1 cup chopped nuts, optional
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

Marshmallow Fudge: Proceed as above, omit nuts and add additional 2 tbsp. butter to mixture; fold in 2 cups miniature marshmallows.
Ingredients:
Chocolate Peanut Butter Chip Glazed Fudge: Proceed as above, stir in 3/4 cup peanut butter chips in place of nuts.

Glaze: Melt 1/2 cup peanut butter chips with 1/2 cup whipping cream; stir until thick and smooth. Spread over fudge.
Instructions:
In heavy saucepan; over low heat, melt chips with Eagle Brand and salt. Remove from heat; stir in nuts if desired and vanilla. Spread evenly into wax paper lined 8- or 9-inch square pan
 Chill 2 hours or until firm. Turn fudge onto cutting board, peel off paper and cut into squares. Store covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup margarine or butter, melted
2 (8-oz.) packages cream cheese, softened
1 (14-oz.) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk (NOT evaporated milk)
3 eggs
1/4 cup Real Lemon Lemon Juice from Concentrate
1 (8-oz.) container sour cream, at room temperature
Raspberry Sauce, optional (recipe below)
Ingredients:
Raspberry Sauce:
In small saucepan, combine 2/3 cup syrup drained from 1 (10-oz.) package thawed frozen red raspberries, 1/4 cup red currant jelly or red raspberry jam and 1 tbsp. cornstarch. Cook and stir until slightly thickened and clear. Cool. Stir in raspberries. (Makes about 1 1/3 cups)

New York Style Cheesecake:
Omit sour cream. Increase cream cheese to 4 (8-oz.) packages and eggs to 4. Add 2 tbsp. flour after eggs. Proceed as above. Bake 1 hour and 10 minutes or until center is set. Cool. Chill. Serve as above
Instructions:
Combine crumbs, sugar and margarine; press firmly on bottom of 9-inch spring form pan.  With mixer, beat cream cheese in large bowl until fluffy. Gradually beat in Eagle Brand until smooth. Add eggs and Real Lemon; mix well.  Pour into prepared pan. Bake 50 to 55 minutes or until center is set; top with sour cream. Bake 5 minutes longer. Cool 1 hour. Chill at least 4 hours.
 Serve with Raspberry Sauce if desired. Store leftovers covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
3 (6-ounce) packages premium white chocolate chips
1 (14-ounce) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk (NOT evaporated milk)
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/8 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup chopped green candied cherries
1/2 cup chopped red candied cherries
Ingredients:
Rum Raisin White Fudge: Omit vanilla and cherries. Add 1 1/2 teaspoon of white vinegar, 1 teaspoon rum flavoring and 3/4 cups raisins.

Toasted Nutty White Fudge: Omit cherries. Add 1 cup chopped toasted nuts.
Instructions: Over low heat, melt chocolate with Eagle Brand, vanilla and salt. Remove from heat; stir in cherries. Spread into foil-lined 8 or 9-inch square pan.   Chill 2 hours or until firm.   Turn fudge onto cutting board; peel off foil and cut into squares. Store covered in refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 (8-oz.) package cream cheese, softened
1 (14-oz.) can Eagle Brand Sweetened Condensed Milk
1/3 cup Real Lemon Lemon Juice from Concentrate
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
Ingredients:
2 (4-oz.) packages Ready Crust Graham Cracker Pie Crusts (12 crusts)
Assorted fruit (strawberries, blueberries, bananas, raspberries, orange segments, cherries, kiwi fruit
1/4 cup apple jelly, melted (optional)
Instructions: With mixer, beat cheese until fluffy. Gradually beat in Eagle Brand until smooth. Stir in Real Lemon degrees and vanilla. Spoon into crusts.   Chill 2 hours or until set.   Just before serving, top with fruit; brush with jelly if desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
1 cup  all-purpose flour
1 egg, beaten
1/2 cup  granulated sugar
3 tablespoons melted or liquid shortening
2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 cup  milk
Ingredients:
1/2 teaspoon  salt
1 cup  well mashed bananas (about 2 medium bananas)
1/2 teaspoon  baking soda
1/2 cup  chopped nuts
3/4 cup  Quick Quaker Oats (uncooked)
Instructions: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and soda in a bowl. Stir in Quick Quaker Oats. Add remaining ingredients; stir only until dry ingredients are moistened. Fill medium sized greased muffin cups 1/2 full. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve piping hot.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup white sugar
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup margarine, softened
2 eggs
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
Ingredients:
1 3/4 cups all purpose flour
1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup unsweetened chocolate chips
1 cup coarsely chopped walnuts (optional)
Instructions: In large mixing bowl, combine sugars, butter, eggs and vanilla.  Beat at medium speed until well blended.  Add flour, cocoa, baking soda and salt.  Beat at low speed until soft dough forms.  Stir in chips and walnuts.  Drop dough by heaping tablespoons 3 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.  Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until set.  Let cool 1 minute before removing from cookie sheets.  Cool completely before storing.

Ingredient:
2 pkg. (8 squares each) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate
1 can (14 oz.) sweetened condensed milk
2 tsp. vanilla
1 cup chopped  Walnuts

Substitute toasted BAKER'S ANGEL FLAKE Coconut for walnuts.
Ingredients:
Chunky Peanut Butter Swirl: Prepare Fudge as directed, using 1 cup chopped dry roasted peanuts for the nuts. Drop 1/4 cup peanut butter by teaspoonfuls on top of Fudge. Swirl with knife to marbleize.

Double Chocolate Orange: Prepare Fudge as directed. Spread in pan. Before refrigerating Fudge, melt 1 package (6 squares) BAKER'S Premium White Chocolate as directed on package. Stir in 1/2 cup sweetened condensed milk and 1 tsp. grated orange peel. Spread over Fudge in pan.
Instructions:
Microwave chocolate and milk in large microwavable bowl on high 2 minutes or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring after 1 minute. Stir until chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in vanilla and nuts. Spread in foil-lined 8-inch square pan. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Cut into squares.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/3 cup evaporated milk
2 pkg. (8 squares each) BAKER'S Semi-Sweet Baking Chocolate
Ingredients:
3/4 cup powdered sugar, sifted
2 tsp. vanilla
1 cup chopped PLANTERS Pecans (optional)
Instructions: Spray 8-inch square pan with no stick cooking spray.  Mix corn syrup and evaporated milk in 2-quart saucepan. Add chocolate. Cook on medium-low heat until chocolate is completely melted, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar, vanilla and nuts. Beat with wooden spoon until thick and glossy. Immediately spread into prepared pan. Refrigerate 2 hours or until firm. Let stand at room temperature 15 minutes before cutting into 1-inch squares.

Ingredient:
Filling:
1 1/2 cups golden syrup
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla
2 1/4 cups chopped pecans
4 eggs, slightly beaten
6 squares semi-sweet chocolate, chopped
Ingredients:
Crust:
3 cups all purpose flour
1/2 cup sugar
1 cup butter, softened

Drizzle:
2 squares semi-sweet chocolate
Instructions:
Crust:
In a large bowl, beat flour, sugar and butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Press firmly and evenly into greased foil lined 15 x 10 inch cookie sheet with sides.  Bake for 20 minutes.

Filling:
Place 6 squares of chocolate and syrup in saucepan.  Over low heat, stir until chocolate melts; remove from heat.  Stir in sugar, eggs and vanilla until blended.  Stir in pecans.  Pour filling over hot crust; spread evenly.  Bake for 30 minutes or until filling is firm around edges and slightly soft in centre.   Do not over bake filling; it should be soft and slightly runny.  Cool in pan on rack.

Drizzle:
Melt chocolate over hot water or in microwave on medium power for 2 to 3 minutes.  Drizzle over top (use a small spoon dipped in melted chocolate.  Gently tap spoon over bars for a random drizzled effect).  Cool; cut into squares.

Ingredient:
8 squares Baker's Unsweetened Chocolate
1 1/2 cups butter
6 eggs
3 cups white sugar
1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
1 tablespoon vanilla
1 cup chopped walnuts

(Variations) Topping:
Sprinkle with chopped nuts and Baker's semi sweet chocolate chips before baking.  Sprinkle cooled brownies with icing sugar.
Ingredients:
Glaze:
Melt 1 square Baker's unsweetened chocolate with 1 tablespoon butter and 1/4 cup milk; blend until smooth.  Add 1 1/4 cups icing sugar; blend well.  Spread over 1 pan cooled brownies.

Rocky Road:
Sprinkle 2 cups Miniature marshmallows over 1 pan warm brownies.  Broil under pre-heated broiler until golden brown.  Drizzle with 1 square melted Baker's semi sweet chocolate.
Instructions: Melt chocolate and butter over hot water or in microwave on medium 4 minutes; remove and blend well.  Cool.  Beat eggs until lemon colored.  Gradually add sugar, beating until thick, about 3 minutes.  Stir in chocolate mixture.  Fold in flour, vanilla and nuts.  Pour into two greased and floured 8 inch square pans.  Bake for 35 to 40 minutes.  Do not over bake,  Freezes well.

Ingredient:
1 cup ketchup
1 tablespoon brown sugar
2 tablespoons vinegar
Ingredients:
1/4 teaspoon dry mustard
1/2 cup water
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
Instructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Boil any meat until done about 40 minutes for chicken pieces.  Simmer 1/2 hour at lowest heat on stove.  Make Hamburg into tiny balls for cooking.

Ingredient:
2 cups white sugar
1/2 cup margarine
1/2 cup milk
2 squares unsweetened chocolate
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon vanilla
2 1/2 - 3 cups rolled oats
1/2 teaspoon salt (optional)
1 cup coconut
Instructions: Put sugar, margarine, milk and chocolate in saucepan on stove.  Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and cook for 3 minutes,  add remainder of ingredients.  Drop by teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet and put in fridge to cool.

Ingredient:
Onions
Celery
Flour
Fish
Ingredients:
Potatoes
Savory (optional)
Salt
Pepper
Instructions: Dice onions and celery.  Saut degrees in large pot until transparent.  Add flour and stir into oatmeal consistency.  Add fish stock from whatever fish you are using.  After adding stock if still too thick add fresh milk.  If you like it thick add just enough milk to your liking.   (Don't forget your adding diced potatoes which will thicken it some more because of the starch).  Add diced potatoes.   Add savory to taste.  Slow cook until potatoes are done.  Add salt and pepper to taste.

Ingredient:
1 package cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup sour cream
1/2 cup miracle whip
1 bottle Heinz seafood chili sauce
Ingredients:
1 large onion, chopped
1 large green pepper, chopped
1 large red pepper, chopped
Mozzarella cheese, grated
Instructions: Blend together first three ingredients until smooth.  Put in 9 inch dish.  Put in layers seafood chili sauce, onion and peppers.  Spread with cheese.  Serve with taco chips or crackers.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup white sugar
2 eggs
1/2 cup milk
Ingredients:
3 bananas
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/3 teaspoon salt\
2 1/2 cups flour
Instructions: Blend all ingredients together.  Put in loaf pan and bake for 45 to 60 minutes.

Ingredient:
4 to 4 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 cup sugar
2 packages Fleischmann's Traditional or QuickRise Yeast
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
Ingredients:
3/4 cup warm milk (105 to 115oF)
1/2 cup warm water (105 to 115oF)
1/3 cup butter or margarine, softened
2 eggs
SPICE ISLANDS Poppy Seed or Sesame Seed, optional
Instructions:
In large bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups flour, sugar, undissolved yeast, and salt. Gradually add warm milk, warm water, and butter; beat 2 minutes at medium speed of electric mixer, scraping bowl occasionally. Add 1 egg and 1/2 cup flour; beat 2 minutes at high speed. With spoon, stir in enough remaining flour to make soft dough. Grease top; cover tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate 2 to 24 hours.   Remove from refrigerator. Punch dough down. Remove dough to lightly floured surface. Shape as desired. Place rolls, about 2 inches apart, on greased baking sheets (or in other pans as directed). Cover; let rise in warm, draft-free place until doubled in size, about 20 to 40 minutes.   Beat remaining egg; brush on rolls. If desired, sprinkle with poppy or sesame seed. Bake  for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from sheets or pans; let cool on wire racks.
PAN ROLLS: Divide dough into 18 equal pieces. Roll each piece into ball. Place 9 balls in each of 2 greased 8-inch round baking pans.
LUCKY CLOVERS: Divide dough into 18 equal pieces. Roll each piece into ball. Place balls in 18 greased 2 1/2-inch muffin pan cups. Let rise as directed. Just before baking: With scissors, snip each roll in half, then in quarters, cutting to bottom but not through roll.
CRESCENTS: Divide dough in half. Roll each half to 16-inch circle. With sharp knife, cut each circle into 12 wedges. Roll up tightly from wide end. Place rolls, with points down, on greased baking sheets. Curve ends to form crescents.
KNOTS: Divide dough into 24 equal pieces. Roll each piece to 9-inch rope. Tie loose knot in center of each rope.
COILS: Divide dough into 24 equal pieces. Roll each piece to 9-inch rope. Coil each rope and tuck end under coil.
TWISTS: Divide dough into 24 equal pieces. Roll to 12-inch ropes. Fold each rope in half and twist three to four times. Pinch ends to seal.
CLOVERLEAF ROLLS: Divide dough into 18 equal pieces. Divide each again into 3 equal pieces.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter, softened
1/4 cup white sugar
1 cup all-purpose flour
2/3 cup dried apricots
1 cup water
2 eggs
1 cup packed light brown sugar
Ingredients:
1/3 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 teaspoon lemon juice
1 cup chopped walnuts
3/4 cup flaked coconut
1/3 cup confectioners' sugar   for decoration
Instructions: In a medium bowl, mix together butter, sugar, and 1 cup flour.   Press into the bottom of an ungreased 9x13 inch pan.  Bake for 25 minutes. In small saucepan, bring apricots and water to a boil, and cook for 10  minutes. Drain, chop, and set aside to cool.  In a medium bowl, beat eggs and brown sugar. Stir in 1/3 cup flour, baking powder, salt, vanilla, and lemon  juice. Fold in nuts and chopped apricots. Stir in coconut, if desired. Pour over the prepared crust.  Bake for an additional 20 minutes, or until firm. Cool, and dust with confectioners' sugar before cutting into squares.

Ingredient:
1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 cup Sour Cream
1 cup KRAFT 100% Grated Parmesan Cheese, divided
Ingredients:
8 oz. spaghetti, broken in half, cooked and drained
3 cups frozen broccoli flowerets, thawed
2 cups chopped cooked turkey
Instructions: Mix soup, sour cream and 3/4 cup of the Parmesan cheese in large bowl. Add spaghetti, broccoli and turkey; mix lightly. Spoon into 2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Ingredient:
3 cups flour
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon cloves
Ingredients:
1 cup butter or margarine, softened
2 eggs, beaten
1 teaspoon vanilla
Raspberry or strawberry jam
Instructions: Sift dry ingredients together. Cream butter, then add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Add dry ingredients. Spread half mixture in a greased 10 x 15-inch cookie sheet. Spread generously with jam. Crumble remaining dough over jam. Bake  for 45 minutes or until lightly browned.

Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1/2 cup almonds, sliced
Ingredients:
3/4 cup butter
1 egg yolk
1 cup candied cherries
Instructions: Cream butter and add sugar gradually. Cream together until fluffy. Add egg yolk and mix well. Add flour, a small amount at a time. Add vanilla, cherries, and almonds. Roll into 2-inch logs. Refrigerate until firm or overnight. Slice thinly. Bake on greased sheet for 4 to 5 minutes or until lightly browned.

Ingredient:
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon plus 2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
2 teaspoons baking soda
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
3 cups granulated sugar
Ingredients:
1 can (15 oz.) Libby's 100% Pure Pumpkin
4 large eggs
1 cup vegetable oil
1/2 cup orange juice or water
1 cup sweetened dried, fresh or frozen cranberries
Instructions: Grease and flour two 9 x 5-inch loaf pans.  Combine flour, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda and salt in large bowl. Combine sugar, pumpkin, eggs, vegetable oil and orange juice in large mixer bowl; beat until just blended. Add pumpkin mixture to flour mixture; stir just until moistened. Fold in cranberries. Spoon batter into prepared loaf pans.  Bake for 60 to 65 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans on wire racks for 10 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 pounds lean ground beef
1/2 cup crushed buttery round crackers
3/4 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
Ingredients:
1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
2 eggs, beaten
1/4 cup ketchup
2 tablespoons steak sauce
Instructions: In a large bowl, stir together ground beef, crushed crackers, cheddar cheese and onion soup mix until well combined.
