Begin by soaking maraschino cherries (with stems) in liquor for 4-7 days.  One with cherry vodka; the other with white creme de cacao. I soaked my cherries right in the jar they came in. Just empty out the red syrup and fill the jar with the liquor.  Once they have soaked for the specified time, drain off the liquor. (You can save this for cocktails.)
Then, dry the cherries on a paper towel. This will help the chocolate to stick.  Cover a cookie sheet with wax paper and set aside. In a double boiler (or the microwave), melt your chocolate chips and shortening. (The shortening  prevents the chocolate from getting really hard.) Stir until smooth.  Next, dip the cherries into the chocolate and set on wax paper. Add any leftover melted chocolate to a plastic baggie. Cut a very small section of the  tip of the bag and pipe lines or designs on the cherrie

Ingredient:

Ingredients:
3 eggs
2/3 cup milk
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1 teaspoon baking powder
Instructions:
Mix all ingredients together.  Spoon into prepared muffin cups.
Bake at 375 for approximately 20 minutes or until tops are lightly browned.
For ALMOND POPPYSEED MUFFINS: use a white cake mix, add 2 teaspoons poppyseeds, and 1 tsp almond extract.
FOR CHOCOLATE MUFFINS: use a chocolate cake mix and stir in 1 1/2 cup chocolate chips.
Create your own: use whatever flavor cake mix you want and add your own goodies.
French vanilla cake mix and fresh raspberries.

Spice cake mix with cinnamon/sugar topping

RecipeName:
Lemon Poppy Seed Loaf Cake -
with lemon glaze!
Ingredient:
2 cups flour
1 1/2 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp baking soda
2 Tbsp poppyseeds
zest of 2 lemons, finely minced
 degrees cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
Ingredients:
2 eggs
1 tsp vanilla extract
Juice of one lemon + enough milk to measure 1 cup
For the glaze
1/3 cup sugar
juice of one lemon
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan well and line with parchment paper.  Add the sugar and lemon zest to the bowl of an electric mixer and mix together on low speed for a few minutes. This helps to release all of the flavour in the zest.   Add the butter to the sugar and lemon zest and cream until light and fluffy on medium speed,
about 5 minutes  Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Beat in the vanilla extract.  Mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and poppyseeds.  Add the dry ingredients alternately with the milk/ lemon juice mixture, beginning and ending
with the dry ingredients. In general, I add the dry ingredients in 3 portions and the milk in 2 additions.  Spread batter evenly into the prepared pan.  Bake at 350 degrees F for about 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.  Let the cake rest in the pan for 5 minutes then remove it from the pan and set on a wire rack to
cool and be glazed.
To prepare the glaze
In a very small saucepan combine the sugar and lemon juice and bring to a simmer for only 2-3 minutes. Large bubbles should begin to appear at this point, indicating that it has reached a syrupy stage.  As soon as the cake comes out of the pan and is still hot, begin brushing on the lemon glaze over the top. You will need to do this in several coats, waiting a minute or so between coats to allow the glaze to absorb into the cake.  Allow to cool fully before slicing and serving. Store leftovers in an airtight container.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 cup sugar
1 cup packed brown sugar
1 egg
1/4 cup milk
2 tablespoons lemon juice
3 cups all-purpose flour
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon baking soda
1 package (12 ounces) fresh or frozen cranberries, chopped
1 cup chopped walnuts
Instructions: In a large bowl, cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in egg. Beat in milk and lemon juice. Combine dry ingredients; add to creamed mixture and mix well. Stir in cranberries and nuts.   Drop by heaping teaspoonfuls 2 in. apart onto greased baking sheets. Bake at 375 degrees for 13-15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on wire racks.

Ingredient:
1 teaspoon plus 2 tablespoons butter, divided
24 ounces Baker's white baking chocolate, coarsely chopped
Ingredients:

1/3 cup Kahlua (coffee liqueur)
Instructions: Line a 9-in. square pan with foil; grease foil with 1 teaspoon butter. In a large heavy saucepan, cook and stir white chocolate over low heat until melted. Add milk and remaining butter; stir until blended. Remove from heat; stir in pecans and Kahlua.  Spread into prepared pan. Refrigerate, covered, 2 hours or until firm. Remove foil; cut fudge into 1-in. squares. Store between layers of waxed paper in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Ingredient:
1 cup undiluted Carnation Evaporated Milk
1 cup water
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 envelope (3 ounces) instant
mashed potato crystals
Ingredients:
1 cu p (7 3/4 ounce can) drained , flaked salmon
1/2z cup f inely chopped celery
1/4 cup f inely chopped onion
1 tablespoon lemon ju ice
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1/3 cup prepared cornflake crumbs
Instructions:
Heat Carnation, water and salt to just below boiling. Remove from
heat. Stir in instant potato crystals vith a fork. Beat until liquid is fully absorbed.  Add salmon, celery, onion, lemon juice and pepper. Mix well. Divide mixture into 8 heaping 1/3 cup portions and shape into 5-inch long bars.  Roll in cornflake crumbs. Place on a buttered baking sheet. Bake in a moderate oven (350"F.) 15 minutes.  Serve with your favourite fish sauce.

Ingredient:
6 cups powdered sugar
1/4 - 1/2 cup whole milk
1/4 cup light corn syrup
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons almond extract
Food coloring (in desired colors)
Instructions:
In the bowl of a stand mixer (or using an electric mixer) combine
sugar and 1/4 cup milk.  Miox until smooth.  Add milk as need to create a smooth mixture, one tablespoon at  a time. Add corn syrup and
almond extract. To decorate cookies, your outline icing should be the
consistency of toothpaste, your flood icing should be the consistency of
corn syrup  Add food coioring one drop at a time until desired color
is reached. Pour into bottles, decorator bags or a cup' Keep unused icing sealed until ready to use.

Ingredient:
2 1/2 cups cake flour (not self-rising),
plus more for dusting
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature
Ingredients:
3/4 cup sugar
1 large egg
1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract ' Basic royal icing, gel food coloring and edible pearls, for decorating
Instructions:
Sift the cake flour,baking powder and salt into a bowl; set aside. Beat the butter and sugar in a large bowl with a mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add the egg and vanilla; beat until incorporated. Reduce the mixer speed to low and beat in the flour mixture in 2 batches untiljust incorporated. Divide between 2 pieces of plastic wrap; shape into disks. Wrap and refrigerate until firm,
at Ieast t hour.  Line 2baking sheets with parchment paper. Working with 1 disk at a time, roll out the dough on a floured surface until about L/ainch thick. Cut out shapes with cookie cutters; arrange2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets. (lf the dough becomes soft, refrigerate until firm.) Refrigerate the cookies 30 minutes.  Gather the scraps and refrigerate until firm; reroll and cut out more cookies.
Position racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and preheat to 350'.  Bake, switching the pans halfway through, until the cookies are slightly puffed and just golden, 13 to 15 minutes. Let cool 5 minutes on the baking sheets, then remove to racks to cool completely before icing.

RecipeName:
Paaintbruch Icing for  Sugar Cookies
for Sugar Cookies
Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups icing sugar, plus
more if needed
4 tsp milk, plus more if needed
Ingredients:
11/2 tsp lemon juice
assorted food colourings
Instructions:
Sift icing sugar into large bowl.  Mix in milk and lemon juice until
smooth. lcing should be thickness of honey. lf too thick, stir in additional
milk, 1 tsp a time; if too thin, stir in additional sifted icing sugar, about 2 tbsp at a time.  Divide icing among multiple dishes.  Keeping to a single food colouring in each dish, mix in a few drops to create desired shade.  Using one small clean paintbrush for each colour, brush icing onto plain sugar cookies. To avoid smearing, allow each colour to dry before proceeding with next colour. Let icing on cookies dry, about 15 min.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup pure maple syrup
1/2 cup melted butter
Ingredients:
Salt and pepper, to taste
12 ears of corn, husks and silks removed
Instructions:
Preheat the grill to high. In a bowl, combine the maple syrup, butter, salt and pepper. Set aside.  Tear off 12 pieces of aluminum foil to wrap the individual ears. Place 1 corn ear on a sheet  of foil and baste the corn with the maple-butter mixture, then tightly wrap the foil around it.
Repeat with all ears. PIace corn on the grill and close the cover.  After 4 minutes, give the corn a quarter turn and close the cover. Repeat three times, until all four sides have been grilled (a tota! of 16 minutes).

Ingredient:
2 large eggs
2 cups milk
1/2 cup sugar
1/4 cup butter, melted
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon salt
6 cups cubed day-old bread
1/2 cup golden raisins, optional
Ingredients:
BROWN SUGAR BUTTER SAUCE:
1/2 cup butter
1 cup packed brown sugar
3 tablespoons unsweetened apple juice
2 teaspoons rum extract
1 drop orange extract
Instructions: In a large bowl, whisk eggs, milk, sugar, butter, cinnamon and salt. Gently fold in bread cubes and raisins if desired. Transfer to a greased 8-in. square baking dish. Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.  In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt butter; stir in brown sugar and apple juice. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved. Remove from the heat; stir in extracts. Serve warm with bread pudding. Refrigerate leftovers.

Ingredient:
12 large eggs
1-1/2 cups sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 quarts whole milk, divided
2 tablespoons vanilla extract
Ingredients:
1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
2 cups heavy whipping cream
Whipped cream, additional nutmeg and cinnamon sticks, optional
Instructions: In a heavy saucepan, whisk together the eggs, sugar and salt. Gradually add 1 qt. milk. Cook and stir over low heat until a thermometer reads 160 degrees, about 25 minutes. Pour into a large bowl; stir in vanilla, nutmeg and remaining milk. Place bowl in an ice-water bath; stir frequently until cool. If mixture separates, process in a blender until smooth. Cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours.  When ready to serve, beat cream in a bowl on high until soft peaks form; whisk gently into cooled mixture. Pour into a chilled 5-qt. punch bowl. If desired, top with dollops of whipped cream, sprinkle with nutmeg and serve with cinnamon sticks.

Ingredient:
1/3 cup ketchup
3 Tbsp  fish sauce
2 Tbsp dry  sherry
2 Tbsp sugar
1 Tbsp canola oil
1 Tbsp fresh ginger, grated
3 garlic cloves, minced
Ingredients:
1 rack pork loin back ribs
1 large pineapple, peeled,
quartered lengthwise and cored
3 tbsp butter melted
2 tbssp honey
Instructions:
Prepare the marinade: ln a medium bowl, combine all marinade ingredients. Reserve 1/2 cup.  Combine remaining marinade and ribs in a large resealable bag and toss to coat. Marinate, refrigerated, at least 2 hours or up to overnight.  Arrange oven rack in upper third of oven. Preheat oven to 300 F.   Place a wire rack on a foil-lined baking sheet. Remove ribs from marinade.  Place ribs, meaty side up, on rack. Bake ribs for 45 minutes. Remove ribs from oven and baste with some reserved marinade. Return ribs to oven for 45 minutes. Remove ribs and baste again. Return ribs to oven and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the meat pulls away from the bone. Transfer ribs to
a cutting board; cover and keep warm.  Preheat grill to medium-high. Cut each pineapple quarter lengthwise into 1/2 inch pieces.  In a cup, mix butter and honey; brush half on pineapple   Grill pineapple 3 to 4 minutes, brushing with the remaining butter and honey, until browned and hot. Grill ribs, uncovered, for 4 to 5 minutes or until evenly charred, turning ribs halfway through grilling. Remove from grill and rest 3 minutes before serving .

Ingredient:
6 Tbsp. butter melted {I use 36 Golden Oreo Cookies
6 tablespoons butter. Melted

Ingredients:

Instructions:
In a food processor, pulse the Oreo cookics until they are fine crumbs. Combine the crumbs and the butter until crumbs are fully coated.   Press the mixture into a 9x13 inch baking dish.  Place the dish in the refrigerator while you work on the other layers.  In a medium bowl  whip the cream cheese and sugar on medium-low speed. Add the milk and mix until fully incorporated.  With a spatula, fold in 1 1/4 cups cool whip until completely uniform. Spread this mixture evenly over your crust.  In another medium bowl, combine the 3 1/4 cups milk with both of the pudding packages. Whisk constantly until the pudding thickens and creates soft peaks. Spread this layer evenly over the previous layer.
Let the dessert rest for about 5 minutes, to let the pudding fully thicken up. Spread the remaining Cool Whip over the top.  Spread the toasted coconut evenly over the top.  Make sure that it is completely cooled before adding it.   Let dessert sit in the freezer for 1 hour or in the
refrigerator for 4 hours before serving.

Ingredient:

Be sure to use it on cooled layer cakes and refrigerate it after it is mixed and/or on the cake. You can use fat free milk if you want to but it is no where near as rich,
thick and creamy

Ingredient:
STRAWBERRIES
2lbs fresh strawberri degreess, washed, hulled and chopped
3 tbsp  sugar
FILLING
8 oz cream cheese, room temperature
1 1/4 cup  sugar
2 3/4 cups heavy whipping cream, cold
1 1/4 cups powdered sugar
Ingredients:
2 tsp vanilla extract
6 oz  lady fingers
GRAHAM CRACKER CRUMBLE TOPPING
1/3 cup graham cracker crumbs (about 3 graham cracker sheets)
l tbsp  sugar
Pinch of salt
2 1/2 tbsp unsalted butter, melted
Strawberries, for decorating
Instructions:
Combine the chopped strawberries and sugar and set aside while you make the rest of the filling.  Add the cream cheese and sugar to a large mixer bowl and beat until well combined and smooth. Set aside.   ln another large mixer bowl, combine the heavy whipping cream, powdered sugar and vanilla extract and whip on high speed until stiff peaks form.  Add about 1/3 of the whipped cream to the cream cheese mixture and gently fold to combine. Continue adding another third of the whipped cream to the cream cheese mixture until all has been combined.  Add the strawberries (without the juices) to the cream cheese mixture and gently fold together.  Place a full layer of lady fingers in the bottom of a 9x13 inch cake pan.  Add about half of the strawberry cream cheese mixture to the top of the lady fingers and spread into an even layer.  Add another full layer of lady fingers on top of the strawberry layer, then add the remaining strawberry cream cheese mixture and smooth into an even layer.  Place the icebox cake into the fridge to set, about 4-5 hours.  While the cake is in the fridge, make the graham cracker topping. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.   Combine the crumbs, sugar, salt and melted butter and stir together until well combined.  Spread the mixture evenly onto a parchment paper or silicone baking mat lined cookie sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes, until the edges of the mixture start to brown.  Remove from oven, allow to cool for a few minutes, then break into crumble pieces.
Once the crumble is cooled, sprinkle on top of the icebox cake along with some additional strawberries. Let the icebox cake continue to set in the fridge until you are ready to serve it.  lcebox cake is best for 2-3 days, or as long as the strawberries stay frsh.
You can use two 3 oz packages of the softer, more sponge cake-like ladyfingers. Not the firm ones. I find them in the bakery section
of our grocery store. lf you're unable to flnd them in your area, you could substitute them with Nilla Wafer cookies or shortbread cookies. lf you use the cookies, l'd suggest dipping them in milk quickly before adding them to help them soften up.  The graham cracker crumble could be baked or not baked. I like it baked because it gives it a litt[e more crunch that stayes crunchy even in the fridge, but it would be fine either

Ingredient:

Instructions:

Set aside.  ln a small saucepan over medium heat, mett  1/2 cup butter.  Place reserved, chopped mushroom stems in the pan, and slowly cook and stir untit soft.   Stir in the flour to coat mushroom stems. Mix in green onions, sherry, minced clams and 1/2 their reserved juice (discard rernainder), garlic, bread crumbs, pepper, ltalian-styte seasoning and bacon bits.
Continue cooking approximatety 3 rninutes, until all ingredients are well mixed. Remove from heat and stir in Romano cheese. Altow mixture to cool approximately 5 minutes.  Fill the mushroom caps generousty with the mixture. Drizzle with melted butter.  Bake in the preheated oven 20 to 25 minutes, untit tightly browned. Serve with lemon wedges.

Ingredient:
12 whole fresh mushrooms

1 tablespoon minced garlic
1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
Ingredients:
1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
1/4  teaspoon onion powder
 1/4 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper
Instructions:
Spray a cooking sheet with cooking spray.  Clean mushrooms with a damp paper towel.  Carefully break off stems.  Chop stems extremely fne, discarding tough end of stems.  Heat oil in a large skillet over
medium heat. Add garlic and chopped mushroom stems to the skillet.
Fry until any moisture has disappeared, taking care not to burn garlic.
Set aside to cool. When garlic and mushroom mixture is no longer hot,
stir in cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, black pepper, onion powder
and cayenne pepper. Mixture should be very thick Using a little
spoon, fill each mushroom cap with a generous amount of stuffing.   Arrange the mushroom caps on prepared pan.  Bake 20 minutes or uyntil the mushrooms are piping hot and quid star form under skins.

Ingredients:

Ingredient:

Ingredients:

RecipeName: Hawaiian Hamburgers with Sweet & Sour Sauce
Ingredient:
Burger Mixture
2/3 cup (small can) Carnation Evaporated Milk
1 1/2 lbs ground beef
1/2 cup chopped onion
2/3 cup cracker crumbs
1 teaspoon seasoned salt
Ingredients:
Sweet & Sour Sauce
15 oz can drained pineapple chunks (save the  syrup)
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup vinegar
1/4 cup brown sugar
2 tablespoons soy sauce
1 cup coarsely chopped green pepper
Instructions:
Combine burger mixture ingredients.  Form 4 8 inch patties by pressing each between pieces of wax paper.  Brown patties in skillet in small amount of fat.  Make sauce.
Saucxe
Add water to pineapple syrup to make one cup.  In saucepan mix syrup with cornstarch, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce,  Cook stirring until thick and clear.  Pour excess fat off burgers, in skillet, cover with sauce.  Add pineapple chunks and peppers.  Cover, simmer over low heat 15 minutes.

Ingredient:
1/2 cup margarine, melted
2 cups Graham Wafer Crumbs
1 egg
1/2 cup soft margarine
Ingredients:
1 1/2 cups icing sugar
Cool Whip
1 14 oz can  crushed pineapple, well drained
Instructions: Mix margarine and Hraham Wafer Crumbs together.  Keep 1/4 cup for topping.  Press mixture into 13 inch baking pan.  Bake for 5 minutes.  Let cool completely.  Beat egg and soft margarine together addding icing sugar and beat until fluffy.  Spread over baked crumbs.  Mix pineapple nd whipped cream together and spread on top.   Sprinkle remaining crumnbs over top

Ingredient:
2 tbsp butter
1 medium yellow onion, diced
2 medium cloves garlic, minced
2 cups tomato sauce
1 1/2 cups roughly chopped frozen dark sweet cherries
1/3 cup dark brown sugar
Ingredients:
1/3 cup  orange juice, freshly squeezed
1/4 cup molasses
1/4 cup cider vinegar
1 tsp chili powder
2 tsp kosher salt
2 tsp frshly ground white pepper
Cayenne pepper to taste
Instructions: Melt butter in  medium saucepan over medium heat.   Add onion and cook until softened, about five minutes.  Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.  Add tomato sauce, cherries, btown sugar, orange juice, molasses, cider vinegar,  chili powder, white pepper and cayenne and stir to combine.  Bring to boil, then reducd to heat to low and simnmer until slightly thickened, about 30 minutes, stirring occasinally.  Transfer sauce to blender and blend lightly  for chunkier texture.  Le tcool to room temperature, transfer to a jar and store in the refrigerator for up to one month.

Ingredient:
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 egg
1/2 cup chopped nuts
1 cup coconut
3/4 cup flour
1/2 tsp salt
1 tsp bakng powder
Ingredients:
1 tsp maple extract
Frosting
1/4 cup butter
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 tbsp milk
1 cup iciing sugar
2 tsp maple extract
Instructions:
In saucepan melt 1/2 cup butter then add 1 cup brown sugar..  Remove fron heat and add remaining batter ingredients.  Press into greased 8 x  8 inch pan.  Bake 20 minutes.  Cool.
Frosting:   Place in a saucepan butter and bown sugar.  Bring to a boil.  Set in cold water and add 1 cup icing sugar and maple exract . Stir until smooth  Spread over squares.

Ingredient:
1 (8 ounce) packages of cream cheese, softened
 1 (8 ounce) cans of crushed pineapple, well drained
Ingredients: 2 to 1/2 cups of sweetned shredded coconut
Instructions: Push as much juice out as possible with a fine strainer when draining the pineapple. This process makes the mixture a bit more firm and easier to work with.  In a small bowl, beat cream cheese and pineapple. Mix well.  Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.  Once done, roll mixture into 1-inch balls.  Then roll in coconut.  Refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight.

Ingredient:
3 large firm apples, peeled and sliced into wedges
3 tbsp butter
pinch salt
3 tbsp brown sugar
1/4 tsp cinnamon
For the Bread Pudding
3 cups bread cubes  French, Italian or Belgian bread)
1/4 tsp freshly grated nutmeg
1/2 tsp cinnamon
 degrees cup whipping cream
 degrees cup milk
Ingredients:
1 egg
1 egg yolk
1/3 cup sugar
1  degrees tsp vanilla extract
Pinch salt
For the Oatmeal Crumble Topping
1 tsp baking powder
2/3 cups rolled oats
2/3 cups flour
1/3 cup brown sugar
1/2 cup butter, cut in small cubes
Instructions
1. Begin by saut degreesing the apple wedges,
Instructions:
Begin by saut degreesing the apple wedges, butter, brown sugar, salt, and cinnamon together in a medium non-stick pan.  Saut degrees for only a couple of minutes; you want the butter and sugar to caramelize together, but you don degreest want the apples to become too soft.  Set aside to cool.
To prepare the Bread Pudding layer
Grease a 9 degrees x 9 degrees baking dish well. A slightly larger baking dish will work too.  Toss the bread cubes with the grated nutmeg and cinnamon, and then place the spiced bread cubes into the greased baking dish.  Whisk together the whipping cream, milk, 1 egg and 1 egg yolk, sugar, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt.  Pour the mixture evenly over the bread cubes, pressing down slightly to make sure all the cubes are soaked. Leave them to soak while you make the crumble.
To prepare the Oatmeal Crumble Topping
Preheat the oven to 350 degreesF. In a large bowl, toss the baking powder, rolled oats, flour, and brown sugar together.  Using your hands, rub the small cubes of butter thoroughly through the dry ingredients.
When the butter is fully incorporated into the dry ingredients, layer the apples evenly over the bread pudding layer.  Drizzle any of the caramel from saut degreesing the apples over the bread pudding as well.  Press the crumble together in handfuls and then crumble it over the apples by breaking off small  pieces about the size of the top of your little finger.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 35 to 40 minutes or until the top is evenly golden brown and the custard beneath is set. A clean butter knife inserted into the center of the pan will determine if the custard beneath is still liquid.  Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack for 20 to 30 minutes before serving with a generous drizzle of Homemade Caramel Sauce

Ingredient:
For the bread pudding
5 cups bread cubes (French, Italian or Belgian bread.)
1 tsp cinnamon
1/2 tsp nutmeg
1 cup whipping cream
1 cup milk
2 eggs
2 egg yolks
2/3 cup sugar
Ingredients:
1 tbsp vanilla extract
Pinch salt
For the Maple Apples
4-5 large apples
1/4 cup butter
1 tsp cinnamon
1/4 cup brown sugar
3/4 cup maple syrup
1/3 cup whipping cream
Instructions:
To prepare the bread pudding
Grease an 8x8 inch baking dish well.  In a bowl, toss the bread cubes with the nutmeg and cinnamon.  Place the spiced bread cubes into the greased baking dish.  Whisk together the whipping cream, milk, egg yolks, eggs, sugar vanilla and salt.   Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved.  Pour the mixture evenly over the bread cubes, pressing down slightly to make sure all the cubes are soaked.  Bake in a 350 degree oven for about 45-50 minutes until the custard is set and no longer liquid in the center.  Let the bread pudding stand for about 20 minutes before serving.  Serve with the apples and maple caramel sauce.
To prepare the apples
Peel and cut the apples into thick slices.  In a medium skillet melt the butter and add the cinnamon and brown sugar.  Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves and the mixture is bubbly.  Add the apples and saut degrees until the apples are just fork tender but not mushy.  Remove the apples from the sauce. Let them drain in a colander or sieve and return all the liquid to to a small saucepan.  Add the maple syrup and simmer the sauce for several minutes to reduce it to a slightly thickened
bubbling consistency.    Add the whipping cream and simmer for an additional couple of minutes.  Return the apples to the sauce to warm them and serve over the bread pudding.

Ingredient:
1 (14 3/4 ounce) canned salmon
1/4 cup onion, finely chopped
1/4 cup cornmeal
Ingredients:
1/4 cup flour
1 egg
3 tablespoons mayonnaise
Instructions:
Open salmon and drain thoroughly. Place drained salmon in mixing bowl and flake evenly with a fork.  Add onion, corn meal, flour, mayonnaise, and egg. Stir until well blended.   Shape the mixture into patties about the size of an average burger or less.  Cook in oil in skillet over medium heat until browned on each side. Turn once while frying.
Note: The mayonnaise helps the patties hold their shape and keeps them from being too dry.

Ingredient:
1 Large Salmon Fillet
Generous sprinkle of Maple Pepper' 0riginal Spice Blend
Grape Seed or Canola 0il
Instructions:
Preparation:  Submerge grilling plank in water for 2-6 hours before cooking.
Cooking Time: 15-25 minutes (about double the cooking time of non
planked salmon)
Preheat barbecue grillto medium heat  350 degrees.  Place plank on grill and brush with grape seed or canola oil.  Sprinkle Maple Pepper'Original Spice Blend liberally onto salmon fillet.  For BBQing, put your planked salmon on one side of your grill andcontinue heating the barbeque for another 5 minutes.  After the 5 minutes, turn the side your plank is cooking on, down to low and turn the other burner down to medium and close the lid.  The plank should crackle & smolder. This creates the smoke for the smoky flavour!  Keep a spray bottle handy to spritz out flames, you want your plank smoldering, not flaming. Keep the lid closed as much as possible to keep in smoke.  Continue cooking until flaky, dont turn salmon.  Clean your planks in light soapy water and rinse really wetl. Place in a 350 degrees oven for 15 minutes and when cooled, store upright.  Resoak when ready to use again.

Ingredient:
1 cup butter,  softened
1 1/2 cups sugar
1 egg
1 1/2 tsp clear vanilla
Ingredients:
1/2 tsp lmitation Almond Extract
2 3/4 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp salt
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350'F. Lightly spray pan cavities with vegetable pan spray.  In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar with electric mixer at medium speed until well blended.  Beat in eggs and extraccts, mix welll.   Combine flour and salt, add to butter mixture.  Beat until well blended.   Press dough into cavaties, filling 2/3 full.  Bake 10-12 minutes or until light brown around edges.  Cool in pan 10 minutes.  Turn pan over, lightly tap pan to remove cookies.  Cool comp0letely onn cooling grid.

Ingredient:
2 cups all-purpose flour
2/3 cup plus 1/4 cup sugar, divided
3 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup cold butter
1 cup 2% milk
Ingredients:
2 medium tart apples, peeled and chopped
1-1/2 cups orange juice
1/2 cup honey
2 tablespoons butter, melted
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1-1/3 cups sour cream
1/4 cup confectioners' sugar
Instructions: In a small bowl, combine the flour, 2/3 cup sugar, baking powder and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in milk just until moistened. Spread into the bottom of a greased 4- or 5-qt. slow cooker; sprinkle apples over batter.  In a small bowl, combine orange juice, honey, melted butter, cinnamon and the remaining 1/4 cup sugar; pour over apples. Cover and cook on high until apples are tender, 2-3 hours.  In a small bowl, combine sour cream and confectioners' sugar. Serve with warm pudding cake.

Ingredient:
3/4 cup melted butter
3/4 cup sugar
1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract
3 beaten eggs
3 cups graham cracker crumbs
1 cup fine dried coconut
Ingredients:
2 1/2 cups mini marshmallow
Additional graham crackers to line the bottom of the pan
1 1/2 cups whipped cream, or use a whipped topping substitute
1 tsp vanilla extract
4 tbsp icing sugar, powdered sugar
Instructions: In a medium saucepan over medium low heat combine the melted butter, sugar and 1 1/2 tsp vanilla extract.  Cook for only a couple of minutes, stirring constantly until hot and the sugar is dissolved.  Quickly whisk in the beaten eggs.  Cook for only about a minute before removing from the heat and very quickly stirring in the graham crumbs, coconut and mini marshmallows.  Lightly grease and line the bottom and sides of a 9x13 baking pan with parchment paper.  Line the bottom of the pan with graham crackers. Cut as needed to fit.

Ingredient:
4 cups granulated sugar
4 sticks margarine
8 eggs
4large lemons
6 cups all-purpose flour
Ingredients:
2 teaspoons salt
4 teaspoons baking powder
2 cups milk
4 teaspoons lemon extract
2 cups chopped nuts (optional)
2 additional cups of sugar
Instructions: Set oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 3 large loaf pans. Beat together the sugar and margarine, add the eggs, and beat well. Zest the 4 lemons, reserving the fruit.  Stir the zest into pmixturp, Stir in milk, lemon extract and nuts.  Pour mixture evenly into the loaf pans and bake 45 to 60 minutes or until a straw comes out clean. While the loaves are haking, juice the 4 lemonss and add the juice to the 2 cups of sugar, stirring until ihe sugar is dissolved. Upon removing the loaves from the oven, puncture each loaf 40-50 times with a straw and pour the lemon-sugar mixture over the loaves,

Ingredient:
300 g beef steak, thinly sliced
100 g broccoli florets
1 srnall red onion, sliced
Ingredients:
1 sachet Blue Dragon Broccoli
Beef Stir Fryauce
Instructions:
Heat the oil in a wok and add the beef strips, stir fry tor 2 minutes.  Add the broccoli florets and onion and stir fry for a further minute.
Pour over the Sauce and heat through.

Ingredient:
1 1/2 cups brown sugar
1 cup buttter or margarine
3 eggs
2 1/2 cups flour
1/2 tsp salt
1 tsp baking soda
Ingredients:
1 tsp cinnamnon
1 tsp vanilla
1 cup raisins
1 cup red & green cherries, chopped
1/2 cup walnuts
Instructions: Mix in order,  Roll inn balls and place on parchment paper on cooking sheet.  Bake at 350 degrees for 15-18 ,onutes.

Ingredient:
1 cup unsalted butter softened to room temperature
2 cups granulated sugar
4 large eggs room temperature
1 large egg yolk room temperature
2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract
2 3/4 cups cake flour spooned & leveled
2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
Ingredients:
3/4 cup buttermilk
1/3 cup dark rum
1 cup chopped walnuts or pecans optional
To make the rum syrup:
1/2 cup unsalted butter
1 cup granulated sugar
1/4 cup dark rum
1/4 cup water
1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degreesF.  In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, or in a large mixing bowl using a handheld mixer, cream the butter and granulated sugar together until light and fluffy (about 4-5 minutes). Beat in eggs one at a time, then beat in the egg yolk and pure vanilla extract, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.  In a separate mixing bowl whisk together the cake flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.  In a large measuring cup whisk together the buttermilk and rum. Set aside.  Alternate mixing the dry ingredients with the buttermilk rum mixture into the wet ingredients in three additions, starting and ending with the dry ingredients.  Generously spray a 10-inch (12-cup) bundt pan with nonstick cooking spray, making sure to fully coat the entire pan. Sprinkle the chopped nuts into the pan and spread them around in an even layer. Scoop the batter into the prepared bundt pan over the chopped nuts and spread it around into one even layer.  Bake at 350 degreesF  for 40-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cover loosely with foil for the last 5-10 minutes of baking time if needed to prevent excess browning.  Remove the cake from the oven and place it on a wire rack to cool slightly in the pan while you prepare the glaze.
To make the rum glaze:
Slice the butter into pieces and place it in a large saucepan over medium heat. Once the butter has melted, add the sugar, rum, and water to the saucepan and stir until well combined.  Bring to a rapid boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally. Once the mixture begins to rapidly boil, reduce the heat to medium-low heat and simmer for 6-8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat, then stir in the vanilla extract.  Use a skewer to poke holes in the cake, spoon about 1/3 of the glaze over the cake in the pan. Allow it to sit for about 10 minutes.  Place some foil or parchment paper under the wire rack, then carefully invert the cake onto the wire rack and remove it from the pan. Use a skewer to poke holes on the top of the cake and then carefully spoon the rest of the glaze on top of the cake and around the sides.  Allow the cake to cool completely, then serve.
Notes
Store leftover cake in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 4 days.
Freezing Instructions: Cake will freeze well for up to 3 months. Thaw overnight in the refrigerator and bring to room temperature before serving.
Rum:  You can also use a gold or spiced rum in this cake.

Ingredient:
5 large eggs, separated, room temperature
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup butter, softened
1/2 cup canola oil
2-1/4 cups cake flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon baking soda
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup buttermilk
1 teaspoon coconut extract
Ingredients:
2 cups sweetened shredded coconut, chopped
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon almond extract
1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar
FROSTING:
11 ounces cream cheese, softened
2/3 cup butter, softened
4-1/3 cups confectioners' sugar
1-1/4 teaspoons coconut extract
2 cups sweetened shredded coconut, toasted
Instructions:
Place egg whites in a large bowl; let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.  Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In another large bowl, beat sugar, butter and oil until well blended. Add egg yolks, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition.  Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk, beating well after each addition. Stir in coconut and extracts..  Add cream of tartar to egg whites; with clean beaters, beat on medium until stiff peaks form. Fold a fourth of the egg whites into batter, then fold in remaining whites.  Transfer to 3 greased and floured 9-in. round baking pans. Bake 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
For frosting, in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until fluffy. Add confectioners degrees sugar and extract; beat until smooth.  Place 1 cake layer on a serving plate; spread with 1/2 cup frosting and sprinkle with 1/3 cup coconut. Repeat. Top with remaining cake layer. Spread remaining frosting over top and sides of cake; sprinkle with remaining coconut. Refrigerate for 2 hours before cutting. Store in the refrigerator.

Ingredient:
2 Eggs
4 cups flour
1/2 cup sugar
2 Tbsp yeast
Ingredients:
1/2 cup oil
3 1/2 cups flour
3 cups warm water
1 Tsp salt
Instructions: Mis well, eggs, sugar, warm water and oil.  Add the 4 cups of flour and yeast.  Add last the 3 1/2 cups flour and salt.  Add  more flur as needed, 1 to 1/2 cup.  Let rise for 15 minutes, punch for 4 minutes, the raise 15 minutes.  Make rolls and let rise for 30 minutes.  Bake 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.

Ingredient:
1 Egg
1/4 cup dry bread crumbs
2/3 cup spaghetti sauce
1 lb ground beef
1 1/2 grated mozzarella or cheddar cheese
Ingredients:
1 minced garlie clove
1 Tsp dryed basil
1/3 Tsp dried oregano leaf
1/2 Tsp salt
1/4 Tsp ground pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  Lightly grease a 9 inch pie plate.  Lightly beat egg.  Stir in bread crumbs and 1/3 cup spaghetti sauce.  Crumble in beef.  Add 1/2 cup cheese, garlic, basil, oregano,  salt and pepper.  Work mixture until combined.  Evenly pat into pie plate.  Bake uncovered for 20  minutes.  Drain off any juices.  Spread remaining sauce and  sprinkle remaining cheese.  Bake 10-15 minutes or until cheese is golden.

RecipeName: Deep Dish Honey Crisp Apple Pie
Ingredient:
Crust
2 ready made deep dish pie crust
1/4 cup milk
1 Tbsp cinnamon
3 Tbssp sugar
Filling
1/4 cup cornstarch
1/2 cup water
Ingredients:
10 cups Honey Crisp Apples cored, peeled and sliced
1/2 cup light brown sugar, firmly packed
1/4 cup white sugar
1 1/4 tsp cinnamon
1/4 tsp nutmeg
2-3 Tbsp butter
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees.  In a large bowl mix cornstarch with water.  Toss with all filling ingredients.   Let  stand for 10-15 minutes.  Meanwhile line a 10 inch deep dish pie pan with crust.  Spoon the filling into the crust in layers.  Add the top crust, seal and flute the edges.  Cut decorative designs into the top crust, then brush with milk.  Mix cinnasmon and sugar and sprinkle over crust.  Cover the crust eges with foil.  Bake the pie for 15 minutes, reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake 45-50 minutes or until juices form bubbles.  Remove the foil to the last 15-20 minutes of cooking time to brown the edges.

Ingredient:
4 lbs deer meat or hamburger, cooked
2 lbs suet
7 1/2 cups brown sugar
14 cups raisins
6 cups currants
2 tbsp cinnamon
2 tbsp nutmeg
2 tbsp cloves
Ingredients:
2 tbsp all-spice
2 tbsp ginger
10 cups apples, grounded
5 lemons -zest and juice
5 oranges - zest and juice
5 1/2 cups apple cider
1 cup brandy
1/2 cup cider vinegar
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and simmer for 2 hours, stirring often to prevent burning.

Ingredient:
11 cup brown sugar
1 egg
Ingredients:
1 tbsp cider vinegar
1 tsp vanilla
Instructions: Combine all ingredients and stir until completely combined.   Put in prepared tart shells and bake for 30 minutes.

Ingredient:
For the Pastry
2 1/4 cups flour, pastry flour is best to use but all-purpose will do
1 tbsp brown sugar
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup shortening, Very cold and cut in cubes
1/2 cup butter, Very cold and cut in cubes
6 tbsp ice water, approximately, enough to bring the dough together
Ingredients:
For the Filling
1/2 cup lightly packed brown sugar
1/2 cup corn syrup
1/4 cup butter, melted
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract
1/4 tsp salt
1/2 cup raisins, substituting, pecans, walnuts or chocolate chips also make good variations
Instructions:
To prepare the pastry
Pulse the cold butter and shortening into the flour sugar and salt using a food processor until the shortening or butter is reduced to pea sized pieces.  Sprinkle the water over the surface and toss with a fork until the water is just incorporated into the dough. Do not over work the dough; handle it only enough so that the dough stays together.  Form the dough into two rounds about an inch thick.  Wrap in plastic wrap and let rest in the fridge for about a half hour.  Roll out on lightly floured surface. Cut into rounds with 4 inch cutter. Fit into muffin cups. Chill in the fridge or freezer while you prepare the filling. Cold pastry heading into a hot oven will always be flakier.
To make the filling
Combine all filling ingredients except raisins.  Mix well.  Sprinkle raisins in a single layer in the bottom of the pastry lined muffin cups.  Fill 2/3 full with syrup mixture.  Bake on bottom shelf of oven at 425 degrees F for 12 to 15 minutes.  Cool completely on a wire rack and remove tarts from pans.
If you want a firmer, less runny filling simply add an additional egg, increase the brown sugar to 3/4 cup and decrease the corn syrup to 1/4 cup.
